description: BASKETBALL

title: Angela Davis in Cuba
description: MIAMI, Jan. 1 (UPI)Angela Davis has arrived in Havana for a visit with Cuban leaders, the Cuban radio said today.

title: ORR EQUALS MARK AS BRUINS WIN, 82
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Jan. 1 (UPI)Bobby Orr tied a National League record with six assists tonight and Phil Esposito scored three goals as the Boston Bruins overwhelmed the Vancouver Canucks, 82.

title: MEXICO PLANNING INVESTING CHANGE
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 1President Luis Echeverria has sent to the Senate a bill that sets new guidelines for foreign investment in Mexico.

title: Poland Seeks to Listen to Public Opinion
description: WARSAW, Jan. 1  More discussion, Edward Gierek demanded after he assumed power here two years ago. Only increased debate of crucial issues, the Communist party leader said, would prevent repetition of conditions that brought Poland then to the brink of civil war.

title: 7 Gypsies Die in Plunge
description: CAEN, France, Jan. 1 (AP)The police reported that a car carrying Yugoslav gypsies skidded on a frosty road today and careened into 16 feet of water at the port of Caen, killing senev persons.

title: Slain Irish Couple Are Believed Terrorist Victims
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 1An engaged couple were found shot dead today in a remote country lane near the border with Northern Ireland.

title: YOUTH AGENCY CUTS ITS TIE TO INSTITUTE
description: As of today, all the contracts have been terminated between the City Youth Services Agency and its major operating arm, the Youth Board Research Institute.

title: 2 Killed and 6 Hurt in Dacca As Police Fire on Students
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Jan. 1 (Reuters)Two people were killed today and six injured, one critically, when the police opened fire on students demonstrating against American bombing in North Vietnam.

title: Blood Supply Need
description: From Los Angeles to New York City, much of the nation has been plagued by a shortage of blood for medical purposes through the holiday weekend. Much elective surgery has been postponed to conserve supplies, but even so, many cities have lived and continue to live under the threat that a major catastrophefor example, an airplane crash like that in Miamimight exhaust local blood supplies before all needs were met.

title: A Hackensack Car Salesperson Finds Male Chauvinist Buyers Are Lemons
description: HACKENSACK, Dec. 30 In the 10 weeks that Daphne Liakos has been working in the showroom of the Hackensack Ford Agency, she has sold 11 or 12 cars and run into her share of male chauvinist customers who think that selling cars is strictly a man's game.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Jan. 1The postman never rings twice. But when Sylvia Hooks received a letter from Gladys Heldman about six weeks ago inviting her to play on the Virginia Slims women's tennis circuit, she didn't believe the man had rung at all.

title: 2 General Telephone Units Merged Into 3d Affiliate
description: ERIE, Pa., Jan. 1 (UPI)The York (Pa.) Telegraph and Telephone Company and the Princeton (N. J.) Telephone Company, both subsidiaries of the General Telephone & Electronics Corporation, have merged with the General Telephone Company of Pennsylvania, also a G.T.&E. affiliate.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: The top teams, with points figured on a 201816141210987654321 basis (first. place votes In parentheses) and wonlost records and total points.

title: Ralph Nader Study Group Assails Policies on National Forests
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 1  A study of the national forests by a Ralph Nader group has concluded that tentative Federal logging plans will result in the destruction of millions of acres of potential wilderness and recreation areas.

title: AllWomen Fire Force In Texas, Naturally
description: WOODBINE, Tex.  In this Cook County community of 500 population some 60 miles north of Fort Worth, women are the entire force of the volunteer fire department, some 25 strong.

title: Anken Industries Buying A Bell & Howell Division
description: Anken Industries, Inc., has announced the purchase of the Rochester film division of the Bell & Howell Company.

title: WORKERS IN ISRAEL STRIKE FOR 2 HOURS
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 1 (UPI)Israeli workers in almost every sector of the economy staged a twohour strike today to protest the automatic lifting of price controls on a wide range of consumer goods and services.

title: British Football Results
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: REED, LUCAS PLAY JABBAR TONIGHT
description: The Knicks worked out for more than an hour yesterday at St., John's University's gym and talked about Koreem Abdul  Jabbar, Willis Reed and their previous two games with the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Hanoi Greets Year in a Somber Mood
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Jan. 1 (Agence FrancePresse) It was a somber New Year's Eve here in Hanoi, its streets deserted and its shutters closed.

title: Pilot Error Hinted in Fatal Miami Crash
description: MIAMI, Jan. 1  Recorded flight information recovered in the wreckage of the jumbo jetliner that crashed on an approach to Miami International Airport last Friday night has given support to speculation that the aircraft crew may have unwittingly flown it into the ground, Federal investigators revealed today.

title: Navy Feeling the Impact of Black Servicemen's Caucus After Year's Growth
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 1In an old cinder block building in a black neighborhood out where Imperial Avenue crosses 30th Street, the Black Servicemen's Caucus quietly set up shop about a year ago.

title: MAXWELL BARUS
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Jan. 1Maxwell Barus, who retired in 1965 after almost half a century as a patent attorney, died yesterday of cancer at the Community Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived at 830 Valley Road, Upper Montclair.

title: Timber Wolf Reprieved By Hunting Moratorium
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1The Department of the Interior has reversed itself on a plan that would have permitted the killing of the Eastern timber wolf, regarded as threatened with extinction.

title: A Bridge Near Park Ave. Over 51st St. Is Sought
description: Permission to construct a bridge several stories over 51st Street, between Park and Madison Avenues, has been requested by the Uris Buildings Corporation and opposed by the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, according to the head of the city's Bureau of Franchises.

title: Clarke Takes First Place In A.Y.C. Frostbite Regatta
description: RYE, N.Y., Jan. 1Malcolm D. Clarke of the Am'erican Fleet won the American Yacht Club's annual New Year's Frostbite Invitation Regatta by two percentage points today. Michael H. Calman of the Mamaroneck Frostbite Association, the de1 fender, was second.

title: Stoppage on Jersey Commuter Line Would Begin Tonight If There Is No Accord
description: Representatives of the Port Authority TransHudson commuter railroad and the Brotherhood of Railway Carmen were scheduled to meet with Federal mediators at 11 A.M. in an attempt to avert a strike scheduled for one minute after midnight tonight.

title: New Year's Eve Just a Busy Night for Professional Bartender
description: It is precisely midnight, the new year is beginning, and all about him people are kissing one another and breaking balloons. Mose Peracchio, however, is touched by none of it. He is adding up a check.

title: NEWCOMBE TAKES AUSTRALIAN TITLE
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jan. 1 (AP)John Newcombe won his first Australian national singles title today by beating Onny Parun of New Zealand, 63, 67, 75, 61, in the final.

title: ChristmasTree Disposal Provided
description: The State Department of Environmental Protection has asked residents to have their discarded Christmas trees ground up and recycled or used as windbreakers for exposed flower beds or for birdfeeding stations.

title: Thieu's Supporters Cool To Resumption of Talks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 1The announcement that the United States and North Vietnam would resume their private peace talks in Paris next Monday has prompted a cool, reaction here among supporters of President Nguyen Van Thieu.

title: The Opera
description: The Metropolitan Opera's production of Donizetti's La Fille du Rgiment bumped and burbled its way back into the repertory for the first time this season on New Year's Eve. It seemedeven without any rumored seasonal interpolationsto give the dressedup audience on hand an appropriately boisterous sendoff for whatever revels they had in mind.

title: Puerto Rico's Governor Rafael Hernandez Colon
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Jan. 1Barely more than eight years ago, Rafael Hernandez Coln was one of a group of 22 young men urging the retirement of Luis Munoz Marin as Governor and as leader of the Popular Democratic party.

title: ISLANDERS MEET FLAMES TONIGHT
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Jan. 1The New York Islanders will face the Atlanta Flames at the Nassau Coliseum for the final time this season at 8:05 o'clock.

title: Tournament of Roses Is Delayed by Winds
description: PASADENA, Calif., Jan. 1 (AP)After high winds had delayed the positioning of its 59 floats, the 84th annual Tournament of Roses Parade unfurled before about a million people who arose at dawn on New Year's Day for curbside seats.

title: Rise and Fall of Controlled Rents
description: Tenants of 400,000 rentcontrolled apartments in the city who have been paying a 15 per cent rent increase since last July 1 automaticallyand without noticereceived a temporary decrease of half that amount begining yesterday.

title: Advertising: Agency Baits Questionnaires With Money
description: A while back, Erdos & Morgan, a most respected name in the field of mailed surveys, was retained to do a study on the very top people in American business and industry.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: STANDING OF THE TEAMS

title: Bridge: Intercity or Interclub Plays Get Little Attention in U.S.
description: A satisfying type of contest that gets little attention in this country is the match between two clubs or two cities. Occasional exhibition matches are played on an intercity basis, but there is nothing to compare with the preWorldWar II series of matches between New York and Philadelphia  consistently won by the Philadelphians.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JANUARY 2, 1973

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CHINNING Football fans have their postgame shows and this week over at the Lyceum Theater, drama devotees are being offered a postshow game. The name of the game is talk, and when the curtain rings down on tonight's performance of Eugene O'Neill's The Great Goo Brown and on Thursday night's performance of Moliere's Don Juan, there will he an opportunity to discuss the works with individuals associated with the two New Phoenix Repertory Company presentations.

title: Architect Is Trying to Rejuvenate Old Shopping Areas in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Jan. 1  The little strips of stores were once the heart of the cities neighborhoods, but now they are just as likely to be the places where urban blight begins.

title: Jehovah's Witnesses: A Mini Conglomerate That's SelfSustaining
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y.Even in the gloom of a desolate winter day, the bounty of the farm is impressive. There are beef and dairy herds, hogs and chickens. Gallons of milk pass through the pasteurizer, thousands of eggs are crated. Fields of wheat are growing and oats and corn await spring planting.

title: 5 Youths Seized Stealing From Bronx Howard Store
description: Anticrime patrolmen in the Bronx last night arrested five youths who, they said, had gained entry to the Howard clothing store at 2825 Third Avenue near 148th Street and were in the process of removing merchandise through a hole they had cut in the roof.

title: Autopsy Planned on Victim Of Fraternity's Lesson
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 1 (UPI) An autopsy will be performed to morrow on the body of a college student who apparently blundered over a cliff after he was left in the mountains by three fraternity brothers to teach him a lesson.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A recent Times editorial (Punishing Mr. Rule..., Dec. 26) decrying the Navy's harassment of Gordon W. Rule, outspoken director of its procurement control operation, cornmendably urges Congress to protect courageous civil servants who give honest testimony in response to its questions.

title: Union and American Oil Agree on a 2Year Pact
description: DENVER, Jan. 1 (AP)The Oil, Chemical and Atomic Workers Union has reached an agreement for a new twoyear contract with the American Oil Company for employes of the company's refinery at Texas City, Tex.

title: CONGRESS FACING DRIVE FOR REFORM AS SESSION NEARS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1With many of the aging power brokers of the past now gone, reformminded Democrats and Republicans will open their drive this week to restore Congress to a greater position of power.

title: Woman in BombDeath Case Seized in Coast Robbery
description: CORTE MADERA, Calif., Jan. 1 (UPI)A woman pharmacist acquited last August in a fatal bomb explosion was arrested here today along with two other, guncarrying women and a man as they fled from A supermarket after a $2,70 robbery.

title: Lieut. Gen. Henry Russell Dies; Member of Pearl Harbor Inquiry
description: MACON, Ga., Jan. 1 (AP)Lieut. Gen. Henry D. Russell, one of three generals who investigated the bombing of Pear] Harbor in 1941, died yesterday at the age of 83.

title: MAN TIED IN A SHED; SAVED AFTER 6 HOURS
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 1 (APA 70yearold retired doctor was bound, gagged and left in a storage shed for six hours with an automobile whose engine was running, the police said today.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 37

title: McPhail Wins Chess Title
description: LONDON, Ontario, Jan. 1 (Canadian Press)John McPhail, 18 years old, of Ottawa won the Canadian junior chess championship here today. McPhail, with a total of 8 points from seven victories and two draws, defeated Kevin Spraghet, 18, of Montreal, who had 7 points, and Bruce Harper, 18, of Vancouver, who had 6.

title: Karen S. Rennert Bride in Paramus
description: PARAMUS, N.J., Jan. 1 Miss Karen Stephanie Rennert and Richard Anthony John May were married here this afternoon. The Rev. David Osborn performed the ceremony in the Central Unitarian Church.

title: PLEA IS RENEWED FOR BLOOD DONORS
description: With normal surgical schedule to be resumed at hospitals today, officials of the Greater New York Blood Program called on New Yorkers to increase their blood donations so that plasma reserves can be maintained.

title: CopperMining Deal Set
description: The El Paso Natural Gas Company and the Heckla Mining Company have announced that they have agreed that El Paso will assume a working interest in development of the Lakeshore coppermining properties near Casa Grande, Ariz., by sharing in the costs of such development.

title: Buffalo Paper Appointment
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 1The appointment of Scott Hayden as managing editor of The Buffalo CourierExpress was announced today by the publisher. William J. Connors 3d, Mr. Hayden, 55 years old, joined The CourierExpress as a reporter in 1943, and has served as its chief city editor since 1969. He succeeds Leonard G. Feldmann, who died Dec. 4.

title: Conduct of Cold War by Trum an Stirs Dispute Among Writers of Books on His Presidency
description: Well over two decades after he entered the White House,Harry S. Truman's conduct of the cold war is provoking something of a cold war itself among authors appraising his Presidency.

title: TEXAS CONQUERS ALABAMA BY 1713
description: DALLAS, Jan. 1 (AP)Alan Lowry, the Texas quarterback, bootlegged the ball 34 yards on a tiptoe run down the left sideline for a touchdown late in the fourth quarter today as the seventhranked Longhorns upset fourthranked Alabama, 1713, in the Cotton Bowl.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 37

title: Bartholomew, Field Capture Classes on Manhasset Bay
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Jan. 1Randy Bartholomew won the Interclub Class and Dr. AI Field captured the Penguin competition as the threeday 42d annual Frostbite Regatta ended today on Manhasset Bay.

title: Mayor Dunn Sworn In After Leaving Hospital
description: ELIZABETH, Jan. 1 Mayor Thomas G. Dunn, who was released from the hospital only yesterday, appeared at City Hall today with his physician to be sworn in for a third term.

title: Czechoslovak Six Tops U.S.
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 1 (AP)Jaroslav Holik scored three goals as Czechoslovakia defeated the United States B team, 82, in a hockey exhibition tonight. The game was played in conjunction with the World Cup hockey tournament. The Czechs overpowered the U. S. team, which included only five members of the No. 1 U. S. team.

title: AUSTRALIA TO GET JETS AFTER DELAY
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 1 Australia will receive 24 F111 fighterbombers from the United States this year, nearly a decade after they were ordered, but it may be a year more before the cost of the controversial plane to the Australian taxpayer is known.

title: 531 Choice Is Victor
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 1 (AP) Gaylord's Lucille, a 531 long shot; won the sixfurlong feature at the New Orleans Fair Grounds today, paying $109,60, $49.60 and $41.20. Majave Princess returned $14.60 and 8.60 to place and Lady ln Reverse $5 to show.

title: Wheat Deal Lifts U.S. Maritime Hopes
description: Six days before Christmas a United States merchant ship docked at Odessa in the Soviet Union. Her cargo was wheat, the first tangible evidence of what shipping men were calling a new and vibrant atmosphere in the maritime industry.

title: Puerto Rico Goes Into Mourning
description: Roberto Clemente touched people from all walks of life, especially those with whom he had the closest contacthis Pittsburgh Pirate teammates, many of whom planned to fly to Puerto Rico this week to pay him tribute.

title: Man Slain Here Over Parking Space
description: A woman driver infuriated over the, loss of a parking space to another car on the Upper West Side yesterday fired a .22caliber pistol at the occupants of the other car, fatally injuring one man and wounding his two companions.

title: Clemente, Pirates' Star, Dies in Crash Of Plane Carrying Aid to Nicaragua
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Jan. 1Roberto Clemente, star outfielder for the Pittsburgh Pirates, died late last night in the crash of a cargo plane carrying relief supplies to the victims of the earthquake in Managua.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Program Brings Jewish Students to Visit Hasidim
description: Intellectual curiosity brought me here and I leave intellectually and emotionally involved after my first experience with living Judaism, remarked 19yearold Jeff Marx.

title: PAUSE IN BOMBING CONTINUED BY U.S., OFFICIALS INDICATE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Jan. 2  American warplanes today continued their temporary halt in the bombing begun yesterday in North Vietnam below the 20th Parallel and in South Vietnam to observe a New Year's Day ceasefire, United States officials indicated.

title: HITCHHIKER IS HELD IN ATTEMPTED RAPE
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Jan. 1 (UPI)  A Connecticut hitchhiker was held in lieu of $5,000 bail today on charges he attempted to rape a New Jersey coed when she and another student gave him a life.

title: TV Review
description: The idea of one black fireman in a white firehouse should have made a fine, meaningful and exciting Tuesday Movie of the Week. But clichs muffle Firehouse, a 90minute drama to be seen at 8:30 tonight on the American Broadcasting Company network.

title: Waldheim Reports Bangladesh Faces Threat of Famine Again
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 1  Secretary General Waldheim reported today that despite an enormous and successful effort to avert a famine in Bangladesh in 1972, the prospect of one was now more serious and more threatening than it was at the beginning of last year.

title: West Side Split on How to Stem Evils Of SingleRoomOccupancy Dwellings
description: West Side residents are finding themselves at odds over the effect on the community of its singleroomoccupancy facilities many of them old hotels that house not only the working poor and the elderly but also alcoholics, drug addicts and the mentally ill.

title: San Quentin Inmates Warn Of Strike Over 17 Demands
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., Jan. 1 (UPI)A group of San Quentin Prison inmates have threatened to strike tomorrow unless the authorities meet 17 demands, including the resignations of the warden and associate warden.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Big Change Down Under
description: Few democratically elected heads of government in recent times have made so many major changes so rapidly as Gough Whitlam in Australia and Norman Kirk in New Zealand. Their simultaneous recognition of the People's Republic of China is only the latest in a series of whirlwind actions by the new Labor Prime Ministers to alter longestablished policies at home and abroad.

title: 4 Who Visited Hanoi Tell of Destruction
description: Four Americans who returned from Hanoi Sunday night with hundreds of letters from American prisoners of war described yesterday as overwhelming the destruction they had seen in the city as a result of United States bombing raids.

title: SYLVIA TAYLOR, 50; PRODUCER IN RADIO
description: Sylvia Sirota Taylor, former producer of the International Interview and Careers programs on radio station WNYC, died of a pulmonary embolism yesterday in Bellevue Hospital. She was 50 years old and lived at 22 East 36th Street and in Southampton, L.I.

title: KAWAIDA DISPUTE GETS A NEW TWIST
description: NEWARK, Jan. 1  A report that the Nixon Administration is considering an '18month moratorium on public housing construction has added a new dimension to the Kawaida Towers housing controversy.

title: Japanese Radical Leader Hangs Himself in Jail Cell
description: TOKYO, Jan. 1 (UPI) Tsuneo Mori leader of a ring of Japanese terrorists linked to he Palestine guerrilla movetent, hanged himself in jail today while awaiting trial on nurder charges.

title: Hans, Who Was Tiresome
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1It is in very poor taste to go around talking about bombing all the time. If there is some bombing going on, it is unfortunate, particularly if innocent people are being hurt. Nobody likes to see innocent people hurt, but sometimes it cannot be helped. You have to break a few eggs to make an omelette, as someone once said, maybe Lenin.

title: War Foes Present Demands
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 1 (AP)A group of about 400 antiwar demonstrators niarched six blocks today to the home of Representative Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., Democrat of Massachusetts, with a list of demands for the coming session of Congress. But Mr. O'Neill, who is expected to be the new majority leader in the. House, was in Washington and the demonstrators had to hand over the list of demands to his son.

title: Export Total Expected, to Set Record in '73 Despite Barriers
description: Despite market and monetary uncertainties and persistent trade barriers, United States and world trade should show healthy gains in the new year.

title: Last 3 Quit Crime Panel In Pennsylvania Protest
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 1 (AP)The three remaining members of the state Crime Commission quit the panel today in protest of the forced resignation of Attorney General J. Shane Creamer.

title: 29 Debutantes Bow at New Year's Ball
description: Twentynine young women were presented at the 51st Debutante Assembly and New Year's Ball in the Grand Ballroom at the WaldorfAstoria last night. Miss Laura Jacqueline Hyde and her escort led the grand march at the dinner dance, for which Mrs. Robert Stith Williams Jr. is chairman.

title: Quebec Frightened by a Sense of Isolation
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 1At a cocktail party in one of Montreal's Englishspeaking enclaves the other evening, a woman was discussing the new session of the Canadian Parliament that begins Thursday, and worrying about the future.

title: Roth Sides Gird for Battle on Abortion
description: In 1970, when abortion on demand was legalized in New York State, its opponents, led by the Roman Catholic Church, said they had been taken by surprise.

title: Many Syrian Jews Are Moving to Deal
description: DEALA steady migration by Syrian Jews to this shore community over the last few years has sent the prices of houses soaring and created fears among some older residents that the new group may make it difficult for other Jews to assimilate into the community.

title: Football Bowl Games
description: COTTON BOWL

title: Syrian Jews Here Buy Jersey Homes
description: DEAL  A steady migration by Syrian Jews to this shore community over the last few years has sent the prices of houses soaring and created fears among some older residents that the new group may make it difficult for other Jews to assimilate into the community.

title: CONGRESS CRITICS OF WAR THREATEN TO FIGHT FUNDING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2Congressional opponents of the war in Vietnam threatened today to try to cut off appropriations for the war if the Nixon Administration did not quickly obtain peace settlement.

title: Hayes Alvis, Jazz Bassist, Former Red Cross Aide
description: Hayes J. Alvis, who was labor coordinator with the American Red Cross and also a wellknown jazz violinist, died Saturday at his home, 470 West 159th Street. His age was 65.

title: CEASEFIRE TALKS RESUME IN PARIS
description: PARIS, Jan. 2Technical experts from the United States and North Vietnam resumed their discussions on a ceasefire today with a fourhour session and agreed to meet again tomorrow.

title: Ruckelshaus Struggles With Decision on the Reduction of Lead in All Gasolines
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3The Environmental Protection Agency hopes to resolve in the next two months a question that its administrator, William D. Ruckelshaus, calls the most controversial he has ever faced: Whether to order a reduction in the lead content of all gasoline sold in this country.

title: Sound of New Musk Is Likened to Art
description: The music is new and not likely to be heard in conventional concert halls. One can more often encounter it in lofts, or Greenwich Village galleries, or museums uptown. For it's admirers, it sounds hypnotic and highly colored; for its detractors, it is maddeningly repetitive and simplistic. Amplification is screwed up to the point of pain. Two electric organs and three wind players sustain a steady drone and a reiterated of simple rhythmically charged patterns. Melodies and seductive crossrhythms twist and turn in the aural flux, like flotsam on a wave.

title: AIR FARE CUT ASKED BY CONSUMER GROUP
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (UPI) A Ralph Naderbacked consumer group asked the Civil Aeronautics Board today to set a $125 regular air fare to Europe and end the maze of special fares offered to passengers.

title: Novo Corp. Discontinues Unit
description: The Novo Corporation announced yesterday that ithad discontinued its wholly owned subsidiary, the Weissberger Moving and Storage Co., Inc., because it was unprofitable for the last two years, The company said the move would result in an extraordinary charge for 1972 not yet determined. Weissberger is a commercial mover based here.

title: 55th St. Tenants Resume Harassing of Prostitutes
description: Tenants at the Westerly apartment house, who pay an average rent of $350 a month, are going back to their old tactics now that they have failed in a court move to rid their building of prostitutes.

title: Nathalia Crane Wed to Professor
description: Nathalia Crane, poet and teacher, was married Dec. 13 in San Diego, Calif., to Peter O'Reilly, a professor of philosophy at California State University in San Diego. The bride lectures on poetry and world literature there.

title: 40TH ST. SITE SOLD FOR ADDICTION AID
description: Daytop Village, Inc., has purchased the 11story office building at 5456 Weist 40th Street, the former home of the Overseas Press Club, for use as a narcoticsaddiction rehabilitation center.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Paper Backs Protests On Vietnam at lnaugural
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan 2 (AP)The Louisville CourierJournal in its Wednesday morning editions endorsed peaceful antiwar demonstrations at the inauguration of President Nixon Jan. 20.

title: Allen's Gang Is Not So Over the Hill
description: Every pro football, fan knows that after George Allen became head coach of the Washington Redskins early in 1971 he traded away his future draft choices for older players and in two seasons took the team, which he named The Over The Hill Gang, to the Super Bowl. That is the myth. But of the players who will start at the 22 positions (p l u s two kickers for 24) for Washington in the Super Bowl on Jan. 14 against Miami, 16 of them joined the Redskins before Allen arrived. Fifteen had been regulars at one time or another during the 1969 and 1970 seasons when Vince Lombardi and Bill Austin were in change.

title: Suffolk Plans to Buy and Protect Farms
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Jan. 2The Suffolk County Executive, John V. N. Klein, proposed today that the county begin buying 3,000 acres of farmland to prevent housing development and to preserve it forever for agriculture.

title: No Exit for Congress ...
description: Because they are different kinds of institutions, the Presidency and the Congress naturally tend to have differing perspectives on the nation's needs., When executive and legislative powers are controlled by opposing parties, this tendency is usually magnified. But mutual respect and normal civility can bridge these institutional and political antagonisms and make constructive cooperation possible.

title: PEAK OUTPUT SET BY AUTO MAKERS
description: DETROIT, Jan. 2  Manufacturers are planning to build more vehicles in January than they have ever built in the United States in.a single month.

title: BRADLEY M. WALLS, SENIOR LAW PARTNER
description: Bradley M. Walls, a senior partner in the law firm of Burns, Van Kirk, Greene & Kafer, died apparently of a heart attack on Monday at his home in Upper Nyack, N.Y. He was 42 years old.

title: Stage: Shay Duffin as Brendan Behan
description: SHAY DUFFIN AS BRENDAN BEHAN, a oneman show, based on. the works of Brendan Behan. Directed by Marvin Gordon. Written and adapted by Mr. Duffin; settings by Mr. Duffin and Joe Behan; stage manager and lighting, Mr. Behan. Presented by Signature Products. At the Abbey Theater, 136 East 13th Street.

title: City Council Will Meet Today To Pick New Minority Leader
description: The City Council will meet foday to designate a new mi??ority leader, induct four new Councilmen and perhaps consider contenders for several vacant committee chairmanships.

title: P.S.C. Denies Interim Rise Asked by Phone Company
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2For the first time in recent years, the Public Service Commission today denied the New York Telephone Company's request for a temporary rate increase.

title: FLAMES CONQUER ISLANDERS BY 61
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Jan. 2The Islanders tonight continued to suffer by comparison with the Atlanta Flames, who trounced them, 61, for the fourth straight time in the teams' first National Hockey League campaign.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Science Adviser to Nixon Leaving for Industry Job
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2  Dr. Edward E. David Jr., the President's science adviser, resigned today saying he would return to private industry.

title: Bombers Hit North Below 20th Parallel
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Jan. 3 (AP)United States bombers struck at supply routes in the southern panhandle of North Vietnam yesterday in a resumption of bombing after a 36hour New Year pause.

title: Connecticut Urged to End BusinessEquipment Tax
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 2  In a broad program of tax relief for business and industry, the Governor's Commission on Tax Reform propoed today that the personal property tax be phased out over a 10year period on nearly all new business inventories and industrial equipment in Connecticut.

title: Reform In Social Security
description: The 92d Congress has done a commendable job by putting into effect two legislative measures that boost Social Security benefits by 20 per cent and contain some important improvements in the Social Security and Medicare programs sorely needed by our aged and disabled citizens.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: British Refuse to Pay Malta Increased Rental for Base
description: LONDON, Jan. 2 (AP) British authorities said today that they had refused to pay higher rent for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization base facilities on Malta and might have to withdraw the 3,000 British troops from the Mediterranean island.

title: Mirilovich to Aid Curci
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Jan. 2 (AP) The new University of Kentucky head football coach, Fran Curci, has picked Jon Mirilovich, an aide to Curci for two seasons at the University of Miami, as his offensive coordinator at Kentucky. Mirilovich also served under Curci at Tampa in 1970.

title: Police Said to Have Known In August of Drug Losses
description: The Police Department discovered at least as earty as last. August that sizable quantities of narcotics were missing from the offices of its property clerk, a wellplaced official disclosed yesterday.

title: Two Football Aides Hired
description: STARKVILLE, Miss., Jan. 2 (AP)  Two new assistant coaches were added today to the staff of Mississippi State's football coach, Bob Tyler. Bobby Dwayne Field was named defensive secondary coach and S. E. Sullins was named defensive tackle coach.

title: Shenyang Acrobats Dazzle City Center Audience
description: What on earth would Phineas T. Barnum have made of the Shenyang Acrobatic Troupe of the People's Republic of China. This is the first cultural troupe to come to the United States from China. It opened a brief season at the New York City Center last night, and to call it sensational would be merely to underpraise it woefully.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The shortage of whole blood available to 282 hospitals in the metropolitan area is expected to continue for at least two weeks, a spokesman for the Greater New York Blood Program said yesterday.

title: Frere de Jacques Takes Race at Calder by a Length
description: MIAMI, Jan. 2 (AP)W. G. Freeman's Frere de Jacques closed strongly today to win the Palmetto Purse by a length at Calder Race Course.

title: Fame Nich Sought for Clemente
description: The Baseball Writers Association of America will look into the possibility of inducting Roberto Clemente into the Halt of Fame, this year, Jack Lang, the group's secretary, said yesterday.

title: Italians Hail Ruling on Press Freedom
description: ROME, Jan. 2Italian newsmen are praising a decision by a judge in Perugia upholding their right to criticize court sentences that they consider unjust as a victory in the battle for freedom of the press.

title: Roberts Is Off to Fast Start In His First Day on Bench
description: After four harddriving years as prosecutor in the Bronx, former District Attorney Burton B. Roberts donned the robes of a State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan yesterday, showing no letup in his zeal for action.

title: CEASEFIRE TALKS RESUME IN PARIS
description: PARIS, Jan. 2Technical experts from the United States and North Vietnam resumed their discussions on a ceasefire today with a fourhour session and agreed to meet again tomorrow.

title: COURT STAY ASKED ON SAFETY RULING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (AP) The Labor Department asked a United States District judge today to stay his order against granting states sixmonth extensions to operate their own job health and safety programs.

title: Recall of 10,600 Vehicles Announced by Volkswagen
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, N. J., Jan. 2 (AP)  Volkswagen of America is recalling some of its 1973 station wagons and Karmann Ghia models because of possible safety defects.

title: 76ERS LOSE AGAIN; SKEIN REACHES 12
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 2 (AP)Bob McAdoo, a rookie, scored 30 points tonight, leading the Buffalo Braves to a 114110 National Basketball Association victory over the Philadelphia 76ers.

title: Little by Little, Life in Hanoi Is Beginning to Get Back to Normal
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Jan. 2 (Agence FrancePresse) The city of Hanoi, though still twothirds empty, timidly began getting back to normal today after 12 days of heavy American bombing raids.

title: A Last Quibbling Scene
description: PARISWhen President Nixon received French Foreign Minister Maurice Schumann last September he said he wanted to end the Indochina war before his reinauguration (which he already expected) in order to wipe clean the diplomatic slate for major negotiations with Western Europe and Japan.

title: Major Changes on Agenda At N.C.A.A. Annual Meeting
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 2 (AP)Sweeping reorganizational proposals will, be considered by the National Collegiate Athletic Association at its 67th annual convention in Chicago Jan. 11 through 13.

title: Bride: Challenges Confront Players At Innovative Session on L. I.
description: Poker players play a variety of forms of their game. Chessplayers occasionally indulge in kriegspiel, or change the manner in which the pieces move for problem purposes. But bridge is bridge, and the rules are never tampered with.

title: Wake Forest Picks Wargo
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Jan. 2 (AP)Paul Wargo, who coached the offensive backs and kickers at Utah State, was named today to the Wake Forest football staff by the new head coach, Chuck Mills.

title: TV: Royal Gala From the Palladium
description: Royal Gala Variety Performance, a televised charity program of international stars attended by Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip, sounds promising. But the 90minute program, beamed from London's Palladium stage and due tonight at 8:30 on the American Broadcasting Company network, comes off only as tamely pleasant viewing that suggests other variety specials, with two exceptions. old Palladium like a beacon. The two save the evening.

title: U.S. RESERVE TOTAL SHRINKS $6MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (Reuters)  Total United States reserve assets at the end of November, 1972, were $13.31billion, down $6million from the October level, the Treasury Department reported today. Reserves at the end of November, 1971, were $12.13billion.

title: Philippine President Will Meet Moslem Rebel Leaders Today
description: MANILA, Jan. 2 (UPI)President Ferdinand E. Marcos today scheduled peace talks with Moslem leaders from the southern Philippines where Government troops have been battling rebel forces in heavy fighting in recent weeks.

title: 50 Editors Are Selected for the Pulitzer Prize Journalism Jury
description: Fifty editors have been named to help select the winners of the 1973 Pulitzer prizes in journalism, which are to be awarded on May 7.

title: PANTHER'S 2D TRIAL IN SHOOTING BEGINS
description: Richard Moore, a member of the Black Panther party, went on trial here for the second time yesterday on charges of attempted murder.

title: ...and of Deceit
description: Pentagon spokesman Jerry W. Friedheim hit a new low in official obfuscation yesterday when he conceded that some limited accidental damage was sustained by Hanoi's Bach Mai Hospital during the recently suspended United States aerial blitz. Mr. Friedheim said that information indicating damage to the hospital had reached him after he had denied any damage on Dec. 27 and again on Dec. 29.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: Cerro Corp. Suing Touche Ross & Co. In Stereo Club Deal
description: The Cerro Corporation announced yesterday that it had filed suit in Federal District Court for the Central District of California against Touche Ross & Co., a national accounting firm.

title: RILEY IS SEEKiNG AMP SUBSIDIARY
description: AMF, Inc., announced yesterday it had agreed in principle to sell its subsidiary, AMF Beaird, Inc., to the Riley Company for more than $25million.

title: MISS EMONET WINS WORLDCUP SLALOM
description: MARIBOR, Yugoslavia, Jan. 2 (AP)Patricia Emonet won a World Cup slalom race today on trecherous Pohorje Mountain, where there were more disqualifications and abandonments than finishes.

title: Shift in Boundaries of Soviet Republics Is Proposed in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 2A Soviet planning economist has come up with a startling proposal to revise the boundaries of this country's ethnic republics for more efficient coordination and planning of the, complex Governmentrun economy.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: TEANECK, N. J., Jan. 2For 18 years13 as a player, five as a coachRosey Brown was on the field or the sidelines for the Giants National Football League games. But for the last two seasons, Brown hasn't seen even one Giant game in person.

title: NEWCOMBE VICTOR; FRENCH STARS BOW
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 2 (AP)Ken Rosewall, John Newcombe, Colin Dibley and the Soviet Union's Alex Metre veli advanced at the start of the $19,000 New South Wales tennis championships today, but French players were upset.

title: BULLET IN SUSPECT A DEFENSE ISSUE
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 2 (AP)A man accused of murder carries a bullet in his back. The state alleges that it was fired in selfdefense by a woman before she and her husband were killed. May the slug be removed for use as evidence against the defendant?

title: BLUES' LATE TALLY TOPS PENGUINS, 54
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 2 (UPI)Phil Roberto scored with 1 minute 23 seconds to play tonight to give the St. Louis Blues a 5.4 victory and extend the Pittsburgh Penguins' nonwinning streak to eight games.

title: Global Good and Evil: I
description: CAMBRIDGE, EnglandMany of us have been brought up on a kind of history which sees the human drama throughout the ages as a straight conflict between right and wrong. Sooner or later, however, we may find ourselves awakened to the fact that in a given war there have been virtuous and reasonable men earnestly fighting on both sides. Historians ultimately move to a higher altitude and produce a picture which has greater depth because it does justice to what was thought and felt by the better men of both parties.

title: Need for U.S. Aid for Pennsy Is Cited
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 2 (AP) The trustees of the bankrupt Penn Central Transportation Company said today the line could not reorganize by 1976 without Government financial assistance.

title: None Hurt in Rocket Attack On an Ulster Police Station
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 2 (UPI)A Sovietmade rocket was fired at a police station tonight for the second successive night, the British Army said, but the rocket missed and hit an unoccupied house nearby.

title: Harris and Buchanon Named Rookies of Year in Pro Football
description: Franco Harris of the Pittsburgh Steelers and Willie Buchanon of the Green Bay Packers were named yesterday as National Football League rookies of the year by The Associated Press.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: War Raids lncite Anti  U.S. Feelings in Italy
description: ROME, Jan. 2The United States bombing strikes in North Vietnam have caused a wave of antiAmerican feeling in Italy that the halt of the raids above the 20th Parallel has not stopped.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Managuans Turn to Task Of Rebuilding Their City
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Jan. Carlos Carri6n is a 19yearold Nicaraguan who was planning to go to college to study business and economicsbefore the earthquake. Now he has decided to become an engineer because he feels engineers will be needed to rebuild this devastated city.

title: Biden Takes Oath Friday
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (AP)  Joseph R. Biden Jr., whose wife and infant daughter were killed in an automobile accident last month, will be sworn in Friday as a United State Senator from Delaware at a Wilmington hospital where his two sons are recovering from injuries suffered in the crash. Mr. Biden, who reached the required constitutional age of 30 only after he defeated Senator J. Caleb Boggs, is believed to be the first Senator in 30 years to take the oath of office away from the Senate chamber.

title: POWERS TRIUMPHS IN WEIGHT THROW
description: Danny Powers, a St. John's University senior, won the 35pound weight throw with a toss of 54 feet 1 inches at the Columbia Airdome yesterday as field events were decided in the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union junior track championships.

title: 11 JAIL OFFICERS ACCUSED IN RIOT
description: The warden and 10 other correction officers at the Queens House of Detention in Kew Gardens were charged yesterday by a special prosecutor with using excessive force to quell rioting by inmates in October, 1970.

title: New Books
description: Death Claims, by Joseph Hansen (Harper & Row, $5.95). A suspense novel.

title: KINGS AN AIM AT A RANGER JINX
description: The Rangers and Los Angeles Kings meet here tonight in a game that ends the first half of their National Hockey League campaign. Both clubs have had startling surprises.

title: Cab Driver in Bronx Shot
description: A 50yearold cab Myer was shot in the arm early yesterday by one of four men who attempted to rob him as he pulled up at a stop sign at East 57th Street and Topping Avenue in the Bronx, the police reported. The driver, Ivan Fine, was reported in good condition at Bronx Lebanon Hospital with a bullet wound of the left arm, the police said.

title: First Sign of Spring
description: CINCINNATI, Jan, 2 (AP)Cincinnati Red ballplayers who live in this area will begin a regular winter program of physical training tomorrow under the direction of the team trainer, Larry Starr.

title: Notes on People
description: Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama has been wearing an experimental electronic device designed to control pain impulses to his brain. The Governor started using the device, which he controls from a button on his wheelchair, during a recent vacation in Florida. It is said to alleviate the pain much of the time. The pain is a result of damage done to his spine when he was shot at a rally in Laurel, Md., last May. The shooting paralyzed Mr. Wallace from the waist down, and he has had five operations to heal the wounds. In Montgomery, Mr. Wallace's office said he would undergo a sixth operation, indirectly related to the bullet wounds, to correct an enlarged prostate gland. This surgery was described as elective rather than necessary.

title: MARYLAND WINS 8TH IN ROW, 7658
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Jan, (AP)Unbeaten Maryland, in a lethargic performance booed by the home fans, defeated Kent State, 7658, tonight for its eighth victory. Len Elmore, from New York's Power Memorial Academy, tied a Maryland record by grabbing 24 rebounds. He scored 10 points.

title: 10 Protesters Are Arrested At Research Institute Here
description: Ten persons were arrested yesterday on charges of disorderly conduct during a demonstration against the Riverside Research Institute at 80 West End Avenue.

title: Dr. Jack Hammond, Who Led Willowbrook State School, Dies
description: ROME, N. Y., Jan. 2Dr. Jack Hammond, director of the Rome State School and former head of the widely criticized Willowbrook State School on Staten Island, died today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 56 years old.

title: News Summary and Index WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 3, 1973
description: International

title: Democrats to Leave Offices in Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (AP) The Watergate, an expensive riverfront apartmenthoteloffice complex involved in last June's alleged bugging attempt, is about to lose its most famous tenant  the Democratic National Committee.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

description: It's not the thundering hoofbeats of a great steed.

title: Suffering Spurs $50 Gift for Neediest
description: Humanity looks pretty shabby these days, Ellie Henkind of 18 Sidney Place, Brooklyn Heights, said in note to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Red Smith
description: In solitary, Ron Lyle said, you sleep on a bed, get three square meals a day and take a shower twice a week, but never leave your cell otherwise. The Hole is smaller and there is nothing in it but the slab you sleep on. At least, that's how it was in the Colorado State Penitentiary in Canon City, where Lyle did 90 days in solitary and 20 in The Hole for the fight in which he was knifed.

title: Federal Register to Be Altered; Aim Is to Make It Easier to Use
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 The Federal Register, the official daily record of most rules and regulations proposed and promulgated by Federal agencies, will undergo changes in the next few weeks that are designed to make it easier for more people to use.

title: Supreme Court and Air Pollution
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 2The United States Supreme Court, which recently had to rule on the question of bottomless dancing in California, is confronted with an even knottier question of geography and movement. It is, in effect:

title: PATH Strike Put Off
description: President Nixon invoked the Railway Labor Act last night to postpone for at least 60 days a strike threatened for 12:01 A.M, today against the Port Authority  TransHudson commuter railroad. Detail on Page 26

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Drug Loss Held Known to Police

title: RUGBY RESULTS
description: RUGBY UNION

title: Gun Battle in London Stirs Controversy
description: LONDON, Jan. 2  Police Constable Peter Slimon shot and killed a bank robber here last week.

title: CHEMICAL PLANNING A BANK IN BUFFALO
description: The Chemical New York Corporation, which is the parent company of the $14billion Chemical Bank, is planning to start a new bank in Buffalo: as part of its overall drive to create a statewide banking system.

title: Art: The Beardsley Limner in Montclair
description: MONTCLAIR, Jan. 2One of the curious recent developments in the American museum scene is that you are more likely to find highly specialized exhibitions cropping up outside New York City than in the supposedly sophisticated metropolis.

title: Baruch College Chair Honors Emanuel Saxe
description: Baruch College has announced the endowment of its new Emanuel Saxe Distinguished Professorship in honor of Dr. Emanuel Saxe, who will retire next June after more than 30 years at Baruch as an administrator, dean and, most recently, Distinguished University Professor.

title: DOROTHY AICHELE
description: Dorothy Aichele, administrative assistant to the director of the New York University Health Service at the Washington Square and University Heights campuses died yesterday at University Hospital. She was 48 years old and lived at 31 East 44th Street, Bayonne, N.J.

title: 5Year Study of Apollo Rocks and Photos Is Planned
description: When scientists at Houston got their first look at the Apollo 17 moon rocks and soil last week, it was the beginning of a postApollo lunar science program to extract the knowledge bound up in the 850 pounds of samples, 30,000 photographs and miles of magnetic tape data from the nation's six moon landings.

title: LOUIS HALPER
description: HILLSIDE, N. J., Jan. 2Louis Helper, president of the Halper Brothers Paper Company in Elizabeth and a former ranking welterweight boxer, died yesterday, in Memorial Hospital, New York. He was 63 years old.

title: Death Toll Is 13 in Storms Lashing Sicily and Italy
description: MESSINA, Sicily, Jan. 2 (Reuters)The death toll from three days of torrential rain and high winds rose to 13 today as storms that have left a trail of destruction in Sicily claimed their first victims on the Italian mainland. Three drowned when their car was swept away.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Indian Police Kill 2 Strikers During Separatist Protests
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 2 (Reuters) The police shot and killed at least two persons today during a strike that paralyzed parts of Andhra Pradesh in southern India, where strikers are demanding a separate state.

title: GRAY RESHUFFLES 9 ON F.B.I.'S STAFF
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 L. Patrick Gray 3d, acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, has ordered the immediate reassignment of nine members of his headquarters staff, eight of them with long service in the bureau's Crime Records Division under J. Edgar Hoover, the late director.

title: BANKERS IN STATE CALL '72 BIG YEAR
description: NEWARK, Jan. 2  Some of the state's leading bankers agree that New Jersey banks had a banner year in 1972, coming into direct competition for big customers with the giant banks across the rivers in New York and Philadelphia.

title: CONTROLS RENEWED ON DOLLAR OUTFLOW
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The Commerce Department announced today a continuation for the sixth year of its program of controls over dollar outflow abroad for financing direct corporate investment, with one important relaxation.

title: REPORT OF DAMAGE TO HANOI HOSPITAL CONFIRMED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2  A Pentagon spokesman confirmed today for the first time reports of damage to the Bach Mai Hospital and Gia Lam Airport in Hanoi during heavy air raids last month over North Vietnam but he denied that the damage was either massive or intentional.

title: Teddy Roosevelt Effect
description: A phenomenon called the Teddy Roosevelt effect is being used to explain an unexpected finding about the performance of aquanauts who participated in the difficult underwater living experiments known as Tektite 2. The first President Roosevelt, it will be recalled, began suffering violent attacks of bronchial asthma while an Infant, attacks that persisted well into childhood. Yet he developed into a robust outdoorsman who achieved fame as soldier, politician and statesman. Similarly, among the Tektite 2 aquanauts, those who had suffered most sickness during childhood tended to outperform their colleagues whose early health had been superior.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 3, 1973

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: OASIS High in popularity among current topics of conversation and concern is the quality of cultural life on West 42d Street. To be sure, there is a certain sameness and seaminess to the street, at first glance. But it is not without its redeeming features, and one of them is the Wurlitzer Music Store at 130 West 42d Street between Broadway and the Avenue of the Americas.

title: S.D.S. Protesters Confront Imperiale With a Swastika at Kawaida Towers
description: NEWARK, Jan. 2  About 75 demonstrators, most of them members of Students for a Democratic Society, marched for an hour in front of the Kawaida Towers housing site today and tried unsuccessfully to present a swastika to Assemblyman Anthony Imperiale, indenpendent of Essex.

title: Talcott National Planning Repurchase of Own Shares
description: The Talcott National Corporation has agreed with a representative of the holders of its series D $4.50 cumulative preferred stock to repurchase Talcott's 184,938 outstanding shares of such stock at $71 share for an aggregate of $13,130,598. Of this amount, $7million is payable in cash and the balance in notes.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: Restaurants are rated for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: Donohue Heads $200,000 Class
description: About Motor Sports

title: SOVIET SIX CRUSHES U.S., 13.3, FOR SWEEP
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 2 (AP)The Soviet Union scored five firstperiod goals against the United States tonight and went on to a 133 victory, completing a threegame sweep of the second annual World Cup hockey tournament.

title: China Expelling 3 Zambians After a Rampage in Peking
description: PEKING, Jan. 2Three Zambian students are being expelled from China after a rampage at their hostel early on Christmas Day in which two of them beat up Chinese teachers and policemen and smashed portraits of Chairman Mao Tsetung, a diplomatic source said today.

title: JURY IMPANELED IN CANT WELL CASE
description: TRENTON, Jan. 2  The oftendelayed trial of Maj. Gen. James F. Cantwell, former chief of the New Jersey National Guard, opened today in Mercer County Court with the selection of a jury.

title: U.S. Will Parole Colonel Who Gave Soviet Secrets
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (AP) The United States Parole Board announced today that it would parole William H. Whalen, a 57yearold retired Army lieutenant colonel who is serving a 15year sentence for giving American secrets to Soviet agents.

title: French Teacher Freed In Sex Pamphlet Case
description: PARIS, Jan. 2A magistrate at Belfort, in eastcentral France, today threw out charges against Nicole Mercier, a highschool teacher of philosophy accused of outraging public morals.

title: Scoring Leaders
description: Nat'l Hockey League

title: '73 Rise in Capital Outlay Approved at Union Pacific
description: Directors of the Union Pacific Corporation have approved capital expenditures for 1973 of $195million, up $40 million from the estimated $155million invested in 1972, it was announced yesterday.

title: PATH Strike Put Off
description: President Nixon invoked the Railway Labor Act last night to postpone for at least 60 days a strike threatened for 12:01 A.M. today against the Port AuthorityTransHudson commuter railroad. Details on Paw 26.

title: Suffering Spurs $50 Gift for Neediest
description: Humanity looks pretty shabby these days, Ellie Henkind of 18 Sidney Place, Brooklyn Heights, said in note to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Solarz Challenges Leone As Brooklyn President
description: Assemblyman Stephen J. Solarz announced yesterday that he would seek the Democratic nomination for Brooklyn Borough President in the June 20 primary.

title: GRAY RESHUFFLES 9 ON F.B.I.'S STAFF
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 L. Patrick Gray 3d, acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, lias ordered the immediate reassignment of nine members of his headquarters staff, eight of them with long service in the bureau's Crime Records Division under J. Edgar Hoover, the late director.

title: Cahill Expected to Avoid Asking Major New or Increased Taxes
description: TRENTON, Jan. 2  Legislative sources reported here this evening that Governor Cahill would not recommend any major new or increased taxes in his budget message to the New Jersey Legislature this month.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: MONDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: DR. BENJAMIN KOPP
description: Dr. Benjamin Kopp, a retired physician, died of a heart attack yesterday while visiting in Kingston, N. Y. He was 72 years old and lived at 140 West 57th Street and in Woodstock, N. Y.

title: HEALTH AIDE QUITS U.S. ASSOCIATION
description: Dr. James R. Kimmey, who has served as executive director of the American Public Health Association during its threeyear drive toward a policymaking position in the nation's health arena, has resigned from the organization.The resignation, announced to the staff but not publicly, follows attempts by the 100yearold organization, to stabilize its financial condition and clearly define the programs it favors: The resignation becomes effective at the end of this month.

title: FLAMES CONQUER ISLANDERS BY 61
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Jan. 2The Islanders tonight continued to suffer by comparison with the Atlanta Flames, who trounced them, 61, for the fourth straight time in the teams' first National Hockey League campaign.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Waste Resources Corporation said yesterday it had filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission a shelf registration consisting of 1 million shares of common stock, Robert A. Fox, chairman, said: It is very apparent that our initial shelf registration of Sept. 25, 1972, of 350,000 shares must be substantially supplemented to permit us to maintain the present pace of our planned acquisition program. ... The company's stock, traded overthecounter, closed yesterday at 9 bid, 10 asked, unchanged from Friday's close.

title: Gunman Who Seized Jet Yields To Cardinal and an F.B.I Agent
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 2The hijacking of a Piedmont Airline: plane was thwarted tonight when a man with a gun wa: talked into surrendering by an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, assisted by Law rence Cardinal Shehan, Arch bishop of Baltimore, and a psy. chiatrist.

title: U.S. AIDE DEFENDS RACIAL JOB PLANS
description: The regional director of the United States Department of Labor said yesterday that critics of efforts to place more minority workers in the city's building and construction trades had distorted the total picture by overemphasizing the controversial New York Plan.

title: Steel Production Declined by 3.1 % For Latest Week
description: Production of steel in the week ended Saturday totaled 2,603,000 tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND OTC CLIMB
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market began the new year in a bullish fashion yesterday as both lists made strong advances. The trading pace, however, slowed considerably.

title: MAYOR CRITICIZED ON PROBATION PLAN
description: The president of the city's Probation and Parole Officers' Association charged yesterday that Mayor Lindsay engaged in blatant and dangerous distortion of facts last week when he proposed a reduction in the use of presentence reports in criminal cases.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: The long holiday weekend has left medical institutions in New Jersey with virtually no reserve supplies of blood, the president of the state's largest community blood bank said yesterday.

title: Turkey Planning Direct Control of Universities
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Jan. 2 (AP)  The Government has proposed legislation to allow it direct control over Turkey's autonomous universities. The move appears to be another effort by the conservative Establishment of politicians, businessmen and military leaders to silence the extreme left before general elections next October.

title: The Japanese Press: Tension, Tension
description: I am very proud of the quality of the Japanese press at large.

title: TRUMAN'S PAPERS GO TO THE PEOPLE
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., (UPI)  Harry S. Truman's will, released today as public record, gives nearly all of the former President's papers to the people of the United States, except for some personal notes.

title: SAMUEL S. GREENHUT
description: Samuel S. Greenhut, a structural engineer and founder of Greenhut & Taffel, died Mon,I day of a coronary attack in White Plains Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived at 700! Scarsdale Avenue in Scarsdale,!, N. Y.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 41

title: Knicks Vanquish Bucks, 10292
description: Deadly outside shooting by Jerry Lucas and Bill Bradley as part of a team excellence almost two intricate to describe gave the New York Knicks command in the fourth quarter last night and brought them a 10292 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks before another capacity crowd of 19,694 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Governor Promises Help on Day Care
description: The city has delayed putting into effect a new stateordered fee schedule for daycare programs serving 30,000 children here, while studying a new promise by Governor Rockefeller to recommend state aid for affected families for the next 18 months. If the schedule goes into effect, more than a fourth of such children could face higher costs or be forced to drop out of the centers.

title: Apocalypses and Votes
description: In a performance extravagant enough to stagger not only P. T. Barnum but even Cecil B. DeMille, 8,000 members of the American Economic Association and 19 other social science bodies assembled in Toronto last week to listen to 436 learned papers and addresses, of which this critic bas selected four for comment  three stars for excellent, two stars for good, and one star for pretty good:

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Jan. 2 (AP)Britain's official reserves of gold and foreign currency backing the troubled pound fell sharply in 1972, Government figures showed today. The reserves had increased substantially in 1971.

title: 17,000 Coal Miners Win Pension Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 About 17,000 retired coal miners or their widows who have been denied $150amonth pension benefits by the United Mine Workers Welfare and Retirement Fund will become eligible for payments in about two months under a Federal court order given preliminary approval here today.

title: CONGRESS CRITICS OF WAR THREATEN TO FIGHT FUNDING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2Congressional opponents of the war in Vietnam threatened today to try to cut off appropriations for the war if the Nixon Administration did not quickly obtain a peace settlement.

title: All 5 Die, With Cattle, In Alberta Plane Crash
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Jan. 2 (AP)A Boeing 707 cargo plane crashed and burned in a blizzard early today two miles short of the runway while landing at Edmonton International Airport, and the police said that all five persons on board were killed.

title: SHARP RISE IN NET POSTED BY C. & O.
description: The Chesapeake & Ohio Railway, the first company to issue a report for 1972, had earnings double those of 1971 and the best in six years, the company announced yesterday. The profit included results of the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad and all other majorityowned subsidiaries.

title: Robbery Suspect Is Killed By 2 Patrolmen in Queens
description: A 30yearold man was shot and killed by the police early yesterday after he allegedly held up a Queens drugstore for the second time in five months.

title: Deaths
description: WIESENECKPaul & Pattie Wleseneck (nee Yeckes) joyfully announce the birth David Michael, Jan. 2, at North Shore Hospital, Manhasset.

title: Death of Clemente Casts a Pall Over Inauguration of Puerto Rico's 4th Elected Governor
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Jan. 2Rafael Hernandez Coln was sworn in as the island's fourth elected Governor today in en inaugural ceremony made somber by the death of Roberto Clemente, the Puerto Rican baseball star.

title: KITTY HAWK SAILOR GUILTY ON ONE COUNT
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 2 (AP)The first of 21 black sailors to be tried ashore in connection with racial fighting aboard the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk was convicted of one charge today, but the major counts against him were thrown out.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n;
description: STANDING OF THE TEAMS

title: Science Adviser to Nixon Leaving for Industry Job
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 Dr. Edward E. David Jr., the President's science adviser, resigned today saying he would return to private industry.

title: Woman Wins Battle To Save Texas River
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 2  Hana Ginzbarg has won her fight.

title: Suffolk Plans to Buy and Protect Farms
description: RIVERHEAD, L. L, Jan. 2 The Suffolk County Executive, John V. N. Klein, proposed, today that the county begin buying 3,000 acres of farmland to prevent housing development and to preserve it forever for agriculture.

title: 1972's Record Rainfall Crested at 67.03 Inches
description: When that I was and a little tiny boy,

title: People and Business
description: When Robert P. Koenig joined the board of Canadian Javelin, Ltd., last September as chairman and a member of the executive committee, the company was proud to have him on its team. The 68yearold executive, after all, was very well known in the metals industries as a shrewd mining executive and president of Cerro Corporation for many years.

title: BAR UNIT ANNOUNCES AWARDS FOR MEDIA
description: The winners in the 1972 media awards competition of the New York State Bar Association were announced yesterday by former Associate Judge Francis Bergen of the State Court of Appeals, chairman of the awards committee.

title: REPORT OF DAMAGE TO HANOI HOSPITAL CONFIRMED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2  A Pentagon spokesman confirmed today for the first time reports of damage to the Bach Mai Hospital and Gia Lam Airport in Hanoi during heavy air raids last month over North Vietnam but he denied that the damage was either massive or intentional.

title: Bank Merger Is Cleared
description: Harry W. Albright Jr., the New York State Superintendent of Banks, announced yesterday his approvalas of Friday, Dec. 29of the proposed merger of the Fishkill Savings Bank and Wappinger Savings Bank in upstate Dutchess County to form a combined institution with about $50million in assets. The proposed merger must still be approved by the Federal Deposit Insurance Cord poration.

title: Chairman Mao and Other Chair People
description: Minor though the trend may beflights of fancy devised by sculptors, designers and craftsmenthe human shape seems here to stay in modern furniture.

title: Subway Shifts Rile and Confuse Rockaway and Brooklyn Riders
description: Anger among Rockaway Park residents; confusion and skepticism among Brooklynites.

title: 11 JAIL OFFICERS ACCUSED IN RIOT
description: The warden and 10 other correction officers at the Queens House of Detention in Kew Gardens were charged yesterday by a special prosecutor with using excessive force to quell rioting by inmates in October, 1970.

title: U.S. JURY INDICTS HEROIN SUSPECT
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 2A Federal grand jury indicted today a 31yearold North Carolina man who the Government has said was a functionary in conspiracy to smuggle Asian heroin into the country in the coffins or in the cadavers of American servicemen killed in Vietnam.

title: 4,200 Units of Housing Covered By StateAided Mortgages in '72
description: The State Housing Commissioner, Charles J. Urstadt, reported yesterday that more than 4,200 units of housing worth more than $91million were scheduled to be built under stateaided mortgages arranged during 1972.

title: Roberts Is Off to Fast Start In His First. Day on Bench
description: After four hard  driving years as prosecutor in the Bronx, former District Attorney Burton B. Roberts donned the robes of a State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan yesterday, showing no letup in his zeal for action.

title: BOND RATES TAKE INDECISIVE PATE
description: Interest rates moved indecisively yesterday as the capital markets continued to reflect the seasonal dearth of new financings and unpredictable money flows. Weekend news of the prospective renewal of the Paris peace talks seemed to have only a marginal impact. Most corporate issues advanced by  or  point, but Treasury securities fell. Taxexempts were described as firm.

title: Chicago Police Head Seeks Ouster of 21 Indicted Men
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 2 (AP) Police Superintendent James B. Conlisk announced today that he would seek the dismissal of 21 policemen accused of extorting money from North Side tavern owners. Three other men indicted with them no longer are on the police force.

title: Tax Reform Unit Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (UPI) Senator Jacob K. Javits, Republican of New York, said today that he would introduce a bill to create a 12member commission on the reform of Federal income tax laws.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: U.S. FILES PETITION ON REVIEW OF I.B.M.
description: The Justice Department yesterday filed a petition for a rehearing by the entire United States Circuit Court of Appeals on a Dec. 19 decision by a threejudge panel that a special master be appointed to review those documents that the International Business Ma chines considers privileged and not part of the present giant antitrust suit against the company.

title: Pennsy Threatens To Cease Serving Jersey Commuters
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 2 (UPI) A report filed in Federal court here today by the Penn Central Transportation Company indicates the railroad may join the Jersey Central in trying to end commuter service in the Garden State.

title: Boeing Co. Given GoAhead On $95.2Million Contract
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 2 (AP)The Air Force has given the Boeing Company the goahead to begin work on a $95.2million contract for building and testing two prototype. Advanced Medium Transport Aircraft.

title: PRICES FOR TIRES AND ALUMINUM UP
description: Price increases covering major aluminum products and automobile tires were announced yesterday by a number of companies.

title: Books of The Times
description: ESSAYS IN PERSUASION. By John Maynard Keynes. 451 pages. St. Martin's Press. $9.50.

title: Shucks Smuggling Smashed
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex., Jan. 2 (UPI)United States Customs agents said today that an intensive 10month investigation had broken a smuggling operation specializing in the movement of illicit corn shucks from Mexico into the United States. Corn shucks from Mexico, which are used to wrap tamales, a Mexican dish, are legal if imported for private use, but when they are sold commercially they must meet United States food regulations.

title: Unbeaten Maryland Wins 8th in Row and Is Booed
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Jan. 2 (AP)Unbeaten Maryland, in a lethargic performance booed by the home, fans, defeated Kent State, 7658, tonight for its eighth victory. Len Elmore, from New York's Power Memorial Academy, tied a Maryland record by grabbing 24 rebounds. He scored 10 points.

title: WALTER E. ROLLINS, LYRICIST, 66, DEAD
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 2 Walter E. Rollins, who wrote the words for more than 500 songs, including Peter Cottontail and Frosty the Snowman, died last evening after a brief illness. He was 66 years old.

title: Nixon Averts a PATH Strike By Creating Emergency Panel
description: A strike threatened for last midnight that would have shut down the Port Authority Trans. Hudson Railroad (PATH) was postponed for at least 60 days when President Nixon set up an emergency panel a few hours before the deadline to look into the dispute between management and 214 members of the Brotherhood of Railway Carmen.

title: New Group Reported Set To Take Control of Yanks
description: The New York Yankees are expected to announce a change of ownership today at a noontime news conference at Yankee Stadium.

title: Scoring Leaders
Naval Operations Vice Chief Is Shifted After 4 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (AP)  Adm. Maurice F. Weisner, I who became vice chief of naval operations only a little more than four months ago, is to be moved to another job.

title: Plane Averts Crash
description: MIAMI, Jan. 2 (UPI)  A chartered amphibious plane with 17 persons aboard made a belly landing in a shower of sparks at Miami International Airport today after developing landing gear trouble. The Federal Aviation Administration said that none of the 15 passengers and two crewmen had been injured.

title: Johns Hopkins Professor Lauds Throat as a Cleansing Film
description: A professor of medical psychology at Johns Hopkins University testified in Criminal Court in Manhattan yesterday that people would be less likely to get divorces if they included films like Deep Throat in their sex education.

title: P.S.C. Denies Interim Rise Asked by Phone Company
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2For the first time in recent years, the Public Service Commission today denied the New York Telephone Company's request for a temporary rate increase.

title: INQUEST ON YOUTH IN HAZING SLATED
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 2The county coroner ordered a public inquest today into the death of Fred Bronner, a 21yearold college sophomore, who died during a fraternity hazing during the Christmas recess.

title: El Al Steward Is Charged With Smuggling of Drugs
description: A 22yearold El Al steward was charged yesterday with smuggling $250,000 worth of opium and hashish into the United States.

title: El Barrio Mourns Its Community Hero
description: There was one word on the lips of Puerto Ricans in El Barrio yesterdayClemente. And there were sad reminiscences from a boyhood friend who remembered visits to the home of a man who never forgot his people.

title: Man Shoots Himself in Hand
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Jan (UPI)  A Huntington man slipped and shot himself with his own gun at 1 A.M. today while he was chasing a prowler from his backyard, the Suffolk County police reported.

title: Drivers Get Extension On New License Plates
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2 (UPI)Motorists who have not received their new license plates by mail have been granted a 10day grace period.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: ROLLO HUNTER DEAD; TV AD EXECUTIVE, 52
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 2Rollo Hunter, an advertising executive, died Yesterclay at his home here on Knollwood Lane. He was 52 years old.

title: Quoting of OTC Stocks Changed to Volume Basis
description: Major changes in reporting overthecounter stock prices occurred yesterday under a set of new quotation standards implemented by the National Association of Security Dealers.

title: Eleazar Lopez Contreras, 89, Former President of Venezuela
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Jan. 2 (AP)Former President Eleazar Lopez Contreras, who governed from 1935 to 1941 after the death of Gen, Juan Vicente Gomez, died today at the age of 89.

title: Laotian Peace Talks Seem at New Low
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 2With insults flying, peace talks between the Laotian Government and the Communistled Pathet Lao appeared to have reached a new low today.

title: Legislature Opening Session Today; Debate Foreseen on Budget Surplus
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2Many of the state's 210 legislators began arriving in this frosty but unusually snowless capital city today for an evening of festivities and to prepare for the start of the 196th regular legislative session tomorrow.

title: Pop Music: Midler Style
description: In an effort to combat the Times Square festivities, Bette Midler rose majestically at midnight on New Year's Eve from beneath the stage at Philharmonic Hall. She was diaperclad and a huge 1973 streamer protected her modesty and made the point. For the packed and partisan audience, her efforts were completely successful.

title: ANDREI BELOZERSKY, A SOVIET BIOCHEMIST
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 2 (Reuters) Prof. Andrei Belozersky, vice president of the Soviet Academy of Sciences, died Sunday at the age of 67, Tass, the Soviet news agency, reported.

title: POTATO FUTURES REACH NEW HIGHS
description: Meat and potato prices in terms of futures trading gave consumers some bad news yesterday. Potato futures set another historic high and cattle futures rose to new lifeofcontract highs.

title: 1868 Menu and Prices Fill Many With Nostalgia, Too
description: More than 500 people waited in line yesterday for the start of the 105th anniversary celebration of the Old Homestead, a West Side steak house, which resurrected not only its 1868 menu, but also the prices of the era 19 cents for a fiveocurse meal.

title: Yonkers Reopens Tonight
The President at 60
