description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2President Nixon, who will be 60 on Jan. 9, is now at the very pinnacle of his political power, and yet, coming into his second term and his seventh decade, he is still in trouble.

title: Mansholt Warnings Mark Heath's E. E.C. Fanfare
description: LONDON, Jan. 2  European notables attending a banquet given tonight by Prime Minister Heath to mark his greatest triumph  Britain's entry into the European Economic Communityheard the community's top official warn that it badly needed an injection of democracy.

title: New Group Reported Set To Take Control of Yanks
description: The New York Yankees are expected to announce a change of ownership today at a noontime news conference at Yankee Stadium.

title: Israeli and Syrian Planes In a Clash Over Lebanon
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 2Israeli jets on a patrol flight today fought a brief air battle over Lebanon with Syrian jets that rose from nearby Syrian territory to intercept them.

title: Draft Orders Canceled For '72 CarryOvers
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (AP)Selective Service notified draft boards today to cancel induction orders for men who were left over from last year's draft pool and who have induction postponements due to expire this month or next.

title: Advertising: A Parting of Ways
description: The 40year clientagency relationship of the American Can Company and Young & Rubicam will end March. 31 because of a difference of opinion on marketing strategies and philosophies.

title: Court Bars Campus to 7 At Southern U. Reopening
description: BATON ROUGE, Jan. 2 (UPI) State officials obtained today temporary court orders restraining seven student protest leaders from entering the Southern University campus here and disrupting the predominantly black school's reopening.

title: Issues in the L. I. R. R. Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTSThe Long Island Rail Road and unions representing 5,000 carmen, teamsters, clerks, electrical workers, sheet metal workers and other nonoperating employes, as well as some supervisors.

title: A MOVING VIOLETTA BY MISS CRUZROMO
description: Gilda CruzRomo's first Metropolitan Opera Violetta, in Monday night's performance of La Traviata, was, on the whole, a creditable piece of work. At the very least one could take pleasure in hearing the bright, gleaming timbre of a healthy, wellfocused voice in this difficult role.

title: ARMY ALTERS WAX TO RATE OFFICERS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (UPI) Responding to charges that promotion go first to the conformist who does not rock the boat, the Army has scrapped the old version of its officers' annual efficiency report.

title: Legislature Convenes
description: As the New York State Legislature convenes in Albany today, its members confront an extraordinary range of issues. These run from the extremely personal question of abortion through the always nettlesome issue of relationships between the state and its cities, towns and counties. Even more pressing is need for a decision on the still unsatisfactory relationship between the electorate itself and government.

title: BUDGET NOMINEEBACKED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2, (Reuters)  The White House said today that President Nixon still had full confidence in Roy L. Ash, his choice for director of the Office of Management and Budget, who is alleged to have helped a company get millions of dollars from the United States Air Force with false financial statements.

title: Elimination of 235 Jobs Slated at Gulf Laboratories
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation said yesterday that it plans to eliminate 235 jobs at its research laboratories at Harmarville, Pa., effective March 1.

title: More Americans Are Saying Cheese
description: The cheese business is booming, with cheese departments and specialty stores proliferating and Americans generally becoming more knowledgeable and adventurous.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: PROFESSORS SEEK TO END HOUSE UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2The new 93d Congress, which meets tomorrow, is being petitioned by 365 professors from 94 law schools to abolish the House Committee on Internal Security.

title: Sadat Meets With 3 Ministers As Strike by Students Continues
description: CAIRO, Jan. 2 (AP)President Anwar elSadat met with his Ministers of Higher Education, Youth and the Interior today as a university sitdown strike demanding the release of imprisoned students passed its third day.

title: PENTAGON MAY DROP 100,000 EMPLOYES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (AP)Defense officials expect to slash about 100,000 civilian jobs as a result of base closings and other moneysaving retrenchments.

title: People in Sports: Bengtson Loses His Second Job in Two Weeks
description: Phil Bengtson, back just two weeks after filling in as interim coach of the New England Patriots in place of the dismissed John Mazur, was himself dismissed from his old job as director of talent for the San Diego Chargers yesterday by Harland Svare, coach and vice president of the club.

title: Fire Kills 2 Young Brothers
description: GOLDEN'S BRIDGE, N. Y., Jan. 2 (UPI)Two baby brothers died yesterday in a fire that destroyed their apartment in this northern Westchesteg County Village. Fire fighters were repeatedly driven back by intense flames. Four hours after the blaze broke out at 2 P.M. in the thirdfloor apartment. The bodies of the victims, identified as Bruce Lauder, 3 years old, and his brother, Dion, 2, were found. Their mother, Kathleen, was on the second floor when the fire started but was unable to reach her sons, the police said.

title: Suit Seeks to Reverse Law On Ritual Annual Slaughter
description: A lawsuit was filed yesterday seeking to overturn a Federal law that permitted the Jewish ritual slaughter of animals. The suit was the first one filed this year in Federal Court here.

title: Canada Is Closing Back Door to Aliens
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 2The Government has taken new steps, effective with the new year, to block the way for a rising flood of back door immigrants to Canada.

title: Nixon Asks Quake Aid In Honor of Clemente
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (UPI)President Nixon called today for generous contributions to Nicaraguan earthquake victims as the best memorial to Roberto Clemente, who was killed in an air crash while on a relief mission to Managua.

title: A.E.C. Aide Denies Report On Hijacked Nuclear Cargo
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (Reuters)  The Atomic Energy Commission denied today that any aircraft hijacked to Cuba or anywhere else ever carried a cargo of nuclear material.

title: WILLIAM PARSONS, SURGEON, 84, DIES
description: NOROTON, Conn., Jan. 2Dr. William Barclay Parsons, a retired professor of clinical surgery at Columbia University's College of Physicians and Surgeons in New York, died at his home here today. He was 84 years old.

title: ... Tyranny of Silence ...
description: The refusal of Secretary of State William P. Rogers and Presidential aide Henry A. Kissinger to discuss with key Congressional committees the status of war and peace in Indochina is, as Senator Fulbright has caustically observed, disappointing but not unusual.

title: Gorilla Born in Cincinnati
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 2 (AP)A fourpound gorilla was born last night at the Cincinnati Zoo. It was the sixth gorilla born there, and officials said that was a world record for a single Zoo

title: STOCKS OPEN YEAR MI SHARP GAINS
description: Stock prices rose sharply yesterday to open the market's new year, with buying based on expectations of a robust economy in 4973 and renewed hopes for the Vietnam peace talks.

title: PENHOLDER FIRST IN DASH AT BOWIE
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 2 (AP)Irene D. Karr's Penholder and Augustin Stable's Mo Bay shared honors today on Bowie Race Course's opening program of a 60day meeting by capturing the two divisions of the $15,000 added Southern Maryland Handicap.

title: TALKS REOPENED IN LI.R.R. STRIKE
description: The chief negotiators in the Long Island Rail Road strike met for three hours yesterday, their first facetoface confrontation since last Thursday.

title: City Store Sales Rose in December
description: In a typical lateChristmas surge and postholiday carryover, departmentstore sales in New York City shot ahead in the final two weeks of December. As a result, the month had one of its largest gains of the year over the yearearlier level in both the city and the metropolitan area.

title: Knicks Vanquish Bucks, 10292
description: Deadly outside shooting by Jerry Lucas and Bill Bradley as part of a team excellence almost two intricate to describe gave the New York Knicks command in the fourth quarter last night and brought them a 10292 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks before another capacity crowd of 19,694 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Cahill Expected to Avoid Any Major Tax Requests
description: TRENTON, Jan. 2Legislative sources reported here this evening that Governor Cahill would not recommend any major new or increased taxes in his budget message to the New Jersey Legislature this month.

title: Connecticut Urged to End BusinessEquipment Tax
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 2In a broad program of tax relief for business and industry, the Governor's Commission on Tax Reform proposed today that the personal property tax be phased out over a 10year period on nearly all new business inventories and industrial equipment in Connecticut. be phased out over a 10year period on nearly all new business inventories and industrial equipment in Connecticut.

title: Construction Orders Continuing Strong
description: New construction orders continue strong, the F. W. Dodge division of McGrawHill Corporation reported yesterday.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: An ancient Egyptian sarcophagus, a giltbronze and crystal chandelier from a palace of the Czars and a series of guided tours will be among the unusual objects and innovations at the Winter Antiques Show, opening Jan. 19 at the Seventh Regiment Armory, Park Avenue and 67th Street.

title: H.E.W. Exploring Reaction to Putting Strikers on Relief
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (UPI)The Department of Health, Education and Welfare proposed today two alternative regulations seeking to test public reaction to welfare aid for striking workers.

title: CAIRO STUDENTS AND POLICE CLASH
description: CAIRO, Jan. 3Longsimmering student unrest flared into the open today as thousands of riot policemen used tear gas, bamboo staves and truncheons to keep rebellious university students from marching on downtown Cairo.

title: New State Consumer Aide Sworn In
description: TRENTON, Jan. 3 (AP)Mrs. Millicent Fenwick was sworn in today as the new director of the State Division of Consumer Affairs, thus becoming one of the highestranking women in state government.

title: GRUTTOLA FREED IN BAIL OF $26,000
description: Joseph Grutolla whose release twice on $500 cash bail in connection with the shooting of a policeman stirred a public controversy, was arraigned State Supreme Court yesterday and released on $25,000 bail.

title: Tuesday Night Fights
description: Tokyo  Masao Ohba, 111 pounds, Japan, knocked out Chartchal Chionoi, 109, Thailand, 12; Ohba retained W.B.A. featherweight title.

title: STRIKE APPROVED BY GRAVEDIGGERS
description: Employes of 47 cemeteries in the New York area voted last night to authorize a strike for higher pay, but set no date for a general walkout pending further negotiations.

title: Curbs Urged on Reported Abuse Of FarmlandAssessment Laws
description: TRENTON, Jan, 4The leader of the Middlesex Assembly delegation urged the New Jersey Office of Fiscal Affairs today to recommend ways of curbing widespread abuse of the state's farmland assessment laws which is costing homeowners millions of dollars,

title: Nader Attacks Policy on Nuclear Power
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3Ralph Nader has joined forces with the Union of Concerned Scientists in what he promises will be a wideranging attack on the nation's nuclear power policy.

title: Business Briefs
description: DETROIT, Jan. 3 (UPI)Chevrolet paced the American automobile industry in sales in 1971 and 1972, and will continue in the lead in 1973, F. James McDonald, Chevrolet general manager, said today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Today, Jan. 4

title: In Yankees' Past: Tammany Hall, a Brewery, the Babe and, of Course, Casey
description: In the 70year history of the New York Yankees, nine distinct ownership regimes can be identified, and the 10th will be in command when the 71st year begins this spring.

title: Inaugural Planners Open Ad Campaign To Sell Souvenirs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3The 1973 Inaugural Committee began a national advertising campaign today to drum up business for its official inaugural souvenirs.

title: Brown Six Tops Princeton
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Jan. 3 (AP)Brian Stapleton of Fort Erie, Ontario, scored three goals for Brown and had one assist tonight as the Bruins' hockey team defeated Princeton, 52, in an Ivy League game.

title: Defense Sees Constitutional Test As EllsbergRusso Trial Starts
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 3 In the modern, almost antiseptic Federal Building downtown here, thousands of miles from Vietnam, the final act of the Pentagon papers case began to unfold today with the start of jury selection in the trial of Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. They are accused of espionage.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Occasional rain or showers are forecast today from central New England and the Metropolitan New York area through the Appalachians and Ohio Valley to the eastern Gulf Coast; freezing rain or snow is likely across northern New England. Warmer weather is expected in the lower lake region and the Southeast. Snow or snow flurries will spread from the central and upper lake region across the middle Mississippi Valley to New Mexico and Arizona. Colder weather is forecast from the central lake region to the Southern Plains States and the southern portions of the Rockies and plateau region.

title: Winnebago Net Falls Sharply, Depressed by $2Million Charge
6.000 Restaurants: Edmund Love's Odyssey
description: The man who has almost certainly dined out in more New York restaurants than anyone alive or dead is not a millionaire or a food critic or a policeman on the take. He is a 62yearold former bum.

title: Smith Quits as Arms Negotiator; Klein Reported Being Eased Out
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3Gerard C. Smith, who for almost four years has headed the American delegation to talks with the Soviet Union on limiting strategic weapons, has resigned from Government service.

title: INNSBRUCK JUMP TO SOVIET SKIER
LEFRAK CONFIRMS AID FOR CAMPAIGN
description: Officials of the Lefrak Organization, one of the largest building concerns in the country, confirmed yesterday that companies affiliated with it had made a series of $90 contributions to committees for the reelection of President Nixon but declined to give the total amount.

title: Medicare Cost Up 50 Cents a Month on July 1
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3The Social Security Administration announced today another raise in charges for the 22 million people aged 65 and older eligible for Medicare benefits, the third to go into effect this year.

title: Shula Names Griese as His Starter
description: Quickly and decisively, Don Shula named Bob Griese yesterday as the Miami Dolphins' starting quarterback in the Super Bowl game.

title: Sales Companies Charge Persecution
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 3William Penn Patrick, whose multimilliondollar complex of companies is based on the doortodoor sale of cosmetics, filed suit today against the California Attorney General, Evelle J. Younger; whose office has been attacking the Patrick companies' sales practices.

title: Stiff Hijacking Penalties Are Announced by Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 3The Soviet Union announced stiff penalties for airplane hijackers today, including the death penalty if the seizure of an aircraft causes casualties.

title: Double Loss
description: When a small private plane disappeared in Alaska last October, it caused a double loss in the House of Representatives in Washington. One of the victims was Representative Nick Begich of Alaska, a youthful educator and businessman who in his first term in the House had already shown himself a constructive and intelligent legislator.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Figure in Hijacking Attempt Is Linked to Threat to Nixon
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 3 (UPI)A Federal prosecutor said today that a man accused of trying to hijack a plane last night at Friendship International Airport may have threatened in 1971 to kill President Nixon.

title: U.S. LOSES ITS PLEA ON JOB SAFETY RULE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (UPI) United States District Judge Barrington Parker refused today to stay his order barring the Labor Depatment from extending the deadline for states to get Federal approval of their job safety programs.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 39

title: Three Protestants Charged in Ulster In Catholic Deaths
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 3Three Protestants were charged today with the murder of three Roman Catholics here.

title: Marquette Needs a Late Rally To Top Butler, Stay Unbeaten
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 3 (UPI) Dave Delsman sank two free throws with 84 seconds left tonight to give unbeaten Marquette a struggling 6766 victory over Butler.

title: Southern U. Reopening Is Quiet 7 Weeks After Two Were Slain
description: EATON ROUGE, Jan. 3 Southern University reopened peacefully here today, seven weeks after the fatal shooting of two students prompted state officials to close the predominantly black school.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Parisians Scoff at Price Cuts  And Buy
description: PARIS, Jan. 3The French Government's New Year gift to shoppers, a reduction in the national sales tax, has resulted in some modest cuts in retail prices, more work for store employes, and a large, measure of skepticism from housewives like Mrs. Colette Dupuis, who thinks It's all a joke.

title: People in Sports
description: Tampa was nice but Earle Bruce is not planning to stay around to win another cigar. The 41  year  old Bruce resigned yesterday as Tampa's head football coach, after only one year at the helm, to take the head coaching job at Iowa State. Bruce's team had a 10.2 wonlost record, including a Tangerine Bowl victory over Kent State. Johnny Majors quit the Iowa State job last month after five years to take the top post at the University of Pittsburgh.

title: AMEX AND OTC CONTINUE TO GAIN
description: Prices in the overthecounter market and on the American Stock Exchange continued to move higher yesterday although the advances were not as large as in the previous session. Trading was active.

title: Books of The Times
description: FOGARTY & CO. By Joe Flaherty. 252 pages. Coward, McCann & Geoghegan. $6.95.

title: Hogan Irate at Loss Of Aides to Nadjari
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan of Manhattan said yesterday that it was harmful and unfair for Maurice H. Nadjari, the state's special anticorruption prosecutor, to have offered some of Mr. Hogan's most experienced staff members salary increases to go to work for him.

title: Nixon Friend Seeks TV License Of a Washington Post Station
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Jan. 3 (AP)A Republican fund raiser who is a friend of President Nixon heads one of three companies trying to get the Federal broadcast license from television station WJXT in Jacksonville. WJXT broke the story of a 1948 white supremacy speech by G. Harrold Carswell when Mr. Carswell was a nominee for the United States Supreme Court.

title: Arculeo of G.O.P. Named Council's Minority Leader
description: After a raucus floor fight, the City Council designated Angelo J. Arculeo, a Republican, as its new minority leader yesterday. The event marked the end of the threeyear role of the Liberal party as the dominant minority.

title: A Donor to Neediest Tells Of Her Girl Who Died at
description: The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund received $25 yesterday in loving memory of Catherine Wheeler Davis.

title: Stocks Soar to Record
description: Stock prices soared to record levels yesterday, fed by the booming domestic economy and by hopes for the Vietnam peace talks. The DowJones industrial average climbed 12.12 to finish at 1,043.80. The average has gained more than 36 points in three sessions. Yesterday, 20.63 million shares were sold on the New York Stock Exchange. Page 53.

title: TV: News of 1972 Satirized in LateNight Special
description: TV comedy can be delightfully unintentional. On New Year's Eve, for instance, the Columbia Broadcasting System offered an instant replay of the countdown to midnight with revelers in Times Square. There's nothing quite like watching midnight at 12:02 A.M. If the original deserved one glass of champagne, the replay demanded two.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: 5Year Rule Waived for ClementeThe board of directors of baseball's Hall of Fame moved yesterday to clear the way for Roberto Clemente's immediate election, bypassing the usual fiveyear waiting period. Commissioner Bowie Kuhn announced that the board had amended elegibility rules for the election and authorized the Baseball Writers Association of America conduct a special election in the case of Clemente.

title: LONDON BANKS JOIN THALIDOMIDE CASE
description: LONDON, Jan. 3The collection of financial institutions known as the City of Londonpowerful, discreet and rarely known to enter a public controversyhas joined the campaign to get increased compensation for nearly 400 victims of thalidomikle.

title: Market Place: Accounting Plan For Land Sales
description: When investors begin to have serious doubts about the future of a stock or group of stocks it doesn't take long for the stock market to reflect it. And in no case has this kind of thing been more apparent in recent months than in the shares of the retail land sales companies.

title: For Paris Opera, Dynamic New Regime
description: PARIS, Jan. 3Rolf Liebermann, the new manager of the Paris Opra, today announced an ambitious program for his first season.

title: NEWS INDEX
Amer. Hockey League
description: TUESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Dow Average Advances by 12.12 to 1,043.80, Up 36 Points in 3 Days Analysts Surprised
description: The stock market surged to record highs yesterday, surprising many Wall Street analysts with its continued strength. Trading was heavy, climbing to 20.63 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange from the previous day's 17.09 million shares. Rising to its best closing level in history, the DowJones industrial average moved up 12.12 to 1,043.80.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. Virginia Squires, at Hampton, Va.

title: Hair Styles That Revive the Scissors
description: It should be easier for people watchers to distinguish the boys from the girls in 1973. The one with the short hair is likely to be female.

title: A.C.L.U. to Fight Pentagon On Conscientious Objectors
description: The American Civil Liberties Union said yesterday that it would fight in the courts any move by the Defense Department to abolish the right of servicemen who plead conscientious objection to seek honorable discharge.

title: Jersey Central Case Is Pressed by State
description: The New Jersey Attorney General has asked a Federal appellate court to expedite the state's appeal of a lowercourt ruling that would permit the Central Railroad of New Jersey to end passenger service after Jan. 21.

title: Hoffa Appeal of Conviction On Jury Tampering Rejected
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 3 (UPI)A Federal appeals court rejected today James R. Hoffa's appeal to overturn his 1964 conviction on jury tampering charges.

title: Needham Splits With Kolton on Board Plan
description: A major disagreement emerged yesterday in Wall Street's hierarchy as to how the securities industry should work toward the creation of a new national system of stock exchanges.

title: CAIRO STUDENTS AND POLICE CLASH
description: CAIRO, Jan. 3Longsimmering student unrest flared into the open today as thousands of riot policemen used tear gas, bamboo staves and truncheons to keep rebellious luniversity students from marching on downtown Cairo.

title: Bridge: Blumenthal Is the Successor To Soloway on Aces Team
description: The Aces will have a slightly changed team when they defend their Bermuda Bowl world championship title in Brazil in May.

title: American Fat
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3Americans don't like plain talk anymore. Nowadays they like fat talk. Show them a lean, plain word that cuts to the bone and watch them lard it with thick greasy syllables front and back until it wheezes and gasps for breath as it comes lumbering down upon some poor threadbare sentence like a sack of iron on a swayback horse.

title: 2 RENT STRIKERS GET 45DAY TERMS
description: NEWARK, Jan. 3Superior Court Judge Irwin Kimmelman, conceding that living conditions at the Stella Wright public housing project were bad, even deplorable, sentenced the two leaders of a tenants' rent strike today to 45 days' imprisonment on charges of civil contempt of court.

title: Chess: Tal Making Comeback, Using A Rapier, Not a Broadsword
description: Mikhail Tal, who won the world chess championship in 1960 by defeating Mikhail Botvinnik and returned the crown to Botvinnik the following year, topped a field of 22 to take the recent Soviet championship. Despite the frail health that has hospitalized him off and on over the last 10 years, requiring him to drop out of several tournaments, the Latvian grandmaster blazed a scorching path through 1972.

title: Democrats in Senate Expand and Slightly Liberalize the Finance Committee
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 Senate Democrats, hoping to exercise more, control over key legislation in the new Congress moved today to expand and liberalize slightly the membership of the Finance Committee.

title: YOUTH VOTE HEED OF LITTLE IMPACT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3The new 18to20yearold vote, which some strategists predicted would dramatically change American politics, turned out to make little if any difference, according to a Census Bureau report issued today.

title: POTATO FUTURES SUFFER SETBACK
description: After their recent spectacular string of new historic highs, potato futures tumbled yester day on the New York Mercantile Exchange. Speculators with large recent profits sold, and as the selling increased stop loss orders at lower prices became activated.

title: Big Retail Chain In South Will Use Bank Credit Cards
description: The breakthrough of bank credit cards into the departmentstore field took a major step forward with the announcement yesterday by Thalhimer Bros., Inc., a chain based in Richmond, Va., that it would honor Master Charge credit cards in all its 22 stores starting April 15. The chain also said it would add BankAmericard, another leading bank card, later.

title: Manufacturing Inventory And New Orders Are Up
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 The nation's manufacturing industries continued their steady but unspectacular inventory buildup in November, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: 900,000 Gave to Nixon Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3, (AP) The chairman of the Finance Committee to Reelect the President estimates that Mr. Nixon's campaign received con tributions from more than 900,000 people. Maurice H. Stans said today the campaign had received 1,021,882 contributions, adding the number of contributors was lower because some persons contributed more than once.

title: METREVELI UPSET IN SYDNEY TENNIS
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 3 (AP)  Ross Case upset fourthseeded Alex Metreveli and became one of seven Australians to advance to the quarterfinals of the $19,000 New South Wales open tennis championship today.

title: BLOOD STILL SHORT, APPEAL IS RENEWED
description: The Greater New York Blood Program renewed its appeal yesterday for donors, saying there was less than one day's supply of whole blood available for the 282 hospitals in the metropolitan area.

title: Smith Quits as Arms Negotiator; Klein Reported Being Eased Out
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3Gerard C. Smith, who for almost four years has headed the American delegation to talks with the Soviet Union on limiting strategic weapons, has resigned from Government service.

title: EARL M'BEE, HEAD OF CHEMICAL FIRM
description: WEST LAFAYETTE, Ind., Jan. 3Dr. Earl T. McBee, president and chairman of the Great Lakes Chemical Corporation here and head of the chemistry department at Purdue University from 1949 to 1967, died yesterday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 66 years old.

title: Poll Finds More in U.S. Expect Gain in Economy
description: President Nixon will begin his second term in office with the economic hopes of Americans brighter than at any other time since he began his first term in 1969, the Gallup Poll said yesterday. However, a slightly greater proportion of Americans at the present time predict economic difficulty for 1973 than foresee economic prosperity, it added.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: As a former country editor, this writer can assert with accuracy that few subjects, except the fortunes of the local high school football or basketball teams, stirred the imagination of rural readers more than a contest to determine where the largest trees of certain species grew in the surrounding countryside.

title: Ease and a Warm Personality Blend in Ella Garrett's Singing
description: Ella Garrett, a singer who opened a twoweek engagement on Tuesday at Reno Sweeney, 126 West 13th Street, is one of those fortunate performers who can project a warm, unpretentious, straightforward personality before an audience with the same naturalness and ease that one might in a personal encounter.

title: Relief for the Press
description: Barely a fifth of the 132 members of the United Nations enjoy what can genuinely be called freedom of information, the International Press Institute reported the other day. Although it listed the United States as one of the fortunate few, it also concluded that the Nixon Administration is attempting to chip away at press freedom through the courts and by the threats of court action.

title: Boston's Mayor to Offer Budget Aimed at Barring Tax Increase
description: Kevin H. White, in an effort to avoid an increase in the city property tax rate, already higher than in most major cities, will propose an austerity budget for 1973.

title: A State Watchdog Urged, To Improve Public Schools
description: ALBANY, Jan. 3  In an annual message permeated by disaffection with state and local institutions, Governor Rockefeller today proposed sweeping changes that included the creation of a state inspector general to oversee primary and secondary education, state assumption of local court costs and greater state responsibilities in health and welfare.

title: Script in Albany: A Touch of Levity and Many New Characters
description: ALBANY, Jan. 3Twoyearold Linda Lasher said no to Assembly Minority Leader Stanley Steingut today, bringing a mirthful respite to an otherwise, carefully rehearsed opening of the 1973 legislative session.

title: Nabisco Moving Headquarters From Park Avenue to Jersey
description: Nabisco, the giant baked goods company, disclosed yesterday that it has purchased 121acre golf course in East Hanover, N. J., for its corporate headquarters, which are now at 425 Park Avenue here.

title: Grumman Gets Navy Loan Despite Its Refusal on F14
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Jan. 3The Grumman Corporation has received an additional $18million loan from the Navy, despite its refusal to build 48 more F14's, the fifth batch of the fighter craft ordered from the company.

title: Final Football Ratings
description: The top 20, with firstplace votes in parentheses, season records and total points. Points tabulated on basis of 201816141210987654321.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: PULLOUT SOUGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3The 93d Congress convened today amid pledges by the Senate Democratic leader to bring about complete disinvolvement from the Vietnam war and by the Democratic Speaker of the House to demonstrate independence from the Republican Administration.

title: Castro Says New Agreements With Soviet Provide Major Aid
description: MIAMI, Jan. 3Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba announced tonight five new economic agreements with the Soviet Union that he said offered extraordinary new economic aid to Cuba.

title: College President. Quits
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Jan. 3 (AP)  Sister Mary Christopher O'Rourke, president of Salve Regina College since July 1, 1968, has resigned effective next June 15, according to the college Board of Trustees. The trustees of the small Roman Catholic women's college gave no reason yesterday for the resignation of the 52yearold president.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: ExRulers Could Face Courts Under Draft Pakistani Charter
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Jan. 3 (AP)A proposed constitution' opens the possibility of treason trials for Pakistan's two previous rulers.

title: Nabisco Leaving City for Jersey
description: Nabisco, the giant baked goods company, disclosed yesterday that it has purchased 121acre golf course in East Hanover, N. J., for its corporate headquarters, which are now at 425 Park Avenue here.

title: Amer. Hockey League
description: TUESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: SHIFTS IN POLICY ON CREDIT URGED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3  The National Commission on Consumer Finance called today for extensive shifts in public policy to increase the availability of credit to consumers and to curb unfair or excessively harsh collection practices.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: The top 20 with points figured on a 10987654321 basis for first through 10th Places and wonlost records through games of last Sunday (firstplace votes In parenthese):

title: MIHAJLOV'S APPEAL OF JAIL TERM FAILS
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Jan. 3Mihajlo Mihajlov, the Yugoslav social critic, said today that he had been informed he must serve a onemonth prison sentence for violation of a publication ban.

title: Planners Approve Big Housing Project Near Times Sq.
description: Plans for the construction of a major housing development west of Times Square  including two 45story towers, a row of fourstory apartment houses, a 1,000car garage, five tennis courts, a swimming pool and other recreational and commercial facilities  were approved unanimously yesterday by the City Planning Commission.

title: Bailing Out
description: The United States Navy has now joined the ranks the American investing public. It has no business in this role, and its action is full of dangerous implications.

title: Equity Financing
description: A nonregistered secondary offering of 25,000 common shares of Akwick Industries at $46.50 per share was completed yesterday by Blyth Eastman Dillon. The company's stock closed at 46, down  on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Trammell Wins Mile in 4:20.3
Soviet Assails the U. N. Information Staff
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 3Yakov A. Malik, the Soviet representative, accused the United Nations public information staff today of distortion, misrepresentation and outright deception in its reporting of the work of the justconcluded session of the General Assembly.

title: Rank Robbers Crash And Abandon the Loot
description: Two masked gunmen robbed a Long Island City branch of the Chemical Bank of $30,783 yesterday, but left most of the money in their wrecked getaway car after a collision with a panel truck two miles south on the Brooklyn waterfront.

title: Theater: Van Itallie's Mystery Play
description: JeanClaude Van Itallie is a young American playwright who made a distinct dent into world drama with his series of three playlets, America Hurrah. Widely discussed and highly valued, the expressionist satire of America Hurrah seemed, six years ago, to herald something new in American theater.

title: War Foes Meet in Washington To Urge Congress to Cut Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3Antiwar protesters from 40 states gathered here today to participate in a twoday religious conference aimed at putting pressure on Congress to cut off funds for military operations in Vietnam.

title: Lady Conyers Adds Zest To Bermuda Show Rings
description: A founder and the first president of the Bermuda Kennel Club, Florence Lady Conyers of Pembroke plays leading role in dogshow circles on the island.

title: Notes on People
description: Hypocrisy begins at home, said United States District Court Judge Charles E. Wyzanski, as he ordered all 14 assistant United States Attorneys in Boston to file sworn statements as to whether they have smoked marijuana. The judge, who has said that the Fecteral attorneys in Boston spend too much time prosecuting minor narcotics cases, stated that unless all the affidavits were filed by Feb. 6, he would dismiss the case of a 21yearold man who has pleaded guilty, to possessing hashhish. I want those affidavits ... and I mean it, said the judge.

title: Another Dissident Seized In Soviet Drive on Journal
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 3 (AP)The Soviet police arrested another dissident today in the widening effort to destroy an underground journal, The Chronicle of Current Events.

title: Arthur Daley
description: The natives were restless in the early part of the season. They were grumbling because George Allen, their genius coach, persisted in starting Billy Kilmer at quarterback over their longtime pet, Sonny Jurgensen. Although the Redskin fans conceded that this had been proper enough during the previous year when Jurgy was injured, they vehemently insisted that Jurgy's return to health had robbed this concept of all validity. With bumper stickers and other evidences of displeasure, they demanded the return Christian Adolph Jurgensen 3d. Allen made the switch from Kilmer to Jurgy when he thought the time was right for it, not because of any public pressures. That he scorns. It almost seemed that Sonny hardly had had time to unlimber his throwing arm when he ripped an Achilles tendon, finishing him not only for the season but also perhaps for keeps.

title: U.S. and Hanoi Aides Hold 2d Day of Technical Talks
description: PARIS, Jan. 3As American and North Vietnamese representatives met for the second day today on the technical aspects of a ceasefire, North Vietnam said the United States had halted its mining as well as its bombing north of the 20th Parallel.

title: A State Watchdog Urged To Improve Public Schools
description: ALBANY, Jan. 3  In an annual message permeated by disaffection with state and local institutions, Governor Rockefeller today proposed sweeping changes that included the creation of a state inspector general to oversee primary and secondary education, state assumption of local court costs and greater state responsibilities in health and welfare.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: As a former country editor, this writer can assert with accuracy that few subjects, except the fortunes of the local high school football or basketball teams, stirred the imagination of rural readers more than a contest to determine where the largest trees of certain species grew in the surrounding countryside.

title: City Unfolds Own Ballet for Chinese Acrobats
description: Fresh from a triumphant opening Tuesday night at the City Center, the Shenyang Acrobatic Troupe of the People's Republic of China began its first New York outing yesterday morning with a tour of Lincoln Center. Tony Horafas a hotdog vender stationed at 66th Street and. Broadway, and Harvey. Perlstein, a police sergeant assigned to Lincoln Center, seemed to arouse particular enthusiasm from the group with a keen eye for the working man at work. Sergeant Perlstein grinned broadly as two acrobats flanked him for a photograph by a third at Philharmonic Hall. Another member of the cameraladen delegation called, out in delight as he snapped Mr. Horafas's picture on Broadway.

title: Italy Suffers Fatal Floods and Rome Is Criticized
description: ROME, Jan. 3Whenever it rains, it's the Governments fault, the saying here goes, mocking Italians' penchant for blaming their rulers for every mishap.

title: CONVICTION UPSET IN RAPE OF WHITE
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Jan. 3A young black man convicted of raping a white woman, in one of Virginia's longest and most controversial cases, has won a reversal from a Federal District. Court after spending 10 years behind bars.

title: Critics Choose Cries and Whispers
description: Cries and Whispers, Ingmar Bergman's period drama about the emotional trials of three sisters, dominated the voting yesterday in the 39th annual poll of the New York Film Critics. Not only was it voted the best picture of 1972, but also Mr. Bergman won awards as the best director and screenwriter, and Lid Ullmann, one of the drama's stars, was cited as the year's top actress. The import is now in its premiere engagement at Cinema I.

title: C.B.S. Sells the Yankees for $10Million
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System said yesterday that it was selling the New York Yankees to a 12man syndicate headed by Michael Burke, now president of the team, and George M. Steinbrenner 3d of Cleveland.

title: Excerpts From the Message by Governor Rockefeller on the State of the State
description: ALBANY, Jan. 3Following are excerpts from the message by Governor Rockefeller on the State of the State to the Legislature today. An abbreviated version of the message was delivered on radio and television.

title: WALTER S. SHINN
description: Walter Scott Shinn, a photographer of prominent personalities and families and a specialist in child photography, flied yesterday at his home, 446 East 20th Street. His age was 88.

title: New Owner Held Yanks in Awe as Boy
description: As a boy, George M. Steinbrenner 3d lived in Cleveland so he had to be an Indian fan. But he remembers the Yankees well.

title: Reelect Bargaining Head
description: Arvid Anderson, chairman of the city's Office of Collective Bargaining, was unanimously reelected to a threeyear term, Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday. The office was created by the city and the union of city employes to help settle disputes, avert potential disputes and resolve legal questions.

title: COUGARS DEFEATS NETS, 110 TO 107
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Jan. 3The Carolina Cougars extended their winning streak to seven games tonight despite some poor foul shooting and a hot shooting performance by John Roche. The American Basketball Association Eastern Division pacesetters beat the Nets 110107, at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: LYNCH OF IRELAND DUE IN U.S. TODAY
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 3 (AP)Prime Minister John Lynch is to fly to New York tomorrow for a fiveday visit to the United States and is expected to try to cut off the Irish Republican Army's major financial pipeline from American sympathizers.

title: Snead Poets a 68
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 3 (UPI) Sam Snead posted a 68 today for the best individual score in the proamateur prelude to the $135,000 Glen Campbell Los Angeles Open. Snead's 68 was threeunderpar at the Riviera Country Club, where par is 35, 3671.

title: An Amazon Town, Focus of Colonization Effort, Suffers a Boom
description: ALTAMIRA, BrazilTo talk of shortages of wood and water in the heart of the Amazon rain forest seems to be a supreme absurdity, but these are real problems in this strapping boomtown.

title: PULLOUT SOUGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3The 93d Congress convened today amid pledges by the Senate Democratic leader to bring about complete disinvolvement from the Vietnam war and by the Democratic Speaker of the House to demonstrate independence from the Republican Administration.

title: Hard Line in Albany
description: It was a lock'emupandthrowawaythekey speech that Gov. Nelson Rockefeller delivered in Albany yesterday. Mr. Rockefeller proposed draconian remedies for the state's problems of drug addiction and the street crimes associated with it, including mandatory life sentences for those guilty of only firsttime selling of small amounts of hashish to friends. The crackdown measures Mr. Rockefeller wants on the books would forbid probation, forbid parole and forbid suspension of sentence. A bounty of $1,000 would be paid those turning in all pushers.

title: OBSCENITY TRIAL OF THROAT ENDS
description: The city's obscenity trial of Deep Throat ended yesterday in Manhattan Criminal Court after the taking of more than 1,000 pages of expert testimony in 10 days for and against the popular hardcore pornographic film.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: P.S.C. Phone Ruling Hailed

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: FASHION TALK
description: Towards the end of fashion's era of hats, in the late nineteensixties, the two best milliners of all saw the handwriting on the wall. They began working up little jackets, skirts, shirtdresses.

title: James Young, Who Led Program At Morningside Field, is Dead
description: James H. Young, director of the ColumbiaCommunity Athletic Field in Morningside Park, serving the university and the neighborhood residents, died yesterday in Cumberland Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 48 years old and lived at 530 Riverside Drive.

title: GRAHAM LIVINGSTON
description: Graham Livingston, retired coordinator of production and sales for Lederle Laboratories, a pharmaceutical concern, died yesterday in the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 74 years old and lived at 2501 Palisade Avenue in the Bronx and at the Forest Lake Club near Hawley, Pa.

title: A Newspaper Editor Attacks TV Licensing Bill
description: The Nixon Administration's proposal that local television stations be held accountable for the content of network news they broadcast drew sharp criticism yesterday from Robert G. Fithenberg, chairman of the freedom of information committee of the American Society of Newspaper Editors.

title: Congress Demands Peace
description: Whatever its impact on the negotiating position of the other side, it is now clear that President Nixon's 12day aerial blitz against North Vietnam has had a backlash at home that cannot but affect the American bargaining stance. When Henry Kissinger returns to the Paris talks, he will have, in addition to Presidents Nixon and Thieu, an aroused Congress looking over his shoulder.

title: Flying Command Post
description: HAMPTON, Va., Jan. 3 (AP) Navy and Air Force officials displayed today a $7million aircraft to be operated as the Atlanti Fleet's flying command post in the event of a national emergency. The EC135P, one of two Boeing 707type planes to be used by the Atlantic Fleet commander, Adm. Ralph W. Cousins, will be flown and maintained by the Air Force but under Navy command. It can be refueled in flight to allow it to remain aloft for as long as four days.

title: Hogan Irate at Loss of Senior Staff Aides to HigherPaying Jobs With Nadjari
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan of Manhattan said yesterday that it was harmful and unfair for Maurice H. Nadjari, the state's special anticorruption prosecutor, to have offered some of Mr. Hogan's most experienced members salary increases to work for him instead.

title: TEBALDI REAPPEARS IN OTELLO AT MET
description: Eighteen years ago this month Renata Tebaldi made her debut at the Metropolitan Opera in the role of Desdemona in Otello. On Monday night the soprano returned to the role for the first time in many years, appearing in the Zeffirelli production that was new last season.

title: THE MAYOR NEARS QUEENS PROBLEMS
description: Mayor Lindsay, after listening to community leaders from the Rockaways talk for hours about their problems, told them yesterday that the Queens peninsula had become a microcosm of urban ills.

title: C. B. S. Sells the Yankees for $1 0Million
description: The Columbia Broadcasting ystem said yesterday that it ?? selling the New York ?? to a 12man syndicate ?? by Michael Burke, now resident of the team, and ?? M. Steinbrenner 3d of leveland.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: College Official Appointed
description: TRENTON, Jan. 3 (AP) Robert I. Smith of Livingston, executive vice president of Public Service Electric and Gas Company, was appointed by Governor Cahill today to the board of Newark College of Engineering. Mr. Smith is a licensed professional engineer and former director of the New Jersey Council for Research and Development.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: IN MEMORIAM Ezra Pound died In Venice last November, leaving behind a wealth of highly acclaimed work by Pound, the poet, and a heap of controversy stirred by Pound, the person. Tonight at 7:30, A Quiet Requiem for E.P., a memorial to the poet, will take place in the auditorium of the Donnell Library Center, 20 West 53d Street (790.6447). It's free to the public and sponsored by the Academy of American Poets, the 39yearold organization that gives New Yorkers 10 poetry readings a year, either at the Donnell or at the Guggenheim Museum.

title: Job for Labor
description: With the Long Island Rail Road strike limping into its sixth week today, Governor Rockefeller has passed to President Nixon and Congress the responsibility for rushing through a law to get the trains running again.

title: E.E.C. Order Gives Carpets and Glass Reduction in Duty
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 3 (AP)An end to a 10yearold carpet and glass war with the United States was announced today by the Common Market Executive Commission.

title: BOND PRICES FAIL TO ACHIEVE TREND
description: Bond prices continued without a trend yesterday as Wall Street turned its attention to the first significant new financings since midDecember. Treasury securities, easier on Tuesday, achieved modest gains of up to point in advance of the auction today of $625million of 20year bonds. Corporate issues recovered from early losses and finished about unchanged. Money rates, meanwhile, displayed no definite direction yesterday although their upward pressure of recent weeks was cited by a number of bond men as reason for some concern.

title: Bus Fire Kills 8 in Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 3 (Reuters)Eight persons were burned to death and II others received serious burns last night when a crowded bus caught fire at the seaside resort of Constitucin, in southern Chile.

title: JERSEY PRESSING RAILROAD APPEAL
description: The New Jersey Attorney General has asked a Federal appellate court to expedite the state's appeal of a lowercourt ruling that would permit the Central Railroad of New Jersey to end passenger service after Jan. 21.

title: TaxEvasion Trial Opens Here For a Reputed Leader of Mafia
description: Aniello Dellacroce was described by the prosecution at the opening of his taxevasion trial yesterday as the secret owner of $123,000 in stock that he allegedly obtained to insure labor peace for a manufacturer of plastic coathangers.

title: Bucks Win, 10597
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 3 (AP)The Milwaukee Bucks, with Bob Dandridge scoring 18 of his 22 points in the second half defeated the Atlanta Hawks, 10597, tonight and ended a threegame National Basketball Association losing streak. Kareem AbdulJabbar scored 26 points for the Bucks.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, JANUARY 4, 1973

title: A Witness Denies He Worked On the Home of Gen. Cantwell
description: TRENTON, Jan. 3A retired Army warrant officer denied oil the witness stand in Mercer County Court today that he had ever done construction or immovement work on the private property of Maj. Gen. James F. Cantwell.

title: 100 Physicians Hear Exponents Describe Values of Acupuncture
description: About 100 physicians representing a wide variety of disciplines are attending a seminar on a acupuncture here this week.

title: Bank Robbers Crash And Abandon the Loot
description: Two masked gunmen robbed a Long Island City branch of the Chemical Bank of $30,783 yesterday, but left most of the money in their wrecked getaway car after a collision with a panel truck two miles south on the Brooklyn waterfront.

title: Three Utilities Announce Plans to Raise Capacity
description: Three electric utilities announced yesterday expansion plans totaling more than $1.3billion and including both nuclear and conventional generating systems.

title: 13 Steps to Improvement In Criminal Justice
description: MIAMI BEACHI would like to suggest a broad agenda for our mutual [Federal and state] but separate action in the field of criminal justice.

title: Global Good and Evil: II
description: CAMBRIDGE, EnglandLike our forefathers, we may feel that the world was spoiled before ever we were born. We face systems of society not quite the same now as in feudal times, but such as have been defeating the human race for centuries. It is pointless for us to blame our predecessors, for they handed down to us a world of patches and compromises because they, too, had their desperate moments, wondering sometimes whether they could keep the world on its legs at all. In any case, a few million decent people like us, with the normal amount of egotism, would tangle everything up within fifty years even if they had a clean start.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: After a noisy floor fight, the City Council designated Angelo J. Arculeo, a Republican, as its new minority leader, replacing Eldon R. Clingan, who switched from the Liberal to the Democratic party last fall and resigned the leadership. The futile floor fgiht was led by the two remaining Liberals on the Council, who said their party should keep the post, and one of the Council's three Republicans, Frank J. Biondolillo, who wanted the job for himself.

title: GUARDS HELD6HOURS BY GEORGIA INMATES
description: REIDSVILLE, Ga., Jan. 3 (AP) Four prison guards were held hostage for more than six hours today by a group of rebellious inmates, but they were released unharmed after the authorities agreed to meet three of the prisoners' demands.

title: People and Business
description: Arthur E. Larkin Jr., the former president and chief operating officer of the General Foods Corporation who abruptly took early retirement last April, has been named president of the Keebier Company. At the Chicagobased producer of cookies and crackers, the 55yearold Mr. Larkin succeeds Edwin L. Cox, 51, who continues as chairman.

title: Meskill Gives Tax Reform And Drugs Top Priority
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 3Gov. Thomas J. Meskill told the General Assembly today that he would ask it to deal urgently with a broad program of tax reform, in which he envisaged substantial reductions for both individuals and industries.

title: NICARAGUA REPORTS 16 LOOTERS KILLED
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Jan. 3 (UPI)National Guard troops, with orders to shoot on sight, have killed 16 looters in the last five days in the ruins of this earthquakedevasted city, police officials said today.

title: Graham Replies to Critics Of His Silence on Bombing
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C., Jan, 3 (AP)Responding to criticism that he had not publicly interceded with President Nixon to stop the bombing of North Wetnam, the Rev. Billy Grahamsaid today that he hoped for a rapid and just peace in Southeast Asia.

title: STATE IS SCORED ON NOISE CONTROL
description: Two toplevel Lindsay administration officials accused the state yesterday of failing to consult the city on noisecontrol proposals that they said could jeopardize the city's economy and foment corruption and graft.

title: MARCHI, CONKLIN GET SENATE POSTS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 3  In one of his first moves as majority leader, Senator Warren M. Anderson today appointed Senators John J. Marchi and William T. Conklin, both of New York City, to important positions in the Senate power structure.

title: Dauplaise Brings In Double As Yonkers Meeting Begins
description: YONKERS, Jan. 3  Herve Filion drove 550 miles to get here in time for tonight's 1973 harness racing opener at Yonkers Raceway, but Norman Dauplaise beat him to they punch by bringing home both ends of a $202.60 daily double.

title: Corona's Defense Calls No Witnesses
description: FAIRFIELD, Calif., Jan. 3 The defense in the trial of Juan V. Corona rested today without calling a single witness on behalf of the 38yearold. Mexican national charged with largest multiple murder in nation's history.

title: SABRES VANQUISH ISLANDERS, 4 TO 1
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 3 (AP)Rick Martin and Rene Robert each scored his 24th goal of the season tonight, helping the Buffalo Sabres beat the New York Islanders, 41, in the National Hockey League.

title: Appeals Court Rejects Request To Clarify Austin School Ruling
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 3 (AP) The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit refused today to clarify its desegregation order for the Austin, Tex., public schools.

title: Meskill Gives Tax Reform And. Drugs Top Priority
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 3Gov. Thomas J. Meskill told the General Assembly today that he would ask it to, deal urgently with a broad program of tax reform, in which he envisaged substantial reductions for both individuals and industries.

title: Selection of New Jury Begins in Crowded Court
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 3In courtroom crowded with spectators and prospective jurors, the Pentagon papers trial began again today with the start of the selection of a new jury.

title: Defendants United in Opposing War
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 3Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. are such different men that, but for the accident of their being in Vietnam at the same time, one might be surprised to find them codefendants.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Sale to Begin on Halpert Collection

title: Basha Szymanska Wed to Lewis Rudin
description: Lewis Rudin, chairman of the Association for a Better New York, and Miss Basha Szymanska, a model, were married here last night. The ceremony was performed at the 21 Club by State Supreme. Court Justice Burton B. Roberts. Mr. Rudin, whose previous marriage ended in divorce, is a vice president of the Rudin Management Company, New York building owners. His father, Samuel Rudin, is founder and chairman of the company. The bride, who is with the Wilhelmina Agency here, is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Tadeuz Szymanski of Philadelphia.

title: Justice Raymond E. Peters Of the California High Court
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Jan. 3 (UPI)Justice Raymond E. Peters of the California Supreme Court, who wrote hundreds of liberal opinions in 13 years on the court, died yesterday at his home of a stroke. He was 69 years old.

title: SHIFTS IN POLICY ON CREDIT URGED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3  The National Commission on Consumer Finance called today for extensive shifts in public policy to increase the availability of credit to consumers and to curb unfair or excessively harsh collection practices.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: STANDING OF THE TEAMS East Division

title: TERRORISM REDUCES TOURISM IN ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 3Terrorism by Arab guerrillas and air hijacking cut into Israel's vital tourism industry during the last half of 1972, Government officials conceded here today.

title: Kawaida's Sponsors Assail 3 Blacks for Their Silence
description: NEWARK, Jan. 3The Temple of Kawaida, a black nationalist group sponsoring the controversial housing project in Newark's North Ward, chided three black politicians tonight for what it termed their strange silence in the dispute.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: RANGERS WIN, 30; GIACOMIN EXCELS
description: In a brilliant goaltending duel that wound up with Ed Giacomin becoming the Rangers' career shutout leader, the New Yorkers last night took advantage of their only two powerplay opportunities and scored a 30 victory over the aggressive Los Angeles Kings.

title: Governor's Drug Plan Draws Anger, Cautious Applause and a Sense of Anguish
description: The Governor's call for the mandatory life imprisonment of drug sellers brought quick and angry denunciations yesterday from some of the quarters where such reactions were predictablethe Legal Aid Society, the New York Civil Liberties Union, the chairman of the McKay Commission on the Attica riots and Representative Bella S. Abzug.

title: Marcos Moves to Appease Moslems
description: MANILA, Jan. 3President Ferdinand E. Marcos today sought an end to dissidence among southern Moslems by offering selective amnesty and economic benefits.

title: EVERETT L. HART
description: Everett L. Hart, a television producer for Young & Rubicam, Inc., New York advertising agency, died in Rome on Monday of complications following bronchial pneumonia. He was 51 years old and lived at 347 West End Avenue.

title: CAUTION ON TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3High Administration officials said today that the United States was entering the negotiations with North Vietnam next week without assuranees that an early settlement of the Vietnam war would be achieved.

title: CAUTION ON TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3High Administration officials said today that the United States was entering the negotiations with North Vietnam next week without assurances that an early settlement of the Vietnam war would be achieved.

title: 2 CRIME FIGURES TESTIFY IN QUEENS
description: Two reputed underworld figures answered questions yesterday before a Queens grand jury that is investigating infiltration of legitimate businesses by organized crime and the death of one of the key witnesses in the inquiry.

title: U. S. Continues Bombing of North Vietnam Below the 20th Parallel
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Jan. 4 (AP)Supply routes and other targets in the southern part of North Vietnam were heavily attacked again yesterday by United States planes, among them B52 heavy bombers.

title: City Sees Benefits in State Message
description: ALBANY, Jan. 3The Lindsay administration said today that it had found elements of the Governors State of the State message that can be of substantial benefit to the city  particularly the proposed state assumption of welfare and court costs.

title: Stocks Soar to Record
description: Stock prices soared to record levels yesterday, fed by the booming domestic economy and by hopes for the Vietnam peace talks. The DowJones industrial average climbed 12.12 to finish at 1,043.80. The average has gained more than 36 points in three sessions. Yesterday, 20.63 million shares were sold on the New York Stock Exchange. Page 53.

title: PETROLANE ACQUIRES LOMIT A GASOLINE CO.
description: The Lomita Gasoline Company, the largest producer of natural gas in Southern California, has been purchased by Petrolane, Inc., from the Standard Oil Company of California, Terms of the purchase were not disclosed.

title: LEGISLATURE OPEN
description: ALBANY Jan. 3Demanding a policy of brutal honesty in dealing with the drug problem, Governor Rockefeller toiday proposed that all convicted pushers of hard narcotics and violent addicts receive mandatory life sentences with no possibility of parole or plea bargaining.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Fairchild Camera & Instrument Corporation announced yesterday at Mountain View, Calif., that it had received a $19million contract to supply electronic circuitry to the Polaroid Corporation. The contract would make Fairchild a major supplier of the three solidstate modules which control the exposure, flashfiring and motor functions of the new Polaroid SX70 instant picture camera. Production quantities are already being shipped, Fairchild said.

title: MRS. ELI LORANGER
description: Mrs. Edna Cole Loranger, widow of Eli J. Loranger, who was vice president here of R. L. Polk & Co., publishers of city directories, died Monday in the Echo Rest Home, Syosset, L. J. She was 83 years old.

title: Fringe Benefits for Congressmen Put at $8,500
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (AP) Fringe benefits for Representatives and Senators are worth a minimum of $8,500 and push their total income to at least $51,000, an Associated Press survey shows.

title: Counts to Leave Post As Mediation Director
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 The director of the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service, J. Curtis Counts, announced today that he is leaving the Government to return to private industry.

title: LEGISLATURE OPEN
description: ALBANY Jan. 3Demanding a policy of brutal honesty in dealing with the drug problem, Governor Rockefeller today proposed that all convicted pushers of hard narcotics and violent addicts receive mandatory life sentences with no possibility of parole or plea bargaining.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N.J., Jan. 3Clary Anderson is predictable. All the Montclair State football coach does is win, and then win some more.

title: Thriving Ski Holidays End in a Wet Blanket
description: RUTLAND, Vt., Jan. 3 Just when it seemed that ski area operators were about to enjoy one of their most lucrative holiday seasons in many years, along came rain last Sunday to put a damper on their liftticket sales.

title: GOLF SETS RECORD, A $500,000 EVENT
description: A new World open golf championship with a $500,000 purse and a first prize of $100,000 will be held Nov. 6 through 18 at Pinehurst, N. C. It will be the game's richest tournament.

title: Bowl Games Rekindle Interest In College Football Title Game
description: Advocates of a National Collegiate football championship playoff game have not got back to the line of scrimmage with their plans. But they gained considerable material for their argument last weekend as the bowl games proved nothing new. Southern California is better than any team in the Big Ten. Texas may never lose to an Alabama team coached by Paul (Bear) Bryant. Oklahoma has a fine defense, particularly when pitted against a Penn State team that has no running attack, Notre Dame should have stayed home. These were the conclusions from the Rose, Cotton, Sugar and Orange Bowl games.

title: NIXON FARM CUTS FACE OPPOSITION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3  Bipartisan opposition to the Nixon Administration's deep cuts in farm programs mounted in Congress today.

title: Advertising: Selling to Russians
description: The Soviet Union's only ad agency, the stateowned Vneshtorgreklama, and Marsteller, Inc., which handles more industrial advertising than any other agency in this country, will be working together to help United States' manufacturers sell industrial and engineering products in the Soviet Union.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: TUESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Ending the War in Vietnam
description: To the Editor:

title: State Task Force on Urban Ills Urges Strong Controls on Aid to the Cities
description: TRENTON, Jan. 3The State Task Force on Urban Problems, citing continued financial mismanagement, political conflict, and a leadership vacuum in Newark, is expected to recommend to the Legislature next month that all state urban aid far New Jersey's cities include strong new state controls.

title: Levitz Reports an Increase Of 43% in December Sales
description: The Levitz Furniture Corporation, Pottstown, Pa., reported yesterday that its De comber sales rose 43.6 per cent over the same 1971 month to $30.3million from $21.1million.

title: MRS. NANCY WILLIAMS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 3 (UPI)Mrs. Nancy Guggenheim Williams, an author, ballet teacher and copper heiress, died yesterday of an overdose of sleeping pills, the police reported today. She was 57 years old.

title: Constitution Cited in SexChange Case
description: TRENTON, Jan. 3Lawyers for a teacher who underwent a sexchange operation charged today that she was denied guarantees of equal protection under the 14th Amendment when she was dismissed from her job.

title: Personal Finance
description: If an individual can make out apersonal balance sheet, the person can easily read a corporate balance sheet, whether it belongs to General Motors with its many billions of assets, or to a smaller company. And this is a good time to make out a personal balance sheet; just as many corporations are doing now.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Three New Jersey residents aged 18 to 20 were given summonses by the state police for driving while under the influence of alcohol on Monday, the first day the state's new 18year minimum drinking age was in effect. From 6 P.M. Friday to midnight Monday, the state police issued 103 drinkingdriving summonsesthree to the 18to20yearolds, 99 to other adults and one to a 17yearold from Pennsylvania. In the last 12month period studied, the state police issued 3,958 of the 12,698 drinkingdriving summonses in the state. None of the 18to20yearolds who were issued summonses were involved in accidents.

title: Higher List Prices Slated On Some Alcoa Products
description: The higher price trend for key aluminum products initiated Tuesday by the Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation spread to other major producers yesterday.

title: Yankees' Man of Independence
description: Some say baseball is out of joint with the times, Michael Burke once wrote. Well, at least we have that to be grateful for, these times being made up of a number of appalling ingredients.

title: A.B. C. Will Spend $25Million For Summer Olympics Rights
description: The American Broadcasting Company yesterday agreed to pay $25million for exclusive United States television rights for the 1976 summer Olympics in Montreal.

title: Rockefeller Urges U.S. Curbs To Avert Local Rail Strikes
description: Governor Rockefeller's call for new Federal legislation to avert local transportation strikes in his State of the State message yesterday drew mixed reactions from some Congressional leaders.

title: HOTEL IN CAMBRIDGE GIVEN NEW DESIGN
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 3An agreement was announced today to reduce the height of a Holiday Inn being built next to the site of the planned John F. Kennedy Memorial Library near Harvard Square.

title: 3 Students Killed As Bus Overturns In Rain on Rte. 17
description: OWEGO, N. Y., Jan. 3A bus carrying a highschool swimming team home to Vestal, N. Y., from a meet in Towanda, Pa., overturned during freezing rain on Route 17 tonight. Three of the students were killed and 15 others on the bus were injured.

title: Future of Commuter Club Car in Doubt
description: A group of New Jersey commuters is discovering that a private railroad car is really not much good without a railroad to haul it.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: TRIAL OF KERNER OPENS IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 3  Judge Otto Kerner of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit went on trial today in Federal District Court charged with bribery, perjury and income tax evasion.

title: Russian Defector's Death May Have Been Accident
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif., Jan. 3 (UPI)A young Russian defector, found dead in a rented mountain cabin, apparently shot himself to death accidentally with a gun he carried because threats had been made against his life, the authorities said yesterday.

title: Churchill Letters Told Wife of Undying Love
description: LONDON, Dec. 3Love letters written by Winston Churchill to his wife from the trenches in World War I are to be published this month.

title: U.S. Envoy Irked by Australian Actions
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 3AntiAmerican statements by a member of Prime Minister Gough Whitlam's new Cabinet, coming on top of other disturbing developments in the normally tranquil relations between the United States and Australia, have irked the United States Embassy.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock Exchange yesterday issued its latest weekly report of changes in stock ownership by leading stockholders, directors and officers of its listed companies.

title: $128Million Chavez Suit Charges Rights Violations
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 3 (UPI)Cesar Chavez, the farm worker leader, filed a 8128million damage suit today against the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and California I shippers and growers, alleging civil rights violations through sham contracts that excluded minority farm workers.

title: Grumman Gets Navy Loan Despite Its Refusal on F14
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Jan, 3The Grumman Corporation has received an additional $18million loan from the Navy, despite its refusal to build 48 more F14's, the fifth batch of the fighter craft ordered from the company.

title: Chance Miltie Wins by Head, Pays $12.80 at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 3 (AP) Eugene F. O'Connell's Chance Miltie established himself today as a strong contender for the upcoming $25,000 Germantown Handicap when he won a prep for the Jan. 13 race at Liberty Bell Race Track.

title: GERALD C. O'BRIEN, 41 OF DEMOLITION FIRM
description: Gerald C. O'Brien, owner of G. C. O'Brien, Inc., nationally known contractors specializing in demolition work, was killed Monday evening in the crash of his twinengine airplane at the airport in Memphis. He was 41 years old and lived in Merrillville, Ind.

title: GOLF SETS RECORD, A $500,000 EVENT
description: A new World open golf championship with a $500,000 purse and a first prize of $100,000 will be held Nov. 6 through 18 at Pinehurst, N. C. It will be the game's richest tournament.

title: CONGLOMERATES: DATA LACK CITED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3The wave of conglomerate mergers in the late 1960's has produced one major harmful result, according to a study done for the Federal Trade Commission and made public today.

title: Army Aide Leans to Rejecting Plan for New Deepwater Port
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 3The official in charge of planning a deepwater port off New Jersey for the Army Corps of Engineers side today that he probably would recommend that the corps abandon the idea because of widespread public opposition.

title: A Restaurant That's Often CrowdedFor Good Reason
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and ddcor (four triangles to none).

title: Lottery Numbers
description: NEW YORK

title: CHARLES DOUGHERTY; INSURANCE LEADER
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va., Jan. 4Charles G. Dougherty, who retired as executive vice president of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company in 1971, died today at the age of 65.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Bridge: Player Can Prove His Mettle Even Far From Mainstream
description: There are undoubtedly some excellent players living in remote parts of the world, far from the mainstream of international competition. Lack of strong partners and strong opponents automatically deprives them of the chance of reaching world class, but they can make their presence felt on occasion.

title: Aluminum SetAside To Remain Unchanged
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) The aluminum setaside for the first quarter of 1973 mill remain at the 125million pound level of the preceding three months, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Rental Pools May Put Units Under Federal Securities Laws
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Securities and Exchange Commission today warned developers and agents of condominium and similar real estate units that the offer and sale of such properties are subject to Federal securities laws when linked to rental or profitsharing arrangements with purchasers.

title: JUMBO JET DIVERTED AFTER BOMB THREAT
description: RAPID CITY, S.D., Jan. (UPI)A Trans World Airlines 747 jet with 236 persons aboard on a flight from Madrid to New York was diverted to Ellsworth Air Force Base today because an extortionist said that he had put an altitudesensitive bomb on the craft.

title: SATELLITE RELAY FOR U.S. APPROVED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Western Union Corporation won Government approval today of its plan to build the first United States domestic satellite communications system to handle such services as its telegraph, Telex and private line. services.

title: George Drew, Ontario Premier And Conservative Leader, Dies
description: TORONTO, Jan. 4 (AP) George Drew, former Premier of Ontario and national leader of the Conservative party from 1948 to 1956, died in Wellesley Hospital today. He was 78 years old.

title: Examination of Lansky Set
description: MIAMI, Jan. 4 (AP)A Federal judge ordered today a courtappointed physician to examine Meyer Lansky to determine if the reputed underworld financial figure is too ill to stand trial on contempt charges. Lansky is 71 years old.

title: Recruiting Station Bombed
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 4 (AP) An explosion occurred at Army recruiting station in at residential area early today, the second to damage a military office here this week. No injuries were reported and no estimate of damage was immediately available.

title: Court Action, Not Apology, Set For Hayes Over Bowl Flareup
description: LAS ANGELES, Jan. 4 (UPI), The editor of the Los Angeles Times says the newspaper will not apologize to the Ohio State coach, Woody Hayes, for an incident in which the coach allegedly shoved a camera into the face of a Times photographer before the Rose Bowl game.

title: Niger Cuts Ties With Israel
description: NIAMEY, Niger, Jan. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)Niger broke off diplomatic relations with Israel today. On Jan. 1 Niger suspended relations after a decision by Israel to close her embassy here for economic reasons.

title: Injured Rare Whale Is Put Into a Backyard Pool
description: BEACH HAVEN, Jan. 4An extremely rare species of beaked whale that was rescued from the beach and placed in a private swimming pool has drawn scientists from several states and Canada here in an attempt to keep it alive and to determine just what type of whale it is.

title: $2.634BILLION ASKED FOR RELIEF
description: Despite a forecast drop in relief rolls and a Federal takeover of certain relief categories, the city's Human Resources Administration is asking for a record budget of $2.634 billion for welfare, Medicaid and other programs for the fiscal year starting next July 1.

title: Alexis Johnson Is Expected to Replace Smith as Negotiator on Strategic Arms
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4U. Alexis Johnson, the State Department's senior career officer, is expected to replace Gerard C. Smith as the head of the United States delegation to the talks with the Soviet Union on limitation of strategic arms, wellplaced Nixon Administration officials said today.

title: Stark State Message
description: ALBANY, Jan. 4He was really trying to respond to peopie's frustration at paying more and more taxes with no signs of visible improvement, an official of the Rockefeller administration said today in a comment on the Governor's Itarksome used words like harsh and Draconianannual message to the Legislature. And indeed there were references in his message concerning a public jaded by sluggish governmental performance at all levels, angry at the unresponsiveness of swollen bureaucracies and vested interests and confronted with an allpervasive fear because of crime and drugs.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: A $100,000 GRANT HONORS CLEMENTE
