description: In a letter to Daniel M, Galbreath, president of the Pittsburgh Pirates, Richard P. Mel Ion, president of the Richard King Mellon Foundation, announced a grant of $100,000 yesterday in memory of Roberto Clemente.

title: Music Hall of Israel Comes to Garden
description: Myron Cohen pegged The Grand Music Hall of Israel best last night at the Felt Forum. When the humorous American monologuist appeared on stage for his stint before the finale, he deemed the preceding entertainment delightful. He added: They need, me like a hole in the head. Neither the visitors nor Mr. Cohen needed anything more.

title: Famed Wings Line Up Here
description: The three faces might have been stitched together in the laboratory of a mad scientist. They are a relief map of hockey, detailing the sites of battles and victories.

title: Bridge: Player Can Prove His Mettle Even Far From Mainstream
description: There are undoubtedly some excellent players living in remote parts of the world, far from the mainstream of international competition. Lack of strong partners and strong opponents automatically deprives them of the chance of reaching world class, but they can make their presence felt on occasion.

title: Black, 18, Given Interim Seat On the Englewood City Council
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Jan. 4Only four days after a new state law made him a legal adult, an 18yearold black youth was appointed today to the City Council as a temporary replacement for Councilman Vincent K. Tibbs, who died last Sunday.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
Ward Scores 5 Times As Raiders Win by 94
description: The New York Raiders and the Ottawa Nationals of the World Hockey Association may not play classic hockey, but they do help each other achieve big numbers. With Ron Ward accounting for five goals, the Raiders swamped the Nationals, 94, before a crowd of 4,927 at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: Study Supports Commercials Ban on Children's TV
description: A study undertaken for Action for Childrens Television (ACT) maintains that the networks could eliminate commercials from children's programs over a fivetosevenyear period without cataclysmic financial results.

title: A.B.C. Signs Lorne Greene
description: Lorne Greene, whose 14year run as the star of Bonanza on the National Broadcasting Company television network ends this month, has been signed to star in Griff, a new American Broadcasting Company series about a retired police captain, beginning next season. He will also star in a twohour motion picture for TV to introduce the series.

title: STOCKSALE TALKS CITED IN TAX CASE
description: A key prosecution witness testified yesterday that he had met with Aniello Dellacroce three times to discuss selling stock that Dellacroce allegedly omitted from his Federal income taxes.

title: Tough Drug Stand Urged By Both Parties at Albany
description: ALBANY, Jan. 4Legislative leaders of both parties today voiced initial favorable reaction to Governor Rockefeller's proposals for increased penalties for drugpushersincluding a mandatory life sentence for convicted illegal drugtraffickersbut withheld full support until they had seen them in bill form and had had time to study them.

title: G.I. BUS COMPANY SEEKS RUN TO CITY
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Jan, 4 The Alert Bus Company, Which has been carrying Long Island commuters to Shea Stadium on an emergency basis during the Long Island Rial Road strike, said today that it would apply to the State Public Service Commission for permission to establish a permanent commuter run from Long Island into Manhattan after the strike is over.

title: A RECORD DIVIDEND FOR G.I. INSURANCE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP)Veterans who hold World War I and World War II G.I. insurance will get a record dividend this year, Veterans Administrator Donald E. Johnson announced today.

title: A House Divided
description: One of the central issuesif not the central issuefacing the renewed peace talks. Monday seems to be South Vietnam's demand, apparently backed by the United States, that any accord recognize and support the continuing existence of two Vietnams.

title: Coast Jockey Cut in Spill
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 4 (AP) Wayne Harris, a jockey, suffered cuts on his face and hands when he was spilled from his mount in the backstretch during the third race today at Santa Anita.

title: ROYAL DANIEL JR.
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 4 (AP)Royal Daniel Jr., former managing editor of the old Pittsburgh SunTelegraph, city editor of The New York Daily Mirror and managing editor of The Boston Daily Advertiser, died Tuesday at the age of 77.

title: DONALD D. EGBERT, AN ART HISTORIAN
description: Donald Drew Egbert, professor of architecture emeritus at Princeton and one of America's most distinguished scholars in the history of American art and architecture, died Wednesday at the Medical Center in Princeton. He was 70 years old.

title: The Mood Of Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The 93d Congress is back in the capital spouting New Year's resolutions and promising, like a repentant drunk, to give up its feckless ways.

title: No Taps for Horses
description: It is only a matter of time before West Side urban renewal will shut down the Claremont Riding Academy, Manhattan's last remaining public renting and boarding stable. The threat of such a final closing has been hanging over that facility for years, but the search for a replacement appears no further advanced than it was in 1970, when the Board of Estimate and the City Council scuttled the excellent design for a complex of combined police and public stables.

title: OTB Presents City with $2.5Million And Indicates Monthly Share Will Grow
description: The Offtrack Betting Corporation presented the city with a check for $2.5million yesterday as its part of the corporation's earnings for the month of December.

title: Tank Car Blast Kills Girl
description: LIMA, Ohio, Jan. 4 (UPI)Betty Jo Sherard, 15 years old, was killed and her father, Bernard, was injured today when they were struck by metal from exploding chemical tank cars three blocks from an Erie Lackawanna Railway freight train derailment in the village of Harrorf, about 10 miles east of here.

title: EAST GERMANS ASK TO MEET ViITH US. ON DIPLOMATIC TIE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 4East Germany moved today toward seeking diplomatic relations with Washington, and United States officials said they were willing to discuss the matter.

title: Study Ordered of Charges by Roosevelt Doctors
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Jan, 4The Middlesex County Board of Freeholders instructed the Board of Managers of Roosevelt Hospital in Menlo Park today to look into misconduct charges with political overtones raised by seven staff doctors against Dr. Man Wah Cheung, medical director and chief administrator of the hospital.

title: EDWARD A. GIBBS, 53, A HOUSING OFFICIAL
description: Edward A. Gibbs, assistant commissioner for Federal code enforcement of the city's Department of Rent and Housing Maintenance, died of a cerebral hemorrhage Monday in St. Martin, W.I., where he was on vacation. He was 53 years old and lived at 25 Sixth Street, Westbury, L.I.

title: U.M.W. CHIEF CUTS PAY OF OFFICERS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 Arnold Miller, the insurgent coal miner who won the presidency of the United Mine Workers of America in a bitterly contested election last month, announced today he was cutting his own salary and the salaries of other union officials and staff members.

title: F.C.C. Authorizes Domestic Satellites For Western Union
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Western Union Corporation won Government approval toclay of its plan to build the first United States domestic satellite communications system to handle such services as its telegraph, Telex and private line services.

title: LIABILITY LIMIT ON LENDERS ASKED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) The Federal Reserve Board recommended today that Congress set a ceiling on the amount of money that can be collected from lending institutions in classaction suits.

title: People and Business
description: Stanley Abelson has been named president of Macy's New York, which operates 16 department stores and is the largest division of R. H. Macy & Co., Inc. Effective Jan. 15, he succeeds K. Wade Bennett, 57 years old, who has resigned to become an executive vice president of BroadwayHale Stores, Inc., in Los Angeles.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Many Drivers Lack Insurance Cards

title: Restored Pieta Shown; Condition Near Perfect
description: ROME, Jan. 4The Vatican permitted foreign newsmen to inspect Michelangelo's restored Pieta today, and announced that next month the public would be able to see the masterpiece behind a triplelayer glass shield, twothirds of an inch thick, at a distance of 25 feet.

title: Teacher, 28, Slain In Her Apartment On West 72d Street
description: A 28yearold teacher of deaf children was found knifed to, death in the efficiency apartment on West 72d Street to which she had moved because she was impressed by the comparative security of the building and the street.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 5, 1973

title: U.S. IS ASSAILED AS TALKS RESUME
description: PARIS, Jan. 4The fourparty Vietnam peace conference resumed here today, and the Vietnamese Communists accused the United States of seeking to perpetuate the division of Vietnam.

title: Permanent Rebellion
description: PARISCurrent Egyptian student riots remind the world that numerous countries, regardless of ideology, share one basic problem: how to bridge the generation gap between youth and those who guide them.

title: Woman, 22, Is Becoming A Wall Street Specialist
description: One of Wall Street's last remaining all  male professions has finally been invaded by a woman.

title: GIBBON TAKES 36 ON NEWARK TOUR
description: NEWARK, Jan. 4Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson today took 136 state legislators on a 90minute guided tour of the city and to a luncheon, and then asked his guests for $2.4million.

title: DETECTIVE CALLED TIPSTER ON DRUGS
description: A detective who had been charged with taking $30,000 in bribes in the last five years from narcotics dealers in return for supplying confidential police information was suspended from the force yesterday.

title: PASSAIC IS REBUFFED ON PLEDGE TO FLAG
description: PATERSON, Jan. 4 A Superior Court judge ruled today that it was illegal to eject a person from a public meeting because he failed to place his hand over his heart during the Pledge of Allegiance.

title: Harlem Response Mixed
description: Some black New Yorkers gave mixed responses yesterday to Governor Rockefeller's call for stern measures to eliminate drugrelated crime.

title: Film Shorts Yield Slice of Americana
description: A nice little old lady sits in a child's swing. She isn't wearing tennis shoes. In fact, she isn't wearing anything if you don't count the flower painted on her waist. In Chicago, police practice the use of tear gas. A plump, middle-aged man named Bernie welcomes us to a honeymoon hotel that has heart-shaped bathtubs and round beds.In Texas, Gussie Nell Davis, who wears harlequin glasses and seems to exercise her face by smiling, talks about the values she instills in the girls who become Kilgore College Rangerettes: loveliness, poise and dependability. Somewhere else we watch as the state legally executes a terrified little man by hanging him.Whether you like them or not, these are some of the scenes you'll probably carry away from the Whitney Museum's vivid and tough new program of six short films collectively titled "American Dreams and Nightmares."Taken together, they suggest that America may collapse into mumbling witlessness in about five minutes. This is a legitimate suggestion from concerned social critics, people whose business is raising hell about society's sanctified idiocies. It may not, however, be an opinion shared by each of the film makers represented in the Whitney show.Short films of this sort are terribly impressionable. They acquire moods and attitudes from the things that surround them. Thus the dominant theme of "American Dreams and Nightmares"  that America the Beautiful has become rotten and grotesque  gives to "Beauty Knows No Pain" an effective malignance I didn't notice when I first saw it last year in a commercial theater.On a program with the beatifically bland "The Trial of the Catonsville Nine," Elliott Erwitt's 25-minute documentary, about the care and training of a group of majorettes, seemed rather sweet and sad. Here the rigors the girls so willingly endure look like the preparations for a national lobotomy.Tom Palazzolo's 14-minute "Love It/Leave It," which he describes as a Chamber of Commerce film, opens the program and sets its tone. It's a montage of exhibitionism (nude beauty contests, parades, professional wrestling) intercut with shots of people (Gov. George C. Wallace) and things (riots, the White House), about which there's no doubt what our associations should be. As social criticism, it's facile, but as film-making it's riveting.Paul Kocela's seven-minute "The End of One" shows us seagulls going out of their small minds with delight at a huge garbage dump, crosscut with shots of one very ill bird staggering off to die alone down the beach. Although I don't have much feeling one way or the other for a seagull, I did wonder why the film maker photographed rather than helped it."Honeymoon Hotel" is a funny, short (three-minute) anti-commercial for some place called Cove Haven, and "The Chromium Horse" is a sober-sided appreciation of an overage boy who loves his Hrley-Davidson as life itself.The most effective film on the program is Charles Bailey's 15-minute, black-and-white "Cruel and Unusual Punishment," perhaps because it makes no attempt at irony, no attempt to hide its feelings about capital punishment. Correction officers, penologists, professional executioners talk about their business, some quite matter-of-factly.One executioner thinks it's odd that the condemned men always sit on the edge of the electric chair's seat, "so you have to sort of skooter them back onto the chair." Others, including Gov. Milton A. Schapp of Pennsylvania, are passionate in their loathing. Says one penologist after witnessing an execution: "You are no longer outside the system . . . You assume a degree of community guilt." Which is, more or less, the point of "American Dreams and Nightmares."

title: ALBERT A. EXENDINE
description: TULSA, Okla., Jan. 4 (AP)Albert A. Exendine, a member of the National Football Hall of Fame, died today after long illness. He was 88 years old.

title: Injured Rare Whale Is Placed In a Swimming Pool in Jersey
description: BEACH HAVEN, N. J., Jan. 4An extremely rare species of beaked Whale that was rescued from the beach and placed in a private swimming pool has drawn scientists from several states and Canhere in an attempt to keep it alive and to determine just what type of whale it is.

title: DEBUSSCHERE IS OUT FOR KNICKS TONIGHT
description: Dave DeBusschere remained at home yesterday as the Knicks flew to Buffalo for a National Basketball Association game against the Braves tonight at Memorial Auditorium.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: NEW YORK

title: Bay State Council Certifies Vote on Judges' Retirement
description: BOSTON, Jan. 4 (AP)The Governor's Council certified today the results of the Nov. 7 referendum forcing retirement of judges at the age of 70. The action put 36 judges out of their jobs.

title: AMEX STOCKS DIP; OTC ISSUES RISE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange were off sharply during much of yesterday's session but a late rally wiped out many losses. Nevertheless, prices closed slightly lower in moderate trading, with the Amex Index dipping to 26.63, off 0.01.

title: RUGBY UNION
Christopher T. Chenery Is Dead; Meadow Stable Founder Was 86
description: Christopher T. Chenery, prominent horseman, breeder and corporate executive, died Wednesday at New Rochelle Hospital, after a long illness. He was 86 years old and lived at 1357 Park Lane in Pelham.

title: KLEINDIENST SEES MOVE TO RESTORE DEATH PENALTIES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4  Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst said today that he expected the Nixon Administration to ask Congress to reinstate the death penalty, which was in effect struck down by the United States Supreme Court last June 29.

title: Queens Woman, 86, Raped In Her Home by an Intruder
description: An 86yearold South Ozone Park, Queens, woman was raped yesterday in her home by a, youth who fled with $40 from the woman's purse, the police reported.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Public Service Company of Colorado filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission 1.5 million shares of common stock to be sold through Merrill Lynch and the First Boston Corporation. The utility will use the proceeds to reduce outstanding commercial p'aper issued for construction. The company's stock closed at 23, down  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: SNICK PRICES DIP ON PROFIT TAKING
description: Stock prices fell in heavy trading yesterday as profit taking followed the huge gains of the three preceding sessions. But the market rebounded in the final hour, which Wall Stteet analysts interpreted as a favorable sign of internal strength.

title: OldFashioned Dessert for the Weekend
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: 50th Birthday Is Marked With 50th Gift to Neediest
description: Edward U. Gips of 7 Park Avenue marked a dual anniversary on Dec. 21his 50th birthday and the 50th year that a donation had been made by him or in his name to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund. He celebrated both by sending $25 to the fund.

title: Soviet Six Wins, 94
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 4 (AP)Aleksandr Maltsev scored four goals to lead the Soviet Union allstar team to a 94 victory over the New Haven Nighthawks of the American Hockey League in a penaltyridden exhibition game tonight.

title: Bayh Seeks Farm Tax Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP)Senator Birch Bayh introduced today a bill to reduce inheritance taxes on farms handed down to relatives. The Indiana Democrat said the measure was necessary because high inheritance taxes force families to abandon the farms. He said the inheritance taxes were uniquely burdensome for farmers because they are based on the exorbitant real estate value of the land rather than on the far lower farming value or profitability.

title: TEAMSTERS SUED BY CHAVEZ'S UNION
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 4 In two actions in Federal District Court, claiming massive damages and charging a conspiracy with employers, the United Farm Workers, led by Cesar Chavez, has thrown down the gauntlet to the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: PUERTO RICANS FIND SANIT ATIONJOB BIAS
description: Five Puerto Ricans charged in a Federal court suit here yesterday that the city discriminates against Puerto Ricans and other Hispanic residents in the hiring of sanitationmen.

title: Rita Mooney, Abbey Actress And Producer, Dead at 69
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 4 (AP)Rita Mooney, a former actress and producer with the Abbey Theater, died Wednesday in a hospital here. She was 69 years old.

title: Called Senator, a New One Is Shocked
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The tall, thin man was enjoying himself immensely.

title: Right, He Was Wrong
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 4 (Reuters)Reuben Greenspan, a recluse who has been predicting earthquakes for 40 years, had warned that this city would suffer an earthquake Jan. 4 as devastating as the one that shattered it in 1906. But last Friday he said that his calculations were wrong, and that the earthquake would not happen. He was right.

title: PARKS UNIT TO GET TOUGH ON PUBLIC
description: Richard M. Clurman, the Administrator of Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs, said at his swearingin ceremony yesterday that his agency would withdraw all maintenance men and services from public parks that are repeatedly vandalized where the community makes no move to stop it.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Union Warns of Rail Shutdown

title: Danny Kaye Plays Pied Piper of Opera for Youngsters at the Met
description: The Metropolitan Opera Company, got up in its richest panoply and spread out on the stage like the hosts of Nebuchadnezzar, kept a blind date with hilarity yesterday. For nearly two hours it lent itself to the wiles of a conjurer, contortionist, mime and sleightoftongue artist named Danny Kaye.

title: Kidnapper With $1,000 Offer For Brooklyn Baby Is Sought
description: Detectives in Brooklyn conhued without success yesterday to search for a sixdayold boy and the woman who kidlapped him Wednesday after striking his mother with a hammer and saying she had been offered $1,000 for a baby.

title: REVERE COPPER SETS ALUMINUM PRICE RISE
description: Revere Copper & Brass, Inc., said yesterday it would increase the actual market price on a broad range of aluminum flatrolled products, beginning with orders placed after Jan. 8. The changes generally follow those initiated recently by the Kaiser Aluminum & Chemical Corporation.

title: Rail TieUp Is Threatened By Jersey Central Union
description: TRENTON, Jan. 4  A railroad union leader warned today that an attempt would be made to stop other commuter service in New Jersey if the Central Railroad of New Jersey abandoned its passenger commuter service in the state on Jan. 21.

title: Persuasions' Rock At the Bitter End Is Unaccompanied
description: A cappella rock'n'roll performantesa group singing unaccompanied by any instruments have always had a particularly New York flavor. There are several musicbusiness stories of groups being discovered singing away at subway stops (good for resonance). But, for all this, the style has dropped out of favor, relegated to the odd revival at some nostalgiarock show.

title: Hertz to Buy '73 Trucks
description: The truck division of the Hertz Corporation announced yesterday plans for a record purchase of new 1973 trucks valued al retail In excess of $45million. The purchase will entail about 4,200 trucks of various sizes, models and makes land will be put in the company's rental fleet. About threequarters of the new units will be put into service for commercial rental to husincss concerns.

title: Senate Democrats, 3612, Back Action to End War
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Congressional Democrats continued today to make speeches and approve resolutions against President Nixon's war policy, but leaders acknowledged that there was no prospect of immediate passage of legislation that would end the war.

title: 300 Children Attack 6 Soldiers in Londonderry
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 4A crowd of almost 300 children in Londonderry defied volleys of rubber bullets today and attacked six soldiers with stones and other missiles.

title: QUARRY COMEBACKSTOPS THE MUSIC
description: If Jerry Quarry brings some of the rock groups he represented during his brief retirement from boxing with him into Madison Square Garden tonight, he might be assured of a sellout crowd for his 10round heavyweight bout with Randy Neumann. But he won't and there'll be plenty of seats available for the sevenfight card, which begins at 8:30 o'clock.

title: Coast Jockey Cut in Spill
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 4 (AP) Wayne Harris, a jockey, suffered cuts on his face and hands when he was, spilled from his mount in the backstretch during the third race today at Santa Anita.

title: Banks Borrow From Fed at Highest Daily Rate in 20 Years
description: Monetary expansion threatened to run at excessive rates this week, data published yesterday by the Federal Reserve System indicated.Bankers said the increase was, to, a substantial degree, due to the low level of the Federal Reserve discount ratewhich has been at 4 percent since December, 1971in relation to the cost of funds in the open marketwhich averaged 5.61 per cent in the Federal funds market this week, up from 5.34 per cent the previous week.

description: SON OF GROUCHO. By Arthur Marx. 357 pages. New York: David McKay. $7.95.

description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced yesterday two key management changes in Europe and a related change in this country.

description: Some black New Yorkers gave mixed responses yesterday to Governor Rockefeller's call for stern measures to eliminate drugrelated crime.

description: East Germany moved yesterday toward seeking diplomatic relations with the United States and American officials said that they were willing to discuss the matter. The issue was raised by the East German observer to the United Nations during a courtesy call on the chief United States delegate, George Bush. [Page 1, Column 1.]

description: Ten of the country's largest retail chains reported yesterday that their December sales topped last year's by a wide margin as Christmas and postChristmas business surged to record levels.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Symbols of prestige and power surround the little stage where the Pentagon's official spokesman briefs the press on behalf of all the United States armed forces.

description: The new year's first major storm spread across the Central Plains to the upper Great Lakes yesterday. Another storm gathered strength in the Southwest.

description: Officials of the Health and Hospitals Corporation have drawn up a $1,063,000,000 budget, which they say will be used to increase the number of nurses in New York's municipal hospitals, open new facilities, provide specialized training for ambulance drivers and increase hospital security.

description: BLACKSVILLE, W. Va., Jan. 4 (UPI)The bodies of four coal miners who perished in a fire at the. Blacksville No. 1 mine July 22 were found by recovery teams yesterday.

description: It's Friday in New York and we're the Fitzgeratds will be heard today for the last time as it introduces the daily radio broadcast that Ed and Pegeen Fitzgerald have done together here for the better part of 34 years.

description: To the Editor:

title: ANACONDA CONFIRMS PLAN FOR NEW PLANT
description: The Anaconda Company said yesterday that its primary metals division planned to go ahead with construction of a plant to convert copper concentrates into electrolytic copper by a new hydrometallurgical process invented by the company's metallurgical research department at Tucson, Ariz. The company expects the commercialsize plant to demonstrate fully the commercial application of the Arbiter process, as it is called.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Aussies Win Sailing Heat
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Jan. 4 (APIAustralians took the first eight places In the second heat of the World 420 Championships sailed today at Seacliff. Anger Wangel won the heat, edging Peter Sieverwright.

description: Gene Shalit, a movie and book reviewer, sports columnist, and publicity man, will join the panel of the National Broadcasting Company's Today show Jan. 15, replacing Joe Garagiola.

description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn.I keep thinking I'm going wake up; it's alinost too good to be true: my goyishe dogs and my Franchot Tone house.

title: The First Inaugural: He Meant It
description: WASHINGTON  With speculation about the nature and content of President Nixon's second Inaugural Address already rife along the Potomac, some retrospection on his first seems in order.

title: CRITICS REBUFFED ON FARM SLASHES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz brushed aside today bipartisan criticism that recent Nixon Administration cuts in longstanding and popular farm programs would harm rural areas.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
How Prescribed Methadone Killed a Boy
description: Relatives and friends yesterday filed past the coffin of a 16yearold boy whose body lay in a small mortuary in Harlem.

title: Stage: O'Casey's Plough and Stars at Beaumont
description: There are playwrights for their time and, playwrights for every time and only time itself can sort them out. Sean O'Casey, with his physician's finger on the pulse of Irish tragic irony, spoke up for a 20thcentury generation. O'Casey was a master of dramatic artifice and comic blarney, but one wonders how many of his works will survive in the common store of dramatic literature.

title: Senate Democrats, 3612, Back Action to End War
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Congressional Democrats continued today to make speeches and approve resolutions against President Nixon's war policy, but leaders acknowledged that there was no prospect of immediate passage of legislation that would end the war.

title: DEAL FOR THIEVES UPHELD BY COURT
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 4 The granting of immunity to two alleged art thieves in exchange for return of $600,000 worth of art treasures stolen from the Caramoor Center for the Arts was upheld in State Supreme Court today.

title: North Vietnam Says 1,318 Died in the Raids on Hanoi
description: TOKYO, Jan. 4  North Vietnam said today that a preliminary survey showed that 1,318 persons were killed and 1,261 wounded by United States bombing raids on Hanoi last month.

title: ANTI WAR PROTEST TO CONGRESS ENDS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Singing, We will lay down our swords and shields, down by the riverside, a religious conference wound up two days of activities today aimed at putting pressure on Congress to cut off funds for the war in Vietnam.

title: Search for Ship Abandoned
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 4 (UPI) The Coast Guard abandoned yesterday the search for the missing Panamanian freighter Puerto Limon and its crew of 12. The 214foot freighter sailed from Houston Dec. 14 with a load of bulk fertilizer and was to have arrived in Costa Rica by Christmas Eve.

title: Witness Says He Worked For General as a Friend
description: TRENTON, Jan. 4William F. Lawton, a retired National Guard warrant officer, testified today that he performed services on his own time and without charge for Maj. Gen. James F. Cantwell, while the General was chief of the New Jersey National Guard. He said he had done the work on the basis of a friendship that began in 1928 when both were enlisted men in the Army.

title: Competition Curb Urged For Builders of Airliners
description: A Government study panel said yesterday that the development of airliners had become so expensive that Washington should curb direct competition among manufacturers to sell similar craft and should select a single manufacturer to build each type of new airliner.

title: Any Courthouse Will Do
description: NASHVILLE (AP)  South Central Bell reports a small girl called an operator and asked for the number of the courthouse. The operator asked which one. Which one is best the girl replied.

title: Civic Group Urges Scribner Rehiting As Clear Mandate
description: The Public Education Association called on the city's Board of Education yesterday to renew the contract of Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner, which expires on June 30, and thus give him a clear mandate to continue the reform programs that he has so painstakingly initiated.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: From 1933 to 1945, during the course of his Presidency, Franklin Delano Roosevelt held 1,011 news conferences. The complete transcripts of those conferences, running to more than 7,000 pages, will be published this month in 12 volumes by Da Capo Press of New York.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Commissioner Walter Kennedy of the National Basketball Association disallowed a protest by the Chicago Bulls yesterday that time was still remaining when the periodending buzzer sounded in a 106105 overtime loss to the Los Angeles Lakers last Dec. 12.

title: 8Million Loss Posted
Mr. Lynch vs. I.R.A.
description: Officially, Prime Minister Jack Lynch has come to the United States to encourage more investment in the Republic of Ireland. He is believed, however, to intend to use his five days in this country to dissuade IrishAmericans from contributing funds ostensibly for relief in Northern Ireland but used to buy guns and ammunition for the Irish Republican Army Provisionals. Such a timely admonition from such a source cannot be sounded too loudly or too often.

title: U.S. Reports Loss of 16th B52; All in Ciew Reported Rescued
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Jan. 5  The United States command reported yesterday that another B52 the 16th since Dec. 18  had been lost to North Vietnamese antiaircraft fire.

title: Advertising: A Day of Agency Job Changes and New Campaigns
description: Della Femina to Itta to Paccione. How's that for an an ethnic triple play? That's the way yesterday wenttwo new campaigns and a new job.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) The Government sold $6.2billion in savings bonds in 1972, the best oneyear sales since 1948, the Treasury Department said today.

title: The Fitzgeralds to Sign Off After 10,000 Hours of Talk
description: It's Friday in New York and we've the Fitzgeralds will be heard today for the last time as it introduces the daily radio broadcast that Ed and Pegeen Fitzgerald have done together here for the better part of 34 years.

title: Freighter Is Rammed Near Statue of Liberty
description: A Yugoslav freighter heading out to sea was rammed in the side by a Liberian tanker in New York harbor near the Statue of Liberty early last night, the Coast Guard reported. The collision caused a hole 10 feet by 30 feet in the Yugoslav ship and a member of her crew was slightly injured, a spokesman said. The hole was above her water line.

title: Inmates' Strike Over
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., Jan. 4 (UPI)An inmates' strike at San Quentin prison fizzled yesterday as all but a dozen prisoners returned to their jobs. The walkout began Tuesday when 1,200 convicts out of the prison's 1,450man work force stayed in their cells. They demanded the warden's resignation, conjugal visits for all prisoners, an end to indeterminate sentences and the right to grow long hair.

title: Amer. Hockey League
description: WEDNESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: I. C. C. PENALIZES AWED VAN LINES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Interstate Commerce Commission suspended today part of the commercial operations of Allied Van Lines, the nation's largest movers, as a penalty for poor service.

title: Boulez Ternes Upfor Electronic Debut
description: Pierre Boulez looked as delighted as a boy with new toy  947 pounds worth of new toy, in fact, representing the electronic machinery used in his latest composition. The composer and musical director of the New York Philharmonic took time out yesterday afternoon at Alice Tully Hall to tell an interviewer about his new piece, explosante/fixe . . . in which he leaks out into electronic music for the first time in his career.

title: U.S. Protests Ship Boycott by Australia
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Secretary of State William P. Rogers has expressed official concern to the Australian Government over the Australian maritime unions' boycott of American shipping in response to the American bombing of North Vietnam.

title: Trudeau Pledges to Combat Unemployment and Inflation
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 4The minority Government promised the new Parliament today that it would give the highest priority to reducing unemployment, expanding the economy and attaining reasonable price stability.

title: New Cuban Proposals Given To U.S. on a Hijacking Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) The State Department said today that it had received a new set of proposals from Havana on the projected United StatesCuban accord to foil aircraft hijackers.

title: Broader Trade Authority Is Urged by U.S. Chamber
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The United States Chamber of Commerce urged the Nixon Administration today to seek farreaching trade negotiating authority from Congress early in the new session.

title: Australia Ends Racial Curb on Migration
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Jan, 4 Australia, often accused of racism in the selection of immigrants, has officially barred skin color as a factor for consideration in the admission of prospective settlers.

title: Red Smith
description: The annual list of the world's bestdressed men came out the other day and Mike Burke didn't make it. Masking his disappointment, he stood up to a microphone in the Yankee Stadium club and announced that he and 11 others were buying the Yankees from Columbia Broadcasting System. In his dark blue doublebreasted pinstripes, with a red handkerchief blossoming from the breast pocket, Mike didn't look envious of John Lindsay or David Susskind or Mick Jagger, who did make that list. He looked like $10millionor anyway, like $833,333, the ante required from each of the doughty dozen to make them equal partners.

title: A WATCHDOG PLAN ON SCHOOLS SCORED
description: ALBANY, Jan. 4Joseph W. McGovern, chancellor of the State Board of Regents, has told Governor Rockefeller that he has grave concern about the Governor's new proposal for an inspector general for elementary and secondary education in the executive department.

title: Action on Pension Plans
description: Forty Senators of both parties have joined as sponsors of a new and urgent drive for correcting weaknesses in the private pension plans on which thirty million workers rely for an important measure of oldage security. This impressive support for the pension reform bill drafted after long study by Senators Williams of New Jersey and Javits of New York should prevent a new wrecking effort of the kind the Senate Finance Committee marshalled to kill the bill in the closing days of the 92d Congress.

title: GAS GANGRENE HITS 5 CRASH SURVIVORS
description: MIAMI, Jan. 4 (AP)  The swamplands of the Everglades, which cushioned the crash of an Eastern Airlines Tristar jet in which 77 persons survived, also harbored bacteria that spread gas gangrene to five of the survivors, doctors said yesterday.

title: Gremillion Surrenders
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan, 4 (AP) Former Louisiana's former Attorney General, Jack P. F. Gremillion, was taken away toclay to begin serving a threeyear sentence for perjury, but Federal marshals would not say where or when he surrendered. United States District Judge Fred Cassibry sentenced Gremillion to a threeyear term for lying to a Federal grand jury.

title: CHRYSLER'S SALES SET SPEEDY PACE
description: DETROIT, Jan. 4  The Chrysler Corporation and, the American Motors Corporation today reported their endofDecember car sales were running well ahead of last year's pace. High sales are also expected by the other major car manufacturers, when their figures are available. Thus the sales boom that got under way in 1972 is continuing into the new year.

title: BULLS TOP ROCKETS FOR FIFTH IN A ROW
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 4 (UPI)The Chicago Bulls rolled up a 16point lead in the first six minutes tonight and coasted to their fifth straight victorya 11197 decision over the Houston Rockets in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Western Electric Awarded Missile System Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP)The Army awarded the Western Electric Company a $136.8million contract today, for continued production and installation of the Safeguard antiballistic missile system at. Grand Fork, N.D.

title: What Can We Do?
description: PARIS  Where is the difference? Between the devastation of Guernica by the planes of Hitler and the devastation of Hanoi by those of Mr. Nixon, where is the difference? Between the raids of terror over Hanoi to force the Vietnamese to surrender and the raids of terror over Warsaw to force the Polish, over Rotterdam to force the Dutch to surrender, over Coventry to force the British (but Churchill did not surrender and the Vietnamese do not) where is the difference? Between the shredded infants of Spain and the shredded infants of Hanoi? At the time of Guernica, Warsaw, Rotterdam and Coventry what raised the world's conscience with a sacred horror was the recurrence, by the will of one man and his military advisers, of the most barbarous, the cruelest, the most horrifying, the most homicidal means to win a political design. It was the return to Sardanapalus and to Nero multiplied by ten, multiplied by a hundred. The world fought five years against that, against the incredible return of forgotten practices, that one thought had disappeared forever. America was not the least fierce nor the least sincere in that struggle to establish between nations a minimum of civilized relations. It was America which by its initiative (the creation of the U.N.) showed most visibly that will of healing. And now it is America today that brings back Guernica, Warsaw, Rotterdamthat brings us the equivalent of Hiroshima. In order to make an adversary surrender and to make a political design succeed.

title: Voice of the Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Symbols of prestige and power surround the little stage where the Pentagon's official spokesman briefs the press on behalf of all the United States armed forces.

title: Buckley to Seek Private Aid To Keep TV Show on the Air
description: William F. Buckley Jr. said yesterday that he would seek private financial aid to keep his controversial Firing Line program on public television despite an apparent decision by the Corporation for Public Broadcasting to drop the program May 1.

title: FOUR DIE IN FIRE IN QUEENS HOUSE
description: A smoky fire took the lives of a husband and wife, their youngest child and the husband's mother in their Queens Village home at 5 A.M. yesterday.

title: KLEINDIENST SEES MOVE TO RESTORE DEATH PENALTIES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4  Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst said today that he expected the Nixon Administration to ask Congress to reinstate the death penalty, which was in effect struck down by the United States Supreme Court last June 29.

title: Environment Issue Is Raised to Block Kawaida Towers
description: NEWARK, Jan. 4Opponents of the Kawaida Towers lowincome housing development in the North Ward went into Federal court today in another effort to halt the controversial project.

title: 400 Led From Tunnel in Boston During Train Fire
description: BOSTON, Jan. 9 (AP)Three employes of the Massachusetts Bay Transit Authority led 400 commuters half a mile through a darkened tunnel to safety this morning after a fire broke out on an inbound rapidtransit train.

title: Plywood Output at Record
description: TACOMA, Wash., Jan. 4 (UPI)Production of softwood plywood last year reached record 18.5 billion square feet. and total demand for 1973 could range between 18 billion and 18.5 billion square feet, the American Plywood Association estimates, The association reported the plywood industry currently has a warehouse deficit inventory of about 600 million square feet.

title: U.S. Protests Ship Boycott by Australia
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Secretary of State William P. Rogers has expressed official concern to the Australian Government over the Australian maritime unions' boycott of American shipping in response to the American bombing of North Vietnam.

title: 3D LOSS IN ROW SADDLED ON NETS
description: HAMPTON, Va., Jan. 4 With Billy Paultz home with the flu, the New York Nets couldn't match the Virginia Squires in rebounding power tonight and went down to a third straight defeat, this one by a 12897 score.

title: Postal Service Reports Cut in Losses
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4  The United States Postal Service, which took over mail operations from the old Post Office Department 18 months ago, released figures today showing a 14 per cent smaller net loss in the last fiscal year than in the year before.

title: Boros, Miller and Stockton Register 67's in Coast Golf
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 4 (AP) Julius Boros, Johnny Miller and the former Professional Golfers Association champion, Dave Stockton, shot fourunderpar 67's at the 7,028yard, par 71 Riviera Country Club Course today for the firstround lead in the $135,000 Los Angeles open golf tournament.

title: Aussies Win Sailing Heat
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Jan. 4 (AP)Australians took the first eight places In the second heat of the World 420 Championships sailed today at Seacliff. Anger Wangel won the heat, edging Peter Sieverwright.

title: MISS BARTON SINGS TASTEFUL PROGRAM
description: Jenneke Barton's song recital at Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday promised rare satisfactions, built as it was around tastefully chosen groups by Mozart, Wolf, Respighi, Badings and Faure. Moreover, Miss Barton's mezzosoprano could deliver sumptuous tones at its best, and her excellent musicianship did much to keep one interested in her program even when the sound quality deteriorated sadly, which was often.

title: 16th B52 Downed
description: The United States command in Saigon reported yesterday that the 16th B52 since Dec. 18 had been lost in the air war over North Vietnam. Details on page 2.

title: TWO SENATORS SCORE NAVY GRUMMAN LOAN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) Two Senators criticized today the Navy's loan of an additional $18million to the Grumman Aerospace Corporation in connection with the production of the F14 fighter craft.

title: Stolz Names 2 Assistants
description: FAST LANSING, Mich., Jan, 4 (AP) Dennis Stolz, new Michigan State football coach, completed his staff today by ?? Charles Buller and Howard ?? as assistants.

title: Democrats Bid Court Call High Republicans on Watergate Data
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 A Federal judge was asked today to require a number of ranking Republicans to say whether they had ever possessed information obtained by eavesdropping at the offices of the Democratic National Committee.

title: Iran Executes 5 for Sabotage
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Jan. 4 (Reuters)  An army firing squad today executed five Iraqitrained Iranians convicted of Sabotage and terror, a Government spokesman announced.

title: SIMON ISAACSON
description: Simon Isaacson, a retired builder who was president of Isaacson Steel Erectors, Inc., of Farmingdale, L. L, died Tuesday at his home in Hollywood, Fla. He was 87 years old.

title: Campaign Contribution Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP)Senator Harry F. Byrd Jr., Independent of Virginia, proposed today a $25,000 limit on the amount any individual can contribute to a Federal election campaign. Campaign spending has gone beyond all reasonable bounds, he told the Senate.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships

title: 50th Birthday Is Marked With 50th Gift to Neediest
description: Edward U. Gips of 7 Park Avenue marked a dual anniversary on Dec. 21his 50th birthday and the 50th year that a donation had been made by him or in his name to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund. He celebrated both by sending $25 to the fund.

title: Notes on People
description: As official celebrations of Britain's entry into the Common Market continued, it seemed clear that public elation over the event was less than unanimous. Yesterday, a middleaged woman swung her handbag in the direction of Prime Minister Heath as he opened an art exhibition related to the market entry. I'm going to arrest you, said the woman, who was led away, but not arrested. On Wednesday, Mr. Heath was hanged in effigy outside the Royal Opera House as ceremonies went on inside. And rightwing demonstrators hurled stenchbombs near the Opera, one of the bombs wafting its essence near the arriving Queen Elizabeth II. We were aiming at the Prime Minister, one of demonstrators said.

title: U.S. Reports Loss of 16th B52; All in Crew Reported Rescued
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Jan. 5  The United States command reported yesterday that another B52 the 16th since Dec. 18  had been lost to North Vietnamese antiaircraft fire.

title: 16th B52 Downed
description: The United States command in Saigon reported yesterday that the 16th B52 since Dec. 18 had been lost in the air war over North Vietnam. Details on page 2.

title: Teacher Strike Authorized
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 4 (AP) The city's public school teachers have rejected the final contract offer of the Board of Education and authorized a strike for next Monday. The Philadelphia Federation of Teachers voted last night, 8,745 to 1,850, to approve a resolution for an ??

title: JAMES P. SHEEHY
description: James P. Sheehy, the City's Associate Deputy Commissioner of Health, who led the crackdown on dirty restaurants and stores, died at his office Wednesday night. He was 45 years old.

title: HEALTH FUND CUTS IN BUDGET LIKELY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4There are strong indications here of a bleak 1974 Federal budget for medical research and also indications that research training programs considered vital by the nation's medical schools will be phased out.

title: Scarsdale Sympathetic
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Jan. 4Governor Rockefeller's proposal to make life imprisonment mandatory for drug pushers has met with a generally sympa thetic response in this suburban village.

title: Cabaret
description: While Bobby Short is taking his annual winter leave from the Cafe Carlyle, Marian McPartland has moved into the room for two months. For Miss McPartland, this represents quite a challenge.

title: CHINA DEVELOPING SATELLITE LINKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4China is vastly expanding her communications lines to the rest of the world this year with the aid of American communcations technology.

title: FUTURES IN MEAT HIT PRICE PEARS
description: Meatpackers bid up hog and cattle prices to record levels yesterday, fearful of temporarily short supplies. The snow and icestorms in the Midwest have prevented many animals from being moved from farms to market. This will mean higher prices in the supermarkets.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TUNING IN Last May, Brooklyn College's Institute for Studies in American Music, which does just what its name implies, devoted a day to talk and song of the ragtime era. Today the topic shifts to All the Things They Were: American Popular Song of the 1920's and 1930's, For an hour and a half, starting at 4 P.M., there will be a colloquium, a sort of prose jam session, free of charge, in Room 092 in the campus's Gershwin Hall, at Campus Road and Millet Place, near the last stop of the Flatbush IRT. Speakers will be David Hamiltrsn, music critic of the Nation; John Hollander, poet and essayist; Robert Kimball, author of Cole.; William Bolcom, composer, and H. Wiley Hitchcock, the institute's director. At 8 P.M., in the Gershwin Theater, the business gets down to music, with a concert of works by Irving Berlin, Gershwin, James P. Johnson, Jerome Kern, Cole Porter, Rodgers and Hart, Sissle and Blake. It will be done with piano and voice, led by Mr. Bolcom, accompanied by Joan Morris and Clifford Jackson. The concert is a $2 affair (box office: 8591180); other information 7005655.

title: Steep Final Descent Cited In Everglades Jet Crash
description: The Eastern Air Lines widebody jet that crashed in Miami a week ago made a rather steep final descent into the Everglades rather than the gradual descent first reported by Government investigators, Eastern sources said yesterday.

title: Sugarbush Trade Ablaze In Spite of Gondola Fire
description: Last month's fire that destroyed the summit station of Sugarbush's 9,300footlong gondola lift has made a happy philosopher of John King, the general manager of that popular central Vermont ski resort. Recent developments have made me conclude the wisest thing to do is not to fret too much about something you don't have, King said yesterday. When that gondola blazed out of business, I was sure the area would suffer badlyfinancially.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: 4 Killed in Fire In Queens Village

title: SIMON ISAACSON
description: Simon Isaacson, a retired builder who was president of Isaacson Steel Erectors, Inc., of Farmingdale, L. I., died Tuesday at his home in Hollywood, Fla. He was 87 years old.

title: Plywood Output at Record
description: TACOMA, Wash., Jan. 4 (UPI)Production of softwood plywood last year reached a record 18.5 billion square feet. and total demand far 1973 could range between 18 billion and 18,5 billion squarel, feet, the American Plywood Association estimates. The sociation reported the plywood industry currently has a warehouse deficit inventory of about 600 million square feet.

title: Norcross Is Planning to Move From the City to Pennsylvania
description: Norcross, Inc., the second major corporation this week to announce plans to move out of the city, said yesterday that it would move its headquarters to a site 40 miles northwest of Philadelphia.

title: Advisory Group Offers Proposals to Simplify Reports by Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4An advisory committee drawn from the mutual fund industry proposed today that mutual funds no longer be required to make quarterly reports about the stocks they have bought and sold for the fund's investment portfolio.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 33

title: Market Place: Optimistic View Taken by A.&P.
description: A shareholder in the Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company who reads the news release from the company's outside public relations counsel would probably feel reasonably good about the latest earnings result. The release states:

title: 11 Legal Experts in South Africa Say Apartheid Legislation Debases Law
description: JOHANNESBURG, South AfricaA group of liberal lawyers, law professors and Legal, thinkers in South Africa have said their country's apartheid) laws are undermining the twin foundations of the common law, respect for the individual and equality before the law.

title: Blues Win, 4 to 2; End Bruin Streak At Eight Victories
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 4 (UPI)Gary Sabourin scored an unassisted goal midway through the third period tonight to lift the St. Louis Blues to a 42 victory over Boston and snap the Bruins' National Hockey League winning streak at eight games.

title: U.S. IS ASSAILED AS TALKS RESUME
description: PARIS, Jan. 4The fourparty Vietnam peace conference resumed here today, and the Vietnamese Communists accused the United States of seeking to perpetuate the division of Vietnam.

title: Saigon Senators to Lobby in Washington
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 4  Apparently concerned by the threat of an aroused United States Congress to cut off spending for the Vietnam war, President Nguyen Van Thieu is sending a delegation of five South Vietnamese senators to Washington, it was disclosed today.

title: Salt Lake City Selected to Bid for Winter Olympics
description: The United States Olympic Committee selected Salt Lake City yesterday as the new American entry to hid for the 1976 Winter Olympics, despite an unresolved financial situation and possible problems of acceptance from many Utah residents.

title: EAST GERMANS ASK TO MEET WITH U.S. ON DIPLOMATIC TIE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Jan. 4East Germany moved today toward seeking diplomatic relations with Washington, and United States officials said they were willing to discuss the matter.

title: Coopting Labor
description: President Nixon is no conservative when he decides it is time for a change. As he demonstrated with his trips to Peking and Moscow last year, the President is able simply to throw away the ideological baggage he has carried all through his political career and fit himself out with a shiny new set of beliefs.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Jan. 4Dick Lloyd, the Rutgers basketball coach, told the New Jersey college basketball writers today, I am more concerned about the turnovers we commit during a game than anything else right now. This thing about turnovers has gotten out of hand. We had 17 in the first half against Temple and we are just going to have to overcome that.

title: MILLS IS HOPEFUL ON TAX REFORMS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP)  Representative Wilbur D Mills, the House tax chief, foresees passage by the House this summer of a tax reform billbut one not likely to include some of the changes for which reformers have been pressing.

title: CHARLES DOUGHERTY, INSURANCE LEADER
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va., Jan. 4Charles G. Dougherty, who retired as executive vice president of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company in 1971, died today at the age of 65.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Drill Instructor Accused
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 4 (UPI)Sgt. Henry Gonzales, a Marine Corps drill instructor, was ordered yesterday to face a summary courtmartial for allegedly dumping hot water on the back of a 20yearold recruit. The recruit, Sebastian Herrera of San Diego, suffered minor burns in the Dec. 23 incident.

title: Clemente's Trophies Stolen by Mourners
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Jan. 4 (UPI)Relatives of Roberto Clemente, the baseball star who was killed in a plane crash New Year's Eve, said today visitors to the Clemente home had stolen some of his trophies.

title: Sex Education Planned In French High Schools
description: PARIS, Jan. 4 (AP)The Education Ministry announced today that French high school pupils would receive information on reproduction beginning next fall, the first time sex education hag entered the official French curriculum.

title: New Parks Head Insists Public Combat Vandalism
description: Richard M. Clurman, the Administrator of Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs, said at his swearingin ceremony yesterday that his agency would withdraw all maintenance men and services from public parks that are repeatedly vandalized and where the community makes no move to stop it.

title: ALBERT A. EXENDINE
description: TULSA, Okla., Jan. 4 (AP)Albert A. Exendine, a member of the National Football Hall of Fame, died today after a long illness. He was 88 years old.

title: People in Sports: Malaga Resigns U.S.L.T.A. Post
description: The president of the United States Lawn Tennis Association, Robert B. Colwell, anounced yesterday that Robert S. (Bob) Malaga, executive director of the U.S.L.T.A., has resigned his post to return to his law practice and other business activities in Cleveland.

title: SIX WILL VISIT POPE IN ANTIWAR EFFORT
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 4Six Protestant, Roman Catholic and Jewish religious leaders announced today that they would travel to Rome week to seek the aid of Pope Paul VI in mobilizing world opinion against American war activities in Indochina.

title: Research Recession
description: Discussing the current state of American scientific research and education, Dr. Mina Rees used such terms as crisis, distress and suffering in her recent presidential address to the American Association for the Advancement of Science. The days when there were shortages of engineers, physicists, chemists, mathematicians, etc., are now only a memory.

title: Right, He Was Wrong
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 4 (Reuters)Reuben Greenspan, a recluse who has been predicting earthquakes for 40 years, had warned that this city would suffer an earthquake Jan. 4 as devastating as the one that shattered it in 1906. But last Friday he said that his calculations were wrong, and that the earthquake would not happen ?? was ??

title: MRS. HERBERT KESNER
description: JOHNSTOWN, N. Y., Jan. Mrs. Helen McNicholas Kesner, wife of Herbert Kesner, who retired recently from the staff of The New York Times, died of cancer today. She was 56 years old and lived at 404 South William Street.

title: Australia Ends Racial Curb on Migration
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Jan. 4 Australia, often accused of racism in the selection of immigrants, has officially barred skin color as a factor for consideration in the admission of prospective settlers.

title: ROYAL DANIEL JR.
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 4 (AP)Royal Daniel Jr., former managing editor of the old Pittsburgh SunTelegraph, city editor of The New York Daily Mirror and managing editor of The Boston Daily Advertiser, died Tuesday at the age of 77.

title: Saigon Senators to Lobby in Washington
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 4  Apparently concerned by the threat of an aroused, United Slates Congress to cut off spending for the Vietnam war. President Nguyen Van Thieu is sending a delegation of five South Vietnamese senators to Washington, it was disclosed today.

title: CHINA DEVELOPING SATELLITE LINKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4China is vastly expanding her communications lines to the rest of the world this year with the aid of American communications technology.

title: How Prescribed Methadone Killed a Boy
description: Relatives and friends yesterday filed past the coffin of a 16yearold boy whose body lay in a small mortuary in Harlem.

title: France Sues Three Periodicals For Giving Details of Execution
description: PAMS, Jan. 4 The French Government has filed suit against three periodicals that published details about two recent executions by guillotine, it was announced today.

title: SECRECY OPPOSED IN A POLL IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4More than half the members of the House of Representatives oppose secret House committee meetings, according to a questionnaire announced today by John W. Gardner, chairman of Common Cause.

title: DONALD D. EGBERT, AN ART HISTORIAN
description: Donald Drew Egbert, professor of architecture emeritus at Princeton and one of America's Most distinguished scholars in the history of American art and architecture, died Wednesday at the Medical Center in Princeton. He was 70 years old.

title: Scarsdale Sympathetic
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Jan. 4Governor Rockefeller's proposal to make life imprisonment mandatory for drug pushers has met with a generally sympathetic response in this Westchester village.

title: JAMES P. SHEEHY
description: James P. Sheehy, the City's Associate Deputy Commissioner of Health, who led the crackdown on dirty restaurants and stores, died at his office Wednesday night. He was 45 years old.

title: Agnew, Mrs. Nixon and Johnsons Attend a Mass for Boggs
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan, 4 Vice President Agnew, Mrs. Richard M. Nixon and Mr. and Mrs. Lyndon B. Johnson were among the national figures who paid tribute here today to Representative Hale Boggs.

title: Gibson Asks State Guests For $2.4 Million for City
description: NEWARK, Jan. 4  Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson today took 36 state legislators on a 90minute guided tour of the city and to a luncheon, and then asked his guests for $2.4million.

title: Tough Drug Stand Urged By Both Parties at Albany
description: ALBANY, Jan. 4Legislative leaders of both parties today voiced initial favorable reaction to Governor Rockefeller's proposals for increased penalties for drugpushersincluding a mandatory life sentence for convicted illegal drugtraffickersbut withheld full support until they had seen them in bill form and had had time to study them.

title: TV Cigar Ad Ban Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP)Senator Frank E. Moss, Democrat of Utah, said today that he would introduce legislation banfling littlecigar advertisements on television.

title: U.S. LISTS 5 KILLED IN WAR LAST WEEK
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam Jan. 4 (UPI)The United States military command reported today that five Americans were killed in action in the Vietnam war last week. Thirteen were wounded and 24 listed as missing, captured or interned, the command said.

title: C. T. Chenery Dies
description: Christopher T. Chenery, owner of Riva Ridge, Secretariat, First Landing, Cicada and other famous thoroughbred horses, died on Wednesday at New Rochelle Hospital. He was 86 years old. Details on Page 31.

title: Social Security Chief Is Believed Out
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4President Nixon plans to accept the resignations of Robert M. Ball, head of the Social Security System for a decade, and Phillip V. Sanchez, director of the Office of Economic Opportunity, Government sources said today.

title: BIG BOARD SCANS 2 MEMBER FIRMS
description: William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, yesterday urged the New York Stock Exchange to investigate the actions of two Big Board member firms in connection with the rapid rise in the price of Power Conversion, Inc., an overthecounter stock.

title: GORDON RULE ASKS FOR HIS OLD JOB
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 Gordon W. Rule the Navy's outspoken costcutter who was shifted to a minor job after criticizing the President, has asked the Civil Service Commission to help him get his old job back.

title: 26 Indicted in Rochester In SelectiveService Cases
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 4 (UPI)A Federal grand jury indicted 26 young men today for alleged violations of the Selective Service Act. Fifty others were expected to be charged in the next two weeks.

title: I.C.C. PENALIZES ALLIED VAN LINES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 The Interstate Commerce Commission suspended today part of the commercial operations of Allied Van Lines, the nation's largest movers, as a penalty for poor service.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The Ninehester Press, not yet four years old but with 100 published titles to its credit, continues to offer works of special appeal to those interested in the outdoors and related sports.

title: U.S. Hero of Vietnam War Now a Waiter in Australia
description: SURFERS PARADISE, Australia, Jan. 4 (UPI)A retired United States Army Colonel, David H. Hackworth; the most decorated officer of the Vietnam war, said today that he was working as a waiter in a cafe in an Australian resort. And, he said, he likes it.

title: UGANDA TO ABSORB BRITISH COMPANIES
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Jan. 4 (Reuters)President Idi Amin announced today that 500 British concerns in this country would be taken over by Ugandans.

title: North Asserts 1,318 Died in Hanoi Raids; 1,000 Sorties Listed
description: TOKYO, Jan. 4  North Vietnam said today that a preliminary survey showed that 1,318 persons were killed and 1,261 wounded by United States bombing raids on Hanoi last month.

title: BELL & HOWELL SUES EASTMAN KODAK CO.
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 4 (AP).The Bell & Howell Company sued the Eastman Kodak Company today, contending that Kodak's virtual monopoly of the film industry in this country gave it ?? unfair advantage in the production and sales of camera equipment.

title: New Envoy From France Views Hanoi Destruction
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Jan. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)Claude Chayet, France's new Delegate General to North Vietnam, arrived at his post yesterday and immediately toured parts of Hanoi destroyed in recent bombing raids, ineluding Bach Mai Hospital.

title: Arco Told to Pay $3Million In Damages to Ohio Concern
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 4 (UPI)The Champion Oil Company of Hamilton, Ohio, was awarded almost $3million yesterday by a Federal Judge in an antitrust suit against the Atlantic Richfield Company of New York.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 33

title: WILLIAMS HELPS L.I.U. WIN, 6650
description: Ron Williams scored 20 points and grabbed 16 rebounds to pace Long Island University to a 6650 basketball victory over Fairleigh Dickinson University last night at the winner's Brooklyn court.

title: Giant Mine Shovels Finally Cross Road
description: HENDRYSBURG, Ohio, Jan. 4  Traffic on a major interstate highway artery, Route 170, was detoured here today for the 24hour crosshighway transit of two of the world's largest stripmining machines, each with the deadweight of a small naval destroyer.

title: City Curbs Use of Arrest Record As Criterion for Job Rejection
description: The City Commission on Human Rights yesterday extended its protection against discrimination to individuals with arrest and conviction records.

title: Future Nonresident City Aides Will Pay Full Municipal Tax
description: Future nonresident city employes will be required to pay the full city income tax under a bill signed into law yesterlay by Mayor Lindsay.

title: $625Million of Bonds Sold by the Treasury at 6.795% Rate
description: Reflecting eleventhhour improvement in market sentiment, the Treasury yesterday auctioned $625million of 20year bonds  the most distant maturity it has offered since 1965 at a rate of 6.795 per cent.

title: Historic Port in Greece To Be U.S. Navy Base
description: ATHENS, Jan. 4Six American destroyers using Greece as a home port are scheduled to be based at Eleusis, an industrial harbor 13 miles west of Athens, not far from where the ancient Greeks sank the Persian fleet in the Battle of Salamis in 480 B.C.

title: YOUTH IS ARRESTED IN CANARSIE KILLING
description: A 19yearold Brooklyn youth was arrested yesterday as one of three suspects in the fatal stabbing Wednesday night of an 18yearold in a school gymnasium in Canarsie. The two other youthful suspects were still being sought.

title: Mrs. Esther Baskin Is Dead; Author of Nature Books, 47
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., Jan. 4  Mrs. Esther Tane Baskin, nature writer, died in a nursing home today. She was 47 years old.

title: Salt Lake City Selected to Bid for Winter Olympics
description: The United States Olympic Committee selected Salt Lake City yesterday as the new American entry to hid for the 1976 Winter Olympics, despite an unresolved financial situation and possible problems of acceptance from many Utah residents.

title: Cairo Crackdown Stills Student Revolt
description: CAIRO, Jan. 4  Egyptian university campuses were deserted today in the wake of clashes yesterday between students and riot policemen at Cairo University and of the Government's decision to suspend classes at all institutions of higher learning.

title: 8th in Row Registered By Cougars
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Jan. (AP)  The Carolina Cougars, go strong help from their re sernes as they defeated the Virginia Squires, 135118, in aH kinerican Basketball Association game tonight, chalking up, their eighth straight victory.

title: WINE TALK
description: The Center for Science in the Public Interest at 1779 Church Street, N.W., in Washington, D.C., has produced a pamphlet that should be of interest to wine drinkers and merchants. It is called Chemical Additives in Booze, and despite its too cute title and arch prose style, it has some compelling things to say about what goes into what we drink.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: A system of payroll deductions for contributions to the artssimilar to the system used in donations for health and welfare causeswill be explored by leaders of fundraising campaigns for the arts at a seminar next week.

title: Right to Work Group Urges End of Brennan Nomination
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) The National Right to Work Committee urged President Nixon today to withdraw his nomination of Peter J. Brennan as Secretary of Labor. It said Mr. Brennan would use the post to further the aims of organized labor.

title: Contract Is Let for Vehicle For Rescue Work in Mines
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 5  The United tSates Bureau of Mines has awarded the Mine Safety Appliances Company of Pittsburgh a contract to develop, manufacture and test a manually operated vehicle for quick surveillance and rescue work following a mine disaster.

title: Governors Urged to Act On Energy Conservation
description: WASHINGTON, Tan. 5 (AP) The Office of Emergency Preparedness, concerned with the national fuel situation, today called on the 50 Governors to implement strong energy conservation measures in their states.

title: Quiet Requiem for E.P. Recalls Turbulent Life of Embattled Poet
description: The memorial held for Ezra Pound by the Academy of American Poets was billed as A Quiet Requiem for E. P. And though quiet is not the word usually applied to the embattled poet or his turbulent career, the evening at the Donnell Library Center turned out to be one of warm reminiscences, mirthprovoking anecdotes, readings and a brief look at his achievement.

title: WARD IS SEEKING CHAIN IN FLORIDA
description: Montgomery Ward & Co., a subsidiary of Marcor, Inc., said it had agreed in principle to acquire Jefferson Stores, Inc., of Miami.

title: Reputed Underworld Leader Is Freed on Bail at Buffalo
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 5 (UPI)Frank J. Valenti, a reputed underworld leader sentenced to 20, years in prison and fined $60,000 an extortion and conspiracy convictions, was freed late yesterday on $50,000 cash bond.

description: HONOLULU, Jan. 5 (AP)Johnny Rodgers has some good news and some bad news for the South team in tomorrow's 27th annual Hula Bowl Classic.

title: Gym Requirement Ended
description: WESTFIELD, Mass., Jan. 5 (AP)Westfield State College has gotten rid of its physical education requirement.

description: SEATTLE, Jan. 5 (AP)Substantial rollbacks of lumber prices that soared last year will be announced here early next week, the Internal Revenue Service said today.

description: ALBANY, Jan. 5, (UPI)An examiner for the Public Service Commission said today the New York Telephone Company should either end its special rates for some local governments or provide them to all municipalities.

title: Service for Joseph Cornell
description: A memorial service for the artist Joseph Cornell, who died Dec. 29, will be held in the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium of the Metropolitan Museum of Arts at 11 A.M. on Monday, Jan. 15, Tickets will he required for the service and may be obtained in advance by call??.

title: Murphy Says Courts and Jails Frustrate Police Crime Control
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said yesterday that more policing would not produce more crime control unless the state improved the court and correctional systems.

title: Public TV Backs Decentralized Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5  TheBoard of directors of the Pubic Broadcasting Service, at its annual meeting here, has drawn up a position paper restating a commitment to an independent and decentralized noncommercial broadcasting system.

title: Calls Annoy Miss Wade As Miss Goolagong Wins
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 5 (Reuters)  Virginia Wade of Britain was beaten by Evonne Goolagong of Australia today amid a flurry of disputed line calls in the New South Wales open tennis tounament. The score was 75, 46, 64, in the semifinal match.

title: Orange Soil Termed Youngest of the Lunar Samples
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 5 (AP) The orange soil discovered on the moon by the Apollo 17 astronauts is probably the youngest lunar material ever found, the spacemen said today at their first news conference since their return on Dec. 19.

description: Francis T. P. Plimpton, former ambassador and deputy United States representative to the United Nations, was sworn in yesterday as a member and chairman of the city's Board of Ethics.

title: MISS HIGGINS'S 68 LEADS BY STROKE
description: MIAMI, Jan. 5 (AP)Pam Higgins tied the women's record at the Doral Country Club's Red Course today with a fourunderpar 68 to take the firstround lead in the $30,000 Burdine's invitation golf tournament.

title: Dr. Edward Henderson, 76; Headed Geriatrics Society
description: Dr. Edward Henderson, executive director of the American Geriatrics Society, died yesterday of cancer in London, where he had combined a business trip with a visit to his son, Edward. He was 76 years old.

title: 3 Die in Plane Crash
description: ELKTON, Md., Jan. 5 (UPI)  Three air force staff sergeants, including one from Long Island, were identified as the victims of the crash of a singleengine private plane discovered yesterday. The victims were John Evart Shoemaker, 22, Wichita, Kan., pilot and owner of the plane; William R. Stunger, 23, Elmont, L.I.; and David Anthony Rangel, 26, Goodyear, Ariz.

title: Woman Is Ditch Rider
Compulsory Chapel Is Ended by Laird
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 5 (AP) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird today ordered an end to compulsory attendance at religious services at military academies and elsewhere in the armed services.

title: Thalidomide Compensation Increased in Britain
description: LONDON, Jan. 5A former manufacturer of thalidomide agreed tonight, under mounting public and financial pressure, to offer a considerable increase in compensation for nearly 400 victims of the drug.

title: ??utz Firm on Farm Aid Cuts Despite Congress Pressure
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) In the face of bipartisan Conressional pressure, Secretary ??f Agriculture Earl L. Butz re??sed to budge today from the ??dministration's decision to ??iminate or sharply curtail a umber of rural aid programs. Dr. Butz was reported to have ??gered some lawmakers during ??n informal closed meeting of ??e House Agriculture Commit??e that had invited him to dis??iss the moneysaving meas??es announced by the Administration over the last few weeks.

title: The Larger Europe
description: The European Community of Nine is an accomplished fact. With the addition of Britain, Denmark and Ireland to the original Common Market Six, this Community of 253 million people is by far the largest trading force in the world, accounting for 40 per cent of all world trade, with current exports nearly triple those of the United States, an average annual growth rate twice that of the United States, and a gross national product twothirds as big as this country's G.N.P.

title: TALKS ON L.I.R.R. TO RESUME TODAY
description: Negotiators for the Long Island Rail Road and the 12 striking unions were scheduled to meet this afternoon to discuss what the unions said was their new approach on the critical productivity issue.

title: Britons Donate to Hanoi
description: LONDON, Jan. 5 (AP)  A British charity said today that it was contributing $60,000 worth of surgical equipment and medical supplies to North Vietnam for the treatment of United. States bombing casualties. Christian Aid said a charter plane would leave Paris soon with the supplies.

title: NEWS INDEX

title: Soviet Is Said to Give Missile Boats to North Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Administration officials said today that the Soviet Union recently supplied North Vietnam, for the first time in the war, with a missile boat of the type employed by Egypt in 1967 to sink an Israeli destroyer.

title: Sirhan Ordered to Pay $17,500 to Man He Shot
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 5 (AP)Sirhan B. Sirhan, convicted assassin of Senator Robert F. Kennedy, has been ordered to pay $17,500 to one of five persons wounded in the gunfire that felled Kennedy.

title: EDWARD MELLINGER, EDITOR, RADIO AIDE
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Jan 5Edward D. Mellinger, writer and editor and former director of nationwide radio discussion programs, died Tuesday of a heart attack at the United Hospital, Port Chester. He was 55 years old.
