description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 8 The Super Bowl hullabaloo began in notsoblase Los Angeles with a mob scene today that broke up the Washington Redskins workout and their availability for 100 photographers and reporters at a photomedia session. Some 5,000 people, the majority males 6 to 16 years old, poured out of the stands at nearby Anaheim Stadium, causing the 47 players to retreat and frightening the coach, George Allen.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Detectives said yesterday that they had no clues so far to explain the case of a 40yearold Salvadorian man, Ralph Fernandez, who was found shot to death in West 79th Street on Sunday just a few yards from the spot where his younger brother, Luis, was shot to death on Aug. 23. Ralph Fernandez was killed by several bullets fired into his head at very close range. He died sitting in a 1971 Cadillac that was registered in his wife's name.

title: HIGH JOURT BACKS RAILROAD MERGER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  The Supreme Court, rejecting the protests of two competing railroads, approved today the merger of the Illinois Central and the Gulf, Mobile and Ohio railroads to form the Illinois Gulf Central.

title: Expert identifies Berlin Skeleton as Bormann's
description: BERLIN, Jan. 8A West Berlin forensic expert said today that he had established with near certainty that Martin Bormann, Hitler's aide, died in Berlin at the end of the war as Russian troops closed in on the former German capital.

title: 2 ExWalston Officers Plead Guilty to a Fraud
description: Two former officials of a major brokerage company pleaded guilty yesterday to participation in a stock scheme that allegedly cost investors $200million in one of the largest fraud cases ever uncovered.

title: Penn Central and Union To Renew Talks Today
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 8 (UPI)  Representatives of the United Transportation Union and the Penn Central Company plan to meet tomorrow for further talks aimed at forestalling a strike against the railroad Jan. 12. No bargaining session was held today.

title: Former Addicts Here Assail Governor's Bill on Narcotics
description: I was mentally ill, said 22yearold Bryant Ramsey, a former narcotics addicts who is receiving treatment at Brooklyn's Harambee House. I wouldn't even have felt guilty about stealing my mother's welfare check. How could I have felt anything about selling drugs?

title: CORONA PROSECUTOR STARTS SUMMATION
description: FAIRFIELD, Calif., Jan. 8 (AP)A massive body of circumstantial evidence proves boyond reasonable doubt that Juan V. Corona murdered all of the 25 men buried in makeshift graves near Yuba City in 1971, G. Dave Teja, the prosecutor, said today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JANUARY 9, 1973

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Parents Go to Albany to Ask DayCare Fee Freeze
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8Legislators arriving for their first working day were buttonholed today by hundreds of intense amateur lobbyistsparents and social workers from New York City who demanded that the state not increase daycare fees.

title: CAUTIOUS MARKET SCORES LATE GAIN
description: The DowJones industrial average edged into new high ground yesterday in a generally cautious and quiet session.

title: Cold Snap Causes Rail and Heating Problems Here
description: An arctic cold wave that gripped much of the country held the metropolitan region in subfreezing temperatures yesterday and brought woe to commuters, many office workers and apartment dwellers.

title: Watergate Trial Opens; Jury Screening Begins
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8At least seven of President Nixon's White House aides and campaign workers were among 60 potential witnesses announced by the Government today as the Watergate trial opened in United States District Court here.

title: DOCTOR ON VACATION WAS SLAIN WITH WIFE
description: ROANOKE, Va., Jan. 8 (AP) Dr. Robert Vernon Steagall Jr., 28 years old, worked through the Christmas and New Year's weekends at Roanoke Memorial Hospital so that he and his wife of six months, Elizabeth, 25, could add a few days to a Southern vacation.

title: Shultz: Low Food Prices With High Farm Income?
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz indicated today that food prices are his principal concern in thinking about the continuation of the government's economic controls program this year.

title: $4.7BILLION BUDGET OFFERED IN ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 8  Finance Minister Pinhas Sapir told Parliament today that for the first time since the 1967 war Israel would spend more on social services than for security in the fiscal year beginning April 1.

title: House Rules Chairman Favors Floor Amendments to Tax Bills
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The new chairman of the House Rules Committee declared today that he would try to assure that tax proposals be subject to amendment on the House floor.

title: Excerpts From Cahill's Annual Message to the Legislature Today
description: TRENTON, Jan. 8Following are excerpts from Governor Cahill's third annual message to the New Jersey Legislature:

title: Article 1  No Title
Republicans in the Senate Vote to Curb the Seniority Rule by Electing the Ranking Members of Committees
description: WASHINGTON, Jam 8 Senate Republicans voted today to take a step toward eliminating the absolute seniority rule for selecting party leaden on committees.

title: Records: Sahm and Band
description: Rock n roll is not a closed world by any means. News of important recording sessions, despite closeddoor studio security, spreads quickly. Doug Sahm'sa.k.a. Sir Douglas  recording in New York was not particularly important on the surface but when Bob Dylan arrived at the studio to sing, accompany, help and contribute material, the sessions were immediately elevated in status.

title: Lindsey Nelson's Wife Dies
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Jan. 8 (AP)Mrs. Mildred Murphy Nelson, the wife of Lindsey Nelson, the sportscaster, died Saturday on the island of Minorca, the United States Consulate reported today. She was 52 years old. Mr. Nelson remained on Minorca awaiting results of an autopsy. The couple had been living at Dinixifue, a few miles outside Mahon, the Minorcan capital. In the United States, they have a home in Huntington, L. I.

title: INTEREST REVIVED IN TRANSIT PLANS
description: TRENTON, Jan. 8  Governor Cahill's proposal for mass transit agency has revived interest in plans to construct monorail or other mass transit systems along the rights of way of the New Jersey Turnpike or the Garden State Parkway.

title: Raids Go On in Southern North Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Jan. 9 (AP)  Heavy United States air raids were continued yesterday against the southern part of North Vietnam in an effort to check the flow of men and material to Communist forces in South Vietnam.

title: Little Progress Reported In U.S.Soviet Arms Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8WellplacedAdministration officials said today that the United States and the Soviet Union had failed to make any significant progress in their latest round of talks on the limitation of strategic arms.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships

title: Music: Exploring Flute's Potential With Dunkel
description: Great creative explosions have occurred when a composer, having fallen in love with a particular instrument, pours out a flood of music to explore the potential of the medium. So, we get Mozart's piano concertos, say, or Schubert's songs, or Scarlatti's harpsichord sonatas. But the road runs the other way, too: Instrumentalists occasionally inspire (encourage or commission are the unpoetic modern terms) composers to produce significant works, such as the Concerto for the Left Hand that Ravel provided for Paul Wittgenstein, the onearmed pianist.

title: Hospital Patients' Bill of Rights' Backed
description: An individual's right to choose death by rejecting medical therapy and a patient's right to obtain a full explanation in clear, concise terms of his medical condition were affirmed in a 12point Bill of Rights that the nation's leading hospital association issued yesterday.

title: RODRIGUEZ BEATS COBB ON DECISION
description: Jose Rodriguez, a Bronx middleweight, slugged his way to a unanimous 10round decision over Don Cobbs of St. Louis before a crowd of 1,451, at the Felt Forum last night.Rodriguez, undefeated in three bouts last season, one in the Forum and two in Madison Square Garden, won for the 11th time of his pro career. He has lost two and drawn two, scoring one knockout.

title: WILLIAM COREY
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 8William Corey, assistant to the president of Norwalk Community College, died yesterday at his home, 341 Flax Hill Road. He was 59 years old.

title: 5 Union Fund Officials Indicted In Diverting Money to Presents
description: Five members of a Long Island labormanagement promotion fund were indicted yesterday on charges of conspiring to violate the TaftHartley Act by diverting employer contributions to such things as gifts of jewelry and a televisionstereo set to union officials.

title: ROMNEY DISCLOSES HIPP IN SUBSIDIES FOR NEW HOUSIN
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 8George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, announced today that the Nixon Administration had halted virtually all new commitments to subsidize lowand middleincome housing construction.

title: Salt Lake City Olympic Bid Needs $30Million Backing
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 8 (AP) Mayor Jake Garn told the Utah Senate today that he wouldn't even take the city's 1976 Winter Olympics bid to the International Olympic Committee next month unless the Federal Government promised $30million.

title: Appeal by Alice Crimmins Will Be Argued on Jan. 18
description: An appeal by Alice Crimmins, who has spent the last 20 months in prison for child murder, will be argued Jan. 18 before the, Appellate Division in Brooklyn, lawyers for both sides said yesterday.

title: Protesters Cement Locks Of Army and Draft Offices
description: MEDIA, Pa.; Jan. 8 (UPI) Four war protesters today placed a cementlike substance in the locks of the draft board and the, Army recruiting offices.

title: LAIRD DEFENDS SHIFT OF NAVY CONTROLLER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that Gordon Rule had not been dismissed as the Navy cost controller for his Senate testimony against a major shipbuilder but for a series of other unspecified statements.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Osteopath Sentenced in Drug Sales

title: Business Briefs
description: U.S. and Glass Makers Modify Accord

title: Egg Imports Restricted
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI) The Agriculture Department announced today restrictions on egg imports in an effort to prevent new invasions of Newcastle disease.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. Cougars, at Greenboro, N. C. (Television Channel 9, 8 P.M.)

title: The Fight on Narcotics
description: We must remove the carriers of this diseasethe pushers  from the streets, parks And schoolyards of our Communities, said Governor Rockefeller in 1966. Lawenforcement activities must be accelerated to apprehend the pushers, particularly those who are not Addicts themselves and engage in this filthy commerce for profit alone. At the Governor's urging, mandatory minimum sentences for drug trafficking, which had been in effect since 1951, were once again raised in 1966. Sales to adults were to be punished by seven, not five, years in Prison and sales to minors would automatically draw 10 years rather than seven.

title: Parks Director Sworn In
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP) A former White House aide, Ronald H. Walker, was sworn in today as director of the National Park Service.

title: Whether Boon or Calamity, Jewels Are Leaving U. S.
description: Visiting Europeans have always bought jewels here to take back home with them, but in the last few months they have been outdoing themselves. The Japanese and Mexicans have been loading up, too.

title: 3 CENTERS CHOSEN FOR CANCER TESTS
description: The American Cancer Society and the National Cancer Institute announced yesterday the selection of the first three of 20 planned breast cancer detertion centers across the country. The centers will provide free examinations for the detectior of this leading killer at an early, curable stage.

title: Yale's Poor Little Lambs Aid Neediest
description: Yale University's poor little lambs who have lost our way and its little black sheep who have gone astray sent a check for $25 the other day to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: 11 Complaints Bring Study of N.F.L. Player Agency
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 8 (AP) The office of Attorney General Louis Lefkowitz has been investigating complaints from six National Football League players and the league's players' association that a White Plains company victimized them by failing to live up to contracts to manage their personal finances.

title: F.P.C. ASKS A CURB ON NATURAL GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 8The Federal Power Commission proposed today a system of rationing scarce natural gas supplies that would give first priority to homes and small commercial consumers.

title: JOSEPH L. STROMME
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 8 (AP)Joseph L. Stromme, Assistant Secretary of War under President Franklin D. Roosevelt, died Friday of cancer. He was 84 years old.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Egypt Takes 3 Swimming Gold Medals

title: WILLIAM B. STONE
description: William B. Stone of Bronxville, N. Y., a stockbroker with the New York office of Janney Montgomery Scott, Inc., died Friday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. Mr. Stone attended Hamilton College and the University of Pennsylvania.

title: Learning Like Children, Parents Study the Fun Of an Open Classroom
description: With a surgeon fitting dowels together to make a geodesic dome, an interior decorator playing with a box of Cuisenaire rods, and a film producer painting with a green pepper, it might have been a happening.

title: Israeli Cabinet Tells Dockers To End 4Day Slowdown
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 8 (Reuters) The Israeli Cabinet called on longshoremen today to end a crippling slowdown in Israeli ports or face drastic countermeasures.

title: W.H.A. SCORING
description: DO NOT FORGET THE NEEDIEST!

title: CATTLE FUTURES RISE TO RECORDS
description: From Chicago yesterday came dismaying news for most housewivesnew record prices for live beef cattle in futures trading on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange. At the same time frozen pork bellies, the raw material for bacon, was setting new lifeofcontract highs, prices that were only a shade lower than the record high in 1966. Not to be outdone, live hog prices lingered just below their recent record highs, except for the February delivery which set a new record.

title: Guide GOING OUT
description: PULLING STRINGS Rey de la Torre is a classic guitar virtuoso, something he's been ever since he made his debut in Barcelona at the age of 16. Now, in his early 50's, the Cubanborn, Spanishtrained guitarist is returning for a second annual concert at Alice Tully Hall, Broadway and 65th Street (EN 21911), tonight at 8.

title: Attorney General Plans to Consider Terrorist Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst has agreed to meet with William J. Guste Jr., the Louisiana Attorney General, to discuss Mr. Guste's belief that there is a national terrorist group involved in the New Orleans leans gun battle.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Mixed at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Yields on United States Treasury bills were mixed in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: STOCK PROPOSED IN SAVINGS UNITS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The Federal Home Loan Bank Board today proposed complex new regulations that could provide windfall profits for millions of savers in 20 or more states across the country.

title: Israelis and Syrians Fight Air and Artillery Battles;Each Side Says That Foe Loses Planes and TanksGuerrilla Attacks on the Golan Heights Said to Ignite Clash
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 8Israel and Syria fought extensive air and artillery battles today after Israeli planes struck at Syrian targets in what a military spokesman described as reprisal for guerrilla attacks on the Golan heights.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Toward Phase III

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The General Electric Company has received $96million in defense contracts, it was announced yesterday. Three awards were from the Navy: $49.1million for ship propulsion equipment; $41.2million for ship turbine generator sets and spare parts and $4.6million, for research and development on fire control equipment in the Trident submarine missile program. G.E. also received a $1.1million Air Force contract for improvements to the J85 jet engine.

title: Harlem Dentist Heads Professional Society
description: Dr. W. Kenneth Williams, a dentist who has practiced in Harlem for three decades, was installed as president of of the Manhattan and Bronx. branch of the American Dental Association yesterday.

title: People in Sports: Calmer Golfer
description: Regular church attendance during the last two years is credited by JoAn bn Prbentice with helping her curb a very bad temper and become a better golfer. I think I lost tournaments in the past because I didn't have myslef under control, the 39yearold pro said. Now I'm calmer. After winning only two tournaments in 16 years, she has now won two of the last three she has entereed.

title: LAIRD SAYS SAIGON IS READY ON ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird told the House Armed Services Committee today that from a military standpoint, the Vietnamization program has been completed.

title: Sadat Is Said to Give Up Hope in U.S. Peace Effort
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 8President Anwar elSadat of Egypt was quoted today as having said that he had given up all hope in United States efforts to bring about a peaceful settlement of the Middle East conflict.

title: STEAM AT BELLEVUE SCALDS SIX FIREMEN
description: Six firemen were injured, none seriously, and about 30 patients were temporarily moved to other buildings when a steam line burst in two connected buildings of the Bellevue Hospital complex last night.

title: VANDERBILT BOWS TO FLORIDA, 8072
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Jan. 8 (AP)A freshman, Gene Shy, led Florida to an upset victory over nationally ranked Vanderbilt, 8072, tonight in a Southeastern Conference basketball game. Shy, a 6foot5inch forward, scored 24 points, hitting on nine of 14 shots and six of nine free throws.

title: Notes on People
description: Dispatches from Moscow said that Dr. Michael E. De Bakey had arrived there to operate on Mstislav Keldysh, president of the Soviet Academy of Sciences. Dr. De Bakeaty, a pioneer in the development of an artificial heart, is scheduled to implant an artificial femoral artery in one of Dr. Keldysh's thighs. Dr. De Bakey has performed similar operations in this country.

title: Earnings Decline at M.G.M. Before Sale of Publishing Unit
VOLKSWAGEN SALES FALL BY 7% IN U.S.
description: BONN, Jan. 8 The Volkswagen Company announced today that although its total sales in the United States fell by 7 per cent in 1972, sales of the Beetle rose almost 4 per cent to 345,000 cars.

title: Mr. Nixon's Feelings
description: WASHINGTONThere is only one way the Congress of the United States can end the war in Vietnamby forcing a surrender of almost all American objectives in Southeast Asia.

title: TV: Devil's Daughter
description: Subtract the baby from Rosemary's Baby, transplant those strange, Manhattan cliffdwellers to sunny California and you have The Devil's Daughter, one of the better madeforTV movies. It's being presented tonight at 8:30 by the American Broadcasting Company.

title: 2 Murdered Men Found in an Apartment on Fire
description: Two men were found stabbed to death yesterday morning in a Lower West Side tenement flat that had apparently been set afire.

title: Adirondack Park Agency Meets Opposition on Conservation Plan
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Jan. 8The Adirondack Park Agency ran into local opposition as it opened its first public hearing tonight on its controversial plan to control sharply development of the 3.7 million acres of private land in the vast Adirondack Park.

title: Sabres Get Sharp at Health Farm
description: When the coach of the Montreal Canadiens, the top outfit in the National Hockey League, becomes curious about the Buffalo Sabres' secord, something interesting must be happening. It is Scotty Bowman, the Frenchmen's leader, phoned the league office yesterday to find out whether the Sabres indeed are as strong at the end of a game as their touted physical  conditioning methods would have people believe.

title: Cashen and Baldeschwieler, White House Aides, Resign
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The deputy White House press secretary, Gerald C. Warren, announced today the resignation of two members of the White House staff.

title: GOVERNOR ASSAILS DRUGBILL CRITICS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8On the eve of the submission to the Legislature of his narcoticsoffense sentencing proposals, Governor Rockefeller today castigated judges who said last week that the plan would be unworkable.

title: Threat to Congress ...
description: The lecture read to the President's Congressional critics by Herbert G. Klein, the White House Director Communications, spells out Mr. Nixon's determination not to brook interference with his conduct of either the war or the peace negotiations. In the process, political facts at home and military realities in Vietnam are to be bent to the President's will. If the truth stands the way, the White House communicators blithely revise it.

title: Frasch Sulphur Price Lifted
description: Texas Gulf, Inc., said yesterday that it had notified customers of an increase in the delivered price of Frasch sulphur amounting to $3 a long ton, effective immediately. Texas Gulf said the higher prices were necessary to maintain a domestic Frasch sulphur industry.

title: One Man's War
description: Vietnam has become one man's war. Whether it is his crusade to prove that he, personally, cannot be pushed around, or that our inevitable eventual departure is honorable does not matter. What matters, aside from the supreme consideration of the human losses and suffering caused, is that the President used the period of Congressional adjournment and preoccupation with the holiday season to intensify the war far above any previous level.

title: W.H.A. SCORING
description: DO NOT FORGET THE NEEDIEST!

title: Chess: A NoRisk Policy Pays Off Only in Lost Opportunities
description: Some players simply cannot bear to part with material, not even for the chanceat a really terrific mating attack. They hoard their knights, rooks and pawns in secure clusters, hoping that a head count in the end game will bear testimony to their thrift.

title: U.S. Acts to Bar Court Order Forcing Action on Integration
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The Department of Justice is struggling to avoid a possible court order that would force the Government to resume the largely, abandoned practice of threatening schools and colleges with loss of Federal funds for failing to desegregate.

title: Nixon, at 60, Gives Formula for Living: Never Slow Down
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8On the eva of his 60th birthday, President Nixon said the way to thwart advancing age was to avoid boredom, look to the future andabove allto have young people around.

title: Selection of Ellsberg Jury Is Being Conducted on Two Levels
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 8  In they come, the prospective jurors, sometimes 100 at once, sometimes only 18, often just one, to be questioned.

title: Quito's Police on Strike
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Jan. 8 (Reuters)Quito's 3,000man police force went on strike today, leaving the city's 600,000 inhabitants unprotected and setting off vast traffic snarls. The police are seeking wage increases that they say the Government previously promised them to offset the rising cost of living.

title: Stage: Tricks, Musical Based on Moliere, Arrives
description: There was a great deal of vivacity at the Alvin Theater last night, but rather less life. The occasion was the opening of a new musical called Tricks. Based on Molire's classic The Pranks of Scapin, which, after all, was itself based on a play by Terence, the musical is unassuming and sprightly, without a great deal of substance but a certain cheerful boisterousness.

title: Woodstock Jesuit College Here, Experimental Seminary, to Shut
description: Woodstock College, the Jesuit seminary here that has been conducting an experiment in theological education, will close permanentlyat least in its present formon or before the end of the academic year.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Salt Water Flies, by Kenneth E. Bay (J. B. Lippincott Company, 158 pages, illustrated, $8.95) fills a long empty voiduntil its publication no book devoted entirely to the subject was available.

title: Barbara Ward Is Appointed Head of Environment Group
description: Barbara Ward, British author and economist, was appointed yesterday as president of the International Institute for Environmental Affairs, a group representing 18 countries that considers the transnational economic, social and ecological implications in dealing with environmental problems.

title: The Politics of Drugs
description: While hardly any penalty can be considered too severe for bigtime peddlers of hard narcotics, Governor Rockefeller's proposed crackdown on the addiction problem as outlined in his State of the State message is little better than a politically attuned harangue that threatens to make a bad situation worse.

title: S.I. DRUG SUSPECT FACES A TAX LIEN
description: An Internal Revenue Service claim for $7,009,165 in taxes due for last year was filed yesterday against Frank Matthews, the Staten Islander arrested in Las Vegas, Nev., last week in an investigation of alleged milliondollar trafficking in cocaine.

title: Basketball Ratings COACHES' POLL
description: The to 20 teams, with points awarded on a 10987654321 basis (firstplace votes' in parentheses) and wonlost records and total points.

title: LUCAS HIT BY FLU AS KNICKS DEPAET
description: A vital seven  game road trip for the New York Knicks; a halfgame out of the lead in the National Basketball As. sociation's Atlantic Division, began on an unpleasant note yesterday.

title: New Orleans Police Hunt In Vain for Second Sniper
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8The police stormed a sniper stronghold on the roof of the Downtown Howard Johnson's Motor Lodge today. But they found only the body of a sniper who was shot to death last night and not the second gunman they had said they thought was holed up there.

title: Egress Recap Is Given New Title: Homecoming
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 In one of his last acts as Defense Secretary, Melvin R. Laird today abolished the naine Egress Recap, given year ago to the plans for handling the return from Indochina of American war prisoners, and retitled it Homecoming.

title: Miss Goolagong A 60, 63 Victor In New Zealand
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, fan. 8 (AP)Evonne GoolaNeng, beaten yesterday in the final of the New South Wales :ennis championship, won her first match in the New Zealand open championship today. The 21yearold Aussie easily beat Lindsay Blatchford of Britain, 30, 6.3.

title: New Orleans Police Hunt 2d Sniper in Hotel Ducts
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 8The police stormed a sniper stronghold on the roof of the Downtown Howard Johnson's Motor Lodge today. But they found only the body of a sniper who was shot to death last night and not the second gunman they had said they thought was holed up there.

title: Soviet Gas Deal Held Up as U.S. Studies Cost
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 Last Nov. 4, three American companies announced that they expected to complete within 60 days a $3.7billion investment agreement for the sale of Soviet natural gas to the United States.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: GTE Sylvania to Expand
description: GTE Sylvania, Inc., announced yesterday at Batavia, N. Y., that its entertainment products group would expand its manufacturing facility at Smithfield, N. C., by approximately 20 per cent to meet expected increased demand for colortelevision sets and audio units. The expansion will permit addition of a fourth color TV assembly line at the plant.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: State correction officials reported that a new holiday furlough program for prison inmates was an outstanding success, with all but 7 of 680 prisoners having returned to custody after visits home.

title: LAIRD SAYS SAIGON IS READY ON ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird told the House Armed Services Committee today that from a military standpoint, the Vietnamization program has been completed.

title: Legislators See Problems In Stiff DrugCrime Laws
description: ALBANY, Jan. 9The chairmen of the Legislature's Codes Committees cautioned today against expecting rapid passage of Governor Rockefeller's proposed penalties for drug criminals.

title: ISIDORE EDELMAN
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md., Jan. 9 Isidore Edelman, a program analyst with the Department of the Army, died Friday of cancer at the Washington Hospital Center. He was 58 years old and lived here.

title: Hiring of State Legislator Delays StampTheft Trial
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 9 (UPI)Former State Representative Hudson Moyer has forced a fourth delay in his trial on charges of stealing postage stamps by hiring a state legislator to defend him.

title: Hunter Absorbs Concert Bureau Following 30 Years' Autonomy
description: The Hunter College Concertits Bureau, for 30 years a sponsor of some of New York's most illustrious concert offerings, is losing its autonomy and will function as an activity of general arts program at Hunter.

title: STEELMAKERS BAR A BLACK CANDIDATE
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 9  The United Steelworkers of America announced today the names of nominees for international and district offices but ruled ineligible the first black man ever to seek one of the three top offices in the union.

title: Farming in State: A Fight to Survive
description: LA GRANGEVILLE, N.Y., Jan. 9  In 1794 the Rutson family started a farm here in Dutchess County that produced almost everything that a Colonial family needed to survive.

title: Heroin Arrest in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 9 (UPI)Government agents arrested the owner of a Chicago filmediting service on charges of smuggling $2million in semiprocessed heroin into the United States, it was announced today. United States Attorney James R. Thompson said customs agents arrested Ted Norcutt yesterday when the first of four packages were delivered to his apartment by Parcel Post.

title: Books of The Times
description: WILD EXCURSIONS. The Life and Fiction of Laurence Sterne. By David Thomson. 325 pages. Illustrated. McGrawHill. $8.95.

title: Abbado Leads Mahler In Exhilarating Concert
description: Mahler's vogue  socalled by those who fail to understand his powerful grip on a growing public as well as on many of our most cultivated musicianscontinues to thrive. Not only do we hear the relatively manageable First and Fourth symphonies but also, with astonishing frequency nowadays, the summit works such as his Second, the Resurrection Symphony. The Philadelphia Orchestra under the direction of Claudio Abbado performed the work grippingly on Monday night at Philharmonic Hall.

title: (Reprinted from yesterday's late editions.)
description: Jose Rodriguez, a Bronx middleweight, slugged his way to a unanimous 10round decision over Don Cobbs of St. Louis before a crowd of 1,451 at the Felt Forum last night.

title: U.S. Law Urged for Assault On Patrolman or Fireman
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 (AP)Senator James O. Eastland, Mississippi Democrat who is chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee, introduced a bill today to make it a Federal crime to kill, injure or assault a policeman or fireman.

title: STATE IS PRESSING ATTICA NEWS CASE
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 9  The State Attorney General's office argued today that New York's law exempting newsmen from giving forced testimony does not apply to a reporter who has witnessed a crime.

title: Police Group Agrees on Need For a Uniform Code of Ethics
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 9A group of reformminded police officials and law enforcement scholars agreed today on the need for a uniform code of ethics for American policemen similar to the codes followed by the legal and medical professions.

title: PATRIOTIC SAYING EXCLUDES A JUROR
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 9  A saying that has been used to stir the hearts of generations of schoolchildren'Our country, right or wrong'led to the dismissal this afternoon of a prospective juror in the Pentagon papers case.

title: Arab Aide Dies in Paris
description: PARIS, Jan. 9 (Reuters)The Paris representative of the Palestine Liberation Organization, Mahmoud Hamchari, died tonight of wounds incurred when an explosive charge damaged his apartment here last month.

title: Results of 3Year Effort in State: 35 Public Officials Convicted and 25 Awaiting Trial
description: NEWARK, Jan. 9Thirtyfive past or present public officials in New Jersey have been convicted on charges brought by the United States Attorney's office here since September, 1969.

title: Yifter of Ethiopia Takes AllAfrica Distance Run
description: LAdOS, Nigeria, Jan. 9 (AP) Miruts Yifter, who won a silver medal for Ethiopia in the 10,000meter run at the Olympics last year, captured a gold medal at 10,000 meters today in the AllAfrica Games. His time was 29 minutes 4.67 seconds, far behind his time at Munich.

title: MRS. E. BURD GRUBB
description: Mrs. Rebecca Mix Grubb, wife of E. Burd Grubb, a former president of the American Stock Exchange, died yesterday at their home in Hadlyme, Conn. She was 81 years old. Her husband is the only immediate survivor.

title: Only Slight Rise Found in Narcotics Deaths Here in '72
description: The number of deaths here attributed directly to narcotics use in 1972 rose only slightly over 1971. Specialists in addiction treatment saw this as further evidence that the city's heroin epidemic may be leveling off.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A convicted murderer burrowed a 25foot tunnel in an attempt to escape from Trenton State Prison, the Department of Institutions and Agencies announced yesterday. The convict, identified as Vasile Dovan, had about 50 feet more to go before he could get outside the prison.

title: A.B.C. News Picks Sheehan As Chief Operating Officer
description: William Sheehan has been appointed senior vice president of A.B.C. News, it was announced yesterday by Elmer Lower, president of the American Broadcasting Company news division. Mr. Sheehan has been vice president and director of television news for the last seven years.

title: Curb on Guards in Miami
description: MIAMI, Jan. 9 (AP)  Complaining that Federal money was being spent for bombs instead of social programs, the Metro Commission today denied National Guard troops the use of a Dade County park for weekend training.

title: The Lights Will Go on Again at The Colony
description: Thirteen months ago, The Colony closed its doors, ending a 50year career as one of New York's most elegant restaurants, bringing tears to the eyes of Truman Capote and other regular patrons, and adding one more casualty to a glittering heap brought down by a combination of labor problems, high costs and a vanishing clientele.

title: STOCK PRICES EASE AS VOLUME SLIPS
Big Plants Said to Spurn ExAddicts
description: ALBANY, Jan. 9  A state commission said today that major employers in New York State discriminated against rehabilitated narcotics addicts in their hiring practices, and urged an amendment to the state's executive law that would ban such discrimination.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Major airlines rationed their jet fuel at Kennedy International Airport yesterday because of what industry officials called a very serious shortage.

title: Aid for Hospital Backed
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Jan. 9 (UPI)  The Palo Alto City Council voted today, 5 to 3, to endorse efforts to collect money to rebuild the Bach Mai Hospital, damaged in recent bombing of Hanoi. The council also directed the city staff to prepare a resolution in support of antiwar demonstrations on Inauguration Day.

title: The Treatment of U.S. Prisoners
description: American bombing of Hanoi was resumed on the evening of Dec. 18, and the next day it was announced that captured airmen from B52 bombers shot down over the city would be seen at a press conference at the International Club. The promised occasion proved to be simply an exhibition.

title: Nevele Owners Convicted Of IncomeTax Evasion
description: Two brothers who own one of the largest resort hotels in the Catskills were convicted in Federal Court here yesterday of evading taxes on $1.4million in income during a threeyear period.

title: Rauch, Former N.F.L. Pilot, Hired to Coach Argonauts
description: TORONTO, Jan. 9 (AP)The Toronto Argonauts said tonight that John Rauch, former head coach with Oakland and Buffalo in the National Football League, has signed a threeyear contract as head coach of the Canadian Football League team.

title: WHOLESALE INDEX OF PRICES UP 1.6% RECORD SINCE 1951
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 Wholesale prices increased in December at a pace that has not been equaled since the inflationary surge that followed the start of the Korean War.

title: Gas Industry's Price View Is Opposed by F.P.C. Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9  A staff economist of the Federal Power Commission, arguing that there is little effective competition in the natural gas industry, has opposed the recommendation of an industry task force that Federal regulation of natural gas wellhead prices be ended.

title: Richardson and Brinegar Silent on Key Policy Issues
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 President Nixon's first two new Cabinet nominees to face Senate confirmation proceedings refused today to commit themselves on key Administration policies.

title: Doctor and Patient: Bill of Rights a Break With Old Paternalism
description: There was a time when patients chose just one doctor to treat their every ailment, held him in awe, took his word for everything, did not want know what was in their medical charts, accepted without question the decisions that made on their behalf, and went to a hospital only to die. In those not so distant, days past, the physician had little reason to communicate with his patients other than in a paternalistic manner. Now, medicine is more complex, and the nature of modern medical practice has changed the traditional doctorpatient relationship to the point where on Monday the American Hospital Association issued a 12point Bill of Rights for patients.

title: The New Europe
description: PARISIt is ten years since British membership in the Common Market was vetoed by French President de Gaulle (Jan. 14, 1963) and ten days since Britain, together with Ireland and Denmark, officially joined the European Community.

title: 4 More Years for Kekkonen
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Jan. 9Responding to a request by the seven main parties, President Urho Kekkonen agreed today to stay in office for four years after his present term ends in March, 1974.

title: LINDSAY ASSAILS GOVERNOR'S PLAN TO COMBAT DRUGS
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that the way to safer streets, healed families and greater sense of security was not to be found in the impractical, unworkable and vindictive narcotics penalties proposed by Governor Rockefeller.

title: Pompidou Denounces Visit by Socialists
description: PARIS, Jan. 9  President Pompidou today denounced the scheduled Paris visit of six Socialist heads of government next weekend as an intrusion into French internal politics and therefore perfectly inopportune.

title: Pompidou Denounces Visit by Socialists
description: PARIS, Jan. 9  President Pompidou today denounced the scheduled Paris visit of five Socialist heads of government next weekend as an intrusion, into French internal politics and therefore perfectly inopportune.

title: Corporate Bond Rates Continue to Climb
description: Interest rates on corporate, bonds continued to climb yesterday as fresh worries about inflation and higher money rates swept through Wall Street. Specialists said there was particular concern about the soaring wholesale price index, which last month posted its biggest advance, 1.6 per cent, in more than 20 years. The other sectors of the bond market, meanwhile, held their own yesterday although the atmosphere there also seemed to cloud.

title: Guild Says Time Violates Pact on Job Relocations
description: The New York Newspaper Guild charged yesterday that Time Inc. had forced out employes of Time magazine to make room for favored employes from the company's defunct Life magazine.

title: NATIONALS WIN, 75, FROM NORDIQUES
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 9 (UPI)The Ottawa Nationals rallied from a threegoal deficit to score a 75 victory over the Quebec Nordiques tonight in a World Hockey Association game.

title: BREDICE TRIUMPHS IN WEIGHT THROW
description: Norm Tate and Tim St. Lawrence set meet records in the long jump and pole vault, respectively, but it was Frank Bredice who turned in the most outstanding performance in the 35pound weight throw at the senior metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union championships last bight at the Columbia University airdome.

title: BEATRICE FOODS TO BUY WINE UNIT
description: The Beatrice Foods Company announced yesterday its first venture into the wine industry by agreeing to acquire Brookside Enterprises, Inc., a wine producer with two wineries in southern California and one in Sacramento.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Jazz: By David Amram
description: The peripatetic David Amram, who is conducting two free concerts a day for school children this week at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, with the Brooklyn Philharmonia and his own jazz quartet, found time to bring the jazz quartet to the Overseas Press Club late Monday afternoon to play a twilight jazz concert for the organization's Jazz Club. Leaving no stone unturned, he used the occasion to plug his Brooklyn Philharmonia concerts, to plug his latest record and to plug jazz and the knowledge and appreciation thereof.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Dr. Herman Hailperin, 73; Rabbi in Pittsburgh, Dead
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 9  The Rev. Dr. Herman Hailperin, rabbi emeritus of the Tree of Life Synagogue, a conservative congregation, died today in St. Clare Memorial Hospital. He was 73 years old.

title: KNICKS SET BACK KINGS, 116 TO 115, IN EXTRA PERIOD
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 9Nate Archibald of the Kansas CityOmaha Kings celebrated his achievement of leading the balloting in the National Basketball Association's allstar poll with 52 points tonighthis high for the seasonbut the New York Knicks shook a bad case of jitters to edge the Kings in overtime, 116115.

title: CATTLE AND HOGS UP IN PRICE AGAIN
description: Most live cattle and hog prices equaled Monday's records or set new ones yesterday on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange. The prices for pork bellies, from which bacon is produced, soared to new lifeofcontract highs and the highest levels in six years.

title: New Orleans Sniper Identified; Rifle Linked to Killing of Rookie
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 9The police said today that the rifle used to shoot hotel guests and policemen during a 12hour sniping rampage on Sunday was the same weapon that killed a police cadet and wounded a patrolman here on New Year's Eve.

title: Advertising: Winchester Recoil
description: R. J. Reynolds Tobacco seems to be spending a lot of time these days trying to convince the critics of its Winchester advertising that Winchester is indeed a little cigar.

title: Award to Honor Truman
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Jan. 9 (AP)The City Council in this home town of former President Harry S. Truman lias established a public service award to be presented each Dec. 26, the day Mr. Truman died. Each recipient will be an outstanding elected or appointed official of the city, county, state or nation.

title: Sniper Is Remembered as Quiet Youth Who Grew to Hate Whites in the Navy
description: EMPORIA, Kan., Jan. 9Mark James Robert Essex, the 23yearold Negro identified by the New Orleans police as the sniper who was shot and killed atop the Downtown Howard Johnson's Motor Lodge there, was remembered here tonight as a quiet, average student who somehow developed a hatred for whites during a tour of duty in the Navy.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Tuesday, Jan. 9, 1972

title: A Hijacker Who Cited Insanity Admits Having Used 10 Aliases
description: The man who says lie litjacked a Trans World Airlines jet last Jan. 29 because he has a JekyllHyde split personality admitted on the witness stand yesterday that he had used 10 different aliases during his life.

title: Ship Stops for Ill Woman
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Jan. 9 (UPI) A Caribbean cruise ship was diverted to San Juan today to evacuate a 60yearold passenger suffering from heart trouble, the United States Coast Guard said. A Coast Guard spokesman said the passenger, identified as Lilian Haft, had become ill while traveling on the Sun Viking from Nassau, Bahamas, to St. Maarten.

title: ABORTION BACKERS ASSAIL PRESIDENT
description: Alfred F. Moran, the chief executive officer for Planned Parenthood of New York City, charged yesterday that the campaign to repeal the state's liberal abortion law was being led by the White Housebecause, he said, President Nixon had virtually asked Cardinal Cooke to lead this fight.

title: Rhodesia Closes Her Frontier With Zambia
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 9 Rhodesia closed her frontier with Zambia tonight and said that the Zambian Government had ignored repeated requests to stop guerrillas from using its territory as a base for raids into Rhodesia.

title: COUGARS VICTORS OVER NETS, 11097
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Jan. 9 Steve Jones was on target tonight, connecting on 14 of 17 shots, and it was more than the New York Nets could overcome as Jones's 30point output, helped the Carolina Cougars to a 11097 American Basketball Association victory.

title: Cahill's Message Is Seen As Start of Election Drive
description: TRENTON, Jan. 9Whether it was his intention or not, Governor Cahill's third annual message to the Legislature today signaled the apparent start of the 1973 gubernatorial elecLion, according to many legislators.

title: Airport Workers Say Music Hath No Charms
description: LONDON, Jan. 9The staff of the British Overseas Airways Corporation at London Airport will strike for one hour on Feb. 1 if the pipedin music in the longdistance terminal is not switched off by then.

title: Dinosaurs Left Tracks Near Nyack
description: The first discovery of evidence that dinosaurs once lived in New York State was announced yesterday by a paleontologist of the State Geological Survey.

title: Wrong Way on Drugs
description: The fault with Governor Rockefeller's indiscriminate lock'emupforlife response to the challenge posed by drug pushers and addicts lies not solely in its unworkability. The bitterirony is that it would replace a currently effective program that holds some promise of success.

title: World Survey Shows Newsmen Faced Growing Censorship Problems in 1972
description: In the last year foreign correspondents have faced growing censorship problems around the world, mostly through arrest or expulsin, the threat of expulsion or the denial of entry visas. They also encountered increasing refusal by officials to provide facts and were hampered by state control or censorship of the local press on which foreign reporters often dependfor news tips and background information.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Traffic Department, concerned over slippage in public compliance with twoyearold traffic regulations in downtown Manhattan, doubled its parking enforcement staff in the area south of Canal Street.

title: Trudeau Government Survives First Voting Test in New House
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 9  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's minority Government survived its first voting test in the new Parliament today.

title: 41 AIRPORTS FINED ON PIRACY RUES.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 (UPI) The Government today fined four airports $1,000 a day for failure to comply with its strict new program to combat hijackings. It was the first punitive action taken under the program, which went into effect Friday.

title: Sovereignty in the Skies
description: AMHERST, Mass.Domestic and international efforts to prevent air piracy deal with the fait accompli rather than with the crime in progress. So far the vast majority of hijackings have succeeded because the demands of the air pirates were not resisted, whether for ransom money, safe conduct to a willing foreign country or even the release of duly convicted compatriots. In the face of the nearritualistic threat to blow up the airplane, humanitarian motivations to save the lives of innocent passengers and crews are given priority.

title: DELAWARE TO GET ECOLOGICAL PLAN
description: DOVER, Del., Jan. 9Delaware's conservationist Governor, Russell W. Peterson, took a second major step today to preserve the coast of his state before leaving office.

title: Walker Passes Up Sprints for the 600
description: Tired of fighting the psychic, often affectatious world of sprinting, Dennis Walker will switch to that great quartermile conditioner, the 600yard run, for this indoor season.

title: COACHES VOTE 99 TO RESOLVE TIES
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 9 (AP)The rules committee of the American Football Coaches Association ironically came up with a 99 deadlock in voting today on a proposal for a college tiebreaking rule.

title: ROCKEFELLER SEES FUNDSHARE RISE
description: ALBANY, Jan. 9Governor Rockefeller, foreseeing an increasingly rosy state picture, said today that local governments would receive $93million more in state revenuesharing funds in the new state fiscal year than they would in the current fiscal year, which ends March 31.

title: Mexicans Talk Of Romance: A Love Affair With Tradition
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 9Aside from the persistent smog, that sometimes awkward ballet known as courting probably the most visible phenomenon in Mexico City.

title: Kissinger and Tho Meet for 5 Hours
description: PARIS, Jan. 9Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho held the second session today of their current round of private talks on a Vietnam ceasefire.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It is now a generally accepted conclusion that Secretary of State William Rogers, if you believe the news stories, editorials and columns, is the Secretary in name only. As a somewhat expert observer of the national Government and a longtime Congressional staff member and Government administrator and educator and because of having known and observed him since he was on the staff of the Truman National Defense Committee and its successor, the Mead Committee, I believe history will reveal him as one of best Secretaries.

title: Heavy B52 Raids Reported in Highlands
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Jam 10 (AP)The United States command reported yesterday that heavy B52 raids had been flown for a second day against Communist troop concentrations in the Central Highlands of South Vietnam near Kontum.

title: TV: Southern Trouble
description: With comparatively few recent color rumbles to pounce on, Hollywood and television have been giving a rest to a favorite racial scapegoat, the Deep South. But now, for some reason, there pops up a TV Wednesday Movie of the Week titled Trouble Comes to Town, archaically thumping away like a tired banjo, Crossing both wires and clichs. It will be presented tonight at 8:30 over the American Broadcasting Company network.

title: Stage: Orrin and Love Gotta Come
description: Frances Foster, Earle Hyman and Janet Ward all contributed their talent and their free timeeach is otherwise occupied in a continuing run of a play. As is often the case with the Matinee Series, the actors, not the playwrights, are the major contributors to the entertainment.

title: CAR PRICE ROLL BACK ASKED IN NADER SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9In a new attempt to get access to confidential auto industry cost data, Ralph Nader asked the Federal District Court here today to set aside the price increases approved by the Price Commission on Dec. 1 for the General Motors Corporation and the Ford Motor Company.

title: . . . Stall on Long Island
description: The success of Assistant Secretary of Labor Usery in obtaining a thirtyday postponement of the threatened strike on the Penn Central is good news for the national economy, but bad news for stranded commuters on the strikebound Long Island Rail Road.

title: GOVERNOR SCORED ON NARCOTICS AID
description: A city official said last night that Governor Rockefeller's administration had introduced unnecessary uncertainty into the financing of the special courts here that have been set up to handle narcotics cases.

title: SAMUEL M. FOX
description: Samuel M. Fox, chairman of the Kaufman Carpet Corporation and former president of the General Realty and Utilities Corporation, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 501 East 79th Street.

title: Monday Night Fight
description: New York (At Felt Forum) Jos Rodriguez, 156 pounds, outpointed Don Cobbs, 154, St. Louis, 10 rounds.

title: FAVORS TO KERNER AbEGED AT TRIAL
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 9The prosecution said today that it would present evidence proving that Otto Kerner, former Illinois Governor, had awarded the owner of a horseracing association lucrative racing dates at tracks in the Chicago area in return for specially priced stock in that association.

title: People and Business
description: Ervin E. Wardlow is president of the S. S. Kresge Company, the nation's largest operator of discount stores with about 500 units throughout the United States. So when Mr. Wardlow talks, suppliers and potential suppliers of these KMart and other Kresgeowned stores listen.

title: S.E.C. Plans Rules For Option Trading
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9The Securities and Exchange Commission asked for comments today on two rules it is proposing to cover the operations of the planned exchange in Chicago where put and call options on stocks would be traded.

title: MARAVICH PACES HAWKS' TRIUMPH
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 9 (AP)Pete Maravich, priming for his first start in the National Basketball Association's AllStar game, led a surge in the last five minutes that gave the Atlanta Hawks a 120114 victory over the Houston Rockets tonight.

title: LAG IN NET LISTED BY MELLON BANK
The Critical Swedes
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 6Now that the Swedish Government has talked itself into another diplomatic tangle with Washington, the question has been raised anew here why this neutral country expresses more hostility toward the United States' role in Vietnam than any of America's other traditional friends. The Swedes, rather shy in comparison with, say, the outgoing Danes, and living in a country about the size of California with New York City's population, are themselves divided on the answer. Their neutrality has kept them out of wars since the Napoleonic era but their recent words have brought them trouble, particularly with a sensivive. Washington.

title: ...Stall on Long Island
description: The success of Assistant Secretary of Labor Usery in obtaining a thirtyday postponement of the threatened strike on the Penn Central is good news for the national economy, but bad news for stranded commuters on the strikebound Long Island Rail Road.

title: MISS PROELL WINS DOWNHILL SKIING
description: PFRONTEN, West Germany, Jan. 9 (AP)Annemarie Proell took a commanding lead today in her quest for a third straight World Cup ski championship by winning her third straight downhill of the season.

title: CITY RELIEF ROLLS SHOW BIG DECLINE
description: The largest single month's dectease in the city's welfare rolls since May, 1966  a shrinkage in November of 8,883 personswas announced yesterday, largely reflecting tightened controls by the Human Resources Administration.

title: LINDSAY ASSAILS GOVERNOR'S PLAN TO COMBAT DRUGS
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that the way to safer streets, healed families and a greater sense of security was not to be found in the impractical, unworkable and vindictive narcotics penalties proposed by Governor Rockefeller.

title: MAN WHO DREW GUN IS KILLED BY POLICE
description: A man who had been stopped for passing a red light in the Tremont section of the Bronx was shot and killed by three policemen last night after he allegedly drew out a gun as they accompanied him to tenement where he said his driver's license and registration papers were, the police reported.

title: Nicaragua Plans to Shift Center of Managua 6 Miles
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Jan. 9 (AP)Managua will be rebuilt, with its commercial center about six miles from where it was when an earthquake struck Dec. 23, the country's leader, Anastasio Somoza Debayle, said today.

title: Notes on People
description: If he could run for President again, Senator George McGovern said, he would change quite a few things in his campaign. Without suggesting that he ever would do it again, Senator McGovern said in Washington that he would travel less, use television more and have more no comments for reporters' questions. My confidence in the ability to get to people with appeals based on simple, oldfashioned virtues like trust and decency has been shattered, Mr. McGovern said. Looking back on my travel schedule, I don't know how I did it. And I did it for two years . . . and Nixon never left White House.

title: N.A.A.C.P. DENIES PLOT BY BLACKS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 9 (UPI) Blacks here are not engaged in any conspiracy to kill policepen, and the notion that there are snipers behind every door is false, Harvey Britton, field director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, said today.

title: Moses PoohPoohs Plan to Stop Repair Of Despoiled Parks
description: Former Parks Commissioner Robert Moses said yesterday that the city's new policy of withdrawing money and manpower from parks repeatedly damaged by vandals was utterly impractical.

title: HOCKEELER SEES FUNDSHARE RISE
description: ALBANY, Jan. 9Governor Rockefeller, foreseeing an increasingly rosy state picture, said today that local governments would receive $93million more in state revenuesharing funds in the new state fiscal year than they would in the current fiscal year, which ends March 31.

title: Maryland Takes 14th in a Row, Holding Virginia's Parkhill to 2
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Jan. 9 (AP)Len Elmore scored points and grabbed 17 rebounds as unbeaten Maryland thrashed Virginia, 9374, in an Atlantic Coast Conference basketball game tonight.

title: Capt. Laurence Adams, 97, Oldest Annapolis Graduate
description: INDIO, Calif., Jan. 9 (UPI)Capt. Laurence Stowell Adams, the oldest living graduate of the United States Naval Academy and the Navy's oldest living retired officer, died yesterday. He was 97 years old.

title: CHICAGO'S TEACHERS PLAN STRIKE TODAY
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 9 (AP)The Chicago Teachers Union announced tonight that the city's 21,000 public school teachers will go on strike tomorrow morning. School officials said Chicago schools would shut down until further notice.

title: STATE BOARD BACKS A BANK ACQUISITION
description: The New York State Banking Board, acting on the recommendation of Harry W. Albright Jr., the State Superintendent of Banks, announced yesterday its approval of the proposed acquisition by the Manufacturers Hanover Corporation of the $21million State Bank of Ontario, which is about 20 miles east of Rochester.

title: Whitlam Is Conciliatory, but Warns U. S. on New Raids
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Jan. 9 Prime Minister Gough Whitlam took a conciliatory tone toward the United States today, but warned that he would react strongly and publicly against another renewal of the intensive bombing of North Vietnam, a cause of friction between Canberra and Washington.

title: 3 EARLY SCORES BEAT ISLANDERS
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Jan. 9The Los Angeles Kings extended their domination over the New York Islanders at the Nassau Coliseum tonight. Jumping into the lead with a threegoal splurge in the first period, the visitors registered a 32 triumph over the hapless local aggregation.

title: U.S. Letting Pilots Pursue Foe North of 20th Parallel
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9Pentagon officials said today that American pilots were being permitted to cross the 20th parallel in pursuit of North Vietnamese jets that attempt to attack United States B52's and other bombers operating south of the 20th parallel.

title: AN ARMORER TELLS OF WORK ON HOUSE
description: TRENTON, Jan. 9  A New jersey State Department of Defense employe, Ernest Giancola, testified in Mercer County Court today that he had spent the second week of his employment as an armorer in the New Jersey National Guard working on improvement projects at the home of the guard's commander, Maj. Gen. James F. Cantwell, now retired, in the of 1968.

title: New Orleans Sniper Identified; Rifle Linked to Killing of Rookie
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 9The police said today that the rifle used to shoot hotel guests and policemen during a 12hour sniping rampage on Sunday was the same weapon that killed a police cadet and wounded a patrolman here on New Year's Eve.

title: Dance: Ballet Theater's SeaChange
description: American Ballet Theater last night came back to town at the City Center and, in dance terms at least, 1973 may be officially considered to have opened. The more so, since the same night the New York City Ballet at the State Theater recovered from its annual seizure of The Nutcracker and returned to general repertory. So dance was blossoming all over the city.

title: JOHN NORMAN
description: John Norman, a fashion designer and director of the fashion information center of Butterick Fashion Marketing Company, died Sunday night at his home, 2 Sutton Place South. He was 55 years old.

title: Finger Lakes Gets Dates
description: The State Riming Commission yesterday granted 156 racing days to the Finger Lakes Racing Association in Canandaigua for 1973 with the meeting opening April 27 and closing Nov. 6.

title: L.I.R.R. Talks, Suspended Indefinitely, at a Deadlock
description: Negotiations to end the Long Island Rail Road Strike were suspended indefinitely yesterday.

title: Losses Exceed Gains in Amex And OvertheCounter Trading
description: Declines outpaced advances. yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in overthecounter trading.

title: Beame Is Opposing A WaterRate Rise By Queens Utility
description: City Controller Abraham L. Beame urged the Public Service Commission yesterday not to grant a waterrate increase to the Utilities and Industries Corporation, which serves 20,000 customers in Woodhaven, Queens.

title: German Court Embargo Cited Of Chilean Copper Shipment
description: The Kennecott Copper Croporation announced yesterday that a district court in Hamburg, West Germany, had ordered a shipment of more than 3,500 tons of Chilean copper turned over to a courtappointed officer. The action was taken in a preliminary hearing brought by the Braden Copper Company, a wholly owned subsidiary of Kennecott.

title: Results of 3Year Effort in Jersey: 35 Public Officials Convicted, 25 Awaiting Trial
description: NEWARK, Jan. 9Thirtyfive past or present public officials in New Jersey have been convicted on charges brought by the United States Attorney's office here since September, 1969.

title: Arguments Are Heard in SchoolAid Case
description: TRENTON, Jan. 9The New Jersey Supreme Court heard four hours of arguments today on the landmark schoolaid decision that held that the state's system of financing public school education was unconstitutional.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 10, 1973

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HIGHER EDUCATION The City University's Graduate Center at 33 West 42d Street is 18 stories, tall, scarcely an eyecatcher for the quick passerby, but its interior is surprisingly and handsomely and modernly designed, for a building that first opened its doors in 1912. You enter through a blockthrough mall attractively laid out and occasionally the site for a concert.

title: Redskins Coach Also Ranks His Team Highly
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Jan. 9George Allen went into the business of ranking football teams today and the coach of the Washington Redskins declared that Sunday's opponent in the Super Bowl, the Miami Dolphins, to be the best pro football team we've ever faced, better than the 1966 Packers.

title: British Boxing Team in Drill For Bouts Here on Monday
description: England's amateur boxing team, which includes six Olympians, had morning and afternoon workouts yesterday in preparation for Monday night's competition against the United States national team.

title: Court Bars Incrimination Plea on Tax Data Given to Accountant
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9The Supreme Court ruled today that a Virginia restaurant owner could not prevent her accountant from surrendering her income records to the Internal Revenue Service by arguing that the records might incriminate her.

title: Seniority System In Congress Gets A Double Setback
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9The absolute seniority system for selecting the chairmen and ranking minority members of Congressional committees moved closer to extinction today.

title: Nixon at 60: Quiet and Contemplative
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9President Nixon quietly observed his 60th birthday today in continued silence and isolation so far as his conduct of the Vietnam War is concerned.

title: Artist Creates Ice Escapade at the Whitney Biennial
description: Rafael Ferrer frostily exuded an air of easy confidence. The afternoon temperatures hovered in the midtwenties, and the ice house he was creating in the Whitey Museum of American Art's outdoor garden looked like it would not melt.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Jan. 9 (UPI)  The Bank of Japan today raised the reserve deposit requirements for Japanese banks in an effort to cool off a strong inflationary trend.

title: Victim Says Slain Man Was Not His Attacker
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. (AP)  The man they shot on the roof is not the same man who shot me, one of the Sunday sniping victims said here today.

title: (Reprinted from yesterday's late editions.)
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 8 (UPI)Buster Harvey's powerplay goal with less than seven minutes to play tonight allowed the Minnesota North Stars to earn a 33 draw with the Montreal Canadiens in the National Hockey League.

title: Police Head in, New Orleans Clarence Benedict Giarrusso
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 9Thirty hours without sleep, his face deeply lined, Police Superintendent Clarence B. Giarrusso slumped on a couch in Downtown Howard Johnson's Motor Lodge and tried to answer the questions peppering him.

title: MISS NORELL PLAYS HARPSICHORD WORKS
description: Judith Norell gave her third harpsichord recital in as many years at Carnegie Recital Hall on Monday night, and demonstrated that she has become a finished, mature artist whom one would be glad to hear at any time. On this occasion she kept to the French school for her program material, playing works by Couperin, Gaspard Le Roux and Rameau.

title: Parking Enforcers Doubled Downtown
description: Concerned over slippage in public compliance with stringent parking regulations put into effect two years ago in I downtown Manhattan, the city's Traffic Department yesterday doubled its enforcement staff south of Canal Street.

title: Brazil Bans Sale of Picasso's Erotic Prints
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan, 9Brazil has banned the sale of Picasso's erotic engravings in what appears to be a new wave of cultural puritanism.

title: Jury Is Completed for Trial of 7 in the Watergate Case
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 9Eight women and four lien were sworn in as jurors today for the trial of seven men charged with a conspiracy to spy on the Democrats in the primary election campaigns last year.

title: Far West Financial Corp. Reports $698,000 WriteOff
description: The Far West Financial Corporation, a savings and loan holding company whose shares are listed on the New York Stock Exchange, announced yesterday writeoffs of $698,000due to the revaluation of certain assets at the end of 1972which it said would reduce its 1972 net income by about $400,000, or 21 cents share.

title: . . . Stall on Long Island
description: The success of Assistant Secretary of Labor Usery in obtaining a thirtyday postponement of the threatened strike on the Penn Central is good news for the national economy, but bad news for stranded commuters on the strikebound Long Island Rail Road.

title: Sadat and Libyan Leader Meet on Tension and Unity
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Jan. 9 (Reuters) President Anwarel Sadat of Egypt and Col. Muammar elQuaddai, the Libyan leader, met for about two hours here today to discuss the tense middle Eastern situation, especially along the SyrianIsraeli truce line where a fourhour artillery duel was fought yesterday.

title: Richardson and Brinegar Silent on Key Policy Issues
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 President Nixon's first two new Cabinet nominees to face Senate confirmation proceedings refused today to commit themselves on key Administration policies.

title: More Incentive to Win, Says Buoniconti
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Jan. 9 The second time around, the Super Bowl pressure presumably is less. Many of the Miami Dolphins agreed today with that theory, but Nick Buoniconti and Larry Csonka didn't.

title: 2 Sentenced in Forgery
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 9 (AP)  Alvin Kotz of Washington and Rocco P. Fanelli of Staten Island were sentenced in Federal court yesterday to four years in prison after pleading guilty to interstate transportation of $2.8million worth of forged International Business Machines stock.

title: MORTON B. WHITE
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Jan. 9Morton Bartho White, a former executive of Radio Free Europe in New York and Munich and a former director of the American Council of NATO, died Sunday at his home here. He was 43 years old.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: COUGARS TRIUMPH OVER NETS, 11097
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Jan. 9 Steve Jones was on target tonight, connecting on 14 of 17 shots, and it was more than the New York Nets could overcome as Jones's 30point output helped the Carolina Cougars to a 11097 American Basketball Association victory.

title: Maryland Takes 14th in a Row, Holding Virginia's Parkhill to 2
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Jan. 9 (AP)Len Elmore scored 19 points and grabbed 17 rebounds as unbeaten Maryland thrashed Virginia, 9374, in an Atlantic Coast Conferene basketball game tonight.

title: Ice Capades
description: The cold factcold as the rink floor inside Madison Square Gardenis that an ice show is as much fun as you let it be. Last nights audience for the 33d edition of Ice Capades was warmly appreciative of the mixture as before, spruced up in a new wardrobe with some new production specialties and a clutch of superbly skillful young skaters, some new to the revue.

title: Coven Tops Parun, Case Downs Fairlie At New Zealand Net
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan, 9 (AP)  Georges Goven of France produced the first upset of the New Zealand open tennis championships today with a 62, 76, 63 victory over Onny Parun, the topranking New Zealand player and finalist in the recent Australian open.

title: Ruth Phillips Benziger Bride of Kurt D. Steir
description: Miss Ruth Phillips Benziger and Kurt David Steir were married last Thursday in Bristol, Vt. The Rev. Raymond Provost performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Ambrose Roman Catholic Church.

title: Bridge:
description: Someone who wishes to learn bridge in New York City has a number of options available. A common procedure, but certainly not to be recommended, is to pick up the game in haphazard fashion from friends or neighbors. Better, it is to study a good elementary textbook, or make use of an Autobridge set or other hometeaching device. Better still, for those with some time and some money, it is to take lessons.

title: MARAVICH PACES HAWKS' TRIUMPH
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 9 (AP)Peter Maravich, priming for his first start in the National Basketball Association's AllStar game, led a surge in the last five minutes that gave the Atlanta Hawks a 120114 victory over the Houston Rockets tonight.

title: Transit Sense in Jersey...
description: In proposing a superagency to absorb New Jersey's major toll roads and to channel their profits into an integrated program for mass transit, Governor Cahill has made a monumental contribution toward planning and financing a balanced transportation system for his state.

title: Protests on Monopoly Street Names May Cause Sponsor to Return to Go
description: A tidal wave of support for the preservation of Baltic and Mediterranean Avenues appeared to be gathering yesterday, two days before a vote by the Atlantic City Commission on a proposal to rename the thoroughfares that have been fixtures on Monopoly boards for 37 years.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The probability of its happening was infinitesimal, but the number of new LP records issued in 1972 was exactly the same as that for 19715,196. So say the editors of the Schwann Record & Tape Guide in their annual statistical roundup. There was, however, an increase of 1,874 over the previous year hin the number of tape cartridges and cassettes released, bringing the total in that category to 4,469.

title: U.S. JURY INDICTS JERSEY DEMOCRAT
description: NEWARK, Jan. 9A Federal grand jury today charged John A. Kervick, New Jersey State Treasurer from 1958 until 1970, with having extorted $113,200 from a consulting engineering concern that did business with the Delaware River Port Authority, the New Jersey Highway Authority and the New Jersey Turnpike Authority.

title: The Generalissimo Shows His Medals
description: The commanderinchief of Franco's Italian Army sat in Leone's Italian wine cellar yesterday gazing in wild surmise upon row after row of dusty bottles lining the walls from floor to ceiling. In this one room, Franco Harris could see more good chianti than is dreamed of in his philosophy, more than is dreamed of by all his brothers and sisters: Guiseppe Harris, Mario Harris, Daniela Harris, Marisa Harris, Alvara Harris, Luana Harris, Piero Harris and Michele Harris. Franco Harris is the large young man from Mount Holly, N. J., whose headlong rush into the record books brought him personal acclaim as rookie of the year in the American Conference of the National Football. League, helped the Pittsburgh Steelers enjoy the most successful season in all their 40 years, and won him his stars as generalissimo of the ethnic aberration known as his army. This force is neither military in nature nor Latin in derivation. It is a fan club that sprang into being while Franco was matching the matchless Jim Brown's record by gaining 100 yards or more in six consecutive games, and the troops rallied to the red, white and green colors of Italy out respect for Franco's mother, the Italian war bride of a black American G.I.

title: Conversion of George P. Shultz
description: History may remember as Shultz's Law the principle that price controls work best when they are needed least.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WAYNE, N. J., Jan. 9This winterholiday homecoming was something special for Sandy Mayer, a 20yearold Stanford junior. A year ago he was the 30thranked tennis player in the country, hardly the talk of the sport. Now he ranks No. 11 and wears the crown of the national amateur grass champion. No Jerseyans have soared so high since Eddie Moylan and Dick Savitt in the nineteenfifties.

title: Records: Sarah Vaughan
description: Despite the acclaim that Sarah Vaughan has had for the last 30 years, particularly from her fellow jazz musicians, she has never reached the broad audience that has responded to Billie Holiday or Ella Fitzgerald, who rank with her in the pantheon of jazz singers. The bases for a broad appeal have always been there  the fascinating colors in her rich and very flexible contralto voice, the warmly sensuous texture with which she can express even the simplest phrase.

title: Fanny May Auction Brinns Average Yield of 7.689%
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 (Reuters) The average yield on fourmonth commitments for 7 per cent Federal Housing AdministrationVeterans Administration mortgages at yesterday's auction was 7.689 per cent, up slightly from the average 7.685 per cent at the last such auction, Dec. 26, the Federal National Mortgage Association said today.

title: Weaver to Join Iowa State
description: AMES, Iowa, Jan. 9 (AP)Jim Weaver, builder of Penn State's offensive line that lifted the Nittany Lions to national offensive leadership, will be offensive coordinator on Iowa State's football staff, head coach Earle Bruce announced today.

title: Consumers Union Asks F.C.C. To Ban Ads on Children's TV
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 (AP)A spokesman for Consumers Union urged the Federal Communications Commission today to ban commercials on children's television programs or, if that is not feasible, to limit their number sharply.

title: Chile to Open Sihanouk Ties
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 9 (AP)  Chile announced today that she was establishing diplomatic relations with the Cambodian government in exile of Prince Norodom Sihanouk. The Chilean Government said the Prince would send a diplomatic representative to Chile and open an embassy. Prince. Sihanouk lives in Peking.

title: Accounting Unit Tightens Rules for Land Concerns
description: The Accounting Principles Board has approved by a vote of 15 to 3 tougher new standards for landdevelopment companies, the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants announced yesterday.

title: Penn Central Strike Is Put Off 30 Days; L.I. Talks Collapse
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9Friday's deadline for a strike against the bankrupt Penn Central Transportation Company was postponed for 30 days today at the request of Assistant Secretary of Labor W. J. Usery Jr.

title: Ships Move in Israeli Ports As Dockers End Slowdown
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 9 (AP)Ships began moving in Israel's two Mediterranean ports today after dock workers called off a fiveday slowdown that was crippling shipments of citrus, a major export item.

title: Suspect Seized in Indiana In Teacher's Slaying Here
