title: J. R Hendrie Weds Miss Andersen
description: MURRAY HILL, N. J., Jan. 13Miss Susan Millicent Andersen daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Theodore Andersen of Chatham, was married here this afternoon to John Ragsdale Hendrie, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert F. Hendrie of Mendham. The Rev. Russell E. Swanson performed the ceremony in the Faith Lutheran Church.

title: CHARLES A. HARRINGTON
description: PAWLING, N. Y., Jan. 13Charles A. Harrington, a teache of mechanical drawing at the Trinity Pawling School for 18 years and coach of the track team, died today in the New Milford (Conn.) Hospital, following a stroke. His age was 51.

title: Ballet Challenges Young and Parents Alike
description: PLAINFIELD  Ask most modern teenagers if they know who wrote The Nutcracker, and they will probably reply: What's that?

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Paul M. Mazur, in his article Taxing Money Earned by Money (Dec. 17), criticizes those who argue that money earned by money should be as highly taxed as money earned by work, stating that their logic is faulty. I find this statement rather strange, considering the number of misleading statements contained in his article.

title: Extra Petrified Hands A Puzzle to Museum
description: BOSTON, Jan. 13 (AP)The Boston Museum of Fine Arts has a problem  an extra pair of petrified hands.

title: World News Briefs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 13 (Reuters)  Iraq and Lebanon agreed today to reopen the section of the Iraq Petroleum Company's pipeline that runs through Lebanese territory, an official statement said here.

title: Miss Alice Carroll Engaged to Marry
description: EAST WILLISTON, L.I., Jan. 13Mr. and Mrs. David S. Carroll of East Williston have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alice Stirling Carroll, to Allen D. Cornell 3d. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Cornell Jr. of Newtown Square, Pa.

title: Zanzibar Dooms Smuggler
description: ZANZIBAR, Jan. 13 (Reuters) A Kenyan has been sentenced to death here for smuggling cloves, bringing to 16 the number of men given the death sentencenone has been executed yetfor the crime since last month, Attorney General Wolfgang Dourado said here today. The island of Zanzibar supplies almost all the world's cloves. The Government in 1970 attempted to discourage illegal traffic by imposing the death penalty on cloves smugglers.

title: In Siberia, Too, a Pollution Problem
description: The remarkable softening of two of the world's hardest liners, Nixon and Breshnev, in 1972 sparked a series of events that a few years ago would have been treated as a delusion.

title: Mays Getting Superstar Award
description: The Police Athletic League has established a Superstar of the Year award, and the first recipient will be Willie Mays. He will be the guest of honor at an awards dinner Jan. 30th in the Grand Ballroom of the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: Alison Rhoads And C. P. Ralli Are, Betrothed
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Jan. 13Mr. and Mrs. John Biddle Rhoads of Wilmington and Landgrove, Vt., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alison Rhoads, to Constantine Pandia Ralli, son of Mr. and Mrs. Pandia Constantine Ralli of Bronxville, N. Y., and Rupert, Vt.

title: HOSPITAL CASES LINKED TO SMOG
description: MISSOULA, Mont., Jan. 13Student researchers at the University of Montana have reported results of a twoyear study that showed a correlation between smog and hospital admissions for respiratory illnesses.

title: Stamps
description: IN keeping with the times, the Postal Service has quickly bared all, after an earlier tease that coyly hinted about a Special Stamp for Someone Special as the first commemorative of the year.

title: Tennessee Papers Sold
description: CLARKSVILLE, Tenn., Jan. 13 (AP)An agreement in principle to sell the stock of the Clarksville LeafChronicle Company to Multimedia, Inc. of Greenville, S. C., has been announced jointly by the two concerns. Included in the sale was the LeafChronicle and its three subsidiary companies which own and operate 15 weekly newspapers in central Tennessee. The purchase price of the stock was not disclosed.

title: Nixon's ProgramWisdom or Folly?
description: As the charts and arguments below demonstrate, it was painfully evident once again last week that economic forecasting is not exactly an exact science. Some economists say the charts prove the wisdom of President Nixon's decision to scrap most mandatory economic controls under Phase 3. Others say the same charts prove his folly.

title: Philippines
description: MANILAIn rural barrios, towns and cities all over the country, Filipinos were summoned last week to thousands of Governmentorganized citizens' assemblies to register support for President Ferdinand Marcos and his reforms, objectives and plans, whatever they may be. The Marcos regime had moved into a new phase.

title: Simon Yavitz, Sculptor, 77, Palestine Land Developer
description: Simon Yavitz, who began sculpturing of plants and miniature trees in gold and precious stones at the age of 60, died Thursday at Mount Sinai Hospital in Miami. He was 77 years old and lived at 390 West End Avenue.

title: Jordan Survives With Foreign Aid
description: AMMAN, JordanThe economic tailspin in Jordan caused by the 1967 Middle East War with Israel and internal conflicts with Palestinian radicals is past, but this Arab country of 2 million peopleis by no means on a smooth course.

title: Blood Bank s in State Hope Crisis Is Over
description: TRENTON  The Mercer County Blood Center, which supplies five area hospitals, is facing a critical shortage, but things are brightening up a bit at the other four blood banks in New Jersey.

title: Business in a Front Seat For Today's Super Bowl
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 13Because he succeeded in a sixweek selling tornado in placing 96 floor displays of Tasters, Choice freezedried coffee, 21 over his quota, in the food markets in his territory, Don Harris of Hackensack, N.J., and his wife, Ellen, won a weekend trip to see Super Bowl VII.

title: Physician's Associate Program In Danger
description: The physician's associate program sponsored by the BrooklynCumberland Medical Center, which has been training black and Puerto Rican men and women for the last three years to provide medical care in poor areas, is facing a financial crisis.

title: It is time to normalize relations with Cuba:
description: After a quarter century of hostility, the United States cast off its coldwar veil last year and acknowledged the existence of the People's Republic of China. Now it is time to lift the veil once more and begin the process of normalizing relations with Cuba.

title: THE HUGGER WINS IN JERSEY SHOW
description: READINGTON, N. J., Jan. 13 Vasily Evaskov, a Ukrainian who discovered his real name only a year ago, rode The Hugger to the open jumper championship today at the Four Seasons horse show.

title: Fire at S.I. Park Center Causes $2,000 Damage
description: A fire of suspicious origin swept through a recreation center in Walker Park in the Staten Island community of Livingston early yesterday, causing carnage estimated at $2,000.

title: Numismatics
description: WILL there be a Truman coin or note in 1973? It is more than a possibility for there is certain to be rising tide of official pressure, backed by wide popular sentiment, to place the face of the late Harry S. Truman on one of the currently circulating denominations of United States coins or paper currency. If the pressure is great enough, it will happen this year. (And for all we know, a hold order may already have been issued on the 1973 production of one coin or note, in anticipation of a new design.)

title: Miss Zanetos Affianced
description: BOSTON, Jan. 13The Rev. and Mrs. John C. Zanetos have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eugenia Zanetos, to Richard John Buba, son of Mr. and Mrs. Karol Buba of Salem. Miss Zanetos's father is dean of the Greek Orthodox Cathedral of New England.

title: Closter Restrictive Zoning Faces a Test
description: CLOSTER  Leopold Monaco, a young Bergen County lawyer, has placed himself in the forefront of what promises to be a heated debate on restrictive zoning, one of northern New Jersey's most controversial issues.

title: Mailbox: To Fulfill One Man's Dream
description: To The Editor: A Roberto Clemente Memorial Fund has been established, both to aid the Nicaraguan earthquake victims and also to realize Roberto's dream of a Youth City in Puerto Rico with complete sports facilities for the youngsters of his native land.

title: Navy to Cut 2,700 Jobs To Meet Budget Trims
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP) The Navy has issued orders to trim 2,700 civilian jobs from its work force at 17 installations In 12 states to help meet budget cuts. The largest cutbacks affect East and West Coast shipyards, with Philadelphia and Mare Island, Calif., assigned most of the losses.

title: J. H. Stevenson Fiance Of Nancy C. Desrosier
description: HOHOKUS, N. J., Jan. 13 Mr. and Mrs. Norman W. Desrosier have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nancy Colwell Desrosier, to Jeffrey Hagstrom Stevenson, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Stevenson of Wyckoff. A June wedding is planned.

title: SYRIAN PLEA FAILS TO AROUSE ARABS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 13Despite a Syrian call this week for all Arab countries to join in the confrontation with Israel, other Arab armies show no signs of moving into battle.

title: The Geyser: An Unusual Source of Energy
description: The threatening energy crisis is causing a growing number of scientists, businessmen and government officials to take a second look at an awesome but longignored source of energy: geothermal heat.

title: Heck
description: I'm just a tiny cog in a big wheel. I have no illusions that what I'm doing will shorten the war, but a man has to answer to himself first.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In his article Condominium Concept Is the Key to, Spurring Housing Production [Dec. 10], Robert V. Tishman argues that a vastly increased use of the condominium concept and a reintroduction of private developers into the apartment construction field offer the best hope for solving our housing problem.

title: HOLIDAYS IN ITALY LEAVE HANGOVER
description: ROME, Jan. 13  At the end of a long festive period with seven holidays since Dec. 24 and little work done in between, Italy is now facing the long stretch until Easter, which seems particularly bleak this year.

title: Miss Patricia Marie McDonnell Is Wed to Michael John Gorman
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 13Miss Patricia Marie McDonnell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Donal McDonnell of New Canaan, was married here this morning to Michael John Gorman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jerome F. Gorman of Locust Valley, L. I.

title: East Germans Try to Catch Up
description: BERLIN  At the Falkenau cotton mill near Zwickau, East Germany, more than a thousand workers are involved in a new rollingweek crash program, designed to keep machinery in operation around the clock.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE FEDERAL RESERVE BOARD raised the discount rate from 4.5 per cent to 5 per cent. . . Phase 3, which relaxes profitmargin controls, is expected to bring a rash of price increases at wholesale and retail levels. . . . The wholesale price index rose last month by 1.6 per cent. most in 20 years.

title: B52's Heavily Bomb Enemy Supply Corridor South of the 20th Parallel
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Jan. 14 (AP)United, States B52's bombed sections of an enemy supply cdrridor, stretching more than 150 miles from the North Vietnamese port of Vinh across the demilitarized zone into the northern tip of South Vietnam, American officials reported yesterday.

title: SailingBoating Course Passes Test
description: Deubler, Dew, Eliot, Erickson (C. and K.), Murray, Rudausky (A. and S.), Stark (H. and R.), Taylor and Wrobleski12 names that may not go down in history but 12 that have played an important part in a United States Power Squadron experiment: Is a sailboat course compatible within the traditional power framework of free boating classes?

title: COMMON MARKET FILLS KEY POSTS
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 13Three key figures emerged in the new European Economic Community's commission this week as the Common Market's executive body completed the process of dividing portfolios among its 13 members and naming department heads.

title: The World
description: PARISThe Premiers of five sovereign nations, Socialists all, descended upon Paris this weekend to meet with the leaders of 11 other lesssuccessful SocialDemocratic partiesand ran into an unexpected snub from no less personage than President Georges Pompidou. Sessions of the Socialist gathering are closed but the meeting produced a burst of headlines and controversy France.

title: Travel Notes: Shifting Tides in Ship Traffic
description: ESPITE the imminent demise of of all but two Americanflag passenger ships, sea travel retains a strong lure for a small but devoted number of Americans. The trend continues to shift from ocean crossings to cruises and from once busy ports like New York to newer facilities such as Miami, but the total number of passengers using major American ports teems to have stabilized. Some observers are even predicting an upturn this year. There have been reports that as many as 20 passenger ships intended for the cruise trade are under construction at various shipyards throughout the world.

title: Martin Bormann was last seen definitely in a tank in Berlin on May 2, 1945. Does he live?
description: Martin Bormann, Hitler's deputy, has been the most wanted man in Europe for 27 years. Of the major war criminals who were arraigned before the international military tribunal at Nuremberg in 1945, he alone could not be found. His death in Berlin was reported, but could not be confirmed. His survival also was reported but the reports were insubstantial. In the end he was presumed living and sentenced to death in absence. If he should be found alive, it would be the duty of the four major powers who set up the tribunal, and whose authority still subsists in Germany, to carry out the sentence.

title: Panel Assays EastWest Trade Climate
description: Five experts on international trade met last month at the Sacher Hotel in Vienna to discuss the development of EastWest trade, the atmosphere for it, its extent, and its direction. Host for the roundtable discussion was Clyde H. Farnsworth, economic correspondent of The New York Times.

title: Pakistan, Facing Food Shortages, Fears Trouble
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, Jan. 13 (AP)  President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto's Government is bracing for more political trouble during the next three months over rising prices and scarcity of such basic food items as wheat, flour and sugar. This period has always been the hungry season.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Builders Call For a March On Capital
description: HOUSTONDirectors of the National Association of Home Builders called upon their 68,000 members last week to march on Washington to protest lumber and plywood price increases.

title: By Raymond A. Sokolov
description: For all those people who hate canned soups, here is the absolute reverse. This classic consomme starts from scratch and ends up rich in taste and protein. It is pure and clear and can be frozen successfully, which is why the quantity called for below is large. Once you are done, you will hole an elegant soup easily available for quite a while. The garnishes offer various options for dressing up the soup. Quantities given are again large and may be cut down for smaller dinner parties. In any case, they are mainly for visual effectyellow egg threads or tiny cubed vegetables or designs in tomato royales.

title: ELLSBERG DEFENSE IN PLEA FOR FUNDS
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 13The defense in the Pentagon papers case said today that it was in a critical financial situation and that it was costing $50,000 to $60,000 a month to defend the case.

title: Eileen Leddy Is Fiancee of N. P. Curran
description: Edward F. Leddy of the Bronx has announced the engagement of his daughter, Miss Eileen F. Leddy, to Nicholas P. Curran of New York, son of Mrs. Nicholas P. Curran of Norwood, Mass., and the late Mr. Curran.

title: Soviet Further Toughens Line on Japan, Saying a Revived Militarism Undermines Peace Effort in Europe
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 13  The Soviet Union, displaying an increasing sense of disenchantment and rivalry with Japan in Asia, today accused the Tokyo Government of reviving militarism at a time when European powers were trying to reduce international tensions.

title: KENNETH WALSH
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 13Kenneth Walsh died yesterday at his home. He was 73 years old.

title: Pigeons Defended as Venice Attempts to Reduce Flocks
description: VENICE, Italy, Jan. 13 (Reuters)A leading Italian animal lover has come to the defense of the pigeons of Venice, which are being netted in an effort to halt damage to the city's priceless monuments.

title: 3 Held on Explosives Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13 (AP) Two persons connected with the Weathermen organization have been charged with making and possessing explosives and teaching how to use them, the Justice Department announced. A 19yearold woman also was charged. Three indictments, returned by a Federal grand jury in Cleveland, named Johr Fuerst, 28 years old, Leonart Handelsman, 26, and Joann Zilsel, 19, all fugitives.

title: Point of View
description: WASHINGTONThe 1960's were a turnaround time. If you were a New York Yankee fart through those years, you saw it happen. And if you were an American businessman trying to compete abroad, you saw it happen, too.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated.

title: Israel Bond Sales Reach $270Million, a New High
description: The Israel Bond Organization reported yesterday a sale of $270,404,750 in Israel bonds last year, a record, for the economic development of the Jewish state.

title: Ghana Frees 67 Opponents On Regime's Anniversary
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Jan. 13The Ghanaian Government today marked the first anniversary of the overthrow of former Prime Minister Kofi A. Busia with the release of 67 political prisoners.

title: Arthur Daley Some Super Speculating
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 13Did you see George this morning? an inquirer asked Mrs. George Allen the other day.

title: Jersey Klan Member Jailed 6 Months in Cross Burning
description: FREEHOLD, N.J, Jan 13 (UPI)A member of the Ku Klux Klan has been sentenced to six months in jail for burning a enoss in front of a black man's house.

title: THE NEW YORK TIMES, SUNDAY, JANUARY 14, 1973
description: TRENTON.  The approval of state grants to five local environmental agencies has aroused the interest of conservationists far out of proportion to the $2,500 allocations themselves.

title: Whalers Sink Raiders On 2dPeriod Rally, 43
description: BOSTON, Jan. 13 (AP)The New England Whalers tallied four goals in a 7minute span in the second period and went on to a 43 World Hockey Association victory over the New York Raiders tonight.

title: Japan Aiding Hanoi Victims
description: TOKYO, Jan. 13 (Reuters)The Japanese Government and Red Cross Society will jointly send about $27,000 worth of medical supplies to North Vietnam, Government officials said today. The cargo will be flown to Hanoi via Pakistan and China tomorrow, they said.

title: ATLANTA STAGES STORM RECOVERY
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 13It's like the big New York blackout several year's ago, said the manager of a large apartment complex after an ice storm temporarily crippled Atlanta this week. The hospitals are going to be doing a booming business nine months from now.

title: The Long Night
description: Long nights of cold and brittle starlight, of ice and snow and sharpfanged wind, now are ours. The snow will come and go, but the ice will persist, and the night cold. And the wildlife of this world will follow its own pattern, mostly unheard and unseen.

title: Industry
description: The issue: When, if ever, should the Government come to the financial rescue of a company that has a contract to turn out a defense item but suddenly says it faces economic disaster?

title: Bruce Kapner Fiance Of Amy Lynn Brinberg
description: RYE, N. Y., Jan. 13Miss Amy Lynn Brinberg and Bruce David Kepner, seniors at Ohio Wesleyan University, have become engaged.

title: Who Really Wrote Neil Simon's Plays?
description: March 1, 2361 Proposal for a Ph.D. Thesis Subject: Who Wrote Simon's Plays? Submitted by Degree Candidate 11332407911

title: A Record Companyand Perhaps a HitAre Born
description: MONTVALE  Charlie Wright, a traveling sales manager whose hardrubber products include combs and bowling balls, and Shirley Keller, who describes herself as a housewife, have, somewhat to their own surprise, suddenly found themselves running a record company.

title: Income Data on Camden and Cher Hill
description: Fiftyfour per cent of the 16,200 families living in Camden County's fastgrowing Cherry Hill Township in 1970 had incomes exceeding $15,000. In contrast, the povertystricken city of Camden reported only 11 per cent of its 24,700 families above the $15,000 mark.

title: R.P.I. Five Beats M.I.T.
description: TROY, N.Y., Jan. 13 (AP)Cary Dassatti scored 18 points today in leading Rensselaer Polytechnic to a 75.53 basketball victory over Massachusetts Institute of Technology. R.P.I. led 27.21, at the half.

title: Swiss Banks Pay Price for Inflation
description: GENEVA  Switzerland's bankers have that scapegoat feeling again.

title: Suffolk Reorganizes Welfare Department
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. ILess than two months after taking office last year, Suffolk County executive John V. N. Klein announced a complete reorganization of the county's Department of Social Services that, he Said, had been moving at a Stone Age pace despite a 1972 caseload of nearly 23,000 and a $147 millionayear budget.

title: Gustav Lange, 85, Dies; A Manuscript Illuminator
description: Gustav Lange, a calligrapher who for decades illuminated manuscripts, scrolls and citations with burnished 24karat gold powder, died Friday night at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 85 years old and lived at 117 East 37th Street.

title: The Morning Deluge
description: Although Chou Enlai has become a big figure in world affairsa certain White House aide considers him one of the two greatest leaders in the worldhe is for all his brilliance but Mao Tsetung's stage manager. What of the director himself, the brooding rebel, poet, man of arms, political theorist, fourtimes husband, Mr. Mao?

title: Gabriel Echavarria Plans to Wed Miss Pilar Crespi, Model, Here
description: Miss Pilar Crespi and Gabriel Echavarria plan to be married, perhaps in the spring. No formal announcement of the engagement has yet been made.

title: Bomb Injures Moroccan
description: RABAT, Morocco, Jan. 13 (UPI)Mohammed Lyazhgi, a leader of the Moroccan leftist Opposition party, the National Union of Popular Forces, suffered serious facial and stomach injuries today from a letter bomb, the party said. A letter bomb mailed to another leader, Omar Benjelloun, was found and dismantled, it said.

title: Komar in Track Meet
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 13 (AP)Wladyslaw Komar, the Polish strongman who won a gold medal in the shotput at the 1972 Olympics, will compete in that event at the 13th annual Oregon indoor invitation track and field meet Jan. 27. Officials said Komar's appearance would be the first in the history of the meet by a performer from behind the Iron Curtain.

title: Just One More Time
description: DALLAS, Jan. 13 (AP)To the utter relief of thousands of America's football widows and to the equal grief of the nation's hard corps of football fans, the football season officially ends Jan. 21 in Texas Stadium when the National and American Football Conferences tangle in the Pro Bowl.

title: Women's Attire Stirs Controversy
description: Unlike the equestrienne set, the dog show fanciers are still engaged in the controversy over how feminine woman's attire should be, while judging or showing. No one expects a judge or an exhibitor to wear high heels into the ring, but the worry over excessive exposure, while bending, is equally uncomfortable and distracting.

title: Ulster Prospers Despite War
description: BELFAST, Northern IrelandAfter four long years of guerrilla warfaremuch of it directed at industrial targetsit is surprising that the economy of Northern Ireland survives. What is more astonishing is that it prospers.

title: Crop Damage in California
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 13 (Reuters)The state Agriculture Department said nearly $51million damage was caused here during last month's freeze.

title: Senate: 2 Empty Seats
description: TRENTONThe State Senate has abandoned plans for special elections to fill two vacancies. As a result, Senate Republicans will now have to use finesse, rather than perhaps a comfortable majority, to approve Governor Cahill's legislative programs in this, an election year.

title: Jones Shoots 66 for 198 to Take 3dRound Phoenix Lead
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 13 (AP) Grier Jones, striking his irons with riflelike accuracy, forged a fourunderpar 66 and took the thirdround lead today in the $150,000 Phoenix open golf tournament.

title: Phase 3Big Step Toward a Free Economy
description: WASHINGTON  President Nixon seems to relish surprises. Take, for example, Aug. 15, 1971, a hot, lazy summer Sunday when most Americans were at the beach or on the golf course or sitting in their backyards sipping lemonade or chatting on their front stoops.

title: STOCK LINK NOTED IN KERNER TRIAL
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 13The jury in the trial of former Gov. Otto Kerner has heard two days of testimony by the socalled queen of Illinois racing linking the defendant to ownership of stock in, racing associations.

title: the traveler's world
description: IN the world of medicine, tropical diseases are neither tropical in the sense that they are exclusive to hot climates, nor exotic; they attack people in the temperate zones all over the world and almost every tourist of any experience has been at some time exposed to, if not attacked by, them. Which is why the American tourist is the special concern of Dr. Kevin M. Cahill, a Fifth Avenue internist who is one of the world's authorities on tropical diseases.

title: Aladdin's Lamp for Oil Nations
description: BEIRUT, LebanonA new era of participation in oil profits that makes Aladdin's lamp seem a reality has opened for the petroleum producing nations of the Middle East.

title: Small Kicks in Superland
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13I often go to the supermarket for the pure fun of it, and I suspect a lot of other people do too. The supermarket fills some of the same needs the neighborhood saloon used to satisfy. There you can mix with neighbors when you are lonely, or feeling claustrophobic with family, or when you simply feel the urge to get out and be part of the busy, interesting world.

title: The Official History of the 48th Railway Battalion: A Dirty Story
description: THE old 48th Railway Scenery Battalion is no moreanother proud United States Army unit deactivated by encroaching technology, which has overtaken such glorious Army traditions as the horse, the saber, the brown boot. But the old 48th went out proud and hard, leaving behind a record of achievement plain to see along the most traveled railway corridors of the United States. And for its final run the 48th chose the Penn Central: bankrupt, surly  every inch American railroad.

title: Students Critical of Life Sentences for Drug Sellers
description: On college campuses in the state, where drug use is not uncommon, Governor Rockefeller's strong program against drug dealers and pushers is being scorned as Draconian and disdained as impractical.

title: All's Well That Kills Will?
description: THE contemporary manner of staging Shakespeare consists mostly of dragging him down to our level. Raising the audience even a part of the way up to the, airy heights of his imagination would be as difficult for today's directors as it would be rewarding for us, so down he must come, weighted with leaden inspirations to keep him earthbound.

title: CHINESE BUILDING NEW ROAD IN LAOS
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 13 (AP)Reliable military sources say that work has started on a new Chinese road in northwestern Laos.

title: Rising Wages Bring Curbs On Labor
description: GENEROUS wage contracts adding fuel to inflationary fires. Rising expectations by workers and declining economic growth. New laws passed to curb union power. A governmental freeze on pay and prices.

title: Congress
description: WASHINGTON  Are we a limp bunch of pumpkins, or do we have the intestinal fortitude to reassert ourselves? The question, posed by Representative Robert L. Leggett. Democrat of California, came as Democrats in control of Congress moved last week toward their threatened showdown with the White House over war powers and spending authority.

title: Medford's Ecology Study Offers a Guide to Developers
description: MEDFORD TOWNSHIP The ecology of this Burlington County area has been investigated, dissected and charted almost down to the individual twig, rock and blade of grass.

title: Flu Stops Maine Quintet
description: ORONO, Me., Jan. 13 (AP)The University of Maine's varsity basketball squad has been benched by the flu, forcing cancelation of tonight's game with Siena College in Albany.

title: Susan Moses, Cellist, Bride
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. Jan. 13Miss Susan Ilene Moses, a cellist, plans to be married Feb. 22 in Paris to Pierre Alain Amoyal, a violinist.

title: SHOP TALK
description: LIVINGSTONWhen women with devoted, successful husbands, wellrun homes and children who are a credit to them need a challenge, they open their own businesses.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Donald Westlake is not the only one who writes wacky crime novels. Consider THE MASTERPIECE OF NICE MR. BREEN by Henry Hunvald (World, $5.95). The central characters are five nice old ladies in Secaucus, N. J., who get their drugs from a nice pusher named Mr. Breen. These nice old ladies seem to be permanently stoned, though only one of them is on really hard stuff.

title: Deserting Fathers
description: For laughs, but with a trace of pride, the thin, friendly woman called herself the vine of life, happily admitting she had seven children, all on welfare. She had even named one of them Michelle, she said, in honor of New York City's onetime Welfare Commissioner, Mitchell Ginsberg.

title: Y.M.C.A. Plan Bogged Down
description: LAWRENCE, L. I.  After five years of attempted fundraising, the future still remains uncertain for the proposed $5million Young Men's Christian Association facility in the Five Towns area of Long Island.

title: Drug Center Is Opened To Treat Minorities
description: NEW BRUNSWICKThis aging urban city has taken possession of a storefront building and has transformed it into a narcotics center geared to help minority drug abusers.

title: CELTICS DEFEAT 76ERS BY 11195
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan, 13 (UPI)Jo Jo White scored 29 points tonight leading the Boston Celtics to a 11195 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Change Is in the Air for Comecon
description: WARSAWFor years, the Communist nations of Eastern Europe maintained a hostile attitude toward the European Economic Community. They said it was becoming a supranational body that posed a political, as well as an economic, threat on the Continent.

title: German Waiters: Going... Going ..
description: DUSSELDORFI liked my stay at your place, wrote an American visitor to a Dsseldorf hotelier, but I recommend that you teach your waiters the difference between Pils and Alt [two types of German beer] because nothing irks me more than the wrong beer at the right place.

title: Dance
description: THE difference between dance and acrobatics has always been a fine one. Ordinary peopleor least normal ordinary people  do not spend long seconds of their lives suspended balancing on one foot, tiptoe. Nor do they jump in the air and waggle their legs to and fro, or suddenly, with scarce due warning, turn round twice in the ungrateful atmosphere before negligently returning to earth. Such things, and I could expand upon them, for no girl was ever born who could naturally perform a gargouillade, do savor something of acrobatics.

title: From Behind the Auto Curtain
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 13One of the Soviet Union's most cherished status symbolsa curtain drawn across the rear window of an automobile for privacymay be imperiled by new traffic regulations in effect here since the first of the year.

title: James Allen Jr. to Wed Jane MacGinnis
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Jan. 13Announcement has been made by the Rev. and Mrs. Joseph E. MacGinnis of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jane MacGinnis, to James W. Allen Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Allen of Manhasset.

title: Headquarters of Miners Opened to Rank and File
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13The iron gate at the foot of the marble stairway is gone. Visitors are taken on tours of the late John L. Lewis's cypresspaneled, penthouse aerie, offlimits to nearly all for 20 years. The three gleaming Cadillacs in the parking lot are going to be auctioned off to coal miners.

title: How State Fights Alcoholism Problem
description: TRENTONThe one man who may be instrumental in helping to rescue New Jersey's 350,000 active alcoholics is a softspoken, pipesmoking professional known to few people outside the health field.

title: Sherrill Swan Plans Nuptials
description: GREENBRAE, Calif., Jan. 13Mr. and Mrs. William Bothwell Swan of Greenbrae, Calif., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sherrill Swan, to William Barton Welch, son of Mr. and Mrs. E. Sohier Welch Jr. of Harvard and Mount Desert, Me.

title: A Retired Policeman Set to Hit Books Again
description: NEWARK  Thomas O. Swangin, who holds the longevity record for a black policeman in this city, has retired after 27 years of service.

title: The Old Made New
description: In spite of great obstacles, this remains an oddly romantic era. Little girls still pretend to be princesses, but they often want to be news commentators or stockmarket analysts as well. Ogres and dwarfs abound, but they are disguised in regularlooking bodies. Storytellers still entertain, but instead of a king's wrath, they have to be careful of provoking stridentvoiced monitors of social responsibility. Scratch the surface of our chromeandsteelplated technology and you find a belief in science that is tempered by the knowledge that she can be a very fickle fairy godmother, as capricious as any Olympian.

title: Miss Lanigan and Allen Gilbert Plan to Be Married March 10
description: ARDSLEYONHUDSON, N. Y., Jan. 13Mr. and Mrs. John B. Lanigan have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Browne Lanigan, to Allen Gilbert of Cambridge, Mass. The prospective bridegroom is a son of Samuel H. Gilbert of Radnor, Pa., and the late Mrs. Gilbert.

title: A Soviet Setback Down on the Farm
description: MOSCOW  The Soviet Union, generally viewed as the world's second industrial power after the United States, entered the new year with its economy seriously hobbled by a bad harvest.

title: Extra Rent for Cable TV Barred
description: Tenants in rentcontrolled apartments who install cable television may no longer be charged an additional $2 a month in rent.

title: Jeweler WhoSaid 2 Men Robbed Him Now Admits Lying
description: A Rockland County jeweler who had said Friday that he was assaulted and robbed of $83,000 that investors had given him told the police yesterday that he had lied and that he had not been carrying the cash when he was beaten up.

title: Yearbook Says State Leads the Wayin Taxes, Beets, Per Capita Income and Cabbage for Sauerkraut
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13A conglomeration of facts and figures about New York State, compiled from several yearend reports issued here recently, show it to be the first of the 50 states in many things, from cabbages for sauerkraut to savings.

title: Martha Lifschultz Wed
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Jan. 13Miss Marsha Diane Lifschultz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney B. Lifschultz, was married here this afternoon at the home of her parents to Harvey Martin Abbott, son of Mrs. Otto Abbott of Cheyenne Wells, Colo., and the late Mr. Abbott. Rabbi Samuel Silver of Stamford, Conn., performed the ceremony. The bride's father is chairman of TransAir Freight System, Inc., New York, an international freight forwarder.

title: Columbia Defeats Cornell
description: Columbia outscored Cornell, 112, over the last five minutes to break open a close game and defeat the Big Red, 6859, in an Ivy League game last night in the Lions' gym.

title: Making War, Not Love
description: Senator Barry Goldwater, who sounds as if he'd still like to lob one into the men's room of the Kremlin, thinks it would be nothing short of disaster for Congress to supplant or reduce the President's war powers with some legislative procedure. And he is sick and tired, he said with his usual subtlety, of hearing demands, especially by the members of a political party whose leaders got us into this war, that President Nixon end the conflict on their terms.

title: News of the Rialto
description: ONE of the risks of playwriting, as Tennessee Williams observed not long ago, is creating a smash hit early in a career. Williams knows the pitfalls, of course. So does Arthur Miller. More recently acquainted with the burden of quick success is, Mart Crowley, who first wrote The Boys in the Band and then Remote Asylum. The latter was drubbed in Los Angeles, and the bitterness of the experience has pot yet been covered over. The plan to bring the play to New York collapsed, and when he could face a typewriter again Crowley succeeded in turning out A Breeze from the Gulf. Arthur Whitelaw, whose last hit was Butterflies Are Free, likes it and plans a New York production in March.

title: No Memoirs From Rieti
description: THERE are a handful of composers still living whose careers were given strong impetus by that master impresario Diaghilev. One is Vittorio Rieti, who makes his home in New York. He will be 75 years old on Jan. 28, and there will be some appropriate celebrations. Next Wednesday, as part of her series at Carnegie Recital Hall, Sylvia Marlowe will be joined by several colleagues in an allRieti program. Many of the works will be local premicros. On Friday, the Beaux Arts Trio will give the first performance of a work written by the composer for that ensemble, at Hunter College. And on Jan. 27, Frederic Waldman will lead the Musica Acterna Orchestra at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in the premiere of a Triple Concerto. The soloists in this will be Joseph Fuchs, violinist; Lillian Fuchs, violist, and Artur Balsam, pianist.

title: Officials Hope River Can Dissipate Major Fuel Spill
description: HELENA, Ark., Jan. 13Environmentalists hope that the rainswollen Mississippi River that thwarted their efforts to recover nearly a million gallons of spilled diesel fuel will now protect itself from the fuel.

title: Sweden Proposes Increase In Budget, Social Benefits
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 13 (AP)The Social Democratic Government, facing a general election later this year has presented $13.9billion budget with sweeping social reforms to be financed mainly by employers. This represents a budget increase of 8.5 per cent over the previous year.

title: Margherita Bailey and Michael Baldwin Betrothed
description: BEDFORD, N. Y., Jan. 13  The engagement of Miss Margherita Bailey to Michael Baldwin has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Horace Converse Bailey of Bedford and Cotuit, Mass., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Ian Baldwin of Bedford and Wareham, Mass. A March wedding is planned.

title: 400 Earn JourneymanElectrician Status Here
description: Nearly 400 apprentice electricians received journeymen cards this weekend after completing the training program of the Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry, which conducts one of the larger apprenticeship programs in the state, according to officials of the State Department of Labor.

title: Social Announcements
description: Engagements

title: Miss Hoffman Has Nuptials
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Jan. 13  Miss Susan Elizabeth Hoffman and Paul Douglas Felton were married here this afternoon in the Reformed Church by the Rev. Dr. Charles Copenhaver.

title: Solutions to Last Week's Puzzles
description: (ORIANA) FALLACI: NOTHING, AND SO BE ITI'm here to explain how hypocritical it is for the world to rejoice when a surgeon substitutes one heart for another but accepts the fact that thousands of strong people with healthy hearts are slaughtered . . . for the sake of a flag.

title: Dance: Concerto No. 2
description: There wasn't a tutu in sight as Ballet Imperial, George Balanchine's bestknown homage to the Russian classical ballet tradition, was given for the first time in a slightly changed version and with the new name of Tchaikovsky, Concerto No. 2, by the New York City Ballet Friday night.

title: Penguins Dismiss Kelly; Schiekel Is Named Coach
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 13 (AP) Leonard (Red) Kelly was dismissed today as coach of the Pittsburgh Penguins of the National Hockey League.

title: WARTIME POWERS STUDIED BY PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 13A special committee of the Senate is quietly exploring potential methods to legislate an end to the state of national emergency caused by the warnot the war in Vietnam, but the Korean War.

title: Law School At Hofstra Wins Full Recognition
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I. After perhaps the shortest probation period on record for a private institution, Hofstra University's School of Law has been fully accredited by the Association of American Law Schools. The law school opened in September, 1970, and its first class will be graduated this June.

title: ExNun, Held 5 Weeks By Bolivia, Is Freed
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Jan. 13 (AP)  Mary Elizabeth Harding, a former United States nun arrested five weeks ago and accused of guerrilla activities, was released today in the custody of the American consul.

title: The Politics of A Guaranteed Income
description: Backstage from the White House's bully pulpit is a bully blackboard, where Ivy League professors hold special tutorials for newly elected Presidents. The curriculum changes with the times. Kennedy learned the blunt methods of 20thcentury technocracy. Many disillusionments later, Nixon was schooled in the more circuitous arts of 19thcentury statecraft. Professor Kissinger explained the balance of power while Professor Moynihan elucidated the mysteries of Tory radicalism.

title: Archives Play a Lively Role in College
description: The word archives connotes a musty, murky world of dark and dreary boding, but at St. Francis College, in the Borough Hall section of Brooklyn, the archives play a living role.

title: Bridge Is Moving Closer to Reality
description: ALBANY The Long Island Sound Bridge was scheduled to take another thrust toward reality this week, moving into the vox populi stage, but a Federal District Court judge in Manhattan ruled that more paperwork was necessary.

title: Jeanne Stockman, Barnard '73, Engaged to Frank Hamilton 3d
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L.I., Jan. 13  The engagement of Miss Jeanne Elizabeth Stockman, a senior at Barnard College, to Frank Watrous Hamilton 3d has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Henry C. Stockman Jr., parents of the future bride. Her fiance, who graduated last year from the University of Pennsylvania, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Hamilton Jr. of Mendham, N.J.

title: Drug Thefts From Police Office Here Spur Tighter Security in Other Cities
description: The thefts of seized heroin and cocaine from the Police Department here have spurred authorities across the country to tighten their security procedures for such contraband.

title: JUDGE HERE URGES A UNIFIED JUDICIARY
description: Federal District Judge, Jack B. Weinstein, yesterday submitted to Governor Rockefeller and members of the Legislature a proposed state constitutional amendment calling for a unified statefinanced court system.

title: Monmouth to Get A Museum Home
description: LINCROFTAfter 10 years without a home, the Monmouth Museum will have own quarters on the campus of Brookdale Community College. Ground has been broken there in the first phase of $1.25million building program that is expected triple the museum's annual attendance of 30,000.

title: Housing
description: It was the most hostile territory imaginable for such an announcement the mammoth annual gathering of the nation's builders and their suppliers, who 56,000 strong net under the roof of the Astroworld in Houston. And George Romney, the outgoing Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, was chosen to make it.

title: Music: A Work Deferred
description: If the many kinds of advanced musical works being composed nowadays have any one thing in common, it is probably the challenge their unorthodox scoring and musical procedures offers to performers.

title: CHINESE YOUTHS GIVEN RURAL LIN
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 13Tens of thousands of young Chinese will spend the spring fes tival, the traditional Lunar New Year holiday next month, separated from their parents for the first time in their lives For many of these youngsters who range from about 14 to 17 years of age, the separation will be permanent because they have been sent to remote border regions, thousands of miles from their homes, and are expected to take root there.

title: Turks Send Home DMarks
description: ANKARA, TurkeyWorkers from Turkey have swarmed to West Germany, where they are doing well. They are doing so well, in fact, that all the money they send home is at once a blessing and an embarrassment to the Turkish Government. The problem is how to invest the workers' savings productively.

title: Chess: QueenSwapping a Decision Of Strategy, Not Morality
description: In 1937, with a candor and objectivity rare in world championsat least in their public utterancesDr. Max Euwe diagnosed the shortcomings that had led him to lose his title match with Alexander Alekhine. One principal failure the genial Dutchman conceded was in determining whether to exchange queens.

title: BEHIND AT HALF, U.C.L.A. WINS 57TH
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Jan. 13 (AP)The University of California, Los Angeles, after trailing at halftime for the first time this season, stretched its winning streak to 57 games today as Bill Walton returned to allAmerica form in the second half of a 6950 Pacific8 basketball victory over California.

title: Point of View
description: The principle of trade negotiations has been launched by the United States Administration and accepted by the European Economic Commuity. The Nixon round will differ from the Kennedy round in several respects.

title: JAMES MOODY GROUP SINGS AT HALF NOTE
description: James Moody is a round and jovial man whose saxophone and flute played bright supporting roles in Dizzy Gillespie's bands for many years. He is now leading his own quartet at the Half Note, 296 Spring Street, where along with his instrumental virtuosity he is giving scope to his humor by singing such songs as Eddie Jefferson's amusing parody on Pennies From Heaven, known in this new version as Benny's From Heaven.

title: Two Legislators Sue For Pollution Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11, (UPI)Two legislators filed suit in Federal court today to force the Environmental Protection Agency to pay New Jersey its full share of funds under the Water Pollution Control Act.

title: A Called Strike Packs Shea
description: The cars pour into Shea Stadium in Queens every daybut the game is being played 10 miles away, at Kennedy Airport. The people Shea are the wouldbe riders of the Long Island Rail Road. They use the empty parking lot, shown above, every working day. The game, that is the proper word, is the negotiation that takes place, every often, between the railroad and the striking unions at the International Hotel at Kennedy.

title: An Auction Of Coops Planned
description: An auction sale of luxury cooperative apartments, believed to be the first of its kind to be held here, has been scheduled for early next month.

title: Marie Caldwell to Wed
description: Announcement has been made here by Dr. and Mrs. John R. Caldwell of Kingsport, Tenn., of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marie Elizabeth Caldwell, to Raymond Hirschman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hyman Hirschman of New York. Miss Caldwell and her fianc are advertising copywritersshe for J. C. Penney Co., Inc., here and Mr. Hirshman for Bamherger's, Inc. of New Jersey. Dr. Caldwell is a senior research fellow with the Eastman Kodak Company.

title: Photography
description: A GAINST the somewhat premature burial accorded to still photography by Gene Thornton in this space several weeks ago (The End of a Great Era, Dec. 24, 1972) I feel compelled to counterpoise a different interpretation of the recent passing of Life magazine, if only to indicate the possibility of widely differing critical approaches within this column.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Hospitals Upgrading, Widening Service
description: MONTCLAIR  When Mountainside Hospital opened its new surgical suite last week, it became one of the few New Jersey hospitals to have an operative air curtains systems, a means of reducing to minimal level the chance of infection, particularly in difficult and prolonged surgery.

title: Dave Anderson
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 13The image of the Super Bowl game is that the head coaches, Don Shula and George Allen, have devised all the strategy and will make all the big decisions. But in reality, each is pulling only half of the puppet strings. Shula is concerned with the Miami Dolphins' offensive unit while Allen manipulates the Washington Redskins' defensive unit, creating a classic confrontation between them. But when the Dolphins' defense and the Redskins' offense are on the field, another confrontation will exist between two virtually unknown assistant coachesBill Arnsparger of the Dolphins, wearing a telephone headset as he walks the sideline, and Ted Marchibroda of the Redskins, peering down from a private booth above the audience at the Coliseum.

title: An Extraordinary Fog Envelops Accounting
description: According to Richard J. Powers, the president of Indian Head, Inc., the conglomerate he heads had a very good year in 1972. But according to his company's yearend report, earnings dropped nearly 38 per cent and the concern had a loss in the fourth quarter.

title: TRAFFIC IN OPIUM DENIED BY PEKING
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Tan. 13China has accused the Soviet press of trying to disrupt her growing friendships abroad by falsely charging that she trafficking in illegal opium tc obtain American dollars.

title: Foolproof As Well As Adaptable
description: In a recent Bulletin of the Missouri Botanical Garden, St. Louis, Barbara J. Hyde, horticulturist, stated that The essence of house plantery is selection of the right plant to suit the situation within reason. The trick is to train the plant to settle in its new environment. She selected foliage plants as foolproof and adaptable. Here they are:

title: Boston College Six Wins
description: NEWTON, Mass., Jan. 13 (AP)Richie Smith broke a 5.5 tie with a powerplay goal at 19 minutes 21 seconds of the third period and John Monahan scored into an open net 27 seconds later today as Boston College posted a 75 hockey victory over Boston University.

title: 2 WHITES ARE SLAIN IN RHODESIA AMBUSH
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 13 (Reuters)Three Government land inspectors were ambushed, two of them machinegunned to death and the third kidnapped, informed sources said here today.

title: Phase 3
description: WASHINGTONIt was 17 months ago, on a dog day of summer, that President Nixon, in a major and sudden reversal of policy, jolted the nation by imposing wage and price controls on a persistently inflationary economy. Last Thursday, while workmen shivered in the January winds erecting stands around the White House for a second Nixon inaugural, the President dropped another bombshell.

title: Eileen Stack To Be Bride
description: Miss Eileen O'Connor Stack and John Owen Hennegan plan to be married on Feb. 10. Mr. and Mrs. Maurice D. Stack of New York have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Mr. and Mrs. A. Owen Hennegan of Phoenix, Md.

title: Poland Lets Private Shops Thrive
description: WARSAWWhether it be the latest fashion from the West or a piece of pipe needed to repair the kitchen sink, if it is available anywhere in Warsaw it will be in a private shop.

title: Weathervane Is Stolen At Trotting Hall of Fame
description: The golden trottinghorse weathervane, for many years a landmark in Goshen, N.Y., has been stolen from atop the Hall of Fame of the Trotter.

title: Suffolk Is Gaining in Apartment Units
description: In Suffolk County, builders have been putting up apartment buildings at an unprecedented rate since 1965, even surpassing Nassau's total of new multifamily dwelling units. But the county remains the bastion of singlefamily home construction in the metropolitan area.

title: South African Bird Haven Periled
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Jan. 13 (Agence FrancePresse)South Africa's birdwatchers  and birds  will lose one of their favorite haunts if the Government approves plans for a major industrial port complex at Richards Bay in Natal, in the heart of the Kwazulu Bantustan.

title: The News From Paris
description: WASHINGTON  The surprising thing about the news out of Paris is that the two sides have been hung up for so long over the insertion of a few words that really make very little difference to the balance of power between North and South Vietnam.

title: Loyola School Bows To Trend and Urges Girls Enroll in Fall
description: The Loyola School here, a Jesuit institution that for 72 years had been for boys only has bowed to modern trends and will begin to admit girls next fall, the school announced last week.

title: Berrigans Fight Travel Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 13 (AP) The Revs. Phillip F. and Daniel J. Berrigan, the antiwar priests, have filed suit in United States District Court asking that the United States Parole Poard he enjoined from denying them permission to travel to Hanoi.

title: Soviet Citizens Hazy on Dtente
description: MOSCOWIn the ancient town of Khiva, one of the tourist attractions of Soviet Central Asia, a graduate student warmly told an American visitor how glad he was to hear news of the SovietAmerican trade agreement. And then, obviously unaware of huge Soviet purchases of American grain, he added quizzically:

title: Eire's Costly Import Ulster's Trouble
description: DUBLIN  The promotional claims that the Irish Republic is unaffected by the violence in Northern Ireland are running into contradictions.

title: CROPS DROP IN RAVAGED ASIA
description: SINGAPORE, Jan. 13 (Reuters)The green revolution in Asia seems about to come to an abrupt halt this year with rice crops ravaged by war, drought and floods.

title: Next Course Uncharted For Old Liner Elizabeth
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 13 (Reuters)A year has passed since the former liner Queen Elizabeth was struck by a fire in Hong Kong harbor and the future of the vessel remains in which she lies half submerged.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The fundamental soundness of our system of government was demonstrated last week. Congress, angry about the December bombing of North Vietnam, demanded an immediate ceasefire. Later, Congress extended the President's time to Jan. 20, possibly Jan. 22, with the implied threat that after that date Congress would act to end the war. However, after Congressional leaders met with the President and his advisers, the leaders appreciated the delicacy of President Nixon's negotiations pursuant to a threeandahalfyearlong plan. Congressional leaders still don't like massive bombing; neither does Mr. Nixon. Congress as of now accepts the executive's responsibility and agress:

title: Abrams to Forgo Mayoral Race; Bids Liberals Unite on Choice
description: Robert Abrams, the Bronx Borough President, said yesterday that he had decided not to run for Mayor, and he urged other liberal Democrats to unite behind a single candidate fox the party's nomination.

title: Steinkraus Voted U.S.E S.E.T. Head
description: Bill Steinkraus, who rode Snowbound to the gold medal in the 1968 Olympic Gams in Mexico City, was elected president of the United States Equestrian Team yesterday.

title: Drug Programs Is It True Nothing Works?
description: Let's be frank, Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller told the legislators, let's tell it like it is. That was the nowfamous preamble to the Governor's new formula, proclaimed on Jan. 3, for dealing with drug addiction: Lock up drug dealers and violent addicts for the rest of their natural lives.

title: Women Inmates Also Have Grievances
description: CLINTON  Barbara wears shiny nail polish in shades of black, green and red, Star of Islam earrings, sandals and a long, black cape embroidered with brightly colored threads.

title: Plush Guinness Estate in Mexico May Soon Be a Race Track
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 13  It would appear that unless Loel Guinness and the Mexican Government begin to communicate soon, a Government race track may bloom on the front lawn of the 28acre estate overlooking Acapulco Bay that the wealthy and socially prominent British banker owns.

title: Draft Is Key to Islanders' Hope
description: Now that the second half of the Islanders' National Hockey League campaign has begun, people are curious: will the Islanders improve? The answer: it doesn't matter.

title: City Dedicates a New Branch Library in Greenpoint
description: Brooklyn Borough President Sebastian Leone dedicated the new Greenpoint Librarythe 57th branch of the Brooklyn Public Library last Friday and called for a campaign to increase the lagging library circulation.

title: Council Panel Will Hold Open Session on 3 Bills
description: The City Council's Committee on Public Safety will hold an open meeting Wednesday at 11 A.M. on three bills.

title: GOVERNOR ADDS AIDE ON STATECITY TIES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 13Governor Rockefeller today announced the appointment of Roger W. Hooker Jr. of New York City as deputy secretary to the Governor.

title: Civil Service Union Penalized
description: The automatic payroll deduction of dues for the Civil Service Employes Association has been ordered suspended by the State Public Employment Relations Board, The suspension, a penalty authorized by the Taylor Law for employe organizations that violate the statute's nostrike provision, was assessed against the Civil Service group for its role in the 1972 Easter weekend work stoppage.

title: Serious writers are committed writers
description: In the turbulent spring of 1969, George Abbott White, who was writing a book on F. O. Matthiessen, was asked by the department of social relations at Harvard to teach a seminar on Politics and Literature. It was part of a freely organized course which proposed, in the spirit of the time, to tackle the problems of America from a radical perspective. That same year, in a surprise coup, small group of leftist teachers, led by Louis Kampf, captured key posts in the professionally powerful Modern Language Association of America, and set out to revolutionize literary study.

title: Satellite on Its Own
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Jan. 13 (AP) Massive radio waves from the sun will prevent controllers from communicating from Monday through Wednesday with Pioneer 10, the unmanned satellite bound for Jupiter, the Ames Research Center said yesterday.

title: Former Prostitute and Addict Tells of Long Climb From Devastated Life to Emmy Award
description: Still clad at midafternoon in her orange pajamas, Barbara Quinn sat in the living room of her Harlem apartment yesterday, staring blankly at a flickering television set. The sound was off, and that seemed appropriate.

title: Widened E.E.C. Sets Focus on Problem
description: PARIS, Jan. 14There is a growing public awareness in the European Common Market countries of economic discrimination against wornen, and, as in the United States, women are trying to do something about it.

title: OPPOSITION RISES TO AMENDMENT ON EQUAL RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14Ratification of the equal rights amendment to the Constitution no longer looks like a sure thing.

title: An American De Gaulle?
description: Politics is inseparable from ideas because an idea, no matter haw flickering or illformed, must move through the mind of a statesman before he sets himself upon a course of action. It is therefore of more than idle interestthat President Nixon seems to have patterned himself as a national leader upon that unlikely model, Charles de Gaulle.

title: Helping to Rehabilitate the Young in South Vietnam
description: VINH LONG, South VietnamVu Thi Mai is a former heroin pusher. She and her family used to peddle narcotics to the servicemen at Saigon's Tan Son Nhut air base. An attractive, sleekhaired 18yearold, Mai lived with an American construction worker and has a 10monthold daughter with fair hair and blue eyes.

title: Two Planes Land Safely One on Top of Other
description: NASHUA, N. H., Jan. 14 (AP)  Two light airplanes ended up piggyback today when one landed on top of the other while they were attempting to land.

title: 3 Letter Bombs, Mailed Locally, Sent to Israelis
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 14Israeli officials warned today of a new letterbomb terror campaign: boobytrapped letters bearing Israeli stamps and addressed in Hebrew to residents of Israel were said to be in the mails.

title: Juvenile Institute Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 (UPI) Representatives Henry P. Smith 3d, Republican of upstate New York and Thomas F. Railsback, Republican of Illinois, have introduced a bill to create an institute for continuing studies of juvenile justice.

title: NEUREUTHER FIRST IN SWISS SLALOM
description: WENGEN, Switzerland, Jan. 14 (AP)Christian Neureuther, a West German medical student, survived treacherous conditions and an incorrect judge's decision and won today the Lauberhorn special slalom ski race counting toward the World Cup.

title: Eye Laboratory Planned
description: BOSTON, Jan, 14 (AP)The Massachusetts Eye and Ear infirmary has announced plans to establish a major new research laboratory to study retinal degeneration in the eye.

title: College, School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: Wolde Wins Marathon in Africa
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 14Mamo Wolde, the 44yearold Ethiopian palace guard, passed the goat merchants on Western Avenue and trotted victoriously into the Nigerian National Stadium today to win the marathon of the second AllAfrica Games. His time was 2 hours 27 minutes 32.02 seconds for the 26 miles 385 yards.

title: Blackout Ammunition: 8,476 Unused Tickets
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 14Although the Super Bowl crowd today was recorded as 90,182, the National Football League announced that 8,476 ticketholders did not watch the game at the Coliseum. There were 8,476 noshows, an N.F.L. spokesman said.

title: CITY CUTS RENTS IN 700 BUILDINGS
description: The City Rent Commissioner announced rollbacks to 1971 rents yesterday for 14,000 rentcontrolled apartments in 700 buildings whose landlords had failed to correct violations.

title: PARUN IS VICTOR IN NEW ZEALAND
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 14 (AP)Onny Parun of New Zealand rallied from a twoset deficit and won the men's singles title today in the New Zealand open tennis championships. Evonne Goolagong of Australia swept to a straightset victory in the women's final.

title: MRS. LEO JACOBS
description: Mrs. Fanny Samrock Jacobs, widow of Dr. Leo Jacobs, a Brooklyn physician, died yesterday at her home, 60 East Eighth Street, after a long illness.

title: 6 Die in W. Virginia Fire
description: CHARLES TOWN, W. Va., Jan. 14 (AP)Six persons died early today when fire swept historic house just west of here. The blaze destroyed the interior of the brick structure, which originally was owned by a niece of George Washington.

title: Jury to Resume Today In Corona Murder Trial
description: FAIRFIELA, Calif., Jan. 14A jury of men And two women will begin its fourth day of deliberations tomorrow in the murder trial of Juan V. Corona, unaware that Mr. Corona apparently suffered his third heart attack Friday evening.

title: Divorce Insurance Gains Varied Support in State
description: The idea of divorce insurance, to be taken out immediately before or after marriage, is gaining increasing interest among, feminists, lawyers and legislators. The insurance would be used primarily to insure adequate child support in the event of a divorce, but it could also be used by childless divorced couples and, should the marriage be a lasting one, be converted to other uses.

title: MORE PRESSURE ON RATES SEEN
description: The Federal Reserve's decision to raise the discount rate may well put further upward pressure on interest rates in the money and capital markets.

title: Toothless Watchdog
description: The House Armed Services subcommittee recently concluded an investigation of the unauthorized American air strikes against North Vietnam last winter with the remarkable finding that these raids were not only proper but essential.

title: Arthur Daley Success on the Second Time Around
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 14It's cause and effect rather than coincidence, but one inescapable Super Bowl fact remains: Every team making a return visit to the Super Bowl made good on the second chance by winning. If anyone so desires, he even can count Vince Lombardi's Green Bay Packers, who started the series with two thumping victories. By taking their second game as easily as they had their first, they proved the point. It was a return visit, wasn't it?

title: N. Carolina State, U.C.L.A. Fives Stay Unbeaten
description: David Thompson, a North Carolina State sophomore, whom Fred Schaus, the Purdue coach, calls, one of the 10 best players in, the nation, pros included, enabled his team to emerge from the weekend as one of the nation's two undefeated college basketball teams. The other team, of course, is the University of California, Los Angeles, whose winning streak has grown to No. 57, three short of the national record.

title: ExPoliceman Fatally Stabbed In Times Sq Subway Station
description: A 64yearold retired policeman was stabbed to death yesterday by a 16yearold youth in an attempted robbery on the IND subway stairway at 44th Street and Eighth Avenue, the police reported. The youth was captured minutes after the incident.

title: U.S CRIME REPORT CALLS FOR REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14The National Advisory Commission on Criminal Justice Standards and Goals, in a report issued today, recommended the elimination of plea bargaining within the next five years as one of hundreds of recommendations for change in the nation's courts, police forces, corrections systems and community attitudes.

title: A.D.A. Bids Congress Delay Action on Cabinet Choices
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 (UPI)  Americans for Democratic Action asked the Senate today to refuse to confirm President Nixon's cabinet appointees until the Administration releases all funds enacted for social programs.

title: The Art of Dying: I Lets Only Talk About the Present
description: WASHINGTONI have interviewed over 500 terminally ill patients and asked them to share with us what it is like to be dying, what kind of needs, fears and fantasies those patients have. Perhaps most important, it tells what kind of things can we do:

title: Theater: Enemy Is Dead at the Bijou
COLOMBIA PLEDGES A DRUG CRACKDOWN
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Jan. 14 President Misael Pastrana Borrero has pledged to commit the necessary economic resources to combating the traffic in narcotics.

title: PATH Aims to Grow into New Cornmuter Line
description: If all goes according to plan, the Port Authority Trans Hudson (PATH) rapidtransit system will more than double in size within five years. In the process, it will change from a shorthaul conveyor of other railroad's passengers into a fullfledged commuter line.

title: Communities Merge Their Police Forces
description: Pressed by rising crime rates and by limited financial resources, small communities, cities and counties are abandoning the idea of autonomous local police departments in favor of cooperation with other police departments to improve their police services.

title: City Plans Ceremonies to Mark Martin Luther King's Birthday
description: The birthday of the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., proposed as a legal holiday in legislation still pending before Congress, will be observed here and in many other communities and major cities today.

title: Miami Wins in Bowl for Perfect Season
North Caldwell Man Dies In Accident on a Ski Slope
description: HUNTER, N.Y., Jan. 14 (UPI) Stanley Teich, 36 years old, of 52 Greene Place, North Caldwell, N.J., died today in a skiing accident at Hunter Mountain, the State Police said.

title: ALASKAN DEMOCRATS NOMINATE A NATIVE
description: ANCHORAGE, Jan. 14The Democratic party of Alaska today nominated the first Alaskan native to run for Congress.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The current strike against the Long Island Rail Road emphasizes the growing conviction that it is not in the public interest to pay unemployment insurance benefits to strikers.

title: Wallace Begins His Second Decade as a National Figure, Politically Powerful but Physically in Doubt
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Jan. 14 In the name of the greatest people that have ever trod this earth, I draw the line in the dust and toss the gauntlet before the feet of tyranny, and I say segregation now, segregation tomorrow, segregation forever.

title: Cahill Urges Program Of State Conservation
description: MORRISTOWN, Jan. 14 (AP)Governor Cahill said yesterday that New Jersey was headed for a disaster unless some statewide programs were set up to conserve energy and the environment.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: City MeatGrade Rule Opposed

title: NIXON SENDS HAIG TO SAIGON TO TALK ABOUT CEASEFIRE
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Jan. 14 President Nixon sent Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. to Saigon tonight to consult with President Nguyen Van Thieu about the Paris negotiations on a Vietnam ceasefire.

title: Congress Beginning the Difficult Task of Putting U.S. Criminal Code in Order
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 Congress has begun an attempt to rewrite the entire Federal Criminal Code, a project that encompasses a whole arsenal of explosive issues like abortion, capital punishment, gun control and obscenity.

title: Make Drug Laws Work
description: At the request of Governor Rockefeller's legal counsel, who sought independent, outside, expert advice, the State Commission to Evaluate Drug Laws assessed the chief executive's narcotic proposals with their mandatory lifeterm penalties. The commission found them to be both unworkable and unconstitutional. Mr. Rockefeller has nonetheless presented his proposals for enactment.

title: Anthem Incident Stirs Fans
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Jan: 14Once again an incident of alleged misconduct during the playing of the national anthem has marred a track meet.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: 145 Representatives Back Former Navy Contract Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 (UPI) A group of House members asked Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird today to reinstate Gordon W. Rule to his former job as supervisor of shipyard I contracts for the Navy.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Expressing fears of an energy crisis of immense proportions, William E. Ozzard, the president of the State Public Utilities Commission, has urged the Federal Government to advance the starting date of public hearings on a petition for increased supplies of natural gas in New Jersey.

title: Father, 44, Is Charged With Slaying His Son, 4
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Jan. 14 (UPI)  The father of Oscar Sierra, the 4yearold boy who was found strangled to death in an abandoned lot in Hempstead last week was arrested in an apartment house in Astoria, Queens, and was charged with murder today, the Nassau County Police reported.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: Big Song First at Suffolk
description: BOSTON, Jan. 14 (AP)Big Song won the $7,500 Celtic Handicap today at Suffolk Downs by three lengths from Francis Marion. Big Song covered the six furlongs in 1:11 15 and returned $3.80, $2.80 and $2.20. Francis Marion paid $6.60 and $3.40.

title: Records: Sacred Music
description: Mozart's sacred music has been snubbed as trivial, but that is a judgment needing good deal of qualification. Mozart lived in an age and composed in an idiom that prized grace of feeling, and a later era's failure to perceive the intensity beneath the elegance may only be exposing its own limitations.

title: OpenEnded Sentence
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J.Father Flanigan of Boys Town is alleged to have said, There is no such thing as a bad boy. Perhaps not. But reasonable facsimiles exist: teenaged boys who murder, rape, rob and assault fellow citizens, sometimes elderly people. When such boys or men are apprehended by the police, what is society to do with them?

title: Housing Orchestra Bows at Tully Hall In Varied Program,
description: The New York City Housing Authority Symphony Orchestra was formed last spring as worthy project to train musicians from the public housing community. Evidently the concerts in auditoriums and on the lawns, of the city's developments last summer were a success, for yesterday afternoon the orchestra made its formal midtown debut at Alice Tully Hall.

title: Books of The Times
description: GOD WAS HERE BUT HE LEFT EARLY. By Irwin Shaw. 268 pages. Arbor House. $7.95.

title: Fans Take to Streets
description: MIAMI, Jan. 14 (AP)The chilly air was filled with sounds of firecrackers, horns and chants of We're No. 1! as Miamians took to the streets tonight to celebrate the Dolphins' Super Bowl victory.

title: Offer to Chicago Teachers
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 14 (AP)The Chicago school board offered striking teachers a new settlement package today as negotiations resumed after a oneday break. Negotiators for the Chicago Teachers Union met to study the offer, which did not include a salary increase.

title: Village and S.L.A. Battle Over a Bar
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Jan. 14This Westchester County village is nearing the end of a twoyear court battle with the State Liquor Authority that could fundamentally change the relationship between the authority and local governments throughout the state.

title: JAMES C. MORONEY
description: James C. Moroney, a lawyer with the legal department of the Standard Oil. Company of New Jersey from 1944 to 1971 and former general counsel for Esso Exports, died Saturday in Stockholm on a business trip. He was 66 years old and lived in Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: FLEXTIME BEGINS AT A FIAT PLANT
description: ROME, Jan. 14Last Oct. 1, Italy's giant automobile maker, Fiat, began a more flexible work schedule for close to 5,000 whitecollar workers at the huge Mirafiori plant in Turin. This began the largest single European experiment with flextime thus far.

title: U.S. Jewish Chiefs To See Mrs. Meir On '73 Aid to Israel
description: American Jewish leaders have been invited by Premier Golda Meir of Israel to confer with her this month in Israel concerning her nation's economic needs and its development program for this year.

title: Scalpers Take a Beating, Tickets Go at Face Value
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 14 (AP) Scalpers apparently took beating on the Super Bowl game today.

title: The Tide of Reaction
description: The tide of reaction that is sweeping across America is more than a Republican effort to cancel out the remnants of Johnsonian egalitarianism. It is rather a break with more than forty years of an essentially liberal momentum, supported by the dominant elements in both parties, that has carried this nation forward to a more just and humane society within the framework of enlightened capitalism.

title: BOMBS IN ULSTER Kill 3 POLICEMEN
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 14Three policemen were killed and three injured by two bombs in Northern Ireland today.

title: Advertising: On Claims
description: James J. McCaffrey fell into the agency business age 21, bought into it at age 40 and will be dropping out it at age 50, just as he's been planning to do.

title: Australian to Urge Britain To Abolish Colonial Relics
description: LONDON, Jan. 14 (AP) Australia's Attorney General said today that he would urge Britain to surrender her last vestiges of authority. over his country and thus abolish continuing relics of colonialism.

title: Irish Soccer
description: Shelbourne 1, Bohemians 4.

title: Free Seats Are the Ticket to Success for a Troupe in Yugoslavia That Always Plays to SRO Crowds
description: LESKOVAC, Yugoslavia, Jan 5  A professional repertory theater in this smoky textile town in southern Serbia has achieved what many actors and directors can only dream about Eager playgoers who have broken in the main door three times in the last two seasons who occupy every seat at every performance and who crowd the wall aisles.

title: Dana J. Mintz Married
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Jan. 14At Temple Beth El here this afternoon, Miss Dana Joan Mintz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Mintz of White Plains, was married to Ira Effron, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Effron of Poughkeepsie by Rabbi Melvin Sirner. The bride's father is vice president of the Parer Transportation Company, Waterbury, Conn. Mr. Effron is vice president of ESCO Products, a bakers' supplies concern in Poughkeepsie, headed by his father.

title: Decline Reported in Some Industries
description: LONDONThere is little evidence in progress toward guaranteeing women equality in employment here since the passage of Britain's Equal Pay Act two and a half years ago.

title: Dance
description: That willful wayward force that drives people to write unreadable books and compose unlistenable music, impels tarry Richardson into choreographing visually unbearable dances. On the opening program of his weeklong season at the Eden Theater on Saturday evening, he presented one new work, Stomping Grounds, and three pieces from repertory.

title: Northeast Is Bracing Itself For Possible Energy Crisis
description: The muchtalkedabout enorgy crisis became a reality last week in some other areas of the nation, and it could still happen in the Northeast if the weather turns sharply colder.

title: Rev. Charles Van Tassel, Was Ordained at Age 60
description: BAYPORT, L.T., Jan. 14 The Rev. Charles H. Van Tassel, an Episcopal layman who was ordained in 1960 and had since served as an assistant at St. Ann's Church in Sayville, died yesterday in South Side Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 110 Oakwood Avenue.
