The haughty approach (It's boring) has longsince been suspected as evidence of a mixture of embarrassment and arousal. The gollygeewhiz style (They've gone as far as they can got) is patently untrue, while to make fun of pornography is to avoid facing the subject at all. To call it a healthy development is another vast oversimplification that refuses to acknowledge that it may be fine for some people, and quite upsetting for others.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: I AM delighted by A. D. Coleman's invitation to juxtapose differing critical approaches to photography. However, in order for controversy to exist, there must be genuine differences. And the views Mr. Coleman attributed to me in his recent column, Life May Have Died, But Photography Lives On, were not in fact my own.

title: Table Tennis Is Luring Players Across State
description: Like its moreexpansive claycourt cousin, table tennis is hitting new strides in popularity in the Garden State.

title: Holly Compton Jersey Bride
description: NEW VERNON, N. J., Jan. 20Miss Mary Holly Compton and Irvin Kooris were married here this evening at the home of Mr. and Mrs. John H. Bickford, stepfather. and mother of the bride. Dr. Barbara Raines of the Ethical Culture Society, who is director of the adult degree program at Antioch College in Columbia, Md., performed the ceremony.

title: Gardens
description: The newest type of indoor gardening is called Miniature Water Gardening. Small windowsill type gardens are planted and maintained with little care, knowledge or effort. The materials are readily available and can be put together without fuss or miss.

title: Fordham Downs St. Peter's, 10898, as Charles Scores 46 Points
description: Mr. and Mrs. Clifford Charles of Putnam Avenue in Brooklyn ventured up to the Bronx yesterday for a family day outing, along with their 9yearold daughter, Jackie, to see their son, Ken Charles, tie a school scoring record with 46 points and lead Fordham to a 10898 victory over St. Peter's at Rose Hill.

title: ANGLICANS NAME A SEMINARY HEAD
description: The Rev. Dr. W. Roland Foster, an Episcopal church historian, was chosen last week to be the ninth dean, or chief administrator, of the General Theological Seminary here.

title: Correction
description: The statement in Suzanne Ramos's article, The hardest lesson of all, Dec. 10, that one out of every 20 children loses a mother or father before the youngster is old enough to go to kindergarten, was an error, traceable to a mistake in the source book, Psychological Emergencies in Childhood, by Dr. Gilbert Kliman, which is being corrected in a forthcoming edition. In fact, one out of every 20 children loses a parent by death before entering high school.

title: Nelsen and Reeves End N.F.L. Playing Careers
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 20 (AP) Bill Nelsen, Cleveland Browns' quarterback, confirmed today that he was retiring as a player and would be looking for a coaching job in the National Football League.

title: R.E. Mahony Weds Christina Hunt
description: Miss Christina Hunt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George J. Hunt of Browns Mills, N.J., was married here yesterday afternoon to Robert Emmet Mahony, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul A. Mahony of New York. The ceremony was performed in St. Ignatius Loyola Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Bartholomew Collopy, assisted by the Rev. James Roche, cousin of the bride.

title: The Bulls of Hong Kong
description: HONG KONGWhen the representative of an American company chided his secretary for receiving too many personal telephone calls she explained that the persistent caller was her motherinlaw, who wanted her son and daughterinlaw to put money in the stock market.

title: China Turns to Technology
description: PEKINGWhen seized by the quiet desperation that sometimes besets those engaged in China trade, Western salesmen like to gather in their Peking hotel rooms and cheer each other up with stories about the peculiarities of doing business with the Chinese.

title: Environment
description: LOS ANGELESAngelenos without cars? Unthinkable. The area's commitment to the automobile was underscored back in 1968, when citizens voted down a $2.5billion bond issue for a new rail transit system.

title: New Challenges in Antitrust
description: In 1968 when the Control Data Corporation filed its private antitrust suit against the International Business Machines Corporation the move was a momentous one.

title: Space
description: Barely a month after the final Apollo moon exploration, the Soviet Union has served notice that its robot explorers intend to take up where the astronauts left off. This was the message of Lunokhod 2, the remotely controlled vehitle that last Tuesday began traversing a crater floor at the rim of the moon's Sea of Serenity. It was making tracks just 140 miles north of the TaurusLittrow valley, where the men of Apollo 17 were walking last month.

title: Navy Reenlistment Rate Up
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Jan. 20 (UPI)More sailors are reenlisting now than in the last 14 years despite scars of recent racial incidents, according to Rear Adm. Emmett H. Tidd, head of the Navy Recruiting Command. Admiral Tidd said yesterday that the racial incidents had caused the Navy to try to make itself more attractive for sailors, and added that the technique was working.

title: CHOLERA IS TAKING BIG TOLL IN AFRICA
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Jan. 20 (UPI)The African continent, already plagued by most diseases known to man, has been struck by another killer: cholera.

title: Capital Joins Urban Trend To Publicly Owned Buses
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20Control of bus service in the Washington metropolitan area, following a sevenyear trend in about 50 other American cities, is switching from private hands to public ownership.

title: Computerized Voting Pushed
description: TRENTON  Voters in some New Jersey districts may soon signify their choice of candidates by punching holes in cards.

title: Crime No Stranger to Siege Area
description: Two decades ago it was the Loew's Broadway Theater, and neighborhood residents flocked there to see the latest John Wayne adventure saga or Clark Gable romance.

title: LIBERTY STAKES WON BY GREY DAWN GIRL
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 20 (AP) A long shot, Grey Dawn Girl, took the lead on the inside leaving the stretch turn and held on for a halflength triumph in the $32,725 Heirloom Handicap at Liberty Bell today.

title: THE OPENINGS
description: FREEMANTuesday, American Place Theater, 7:30. A play by Philip Hayes Dean.

title: Wall St. Outlook Under Phase
description: A Wall Street maxim is that surprise and uncertainty are the two factors that can always be expected to unsettle the stock market.

title: WELLS CAPTURES SKI JUMP HONORS
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N.Y., Jan. 20You just have to feel your way through a wind like this, said 19yearold Burney Wells of Brattleboro. Vt., after winning the John Wictorin ski jumping tournament today.

title: The Cairo Documents
description: Not long after Gamal Abdel Nasser came to power in Cairo, he wrote that in this region, there is a role wandering aimlessly about in search of an actor to play it. The role to be filled was that of leader, not only of the Arab world, but of the African and Islamic worlds as well, and Nasser suggested Egypt as the likeliest candidate.

title: Walter Reuther
description: At a time when we confront the controversial public images of such labor leaders as Peter J. Brennan, the hardhat, George Meany, the arrogant lobbyist, and Frank Fitzsimmons, the business unionist, the appearance of this biography of Walter Reuther is a refreshing reminder of another kind of union leader.

title: Asia, One Focal Point for Soviet Foreign Aid
description: MOSCOW  Last October at the opening of the first section of the Sovietaided Bokaro steel plant in India, Prime Minister Indira Gandhi expressed thanks to Moscow for its tremendous assistance in Indian industrialization. She termed Bokaro a symbol of growing IndianSoviet friendship.

title: Guard Captain to Wed Miss. Brohard
description: CORNWALL, N. Y., Jan. 20Mr. and Mrs. Thomas W. Brohard Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Charlotte Clark Brohard, to Capt. David Lee McGinnis of the National Guard who served with the Army's Green Berets in Vietnam. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Glenn F. McGinnis, also of Cornwall.

title: Jazz: Mingus, Gillespie
description: A joint performance by Charles Mingus and Dizzy Gillespie Friday evening at Carnegie Hall, announced as their first appearance together in 20 years, proved to be a goodnatured, rather casual occasion that produced extremely good vibes but relatively bland music.

title: Washington's 3 Moods: Joy, Anger, Indifference
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20Like Gaul, this old city was divided into three parts today.

title: Kidnapped Boy Is Freed
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 20 (Reuters)Kidnappers released the 9yearold grandson of the actress Alejandra Kliment today after a ransom equivalent to $310,000 was paid. Four armed men took the boy from his home Thursday.

title: EXPLOSION IN A. CAR IN DUBLIN KILLS MAN
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 20One man was killed and one was seriously injured this afternoon by an explosion caused by a bomb in a car outside a busy betting shop in downtown Dublin. About 20 persons suffered lesser injuries.

title: Mailbox: Designated Joy
description: To the Editor: The designated pinchhitter legislation should bring great joy to Billy Martin and Detroit. With five outfielders who would be regulars on any other team in the majors, Martin can now use less ingenuity and more hitters.

title: First L. I. R. R. Patrons Get Free Ride
description: The 12:10 A.M. to Jamaica, the first regular train to operate since the Long Island Rail Road was struck by 12 unions seven weeks ago, pulled out of Pennsylvania Station on time yesterday with a tired but happy threeman crew and some 30 uncertain passengers.

title: Mrs. Webster in Final
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 20Mrs. Jerome P. Webster and Virginia Minor, both of Princeton, advanced to the final of the New Jersey State women's squash racquets championship today at the Pretty Brook Tennis Club. Mrs. Webster eliminated Tatiana Balasis of East Lansing, Mich., 155, 1015, 157, 1510, and Miss Minor defeated Mrs. Jackie Green of Yardley, Pa., 1513, 157, 1513. The two will meet in the final tomorrow morning.

title: Actuality Takes Hibiscus, Returns $40.80 at Hialeah
description: MIAMI, Jan. 20  Hialeah's racing strip has been exceptionally fast this season and it was expected that the colt who could make the lead in today's $34,500 Hibiscus Stakes was the colt who would win it. The question was which of the 10 speed horses in the field of 15 would get the lead. The answer was Actuality, and he went all the way to win at 191.

title: Joan Breuder Affianced
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J., Jan. 20Mrs. Mildred Cunneen Breuder of Olde Forge West, and Dr. Andrew B. Breuder of Whippany have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Joan Breuder to Arnold V. Klingler Jr. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs, Klingler Sr. of Chester.

title: Selective Thieves
description: WARREN, OHIO, Jan. 20 (UPI)Thieves who apparently did not like wine but had a taste for whisky stole a truck loaded with spirits last week. The police found the truck Wednesday. About 300 cases of whisky were gone, hut 600 cases of wine were intact.

title: the travele's world
description: READER takes exception to our Dec. 17 report of a hotelier's discussion of the causes and possible cures of hotel overbooking, charging us with being most sympathetic to hotel management and airlines in their use of overbooking to guantee complete sellout of facilities.thought it was an objective rather than sympathetic statement of the problem, of the contributions to its cause by both hotels and airlines and guests/ passengersdeliberate 510 per cent overbooking to protect against noshows, against double bookings by guests to protect themselves, failure of noshows to advise hotel or airline, legitimate noshows caused by weather and other travel delays, miscalculation of the 515 per cent overbooking, and dishonest desk clerks giving away rooms for cash bribes.

title: Filipino Business Endorses Marcos's Martial Law
description: MANILAA political crisis and a sequence of natural disasters severely disrupted the economy of the Philippines in 1972, slowing the rate of growth, but by the end of the year the economic climate had improved with the imposition of martial law and the enforcement of social stability.

title: Yonkers Drivers
Condominium Plan Upsets Glen Cove
description: GLEN COVE, L. I.  The backers compared it to the hanging gardens of Babylon and the opponents called it everything from a coliseum to a mausoleum.

title: The pot lobby
description: WASHINGTON. The capital's most improbable lobbyist, 29yearold Keith Stroup, was sitting at his cluttered desk beneath his Reefer Madness wall poster, sipping a Pepsi and recounting with his usual enthusiasm how he came to start NORML, the National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Law:

title: Plaintive Songs by Laurel Watson
description: Hearing Laurel Watson sing For Once in My Life at the Onliest Place, Hudson and Spring Street, with Buddy Tate's tenor saxophone murmuring softly behind her, can be an eerie experience. The plaintive, slightly grainy throatiness of her voice, caressed by the gentle warmth of the saxophone, is ever so close to the sounds that Billie Holiday and Lester Young made together.

title: After Pro Bowl Game Today at Dallas, the Next Kickoff Will Be on July 27
description: DALLAS, Jan. 20Following the Pro Bowl game here tomorrow, 197 days will pass without any more pro football, or until the Miami Dolphins meet the College AllStars in Chicago on July 27. By and large, the fans, the players, the sponsors and the television sets deserve the respite.

title: Miss Terri Timbers, Teacher, Is Engaged
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Jan. 20 Mr. and Mrs. Robert T. Timbers have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Terri Jean Timbers, to Charles McKendree, son of Dr. and Mrs. Charles G. McKendree of Greenwich. The couple plan to be married in the spring.

title: East Hampton Gets A Starring TV Role
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I.East Hampton, the 25mile long town on the southern tip of Long Island, is the subject of a television documentary that will dominate this week's fourth birthday celebration on Channel 21, the Island's nonoommercial outlet.

title: Clerical Workers Call Off Strike at Teachers College
description: Secretaries and clerks ended a strike and returned to their jobs at Teachers College at Columbia University yesterday as a sign of good faith after their union leaders received a contract offerwhich the union rejectedFriday night.

title: Elizabeth Residents Seek Funds to Assist DayCare Center
description: ELIZABETHIn 1969, a group of local women met to survey community problems in the city's black neighborhoods and to consider how they could possibly solve them. Their consensus was that a private, nonprofit, integrated daycare center was urgently needed.

title: Blizzards in England
description: LONDON, Jan. 20 (AP)Fierce blizzards hit northern England and southern Scotland today, causing the death of two youths and snarling road traffic. It was the first heavy snowfall of the season and brief flurries reach as far south as London.

title: Henry Laugier, ExU.N. Official For Social Affairs, Is Dead at 84
description: PARIS, Jan. 20Prof. Henri Laugier, former United Nations assistant secretary general in charge of social affairs, died yesterday at his Riviera residence at Cap d'Antibes. He was 84 years old.

title: McGovern Visits Museums, Ballet In Day in London
description: LONDON, Jan. 20  Senator George McGovern, the man defeated by President Nixon in last November's elections, spent Inaugural Day visiting museums here, eating lunch with some British reporters and watching ballet at the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden.

title: Linda Wall Affianced To John S. Schieffelin
description: UPPER BROOKVILLE, L. I., Jan. 20Mr. and Mrs. William Wall have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Linda Livingston Wall, to John Schuyler Schieffelin, son of Cooper Schieffelin of New York, and Bridgehampton and the late Mrs. Eleanor Lindsay Schieffelin. The wedding is planned for May 19.

title: The Old Frontier Often Seems Near On the Banks of the Habash, Far Away
description: VINCENNES, Ind.  This is a spe cial city, this old capital of till Indiana Territory on the banks of the Wabash. You know it as soon as you drive in, heading east or U.S. 50 and taking the business dir south along Illinois State Route 33 There are other roads into Vincenne. but none so appropriate as these. In Illinois, before you hit the river and the Indiana line, the land is flat and miserably Midwestern, which is to say rich in truck crops and short on houses. But on the eastern side of the Lincoln Bridge, which spans the Wabash, is Vincennes, a community of heroic statuary, rolling lawns and 18thcentury houses huddled together for protection from the Indians, the weather, the river and God.

title: Australians at a Crossroads
description: SYDNEY, Australia With a Labor Government in power for the first time in 23 years, Australia stands at a crossroads in economic directions.

title: Frank Stella: The Best And Last of His Breed?
description: NOW 36, Frank Stella has been an Old Master for years. And, though the phenomenon of the youthful maitre is a familiar one in recent American art, Stella might well be said to hold a patent on it. He made his debut in 1959 with a series of sensationally austere and dour black stripe paintings, and in subsequent years he seemed driven by volcanic ambition to invent one virtually unprecedented type of painting after another. Throughout the sixties he exercised an imperial influence on other artists and, like Andy Warhol, held a notorious place in the popular imagination, meanwhile commanding the allegiance of the most antipopular formalist critics.

title: Article 99112445 -- No Title
description: ACCORDING to usually reliable sources, the seven large charaoters in the line above are nam, ban, bi, jutsu mei, saku and ten. Contracted and translated they go Namban (Southern Barbarian) Bijutsu (Art) Meisaku (Masterpieces) Ten (Eichibition), and are followed by phonetic characters for jya, pa, n, ha u, su, gya, ra and ri. Push those, together and divide into segments as indicated and you get Jyapan Hausa Gyarari, easily recognizable as Japan House Gallery with a Japanese accent, all of which puts us into a position to get going.

title: Mrs. Nixon, Holding Bibles, Keeps Silent
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20Mrs. Richard M. Nixon held two family Bibles for her husband's inaugural oath for the fourth and final time this morninga beamingly decorative but very private figure, as she has been throughout his long public career.

title: Miss Selander Plans Nuptials
description: NORTHFIELD, Minn., Jan. 20Miss Elizabeth Anne Selander and Bern Winslow Budd, both graduates of the American Musical and Dramatic Academy in New York, plan to be married there May 19 in the Episcopal Church of the Transfiguration (Little Church Around the Corner).

title: 2 Jailed for Fake Interview
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 20 (UPI)Two land developers convicted of selling a fake interview with a hijacker called D. B. Cooper for $30,000 were sentenced yesterday to Federal prison terms. William Lewis, 33 years old, of Bremerton, Wash., was given a threeyear term and Donald S. Murphy, 49, also of Bremerton, was sentenced to two years. Cooper was the name given by a hijacker, who parachuted from a Northwest Airlines 727 with $200,000 somewhere between Seattle and Reno in November, 1971. He has never been found.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: AMERICA'S gross national product last year rose 9.7 per cent in current dollars to $1,152billion. Real growth [without inflation] was 6.5 per cent.... President Nixon suspended quotas on imports of No. 2 heating oil through April 30 and set higher crudeoil quotas for the year....

title: No Room for Loners
description: Adm. Isaac C. Kidd Jr., chief of the Navy Materiel Command, told a Senate committee the other day that the involuntary transfer of Gordon W. Rule was only lateral move, and not punitive demotion. On the chessboard of the military bureaucracy, moving a pawn laterally evidently implies that even though the unlucky figure is effectively banished from the game, he has no reason for complaint or concern.

title: Pakistan Emerges From Stagnation
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  The economy of Pakistan appears headed toward a slow recovery after a year of uncertainty.

title: HAIG SEES THIEU FOR A FINAL TALK
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Jan. 21Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. met for half an hour yesterday with President Nguyen Vari Thieu and then left Saigon for South Korea.

title: A Resident Theater Arriving In Queens
description: The ?? of George Bernard Shaw will be in abundance next weekend when a production of his Major Barbara heralds the arrival of resident professional theater in Queens.

title: M. W. Stukenberg to Wed Miss Eggert
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L.I., Jan. 20Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Joseph R. Eggert Jr. of Cold Spring Harbor and Tunbridge, Vt., of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Amanda Reed Eggert, to Michael Wesley Stukenberg, on of Mr. and Mrs. W. W. Stukenberg of Evanston, Ill.

title: Lie by Kerner Trial Witness Alleged
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 20One of the prosecution's star witnesses in the trial of former Illinois Gov. Otto Kerner suggested this week that another star witness for the prosecution had lied during her testimony.

title: Recordings
description: ONE of the music world's shakier axioms is that opera singers rarely give successful concert recitals. True, a liederabend by Franco Corelli would be a rather grotesque proposition, but there are enough exceptions to the rule to render it virtually invalid. In fact, concertgiving has often proven to be a particularly congenial occupation for both a singer in the twilight of a career and for one just getting established.

title: Miss Patricia B. Powell Is Married
description: The marriage of Miss Patricia Blassingame Powell of New. York and East Hampton, L. L, to Lewis Henderson Gordon Jr. of Princeton, N. J., took place here yesterday. morning in the chapel of the Brick Presbyterian Church. The Rev. Dr. Victor Baer performed the ceremony.

title: West German Teams Lead Europe 2Man Bobsledding
description: CERVINIA, Italy, Jan. 20 (UPI)The West German Olympic gold medal team of Wolfgang Zimmerer and Peter Utschneider posted the fastest time in today's first heat of the European bobsled championships. The second best will be held tomorrow.

title: MINING IS BANNED IN FOREST REGION
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 20 Prospecting and mining of minerals in Minnesota's Boundary Waters Canoe Area have been prohibited by a United States District Court decision that may offer a new protective shield for the nation's wilderness preserves.

title: PEARSON HAS POLE TODAY AT RIVERSIDE
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif., Jan. 20 (UPI)David Pearson of Spartanburg, S.C., will sit on the pole in the Wood Brothers 1971 Mercury tomorrow when the NASCAR Grand, National Circuit starts its season with the $100,000 Winston Western 500.

title: Calculating Diplomat At SCM
description: How do you put back together a high flyer that fell apart? a Wall Street analyst asked.

title: Bridge
description: One of the most exasperating areas for the average player concerns the covering of honors in defense. The beginner is taught to cover automatically: The king always goes on the queen, and the queen always goes on the jack. This is far from accurate. In fact, a careful count would probably show that a good player covers about 50 per cent of the time. So much for the general rule.

title: U.S.G.A. Selects Littler To Receive Jones Award
description: Gene Littler, the softspoken former United States Amateur and Open champion, has been voted the Bob Jones award for distinguished sportsmanship, which is annually presented by the United States Golf Association.

title: Koreans Hope for NorthSouth Trade
description: SEOUL, South Korea With North Korea and South Korea talking with each other for improved relations, hopes are being expressed for the start of trade and some other forms of economic exchanges between the two nations.

title: Frescoed Cave Church Discovered Near Rome
description: ROME, Jan. 20 (AP)A group of amateur spelunkers reported that they had discovered a frescoed cave church probably 13 centuries old in the mountains 19 miles east of Rome.

title: Miss Cavallo Is Bride
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 20 Miss RoseMarie Cavallo of New York and Robert Crace Ray of Weston, were married here this afternoon by Msgr. Andrew Hajus in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Patrick Cavallo of Norwalk. Mr. Ray is a son of Mrs. Chester Wyeth Ray of Weston.

title: Famine Ravages WarTorn Continent
description: HONG KONGAsia's Green Revolution, which promised a new era in food production and an end to famine forever, suffered a severe setback in 1972.

title: MRS. JOSEPH L. RIESNER
description: Mrs. Eleanor Berger Riesner, widow of Dr. Joseph L. Riesner, a dentist and former president of the Dental Health Service, died yesterday in White Plains Hospital. She lived in Hartsdale, N.Y., and New Preston, Conn.

title: PUZZLES
description: HERE AND THEREBy Bert Beaman

title: Disabled May Get FosterHome Aid
description: FRANKLIN TOWNSHIP Irene Cassady and Virginia (Ginger) Hardin are anxiously following the progress of S. 1040, anticipating that its final enactment in Trenton will make feasible the adoption of severely handicapped youngsters. In the meantime, however, they have enriched their own lives by creating a warm and happy home for three handicapped foster children.

title: There's a CopOut in The Sandbox
description: IN Up the Sandbox, Barbra Streisand plays the role of Margaret, a fantasy ridden, daydreaming housewife and mother who spends her days at the sandbox with her children,, escaping into wild mindtrips. Her husband is a history professor totally absorbed in his work, who ostensibly has no need for fantasies. They all live in an upper West Side apartment full of toys, books, pillows, art and other possessions demonstrable of the daily life well lived.

title: Favored Honey Jay Wins $15,000 Black Gold Sprint
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 20 (AP) Honey Jay, the favorite, beat Wind Gusher by a neck in the $15,000 Black Gold Handicap today at the Fair Grounds.

title: DOCUMENT ON JEWS STALLS IN VATICAN
description: ROME, Jan. 20  A document drafted by a Vatican body more than three years ago in an effort to improve relations between Roman Catholics and Jews is stalled, and chances that it will ever be adopted are considered poor.

title: Slumless Clifton Plans Carefully for Future
description: CLIFTON  Before World War II, Clifton, a Passaic County community of almost 12 square miles, was comprised of several villages and dozens of farms. Now a city of 83,000 persons, thanks to a steady postwar migration of Passaic, Bergen and Hudson County residents, the farms have been replaced by houses, roads, stores and industrial parks. We are building a city, explianed City Manager William Holster. Our land is almost 40 per cent commercial and industrial, mostly in clean industrial parks, so our tax rate stays at a healthy $2.33 for every $100

title: Back Pay for ExDiver
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP) The U.S. Court of Claims has ordered the Government to give more than three years' back pay to a former diver who was thrown out of the Navy after being accused of homosexuality. The diver, Gilbert M. Cason, had served 15 years as an enlisted man when a Field Board of Officers found him unfit for service and gave him a general discharge on May 20, 1964. The court found that the Navy had disregarded Mr. Cason's rights and its own regulations.

title: Saigon's Embassy Is Beset by Work and Worries
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The litttle peach tree in the salon of the South Vietnamese Embassy here was bright with pink blossoms yesterday and a diplomat murmured, It is a symbol of the new year, of happiness and joy.

title: Funny Film Bits Enliven Showing
description: Anyone who has ever had the urge to see Jimmy Cagney speak Yiddish in a movie (You mean you never knew he spoke Yiddish?) will have that opportunity and a lot more at a funfilled evening at the Brooklyn Academy of Music next Saturday.

title: The General
description: SAIGONAfter months of delay and bitter objection, South Vietnam's President Nguyen Van Thieu came around last week to making a profound and difficult decision: He has, according to his close aides, accepted the text of the ceasefire accord reached by Hanoi and Washington and now seeks only a few clarifications to the protocols that determine how a decade of heavy fighting is to come to an end.

title: The Poseidon Adventure's Treatment Of Women Is All Wet
description: THE POSEIDON ADVENTURE aims no higher than being a submerged Airport, a midocean The Guns of Navarone. But find it hard to cluck indulgently that Hollywood will be Hollywood and, after all, what do the clichs matter when there is all that lovely water for the characters to drown in.

title: Director Named for W.H.O.
description: GENEVA, Jan. 20The World Health Organization's executive board has nominated Dr. Halfdan T. Mahler of Denmark to head the United Nations specialized agency as director general. Ratification of the board's proposal by the W.H.O. assembly of 135 nations here in May is virtually automatic.

title: Linda L. Arnold Becomes Bride
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 20Miss Linda Louise Arnold and Bruce Barry MacMillan, who received master's degrees last month from Syracuse University, were married here this afternoon in the Congregational Church by the Rev. Charles Crawford Smith.

title: OTHER MOVIES OPENING THIS WEEK
description: THE FLAVOR OF GREEN TEA OVER RICEA film by Yasujiro Ozu, Wednesday at the Quad Cinema #3.

title: Fighting Flares Near DMZ And Northwest of Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Jan. 21 (AP)Heavy fighting was reported in two regions of South Vietnam yesterday as Government troops battled to Improve positions before a ceasefire.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: FLAMINGO, Fla.I sure hope these boards are strong, a nervous young man behind me on the elevated walkway of the Everglades National Park's Anhinga Trail repeatedly muttered to himself as we stood over a spot where three alligators basked in the sun on the edge of a pool.

title: Title Basketball Slated Here by Women's Unit
description: Tickets for the 1973 national basketball championship of the Association for Intercollegiate Athletics for Women go on sale this week at Queens College in Flushing, Queens. The tournament will take place in the college's Fitz Gerald Gym, March 22 to 24.

title: James Farmer Declares Nixon Has No Contacts With Blacks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20When he left the Federal Government two years ago, James Farmer, former civil rights leader who served as Assistant Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, refused to criticize his former boss, President Nixon.

title: Vail Strauss Betrothed
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Jan. 20Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Charles B. Strauss of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Vail Elizabeth Strauss, to John Ely Somerville Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. John Ely Somerville of Green Bay, Wis. An April 21 wedding is planned. Miss Strauss's father is executive vice president of Ferber & Strauss, Inc., advertising agency, and of Pinpoint Marketing, Inc., both in New York.

title: Bernard Hershkopf Dies; Constitutional Lawyer, 87
description: Bernard Hershkopf, who retired several years ago after morathan 55 years as a constitutional lawyer, died in his sleep yesterday at his home, 800 West End Avenue. Yesterday was his 87th birthday.

title: The Mark of a Good Breeder, And Tale of a Good Samaritan
description: The rising interest of breeders in obtaining information about their dogs from experts was demonstrated once again last Tuesday when the limit of 400 was reached for the third annual symposium of the University of Pennsylvania's Veterinary Hospital next Saturday. Although it is regrettable we must limit the attendance, said Dr. Joseph F. Skelley of the veterinary school, who is serving as chairman, we believe it necessary to maintain the effectiveness of the program, especially the questionandanswer part. The hospital staff welcomes the opportunity to become better acquainted with the breeder and to help him with some of his problems.

title: Japanese Study Nature of Boom
description: TOKYOJapan pulled out of a recession and experienced an unexpectedly high rate of economic growth in 1972. But the year also marked the beginning of what might be a significant change from the basic postWorld War II policy of economic growth first toward increasing emphasis on social welfare and improvement of the general quality of life.

title: TALK IS REPORTED BY CORONA JUROR
description: CONCORD, Calif., Jan. 20 (AP)The juror who held out longest for Juan Corona's acquittai said today that the night before she changed her vote a sheriff's matron promised to tell her things later to ease her conscience.

title: 2 More Out of Pro Bowl
description: DALLAS, Jan. 20 (UPI)Dwight White, a defensive end and Henry Davis, a middle linebacker, both Pittsburgh Steelers, replaced today Bill Stanfill and Nick Buoniconti of Miami on the American Football Conference's allstar team for the Pro Bowl tomorrow. Both Dolphin players have the flu. Mel Renfro, a Dallas Cowboy cornerback, also was hospitalized today with the flu and Coach Tom Landry said he did not know if Renfro could be ready in time to play for the National Conference.

title: LAZAR FORESEES IMPROVED TAXIS
description: The chairman of the city's Taxi and Limousine Commission said last week that taxicabs would be safer and more comfortable here within the next two months and that 1973 could bring an end to the gypsycab problem.

title: New Zealand Going Latin
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand  Britain's entry into the Common Market meant that New Zealand had to find new markets for her dairy products and meat, and she has already found some by reaching out across the South Pacific to South America.

title: Working at the foot of Babel's tower
description: Should a man who classifies himself as one of the semilanguaged try to judge and analyze translations from Greek, Hebrew, Latin, French, German, Italian and other tongues in none of which he professes mastery? Should he, having admitted his amateurism, then go on to theorize about translation itself? Or to draw broad comparisons between various languages and their literatures?

title: Art Notes
description: THE decorous, professorly group known as the College At Association will descend on us this week for its 61st annual convention, a threeday affair beginning Wednesday at the Americana Hotel. But wait! the CAA has other things in its fuddyduddy head besides Byzantine altarpieces and Carolingian ivories. Over the last few years the oncestaid agenda of the org, comprising over 6,000 college art educators throughout the country, has livened up considerably. And this year's Convention may be the most zeitgeisty to date.

title: Classroom Records
description: Generations of Americans have gone through school dogged by awesome dossiers of scholastic and personnel data most have never seen: their official school records.

title: Architects to Build Housing
description: The New York State Association of Architects has formed a development corporation to sponsor a 100unit apartment complex for the elderly in Utica, N. Y.

title: Fun for the Children
description: WINTER could be the season to introduce your child to gardening. You both will have the joy of watching the plants grow. Inexpensive materials and methods lead to success in a child's first horticultural venture. Sand, pebbles or water are adequate for most all of these projects.

title: New Hospital Practices Reflect a Need to Help Dying Patients Prepare for Death
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 20The whitehatred woman, ?? to die, paused briefly whe asked what she thought o when contemplating her own death.

title: DOUBLE RETURNS $1,860 AT BOWIE
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 20 Longshot players and holders of the 111 daily double combination came out on the long end at Bowie today. Kathy's Pet, ridden by Rene Riera Jr., took the first race for an acrosstheboard payoff of $51, $20.80 and $9.80. Different, ridden by Ralph Romaine, an apprentice, won the second race in a photo finish and paid $96.20, $35.80 and $15.

title: Joan Howard Becomes Bride In Bay State
description: STOCKBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 20  The First Congregational Church of Stockbridge was the setting this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Joan de Malleville

title: TINA CROLL OFFERS A DANCE ANTHOLOGY
description: Tina Croll's concert Friday evening at the Exchange Theater was an anthology of trends in the modern dance world that had little in the way of individual creative approach. Of the three pieces presented, Light Passage was receiving its premiere performance while the other two were from repertory.

title: The Opera
description: Teresa Kublak's impressive Metropolitan Opera debut served as the chief pinion of a gripping performance of Tchaikbvsky's Pique Dame on Thursday night, but two other singers new to the cast. also, contributed to the night's success. William Lewis, deputizing on short notice for an, indisposed Nicolai Gedda, made the villainous Gherman a credible figure, and Dominic Cossa capably portrayed his antagonist in love and cards, Prince Yeletsky.

title: Solutions to Last Week's Puzzles
F.H.A. to Sell Homes in Bulk
description: The Federal Housing Administration plans to try using bulk sales to dispose of about 800 twofamily to fourfamily homes that it has repossessed, most of them in Brooklyn.

title: Six Goals in 2d Period Help Saints Rout Nordiques, 105
description: QUEBEC CITY, Jan. 20 (UPI) Mike Antonovich scored three goals and Terry Ryan and Len Lilyholim scored twice each as the Minnesota Fighting Saints scored six times in the second period to defeat the Quebec Nordiques, 105, in a World Hockey Association game tonight.

title: QUESTIONS
description: If you have a question, or know the answer to a question asked in these columns, please send it to Garden News, The New York Times, Times Square, N.Y. 10036. We will publish questions of general interest and the practical solutions. Please enclose a stamped, selfaddressed envelope.

title: Skaling is First in Slalom, Copt of Switzerland Next
description: WATERVILLE VALLEY, N. H., Jan. 20 (AP)Jim Skating of Stratton, Me., a member of the national ski team, turned in a brilliant second run to win the seventh Corcoran Cup slalom race today. It was the second stop in the CanAm series.

title: New Round of Prague Purges Begins
description: PRAGUE, Jan. 17A new round of political purges is under Way in Czechoslovakia, involving former Communist party members who avoided expulsion by being permitted to resign pi the wake of the Prague spring of 1968.

title: Inflation: A Growing Threat
description: HONG KONGIn Jakarta, Indonesia, a housewife scolded her daughter when the child complained because she had to eat a lower grade of rice.

title: A Term For Consultation
description: Over the past fifty years American Presidents have been consistently aware that the United States has increasingly become a global force, and that this emphasized their executive power. Moreover, they saw it was necessary to summon the citizenry to help.

title: Jews against Zionism
description: On Dec. 11, 1972, the Israeli Government arrested four nativeborn Israelis for allegedly participating in an espionage ring that involved a large number of Arabs. If the Israelis are found guilty, they will be the first citizens in their country's history who practiced espionage for ideological rather than economic reasons. They were all antiZionists who wanted Israel to become a binational, socialist state.

title: USAC Elects MacDonald
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 20 (AP) Reynold C. MacDonald, a former midget auto racing driver and head of a Chicago steel company, was elected president of the United States Auto Club today. He replaces Charles T. Brockman, an Indianapolis businessman who chose not to run for a fifth term.

title: Ellsberg Trial
description: LOS ANGELES  Finally, last week, testimony in the Pentagon papers trial commenced.

title: U.S. May Relax Curbs On Use of Chitterlings
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP)The Agriculture Department has proposed a rule change that it says could make chitterlings a regular food item in the nation's supermarkets.

title: New and Recommended
description: COLLECTED POEMS OF JOHN WHEELWRIGHT, edited by Alvin H. Rosenfeld. (New Directions, $12.50.) The resurrection of a neglected American poet who produced a body of work of charm, gravity and invention.

title: A Look at The Real Jet Set
description: HE carries a Gucci, smells de Givenchy and is pencilthin. Streaking along in a scrap of silk and a few swatches of cashmere, she waves to Tru, Stash, Joe Naniath or Mark as she boards a plane for Mykonos, Majorca or, maybe,. Ibiza. Her skin is biscuitcolored from last week's sun in Mazatldn, and she moves with easy familiarity into her firstclass seat. She is a member of the jet set, and she is rich, of course, and young.

title: Athens Closes New York Institute's Branch After Protest by Greek Students
description: ATHENS, Jan. 20A branch of the New York Institute of Technology that opened in Athens this month was forced to close today when the Greek Education Ministry revoked its license following a protest by Greek students.

title: Forest Lab Gets A New Director
description: EAST MILLSTONEA new director has taken over supervision of a virgin forest here that he describes as the most heavily studied piece of land in North America.

title: National Hockey League Forging a Link to Europe
description: As early as October, a professional ice hockey league could make its debut in Europe as a prelude to eventual interlocking play with teams in the National Hockey League.

title: Japanese Investors' Wonderland
description: TOKYOOnward to 6,000 on the Dow. This seems the bull market motto of the Tokyo Stock Exchange for 1973.

title: Jakarta's Growth Causes Some Pain
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesia's capital is a city with growing pains. A businessman visiting Jakarta today finds everyday life easier in many ways than it was 10 years ago. But he still meets many frustrations.

title: County Units Checking Perishables in Stores
description: SOMERVILLETo determine whether state enforcement is needed, the length of time that perishable products remain on supermarket shelves is being monitored by county departments of weights and measures, in cooperation with the state's Department of Consumer Affairs.According to Mr. Tabler, it has been established that milk will stand up under proper handling for a period of two weeks. This gives the consumer enough time for home refrigeration, as well as the five possible standing days in the market.

title: Texan Expands Empire With Movies and Music
description: DALLAS, Jan. 21Caruth C. Byrd, at the age of 31, is a musician, frog farmer, actor, investments developer, moviemaker, cattleman and millionaire, but not the usual Texas millionaire. He would make an ideal character in a Harold Robbins novel if he did not really exist.

title: Captives Called Themselves Servants of Allah in Letter
description: The four gunmen who surrendered yesterday described themselves in a letter as servants of Allah, and there was other evidence that they were militant adherents of a form of Islam.

title: Patrolman Hart in Siege Still Serious to Critical
description: Patrolman Frank Carpentier looked at his wife standing beside the hospital bed yesterday, and tried to lift his head a little. I'm all right, he said weakly.

title: NIXON IS PRAISED AT CAPITAL RITD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Nixon marked the first full day of his second term by serving as host today for 300 inauguration workers and members of his new Administration at a White House worship service.

title: Jane Fonda and Hayden Are Married on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 21 (AP)Jane Fonda and Tom Hayden were married; the weekend in a freefornt ceremony that includod the singing of Vietnamese songs and the dancing of Irish jigs, a spokesman announced today.

title: JERSEY CITY FIRE KILLS 3, INJURES 3
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 21 (UPI)  A twoalarm fire characterized by authorities as suspicious killed three persons here today and injured three others. The police arrested a material witness.

title: Miss Elliman Sings With Getz Backup In Nightclub Bow
description: Yvonne Elliman, one of the young talents to emerge from Jesus Christ Superstar, is trying to make the transition from stage to supper club at the Rainbow Grill, where she shares the current bill with the Stan Getz quartet.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING Yonkers Raceway, Central and Yonkers Avenues, 8 P.M.

title: ZYGNUNT NAGORSKI, POLISH LEADER HERE
description: Zygmunt Nagorski, former president of the Warsaw Bar Association and of the Polish Institute of Arts and Sciences in America, died Saturday in Ossining, N.Y., where he had lived. He was 88 years old.

title: A Tip Directs the F.B.I. To Stolen Church Jewels
description: Two diamondstudded crowns and most of the other jewels insured for $100,000 that were stolen 12 days ago from a Roman Catholic church in Brooklyn were recovered by Federal Bureau of Investigation agents from a locker in the East Side Airlines Terminal yesterday afternoon.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: City Faces 37% Rise In Pension Costs

title: SHOP TALK
description: On a cold winter's day there's nothing as warm and cheery as a wood fire. In the city where apartments with fireplaces generally rent for more than comparable ones without and where the local supply of wood has long since been exhausted, this has become something of a luxury.

title: 10 I.R.S. Information Booths Opening
description: NEWARK, Jan. 18The Internal Revenue Service is opening temporary information booths in 10 shopping malls throughout New Jersey So that advice, forms and informative publications can be given to aid in the preparation of incometax returns.

title: Professor Is Elected Headmaster of Groton
description: GROTON, Mass., Jan 21The election of the Rev. Rowland J. Cox as headmaster of Groton School to succeed Paul W, Wright on his retirement on June 30, 1974, was announced yesterday by Robert H. Gardiner, president of the board of trustees.

title: Irish Up for Unbeaten U.C.L.A
description: It's scary. It's bad for the college game. They are inhuman. They are unbeatable at home. Need any more proof of their might?

title: Roxbury Carpet to Close
description: FRAMINGHAM, Mass., Jan. 21 (AP)  The 100yearold Roxbury Carpet Company, a commercial carpet manufacturer, has announced it will close March 30, a spokesman for the company said today. The closing is the result of declining revenues and will leave 374 employes without jobs, Philip de Gozaldi, vice president and general manager of the company said.

title: Better Taxi Service?
description: On both the regulatory and labor fronts, the auguries for some improvement in New York City's wretched taxi service have been made a little brighter by developments over the weekend.

title: Pennsy Case Is Like One in Bleak House
description: Though lawyers in the Penn Central case call their work unique and their problems unprecedented, there is one case, said John E. Massengale, of the law firm of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison, that bears a similarity.

title: Aid Asked for Nicaragua
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21 (AP)Governor Rockefeller issued an appeal today for New Yorkers to give food supplies for the relief of earthquake victims of Nicaragua. The Governor designated Tuesday as a day of mourning and a day of appeal for help for the survivors.

title: Police Operate Calmly and Coolly From a Storefront Headquarters in Siege Area
description: Their backs pressed close to the metal gratings of the locked stores, police commanders inched cautiously along the sidewalk below the silent tracks of the Broadway elevated line yesterday. Then they ducked inside the insurance agency office that had been commandeered as, an emergency command post near the sporting goods store where four gunmen were trapped.

title: Tel Aviv U. Honors Chagall
description: SAINT PAUL DE VENCE, France, Jan. 21 (UPI)  Marc Chagall, the artist, was awarded an honorary doctorate from Tel Aviv University today for his nearly 70 years of art work. Officials of the university presented the award to him for creating through his painting and other means of expression his dreams transcending reality ... The 85yearold painter was unable to travel to Israel for the award.

title: HORSE SHOW CROWN WON BY MRS. JONES
description: WESTON, Conn., Jan. 21Tony D'Ambrosio Jr.'s new fox chaser, Mrs. Jones, captured the maiden working hunter championship today at the Nimrod Farms Horse Show.

title: Natural Gas for Homes Is Curbed in Barcelona
description: MADRID Jan. 21  The Government announced today that starting March 31, the domestic use of natural gas in Barcelona would be halted except for those who desired it and who complied with rigorous safety norms.

title: Villagers Worrying About a Postwar Laos
description: PHA HOM, Laos, Jan. 20 A longlost son nearly managed to get home to this northern Laotian village a few weeks ago, but whatever joy his family felt at the prospect was all but extinguished by the fact that he was driving a Communist tank.

title: City Faces 37 to 39% Rise In EmployePension Cosh
description: The next city budget faces an increase of 37 to 39 per cent $299million to $317million in the cost of pension and Social Security programs for municipal employes, according to a study made public by a state commission yesterday.

title: Harvard Crimson, at 100, Draws Its Sons Back
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 21  An intense young man wearing a bow tie that clung to his neck like a huge butterfly watched with a pained expression as the crowd milled around him calling out welcomes, shaking hands or embracing.

title: Laver Subdues Stockton In W.C.T. Final at Miami
description: MIAMI, Jan. 21 (AP)Rod Laver, returning to the professional tennis tour after being disabled much of last year by back ailment, captured the $10,000 first prize today in the $50,000 Saga Bay Tennis Classic by beating young Dick Stockton 7.6, 63, 75.

title: Making Foreign Policy
description: The United States Navy's successful drive to make Athens its largest homeport in Europe provides a timely case study of how foreign policy is made in the Nixon Administration.

title: Fleming Is Winner Again In Jersey Shore Marathon
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., Jan. 21 Tom Fleming, a 21yearold senior at William Paterson College, repeated as the winner in the second annual Jersey Shore Marathon race today as he set a personal and course record of 2 hours 19 minutes 16 seconds for the 26mile385yard run from here to Sandy Hook State Park and back.

title: New President Elected By Federated Stores
description: Federated Department Stores, Inc., the nation's largest traditional department store chainwhich operates Bloomingdale's and Abraham & Straus in the New York City areaannounced the election of Harold Krensky, 60 year old, as president of the company.

title: How to Curb Inflation?
description: The nation's economy picked up speed in the final quarter of 1972, with gross national product increasing by $432 billion. That burst of production lifted output for the year as a whole by a total of $102 billionwith real G.N.P. growing by 6.5 per cent and the overall price index climbing by 3 per cent. As a result of this strong advance, unemployment has come down from 6 per cent at the end of 1971 to 5.2 per cent at the end of 1972.

title: Medicaid Ineligibles Said To Cost $40Million Here
description: Human Resources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman disclosed new city estimates yesterday that ineligibles on the Medicaid program for the poor may have been causing losses of upward of $40million per year.

title: DAVID W. GRIMM
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Jan, 21David W. Grimm, chief product design engineer for Elastic Stop Nut Division of AmeraceEsna Corporation, died Thursday in Overlook Hospital. He was 55 years old and lived in Watchung.

title: DILEMMA FACES CREDIT MARKETS
description: If Marshall McLuhan was an economist, he might describe interest rates as both the medium and the message, the instrument and subject of national credit policy.

title: Pennsy Case Is Lawyers' Dream
description: The Penn Central may not be the greatest railroad in the world, but it is a gravy train for lawyers.

title: Text of Letter by Gunmen
description: Following is the text of a twopage handwritten letter from the four gunmen who had held the hostages in the Brooklyn sports goods store:

title: MUERN WARNS OF ONEMAN RULE; EXHORTS LIBERAD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Senator George McGovern said today that liberals must help to resurrect Congress if the United States is to escape oneman rule.

title: First National Unit Recasts Its Plans For an Acquisition
description: The First National State Bancorporation, one of New Jersey's largest bank holding companies with more than $1.6billion in assets, has quietly recast the terms of its proposed acquisition of the $137million County Trust Company, Tenafly, N. J. in an exchange of shares worth $18million.

description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P. O. Box 557, New York, N. Y. 10036, or to any of the following eight organizations that certify these cases:

title: SafeCrackers Get $100,000 From Fifth Ave. Korvettes
description: Burglars using an acetylene torch broke into a walkin safe in the basement of Korvettes Fifth Avenue store Saturday night and escaped with about $100,000, according to the police.

title: PAYMENTS BALANCE SHOWS MIXED TREND
description: The United States international balance of payments improved markedly on one measure during 1972, but deteriorated slightly on another, international economists at the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company estimated yesterday.

title: Major Banks Join Share Depository And Transfer Unit
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced over the weekend that its Central Certificate Service had become a wholly owned subsidiary of the exchange and that the 11 New York Clearing House banks and three regional banks had joined.

title: The Reason Why
description: LONDON, Jan. 21If history confirms its promise, the most important sentence in President Nixon's second inaugural will have been this one:

title: Adm. Kenmore McManes Dies; Commanded Charleston Base
description: BETHESDA, Md., Jan. 21 (AP) Rear Adm. Kenmore McManes, former commandant of the Sixth Naval District and the Charleston (S. C.) Naval Base, died yesterday at his home here. He was 72 years old.

title: Dinosaur Project Many Things to Many
description: For visitors to the Hall of Early Dinosaurs on the fourth floor of the American Museum of Natural History this winter, the floodlighted exhibit area has had the look of a paleontologist's base camp.

title: Jersey Investigates Alleged Conspiracy Against Legislator
description: TRENTON, Jan. 21  State lawenforcement authorities reported today that they were investigating an alleged conspiracy to plant narcotics in the home of a Democratic New Jersey legislator and had identified aides of a Republican State Senator as prime suspects.

title: Music: Boston Symphony
description: Michael Tilson Thomas worked hard last week to shake things up Musically in New York.

title: To Coast Track Victors Belong the Smiles
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 21The satisfied people monopolized the conversation after yesterday's Sunkist indoor track meet, in which two world indoor records were set in field events and three noteworthy races were run.

title: Six Dancers
description: Six dancers who happen to be members of the Erick Hawkins Dance Company presented their own choreography Saturday night at the Kaufmann Concert Hall at the Greenhouse Dance Ensemble. They were Natalie Richthan, Nada Reagan, Lillo Way, Beverly Brown, Robert Yohn and Carol Conway.

title: A Youth Employment Service Helps Bridge Generation Gap
description: Around the Mamaroneck area, if you're between 14 and 21 and you want a job, there's a hand waiting to help you. It belongs to the Youth Employment Service of LarchmontMamaroneck, a nonprofit organization staffed by community volunteers.

title: Irish Say That U.S. Ammunition Has Floated to Shore at Cork
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 21 (UPI)Crates containing more than 1,000 bazooka shells and 500 rounds of ammunition originating in the United States have floated ashore on the coast of County Cork in the Irish Republic, the police said today. Markings on the crateswhich weighed eight tonsindicated that they had been shipped from New York to the Netherlands, the police added.

title: The Wild East
description: If the word wilderness were mentioned in a word association test, most people in the eastern United States would immediately respond with the matching word, West. It is natural to think of the towering Grand Tetons in Wyoming or the rugged Alpine beauty of Glacier National Park. It takes reflection to realize that many stretches of genuine wilderness still exist within a day's drive of the crowded cities of the East.

title: HANNAH LEES DEAD; NOVELIST WAS 68
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 21Mrs. Elizabeth Head Fetter, who as Hannah Lees was the author of seven books and many magazine articles and stories, died today at her home. Her age was 68. In private life she was the wife of Dr. Ferdinand Fetter, a physician.

title: Eason and Devon Purchase
description: The Eason Oil Company and the Devon Corporation, both of Oklahoma City, announced yesterday agreement to purchase jointly the properties of four oil and gas producers for $22.9million in cash. The properties include interests in a gas processing plant in Louisiana, pipeline facilities in Louisiana and West Virginia, more than 500 oil and gas wells, 640,000 acres of undeveloped leases and timber lands in Louisiana.

title: State Financing Schemes Are Questioned by Levitt
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21Controller Arthur Levitt said today that the state was committed to lohgterm capitalconstruction financing schemes totaling $5.6billion that were in derogation of the right of the people to vote upon indebtedness of the State of New York.

title: Dance: Great Companies

title: Opposition to the Adirondacks Plan for Private Land Is Mounting
description: LAKE SARANAC, N. Y., Jan. 21Opposition to the Adirondack Park Agency's draft plan for the private land within the park is mounting not only among Adirondack residents and state legislators' but even within the agency itself, which up to now has maintained an appearance of unanimity.

title: Brendel Performs 3 Works for Piano In Carnegie Series
description: Few pianists define music with such specific clarity as Alfred Brendel, and the crystalline purity of his playing at Carnegie Hall yesterday afternoon, the first of three Beethoven, Schubert, Liszt recitals, was paramount in each interpretation.

title: Aaron Schneider, ExOfficer Of Union, Insurance Adviser
description: Aaron D. Schneider, a former regional director of the United Office and Professional Workers of America who later became an insurance executive, died Saturday in Memorial Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 377 South Harrison Street, East Orange, N. J.

title: SUSPENSE IS CUT FOR IYY HOPEFULS
description: The eight Ivy League college and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology announced yes terday a new joint policy de signed to give applicants for admission a much earlier idea than they now get of their chances of being accepted.

title: Barry Injured as Warriors Lose to Bucks, 124 to 108
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 21 (UPI)  The Milwaukee Bucks, sparked by a thirdquarter surge led by Lucius Allen, beat the Golden State Warriors, 124108, today in a National Basketball Association game.

description: Dr. Norbert Sander, from City Island, raced to an easy victory over 104 other competitors yesterday in a 12mile run around Central Park. The race, sponsored by the Road Runners Club of New York, was two laps around the perimeter of the park. Sander, who finished 800 yards ahead of Jim Schindler, was timed in 1 hour 2 minutes 53.8 seconds.

description: SPARROWS POINT, Md., Jan. 21Racial friction is mounting at the huge Bethlehem Steel Corporation plant here.

title: Couple Find Marriage a Good Investment
description: In 1955, when Ida Blackman was a copywriter at Young & Rubicam, she decided to make her first investment in the stock market. Her broker, as it turned out, was Robert S. Gordon.

title: LUIS LEGUIA OFFERS SOLO CELLO RECITAL
description: Two years ago, Luis Legufa made an impressive debut here in a cello recital accompanied by Robert Freeman, pianist. On Saturday afternoon, the Boston Symphony cellist was back in New York, playing in Carnegie Recital Hall and tackling something more difficult, a program for cello alone.

title: Saigon Forces Attacked In Effort to Free P.O.W.'s
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Jan. 22 (AP)South Vietnamese forces made two attempts yesterday to recover wounded soldiers held prisoner by the Vietcong 40 miles northwest of Saigon but were attacked both times, senior officials disclosed today. Twenty of the wounded soldiers were recovered, the officials said, but 10 others were killed and 26 were wounded.

title: Killer Who Aided Guards In Jail Riot Gets Parole
description: LEESBURG, Jan. 21Clarence L. Smith, a convicted murderer who aided guards and police during the riot at Rahway State Prison in 1971, is scheduled to be paroled in April, his attorney said today.

title: Hostage Who Led Escape Is Termed Resourceful
description: As the standoff at John & Al Sports, Inc., dragged on yesterdaywith the police outside and the four gunmen and their nine hostages insideMrs. Lillian Spielberger, the 70yearold widow who owns the building, worried out loud that Jerry Riccio, one of the store's managers and one of the hostages, might provoke something.

title: ELLSBERG JUDGE OFFERS HIS VIEW
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 21 There were the opening statements to the jury in the Pentagon papers case, and there was, for two days, a general in the witness chair. There were even slides projected on two screens in the courtroom.

title: Peru Releases U.S. Boat
description: LIMA, Peru, Jan. 21 (Reuters) The American fishing boat Apollo was released by the Peruvian Navy today after her skipper paid nearly $100,000 in fines and compulsory license fees, navy sources said. The Apollo, registered in California, was stopped yesterday within the 200mile limit that Peru claims and escorted to port. The craft was the 20th boat from the United States to he halted within a week.

title: Shades of 1967
description: When some kind of peace is finally established in Southeast Asia, diplomats will not be at a loss for problems to occupy their energies. That other perennial trouble spotthe Middle Easthas been warming up again in a manner ominously reminiscent of early 1967.

title: Court Tennis Title to Scot
description: BOSTON, Jan. 21Gene Scott, former Davis Cup tennis player, won the national oper court tennis championship to day by defeating Bob McDon ald in an allNew York final 64, 62, 36, 63, at the Bostor Racquet and Tennis Club. Scot ran out the match from 33 it the fourth set, getting the clincher with a forceful drive into the rear grille.

title: Church That Sees Insurance as Sin Finds State NoFault Law a Liability
description: MENDHAM, Jan. 21  A collision between a small religious group and New Jersey's new nofault auto insurance law has stalled the cars of 150 members of the group.

title: Government by Colonel

There has been little discussion of the causes and implications of the coup or of the policies of the new regime. It is one of Washington's stanchest allies in the Andean area.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. conferred with President Nixon and Henry A. Kissinger today shortly after returning from Saigon, where he sought approval of the agreement being drawn up by the United States and North Vietnam to end the Vietnam war.

title: Siege Jars Routine of Residents

description: Bluegrass music can be flashy, highdriving affair, and Del McCoury and the Dixie Pals, who appeared yesterday at the New York University Law School, have their share of effective uptempo numbers. But they and the opening act, the Pine Hill Ramblers, seemed more at home at mellower, comfortable musicmaking, and managed to provide a most pleasant afternoon.

description: RIVERSIDE, Calif., Jan. 21, (AP)Mark Donohue, the 1972 Indianapolis winner, stunned the stockcar racing set today by driving an underpowered American Motors Matador to an impressive victory in the $100,000 Winston Western 500 at Riverside International Raceway.

title: Bridge: Close Finishes Are Recorded In Grand National Matches
description: Three of the eight Grand National matches played Saturday at the New York Hilton provided desperately close finishes. The fifthseeded group headed by Alvin Roth was made to fight all the way, and won by 5 international match points against a young group headed by Saul Bronstein.

description: The four gunmen who surrendered yesterday described themselves in a letter as servants of Allah, and there was other evidence that they were militant adherents of a form of Islam.

title: TIME REPORTS HUNT OFFERED MONEY TO 4
description: Time magazine reported yesterday that it had learned that E. Howard Hunt Jr. talked four other Watergate defendants into pleading guilty and offered them $1,000 a month apiece for each month they spent in jail, the Associated Press reported. Hunt could not be reached for comment yesterday.

description: Schumann's Symphonic Etudes was the meatiest work in Misha Dichter's recital at Hunter College on Saturday night, and in his performance the pianist gave evidence of increased maturity as an artist.

description: The New York City mayor must not be weakened. This year New Yorkers will consider charter revision and vote for the city's chief executive. Many of those who want to emasculate the, office of the mayor are suffering from Lindsayphobia. Despite near universal agreement concerning John Lindsay's ineptitude, we must not overreact to our unhappy experience since 1965.

description: MOSCOW, Jan. 21Glowing accounts of the achievements of model farms and factories are a staple of the Soviet press, frequently giving rise to skepticism among readers.

description: MEGEVE, France, Jan. 21 (AP)Christian Neureuther, West German medical student, won today his second straight World Cup special slalom.

title: 'Under Milk Wood'Arrives on Screen
description: "Under Milk Wood" is the kind of film project that carries failure within it almost proudly, as if to be overwhelmed by literacy were a mark of distinction, even though a fatal one.Dylan Thomas, the Welsh poet who died in 1953, originally conceived, "Under Milk Wood" as a radio play, a poetic, plotless memory of life in a tiny Welsh seaport that is evoked through narration and short, occasionally brilliant gusts of comedy, drama and dreams.Although he originally thought of it as something to be listened to, or read, Thomas went on to adapt the play for the stage where, however, it's never quite as satisfactory as many people think it should be, apparently reasoning that the stage needs words and these Thomas provides  by the bushel basket.Too many words, perhaps, for the stage. Too many words, I'm convinced, for the screen. It's not simply the quantity of words, though. It's also their ornateness. They overflow the ears and get into the eyes. Great clouds of them everywhere, like swarms of big soft gnats. They won't stop, and they make the job of the film adapter almost impossible.This business of finding screen images to match those in Thomas's text can be, at best, redundant. At worst, banal, misleading or wrong. "To begin at the beginning," says the First Voice (Richard, Burton), a sort of composite narrator, guide and angel of death who conducts our tour of Llareggub, "it is spring, moonless night in the small town. . . . " What we see, however, is night so awash in moonlight that we could, if we wanted, read the small type that guarantees a vacuum cleaner for a year.A little later he continues: "It is night, dumbly, royally winding through the Coronation Street cherry trees, going through the graveyard of Bethesda with winds gloved and folded, and dew doffed. . . ." Can any ordinary screen images equal those? Not easily.When Burton urges us, the members of the audience, to look into "the blinded bedrooms" to see "the glasses of teeth, Thou Shalt Not on the wall, and the yellowing dickeybird-watching pictures of the dead," there's not much for the camera to do but to try desperately to keep up with the languagebut the language wins.Some of the dozens of characters we meet do come fitfully alive: Mrs. Pugh (Vivien Merchant), a dainty, purse-lipped, dry-fingered bitch whose husband (Talfryn Thomas) meekly fetches her breakfast and dreams of putting ground glass into her omelette; Mrs. Ogmore-Pritchard (Sian Phillips), who sleeps with the ghosts of her two husbands and fears strangers breathing all over her chairs; Polly Garter (Ann Beach), the town's gentle-spirited whore who can't Help having babies because she loves them.Less successful, perhaps because he has to handle so many words, is Peter O'Toole, ordinarily a fine actor, as the old, blind Captain Cat. O'Toole's readings are so perfectly rhythmical, his wind so magnificently controlled for long eruptions of words without pause, that he almost put me to sleep.Whenever sleep threatens, however, there is the spectacle of Elizabeth Taylor, a wonder to behold though she doesn't seem directly connected to Wales. She does a short, sort of lie-in, as opposed to walk-on, as Rosie Probert, the whore out of Captain Cat's youth who now is buried in the Llareggub graveyard. "I've forgotten that I was ever born," she tells us toward the end in a lovely Thomas line that recalls the greater simplicity and economy of Thornton Wilder's "Our Town."Burton's readings are fine, especially when you close your eyes. Nothing that Andrew Sinclair, the director, chooses to show us does more than complement the text, which often means literalizing it, making it seem smaller, less mysterious, more postcard-picturesque than need be. When Burton tells us that we can hear the dew falling, I had a small panic that Sinclair would show us even that, though he doesn't.Gone is any sense of discovery of language, which, when Thomas was working well, could make one feel very young again, almost drunk with surprise and pleasure. The problem is all those pictures. In a way, Thomas did to words what booze did to him. He shook them up, liberated them, twisted them around so that they took on, if only momentarily, a higher order of meaning. The camera has the presence of a sober-sided friend. It interrupts most of the poet's flights of fancy."Under Milk Wood" opened yesterday at the new East Side Cinema, on Third Avenue near 56th Street.

title: 21 THEATERS HERE TO GET TITLE BOUT
description: There are 21 greater New York locations at which the closedcircuit showing of the Joe FrazierGeorge Foreman world heavyweight title fight can be seen tonight from Kingston, Jamaica.

title: DR. LORENZ BOHLER, BONE SURGEON, DIES
description: VIENNA, Jan. 21 (AP)Dr. Lorenz Bhler, who won acclaim for his method of healing bone fractures and lacerated muscles suffered in wars or accidents, died yesterday in the hospital that bore his name. He had celebrated his 88th birthday six days ago.

title: A.F.C. Wins as Simpson Stars
description: IRVING, Tex., Jan. 21O. J. Simpson was the star of stars in the Pro Bowl game, won by the American Conference over the National, 3328, today in Texas Stadium before an indifferent crowd of 47,879. Showing his greatness as a runner with extraordinary balance and speed, Simpson gained 170 yards, 112 by rushing and 58 on receptions, and scored one touchdown.

title: Key AntiPortuguese Leader In West Africa Is Assassinated
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Jan. 21Amilcar Cabral, one of the most prominent leaders of the African struggle against white supremacy, was assassinated last night in front of his home in Conakry, the capital of Guinea.

title: Jane Friedman Bride of A. D. Jesselson
description: Miss Jane Elizabeth Friedman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ludwig Friedman of Forest Hills, Queens, was married here yesterday afternoon to A. Daniel Jesselson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ludwig Jesselson of Riverdale, the Bronx.

description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 21The satisfied people monopolized the conversation after yesterday's Sunkist indoor track meet, in which two world indoor records were set in field events and three noteworthy races were run.

description: DULUTH, Minn.We say no industry achieves excellence in employment practices if it does not fulfill its responsibility, its obligation, to help the people who make its business possible. Not only the people who work for the company, but the people who buy what it produces.

title: Rule by the Durable
description: After several postponements which gave antireform elements a chance to build up their strength, the Democratic caucus in the House of Representatives will try again today to make some badly needed changes. First among these, and indispensable if the House is ever to be brought abreast of the times, is the end of the automatic seniority system.

title: S. E. C. Confirms A Routine Study Of Fairchild Trade
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission confirmed yesterday that as a matter of routine it would investigate trading in the shares of Fairchild Industries, Inc., on the New York Stock Exchange last week.

title: CHAPARRALS TOP NETS, 105 TO 98
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Jan. 21  The Dallas Chaparrals' unusual experiment with a 6foot8inch guard didn't work the way they had hoped today but the visitors still captured their first road game since Dec. 2 with a 10598 decision over the Nets.

title: ACCOUNTING CODE SET FOR REVISION
description: The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants announced yesterday that its members had approved, by a 93 per cent vote, the first complete overhaul in more than 50 years of the code of ethics that governs the nation's 90,000 public accountants.

title: Leaders Decide New Zealand And Australia Stay in SEATO
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Jan. 21Australia and New Zealand have decided to stay in the Southeast Asia Treaty Organization despite their Governments' strong reservations concerning the military nature of the pact.

title: VERMONTER WINS AT BEAR MOUNTAIN
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N.Y., Jan. 21Bernie Wells soared from the 50meter skijumping slope today with the longest leap of the season. He covered 161 feet in the jumpoff to win the Mount Beacon Ski Club tournament.

title: Msgr. Joseph Connolly Is Dead; Active for Puerto Ricans Here
description: Msgr. Joseph F. Connolly, who played an important role in the Puerto Rican community here as the first coordinator for Spanish Catholic Action of the Archdiocese of New York, died Saturday in Staten Island. In recent years he had been the Roman Catholic chaplain at Kingston (N.Y) Hospital, with similar duties at the Benedictine home for senior citizens there. He was 64 years old.

title: Baseball Found Regaining Popularity
description: Football is still America's vorite spectator sport, but ball is regaining fan interest after sliding badly during the nineteensixties, according to the results of a Gallup poll released yesterday.

title: Records: Fresh Lakme
description: One of the less pressing questions of our time is: Can Leo Delibes's Lakme survive without Lily Pons's navel? The answer, insofar as the Metropolitan Opera is concerned, appears to be no. The Met has always been a star house, and no soprano seems to be able or willing to appear onstage these days as Delibes's simperingly sexy little lovegoddess. But Lakme lives on nonetheless, in such temples of French operatic style as the Paris OperaComique, and a new recording of the piece (Seraphim SIC6082, 3 disks, $8.94) has arrived to document that style.

title: Belgians Agree on Cabinet
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 21 (Reuters)  Belgium's three main political parties today agreed to form a coalition cabinet led by Premierdesignate Edmond Leburton, ending a twomonth government crisis. The parties are his Socialists, the Social Christians and the Liberals.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Nixon Administration claims that network television news programs lack diversity in the coverage and opinions they present to the viewing public. Assuming this criticism to be valid, the solution should not be the Administration's proposed censorship of network news programs by local stations, but rather the creation of more balancing news by the Administration. A restoration of frequent Presidential press conferences, more public appearances by the President and his key associates, and continuation of the usual personal presentation of the State of the Union message by the President are steps that could be taken to create news that is certain to receive network coverage.

title: Air Force Doctors Said to Take Part In Indochina Raids
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Two military physicians have charged that some of their medical colleagues have actively participated in dozens of bombing raids over Southeast Asia, in violation of international law, military regulations and the Hippocratic oath.

title: 200 Help to Stem Oil Slick In San Francisco Bay Area
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 21 (UPI)More than 200 environmentalists and volunteers, aided by floating searchlights, worked through the night yesterday and early today to stem the spread of 50,000 gallons of oil spilled by vandals into an arm of San Francisco Bay.

title: A Belated Tribute to John Cage at 60
description: There are two John Cages, at very least, and both were well represented at a retrospective concert of his music yesterday afternoon at Alice Tully Hall. In a welcoirie though belated observance of the composer's birthday (he was 60 last September), Dennis Russell Davies conducted The Ensemble in four works ranging from 1938 to 1972, as part of Lincoln Center's New and Newer Music series.

title: Guide GOING OUT
