description: ATHENS, Jan. 23  Alexander Onassis, the 24yearold only son of Aristotle Onassis, the multimillionaire, died in hospital here of a brain hemorrhage tonight, 27 hours after his plane crashed at the Athens airport.

title: S.B.C. STEP ASKED ON INVESTOR DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 The Securities and Exchange Commission made public today a proposal by one of its advisory committees that persons offering investment advisory services to small investors be exempted, if they meet certain tests, from the type of Government regulation applied to investment companies.

title: MITCHELL LINKED TO $199,000 FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23A witness said today that $199,000 was paid to a defendant in the Watergate trial during last year's campaign with the approval of former Attorney General John N. Mitchell and former Commerce Secretary Maurice H. Stans.

title: Bridge: Some Cases Where Teams Press Too Hard in Bidding
description: At the end of a long match in which the result is likely to be close, there is a strong temptation to press rather too hard in the bidding. On the diagramed deal, which contributed to the ousting of a favored team from the Grand National contest Sunday, both teams reached optimistic game contracts, but with very different results.

title: H. D. A. to Cancel Contract With Management Group
description: The Housing and Development Administration will cancel its contract with the City Urban Renewal Management Corporation, which has been managing cityowned buildings on 41 urbanrenewal sites since 1962.

title: Public TV Seeks NonU.S. Financing
description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting's recently announced intention of taking) over programing decisions from its distribution arm, the Public Broadcasting Service, has led to efforts on both regional and national levels to create public TV hookup financed without Federal funds.

title: Biologist Calls Criticism Malicious
description: A California space biologist contended in Federal Court here yesterday that a maliciously false report of his animal experiments caused professional associates to ask hostile questions reflecting on his integrity.

title: Rift Develops Over the Tony Awards
description: Talks have broken off between the American Theater Wing and the League of New York Theaters over the future of the annual Tony awardsceremony and show, which is nationally televised.

title: Gentle Revolutionary
description: By dint of intelligence, industry and luck, Amilcar Cabral became one of a handful of young Africans sent off to Lisbon for university training by the white rulers of Portuguese Guinea. As a graduate agronomist he could have settled comfortably into the colonial service to be exhibited to outsidersby his superiors as a successful assimiladoproof that color was no bar advancement under enlightened Portuguese rule.

title: Phase 3: Fast Test
description: The moment of truth for the Pay Board in Phase 2 of the Administration's antiinflation program came last March when it tackled an agreement that would have given West Coast longshoremen wage increases nearly five times the basic 5.5 per cent guidepost.

title: Alitalia Will Cut Its Fares To U.S. in Tourist Class
description: ROME, Jan. 23 (AP)Italy's international airline, Alitalia, has announced reductions of up to 30 per cent in touristclass fares for flights between Italy and the United States or Canada. They will take effect April 1.

title: House Democrats Pick Chairmen: Seniority Wins
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23Despite their newly won right to challenge the seniority system, House Democrats chose committee chairmen today exactly as they had in the pastby seniority.

title: JOHNSON ENDURED SERIOUS ILLNESSES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 Lyndon B. Johnson was a man of immense energy and vitality whose career was punctuated, but hardly slowed, by several serious medical problems.

title: Wildwood's Boardwalk to Use Inaugural ParadeStand Wood
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (UPI) The lumber used to construct the Presidential reviewing stand and adjacent areas for the inaugural parade will be sold to Wildwood, N. J., to rebuild the resort's boardwalk.

title: State College Heads Face Evaluation of Performance
description: Presidents of the 29 colleges Operated by the State UniverSity will be appointed to terms limited to five years and would face intensive evaluation of their performances, under a new policy expected to be adopted today.

title: Presidential Proclamation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23Following is the text of a proclamation by President Nixon today on the death of former President Lyndon Baines Johnson:

title: 3 Ulster Housewives Begin Duty as Police Reservists
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 23 (AP)Women police reservists went on duty in Northern Ireland for the first time today, the vanguard of what authorities hope will be a task force of housewife cops.

title: Parlay Is Coming to OTB With Arrival of AmTote
description: The selection of American Totalisator as winner of the offtrack computer sweepstakes here will mean faster, more reliable and varied service for the $2 horseplayer, the Offtrack Betting Corporation said yesterday.

title: Builder Terms Payoffs A Way of Life in State
description: NEWARK, Jan. 23  The chairman of a major construction company testified today that payoffs to public officials for their help in obtaining government contracts were a way of life in New Jersey. He said the practice had been prevalent for decades.

title: Men in the News: Negotiators of Paris CeaseFire Agreement for Vietnam
description: Whatever triumph and tragedy there will be in the settlement between the contending parties in Vietnam, they belong, ultimately and properly, to President Nixon and to the leaders in Hanoi and Saigon.

title: RANGERS, BRUINS BATTLE TONIGHT
description: In a dramatic homecoming and schedulemaker's dream, the Rangers will be back in Madison Square Garden tonight and face their longtime tormentors, the Boston Bruins.

title: Johnson Service at City Hall
description: A memorial service for former President Lyndon B. Johnson will be held on the steps of City Hall at 12:15 P.M. today. With Mayor Lindsay and other city officials at the service will be the Apollo 17 crew, Capt. Eugene Cernan and Capt. Ronald E. Evans of the Navy and Dr. Harrison H. Schmitt.

title: Willowbrook Patient Care By State Termed Derelict
description: A State Supreme Court justice ruled that the state had been derelict in providing adequate care and treatment for resident of Willowbrook State School on Staten Island.

title: GOING OUT Guider
description: SOUTHERN STYLE The Yugoslays are the southernmost Slavic people, and their latitude makes their culture and dance somewhat different from their northern relatives. That's what makes LADO, the Yugoslav National Dance and Folk Ensemble, out of Belgrade, different from the Polish, Ukrainian, Czechoslovak, Russian and other Slavic troupes. At any rate, the company will be showing what it does tonight only, at 8 in the Hunter College Assembly Hall, 68th Street at Park Avenue (5355350).

title: ASPIN QUESTIONS ASH'S STOCK SALE
description: Roy L., Ash, former president of Litton Industries, Inc. sold more than 85,000 shares of Litton stock for about $2.5million during a period when its prospects were apparently being enhanced by awards of $3billion in shipbuilding contracts, Representative Les Aspin said yesterday.

title: Vatican's Radio Criticizes Abortion Ruling by Court
description: ROME, Jan. 23  The Vatican radio harshly criticized today the United States Supreme Court's decision that sharply limited antiabortion laws yesterday.

title: Synthesized Music By Behrman Offers Beguiling Sounds
description: David Behrman's concert of synthesized music Monday night at the Kitchen was perhaps more successful for sound than for form, but at its best the sounds were so nice that, just this once at least, one was willing simply to let them flow by.

title: Foreman Says He'll Fight Ali, but Ali Must Challenge Me First
description: A George Foreman defense of his new heavyweight championship against Muhammad Ali was the No. I topic on fight tans' lips and in promoters' dreams yesterday, but that encounter isn't very likely to be the next attraction on your neighborhood closedcircuit television screen.

title: Slayer Sentenced to Death
description: PROVO, Utah, Jan. 23 (AP)A Provo man was sentenced today to death by shooting for his firstdegree murder conviction in the slaying of two teenage sistersinlaw last summer. District Court Judge George. E. Ballif sentenced James Walter Winkle, 31 years old. It was not known how the sentence would be affected by last year's Supreme Court ruling that the death penalty as exercised in this country is unconstitutional.

title: Books of The Times
description: AMERICAN MISCHIEF. By Alan Lelchuk. 501 pages. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $8.95.

title: HIGHER EARNINGS POSTED BY EXXON
description: Higher profits were reported yesterday for both the final quarter and full year of 1972 by the Exxon Corporation, for, merly the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey); the Standard Oil Company (Ohio), and the Cities Service Company.

title: Strike by Pilots for the C.I.A. In Laos Is Reportedly Averted
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 23A strike by airline pilots in Laos that would have severely impaired support of antiCommunist forces fighting there has apparently been averted.

title: Agriculture Department Bars Commodity Firm
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (Reuters)The Department of Agriculture issued an order today prohibiting Arthur N. Economou and the New York firm bearing his name from trading on regulated commodity exchanges for 90 days.

title: Pathet Lao Says U.S. Sees Thailand as a Springboard
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 23The Communist, delegation to the Laos peace talks today issued its strongest condemnation so far of the United States role in Laos, charging that President Nixon intends to continue using neighboring Thailand as a springboard for aggression throughout Indochina.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 43

title: Forest Products Gain
description: An earnings rebound from depressed 1971 levels was made last year by four major forest products companies whose reports came out yesterday. The GeorgiaPacific Corporation and the KimberlyClark Corporation set records in their 1972 results, while sharp increases were made by Champion International and Crown Zellerbach. Fourthquarter results contributed to the gains.

title: Late Rally Reduces Losses in Stocks
description: A late rally pared stockmarket losses yesterday as volume increased on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: 29 Said to Survive In Nigerian Crash; Toll Stays at 180
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 23Government sources reported today that 29 people survived the crash of a chartered jetliner in northern Nigeria yesterday as it was carrying Nigerian Moslems home from a pilgrimage to Mecca.

title: New Electronic Vote System Brings Forth Cheers in House
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23Like a roomful of children with a new mechanical toy, the members of the House of Representatives used their new electronic voting system for the first time today.

title: End of a Nightmare
description: The Vietnam agreement announced by President Nixon last night after more than four years of false starts and disappointed hopes could mark a momentous turning point for the United States, for Southeast Asia and for the world. If it does not guarantee peace, this historic pact at least provides the framework and opportunity for a new era of compromise and conciliation in Vietnam and elsewhere. In the President's words, ending the war is only the first step toward building the peace.

title: Nations' Economic Might: New Concept Is Emerging
description: Historical eras are marked off by changes in concepts. The period of colonial expansion of the great European powers was a quest for wealthdefined as, gold and treasure. The end of that era was marked in 1776 by Adam Smith's Wealth of Nations, in which he defined wealth not as precious metals but as the ability of the people of nation to produce useful goods and services.

title: TROOPS TO LEAVE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23President Nixon said tonight that Henry A. Kissinger and North Vietnam's chief negotiator, Le Duc Tho, had initialed an agreement in Paris today, to end the war and bring peace with honor in Vietnam and Southeast Asia.

title: ALL SCHOOLS SHUT IN ST. LOUIS STRIKE
description: ST. LOUIS. Jan. 23. (AP)The St. Louis Board of Education ordered all public schols closed until further notice tonight after the second day of a teacher strike.

title: Brandt Ends Pompidou Talks Optimistic on U.S.Market Ties
description: PARIS, Jan. 23Chancellor Willy Brandt and two of his principal ministers said today after two days of conversations with President Pompidou and members of his Government that France had moved close to the West German view on the need for close relations with the United States.

title: Engineering Concern Linked to Payoffs Enjoys Big Business in State Contracts
description: TRENTON, Jan. 23A New York engineering concern whose officials were accused by Federal grand juries of paying off New Jersey officials in return for contracts is still doing a handsome business with state agenciesincluding the New Jersey Sports Author. ity, which awarded it a $10million contract.

title: People and Business
description: Arnold R. Weber, the first executive director of the Cost of Living Council, has been named dean of the Graduate School of Industrial Administration of CarnegieMellon University. The 43yearold labor economist was also named a provost of the university.

title: Transcript of the Speech by President on Vietnam
description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's televised address to the nation last night on the Vietnam war, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Syria Said to Tell Guerrillas To Quit Villages Near Heights
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 23The Syrian Army has reported ordered Palestinian guerrilla groups to stay out of village along the Golan heights ceasefire line that were severely bombed by Israel on Jan. 8, with what Syria said were heavy civilian casualties.

title: Astronauts' Visit Canceled
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 23 (UPI)A scheduled visit Friday by the Apollo 17 astronauts has been canceled indefinitely because of the death of former President Lyndon B. Johnson, Mayor Richard J. Daley said today.

title: THIEU IS CAUTIOUS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Jan. 24President Nguyen Van Thieu, joining in announcing the Paris accord on Vietnam, declared today that he considered it only as a ceasefire and not as a guarantee of a stable, longlasting peace.

title: AGENT TESTIFIES AT BRIBERY TRIAL
description: An undercover agent who had posed as a gangster was crossexamined yesterday by defense lawyers seeking to show that the Government had illegally entrapped three defendants charged with bribery in a Federal Court trial here.

title: GOVERNOR SCORES EDUCATION WASTE
description: ALBANY, Jan. 23Governor Rockefeller said today that he had been informed of instances of. waste and inefficiency in the educational system throughout the state sufficient enough to warrant the creation of an inspector general for education, with power to investigate, subpoena and recommend changes to eliminate the flaws.

title: House Inquiry Links Navy's Racial Strife to Laxity
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (UPI)  A House subcommittee concluded today that climate of permissiveness and a possible breakdown of discipline  not discrimination contributed to serious racial incidents last year aboard the aircraft carriers Kitty Hawk and Constellation.

title: Arteriosclerosis, Disease That Killed Johnson, Begins Early in Life and Strikes With Deadly Swiftness
description: Arteriosclerosis, within a onemonth period, has claimed the lives of two former Presidents, Harry S. Truman at age 88, and Lyndon B. Johnson at age 64.

title: North Vietnamese Viewed the Costly Spring Drive as Crucial for a Settlement
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 23Just when North Vietnam's offensive began at the end of March, an authoritative Communist official explained to Vietcong officials that our general offensive is designed to defeat the enemy's Vietnamization plan, force the enemy to acknowledge his deTeat and accept a political settlement on our terms.

title: HARRY J. BUNCKE
description: Harry J. Buncke, retired vice president for engineering of the Oxford Paper Company, died yesterday in a Stamford, Conn., convalescent home. He was 80 years old and had lived at 166 Altamont Avenue, Tarrytown, N.Y.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Jan. 23 (AP)An early rally faded today and prices on the London stock market closed down slightly after yesterday's slump.

title: The Theater: Games/After Liverpool
description: Nice surprises are not all that common in the theater these days, but one turned up at the New Bijou Theater on Monday night. The New Phoenix Repertory Company in addition to its season at the Lyceum Theater (now regrettably ended)has instituted a series of what it refers to as Sideshows. These are workshop performancesthe company calls them a preliminary sketch for a productionand here it was giving the third of series of five.

title: PACERS TOP NETS FOR SIXTH IN ROW
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 23The Indiana Pacers stretched their winning streak to six games by staging a secondhalf rally to defeat the New York Nets, 110103, in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Jazz: Saxophone Accent
description: Carmen Leggio, a saxophonist who has been an enlivening soloist in such big bands as Woody Herman's and Maynard Ferguson's, has organized a 12piece band of his own that has an unusual lineup of saxophonesthree baritones plus Mr. Leggio on either tenor or alto. The band, which also includes three trumpets, two trombones, piano, bass and drums, made its first public appearance Monday night at the Jazz Club of the Overseas Press Club.

title: Parlay Is Coming to OTB With Arrival of AmTote
description: The selection of American Totalisator as winner of the offtrack computer sweepstakes here will mean faster, more reliable and varied service for the $2 horseplayer, the Offtrack Betting Corporation said yesterday.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, Jan. 23, 1973

title: PENTAGON PAPERS BECOME EVIDENCE
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 23 The Pentagon paped themselves were introduced into evidence today, and an Army officer who helped put them together testified that their disclosure would be of use to a foreign nation.

title: Dismissal of Abortion Cases Foreseen in Bergen
description: HACKENSACK, Jan. 23The Bergen County Prosecutor Sherwin D. Lester, said today that as he read the press reports, the Supreme Court decision striking down laws that restrict abortions during the first three months of pregnancy could very well dispoae of the case against Dr. Robert M. Livingston and all others like it.

title: SENATORS CONFIRM 2 NIXON NOMINEES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (Reuters)  The Senate confirmed two of President Nixon's appointments to top defense and intelligence agency posts today after one of them, the Deputy Defense Secretary, William P. Clements Jr.. agreed to sell stock in a Dallas bank to avoid a possible conflict of interest.

title: U.S.French Teamwork Said to Smash Drug Ring
description: Federal narcotics agents, working closely with their French counterparts, have smashed a major operation that smuggled about 575 pounds of heroin from France into the United States in the last three years, the Government announced yesterday.

title: RESERVE CRITICIZED ON GROWTH OF MONEY
description: A leading economist charged yesterday that the Federal Reserve System had allowed an inordinate growth in the nation's money supply during 1972, which he said would lead to a rekindling of inflation in 1973 and 1974.

title: Papers and Unions Facing Showdown in Contract Talks
description: The city's three major daily newspapers and their unions are facing a critical confrontation in coming labor negotiations that seems likely to determine whether these citywide dailies can make use of nevi and costsaving print technologies and whether they car achieve settlements that will leave them economically viable.NEWSPAPERSThe three citywide newspapers involved, all members of the Publishers Association of New York City, are The New York Times, The Daily News and The New York Post. The Long Island Press, which was formerly affiliated with the association, is no longer a member.

title: Corona Charge Discounted
description: FAIRFIELD, Calif., Jan. 23 (UPI)The official who prosecuted Juan V. Corona for the murder of 25 itinerant farm workers said today that he had seen no evidence of any jury tampering. G. Dave Teja, Sutter County District Attorney, discounted a charge by the defense attorney, Richard E. Hawk, that a sheriff's matron had talked to one juror about the verdict the night before the panel found Corona guilty. He's made a lot of charges that he couldn't back up, Mr. Teja said.

title: HORSES & EQUIPMENT
description: STAKES winning & stakes placed broodmare 1963. In foal to Bold Favorite. Also 2yr old filly by Dancers Image this mare. $100.000 the pair. Call Lew Plaskett at (401) 4679111

title: TRADE SURPLUS ROSE IN JAPAN LAST YEAR
description: TOKYO, Jan. 25Japan registered a trade surplus of $8,972,000,000 last year, an increase of $1,185,000,000 from 1971, the Finance Ministry announced today.

title: Changes Sought on Oil Import Quotas
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 Representatives of 19 major petrochemical producers said today they had asked the White House to create a new category of oilimport quotas.

title: War Leaves Deep Mark on U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23America is moving out of Vietnam after the longest and most divisive conflict since the War Between the States. But Vietnam is not moving out of America, for the impact of the war there is likely to influence Amercan life for many years to come. Though it is probably too early to distinguish between the temporary and the enduring consequences, one thing is fairly clear: There has been a sharp decline in respect for authority in the United. States as a result of the wara decline in respect not only for the civil authority of government but also for the moral authority of the schools, the universities, the press, the church and even the family.

title: Iran Tells Oil Consortium Pact Will Not Be Renewed
description: TEHRAN, Iran, Jan. 23 (AP) Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi of Iran today told the Western oil consortium operating in his country that its present contract would not be renewed after it expires in 1979.

title: Aftermath of a Siege
description: The shootout between police and gunmen trapped in the act of robbing a sporting goods store in Brooklyn evoked an exemplary display of courage, resolution and restraint by New. York City police during two days of terrible tension. A tragic incident that had already cost the life of one young patrolman was preventedby the policefrom becoming an outright bloodbath that might have involved more patrolmen, the gunmen and innocent hostages as well. Even the escape of the hostages was, properly, not considered by the police to be a green light for an assault on the store. Time worked for calm end to this extraordinary affair and police officials used it well. They deserve the highest commendation.

title: FIL JIM TRIUMPHS IN HIALEAH SPRINT
description: MIAMI, Jan. 23 (AP)V. R. Ferraris's Fil Jim equaled her victory total for 1972 as she won her first outing of the winter in the $7,000 Emardee Purse at Hialeah Park today.

title: SENATORS ASK VETO OVER BUDGET CHIEFS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (AP) In another move to strength. en the powers of Congress, Senate Democratic leaders introduced a bill today to require. Senate confirmation of the director and deputy director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Excerpts From Thieu's Speech on Pact
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Jan. 24 (Reuters)  Following, in unofficial translation, are excerpts from President Nguyen Van Thieu's radio speech today on the ceasefire agreement:

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and index, Page 43

title: MISS LEE DISPLAYS AN IMPOSING VOICE
description: Young Ae Lee possesses one of those voluminous contralto voices that seemingly billow forth without effort singing appears to be the most natural thing in the world for her. Now studying at Juilliard and the American Opera Center, Miss Lee, who is from Korea, gave a program of Handel, Mahler, Barber, Faure and Falla songs on Sunday night in Carnegie Recital Hall.

title: Big Board Unit Gets Deposit
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that some 5.2 million shares of common stock worth about $340million and held by three New. York City pension funds had been deposited in the exIchange's Central Certificate Service, a computerized depository for securities. The deposit was the largest ever made in C.C.S. and the first ever made by a municipality. In all, C.C.S. currently holds over 1.5 billion shares worth more than $55billion.

title: Envoy Held Captive
description: The United States Ambassador to Haiti, Clinton E. Knox, was being held at gunpoint early today by at least two men do his residence in PortauPrince. Details on Page 8.

title: Disciplinary Action Said to Cut Medicaid Costs in Last 3 Years
description: Abuses by physicians, denlists and other professionals in the Medicaid program have led to 370 disciplinary actions and $4271,232 in reductions of claims and restitutions of wrong payments in the last three years, the City Health Department said yesterday.

title: F.T.C. Urges Ban, on RadioTV Ads for Little Cigars
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23The Federal Trade Commission urged Congress today to bar advertisements of cigaretelike little cigars from television and radio.

title: Questions Left Unanswered by Ruling on Abortion
description: The Supreme Court's farreaching decision Monday on abortion, hailed as an overwhelming victory for women's right to privacy and attacked as depriving the fetus of its right to life, has left unanswered a number of serious medical and legal questions.

title: MITCHELL LINKED TO $199,000 FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23A witness said today that $199,000 was paid to a defendant in the Watergate trial during last year's campaign with the approval of former Attorney General John N. Mitchell and former Commerce Secretary Maurice H. Stans.

title: Brooklyn Youth Seized In an Oct. 6 Murder
description: An unemployed 19yearold Brooklyn youth was arrested last night and charged with murdering his neightbor, a 19yearold student, on Oct. 6.

title: CHURCH COUNCIL WIDENS BOYCOTT
description: GENEVA, Jan. 23  The World Council of Churches has decided to include banks in its boycott of concerns doing business with African countries ruled by white minorities.

title: CocaCola Bottling Negotiating On Buying Vermouth Industries
description: The CocaCola Bottling Company of New York disclosed yesterday that it was negotiating to buy Vermouth Industries of America, Inc., a leading, privately owned vermouth producer based in Lodi, N. J.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Seymour to Quit As U.S. Attorney
description: Whitney North Seymour Jr. plans to resign as United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York within the next few months, according to Government sources.

title: U.S. Court Rules Buckley Need Not Join TV Union
description: William F. Buckley Jr. won a crucial first round yesterday in his lawsuit challenging the constitutionality of collective bargaining agreements that force him to be a member of a union in order to express his views on television.

title: Equity Financing
description: The American Electric Power Company yesterday announced plans to sell 6.5 million' shares of its authorized but unissued common stock in a rights offering to shareowners this spring. Directors will determine the subscription price and the date of the offering at a later date. Proceeds will be applied to repay shortterm debt and for other corporate purposes. The company's stock was down  at 20 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: CONGRESS UNITED IN VOICING RELIEF
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23Members of Congress, after years of bitter debate over the war in Vietnam, united tonight in voicing relief and gratitude that the conflict appeared to be at an end.

title: Steel Sales at High
Frazier Still Has His Pride and He Wants That Title Back
description: Only one heavyweight champion ever has regained the title. Floyd Patterson won it back from Ingemar Johansson in 1960.

title: A.B.C. CHIEF CALLS REACTORS SAFE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 James R. Schlesinger, outgoing chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission, refused today to give Congress a flat assurance of total safety of nuclear electric power plants.

title: Candidate Residency Upheld
description: CONCORD, N.H., Jan. 23 (AP) New Hampshire's sevenyear residency requirement for gubernatorial candidates has been upheld by a threejudge panel in United States District Court.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 23Although there are only seven New Jersey skaters here at the national figure skating championship starting tomorrow, they form a quality group with a former Olympian and two Eastern sectional champions among them.

title: Kissinger and Tho End Talks With Handshakes and Smiles
description: PARIS, Jan. 23Henry A, Kissinger and Le Duc Tho concluded their long negotiations on a Vietnam ceasefire today with glowing smiles and hearty handshakes.

title: Philippine High Court Rejects 10 Challenges to New Charter
description: MANILA, Jan. 23 (UPI)The Supreme Court dismissed 10 petitions last night that indirectly challenged President Ferdinand E. Marcos's right to proclaim a Constitution allowing him to rule indefinitely with full personal powers.

title: Credit Markets in Stabilization; Treasury Issues Register Gains
description: The capital markets, aided by a report of diminished inflation during December and by expectations that President Nixon would announce a Vietnam ceasefire, showed signs of stabilizing following the sharp decline that set in with Phase 3.

title: Respect for Privacy
description: The Supreme Court has made a major contribution to the preservation of individual liberties and of free decisionmaking by its invalidation of state laws inhibiting a woman's right to obtain an abortion in the first three months of pregnancy.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: MARYLAND ROUTS L.I.U. FIVE, 10073
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Jan. 23 (AP)Fourthranked Maryland outscored Long Island University, 214, in the first seven minutes of the second half tonight and went on to defeat the Blackbirds, 100.73.

title: IRVING MAAS DIES; FILM EXPORTER, 76
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Jan. 23Irving A. Maas, who revived American film exports after World War II as vice president and general manager of the Motion Picture Export Association, died yesterday in Community Hospital. He was 76 years old and had lived at 104 Malvern Circle.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: More of the Long Island Rail Road's 90,000 prestrike commuters returned to the railroad yesterday, the second weekday of operation since the 90day truce was arranged between the 12 nonoperating unions and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.

title: 76ers Dismiss Rabin, Name Loughery Coach
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 23 (AP)The Philadelphia 76ers of the National Basketball Association dismissed Roy Rubin as coach tonight and replaced him with Kevin Loughery, who will be playercoach.

title: Notes on People
description: Senator Vance Hartke said he had been refusing to be searched before boarding airliners. The Indiana Democrat also said he thought Senators and Representatives should be immune from preflight searches designed to prevent hijacking. An aide to Mr. Hartke said the Senator had refused to be searched before boarding a plane last week enroute from Indiana to Washington.

title: 1,200 Attend Funeral of Clerk Slain in Holdup
description: Twelve hundred Orthodox Jews gathered in the Borough Park section of Brooklyn yesterday afternoon for the funeral of 19yearold Richard Kupferstein, who was shot to death Monday night during an attempted holdup of a drugstore where he had worked parttime as a clerk.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority yesterday retained as its ecological consultant on the Meadowlands Sports Complex the concern that did the original environmental impact study on the complex.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Seymour to Quit As U.S. Attorney
description: Whitney North Seymour Jr. plans to resign as United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York within the next few months, according to Government sources.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A new policy limiting the appointment of each of the system's 29 college presidents to five years and requiring an intensive evaluation of his performance if he seeks reappointment is planned by the State University of New York.

title: Eighth Juror Is Selected For Trial of H. Rap Brown
description: The sixth day of the H. Rap Brown trial ended yesterday with the addition of the eighth juror to the panel.

title: Australia and New Zealand Set Moves Against French ATests
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 23 (UPI)The Prime Ministers of Australia and New Zealand said today that they would take measures, including possibly a break in diplomatic relations if necessary, against the French nuclear tests in the Pacific.

title: DONALDSON, LUFKIN POSTS RECORD NET
description: Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, Inc., a leading institutional investment house, reported yesterday that it had record revenues and net income, in 1972. At the same time, the concern's board raised the semiannual dividend from 5 cents a share to 6 cents.

title: Planning Is Complex For Johnson's Rites
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 23Yesterday afternoon, Robert A. Shand was lounging lazily around his house in a suburb of Washington, watching television in his shorts and socks.

title: Chryster to Expand Plant
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan 23 (UPI) The Chrysler Corporation said today it would expand its truck assembly plant here to increase capacity by onethird from the present average of 480 vehicles per working day. The work, force will be increased to 4,300 from 3,330.

title: PRIVATE COLLEGES GET $1.5MILLION
description: TRENTON, Jan. 23 (AP)The new state program to provide financial aid to private colleges began today as Governor Cahill presented 14 colleges and universities with checks totaling $1.5million.

title: CONGRESS UNITED IN VOICING RELIEF
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23Members of Congress, after years of bitter debate over the war in Vietnam, united tonight in voicing relief and gratitude that the conflict appeared to be at an end.

title: Plan to Build a Bridge Over 51st St. Collapses
description: A proposed bridge over 51st Street near Park Avenuehas been abandoned because of public protest.

title: Steve Smith Is Ready For 18Foot Pole Vault
description: Steve Smith, fresh from setting a world indoor record and confident that he can go considerably higher, will chase the first successful 18foot pole vault indoors in the Wanamaker Millrose Games Friday night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Steve Smith Is Ready For 18Foot Pole Vault
description: Steve Smith, fresh from setting a world indoor record and confident that he can go considerably higher, will chase the first successful 18foot pole vault indoors in the Wanamaker Millrose Games Friday night at Madison Square Garden.

title: U.S Will Consolidate Its Bases in Japan
description: TOKYO, Jan. 23The United States and. Japan announced today a major consolidation of American military bases in Japan. United States officials said it would not significantly reduce American forces or impair American military operations here.

title: Slain Patrolman Is Honored By 7,000 Comrades at Rites
description: An army of policemen poured into the narrow streets of Greenpoint yesterday to attend the funeral of Patrolman Stephen Robert Gilroy, who was killed in action last Friday.

title: Engineering Concern Linked to Payoffs Does Big Business With Jersey Agencies
description: TRENTON, Jan. 23A New York engineering concern whose officials were accused by Federal grand juries of paying off New Jersey officials in return for contracts is still doing a handsome business with state agencies including the New Jersey Sports Authority, which awarded it a contract.

title: BIG SWINGS MARK DOLLAR TRADING
description: PARIS, Jan. 23The dollar moved down early today, depressed by a flow of money into Switzerland yesterday, then rose in the afternoon on rumors that a Vietnam peace agreement had just been signed in Paris.

title: East Tops West, 10484; Cowens Is Most Valuable
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 23  The game was definitely not the thing tonight as the East outscored the West, 10484, in nice, friendly exhibition called the 23d annual National Basketball Association AllStar game.

title: Texas Banker Convicted
description: AMARILLO, Tex., Jan. 23 (AP)A jury convicted John Osorio today of conspiracyembezzlement charges stemming from the Sharpstown Bank scandal. Federal District Court Judge Halbert O. Woodward will sentence him next month. Osorio, former president of Frank Sharp's National Bankers Life Insurance Company, was accused of misusing the company's pension funds to aid Sharp, himself and others.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The latest entry in the network movie derby is the Columbia Broadcasting System's acquisition of rights to about 30 feature films from 20th CenturyFox and MetroGoldwyn  Mayer including Fox's The French Connection, which won the 1971 Academy Award as best picture of the year. The network declined to cite figures except to announced the deal as a multi  million  dollar purchase.

title: Cameron's 3 Goals Help Islanders Top Seals, 81
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Jan. 23Returning to the home fans13,669 of themfor the first time in a week, the New York Islanders displayed their lately acquired scoring form against the California Golden Seals in the Nassau Coliseum tonight.

title: STUDENTS' CHECK ASSISTS NEEDIEST
description: The members of a drug education program at Sarah J. Hale Vocational High School, in the Cobble Hill section of Brooklyn sent the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund a check for $10 for two reasons.

title: Brooklyn Diocese Parishes Will Use Cluster Plan in School Experiment
description: Parishes in the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn have been asked to group into neighborhood clusters of four or five churches during the coming weeks to determine the future of the financially troubled system of parochial elementary schools.

title: C. Merrill Chapin Jr. of St. Joseph Lead, 74, Dies
description: FAR HILLS, N. J., Jan. 23C. Merrill Chapin Jr., retired senior vice president and a director of the St. Joseph Lead Company, now the St. Joe Minerals Corporation, died at his home here today. He was 74 years old.

title: Cameron's 3 Goals Help Islanders Top Seals, 81
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Jan. 23Returning to the home fans13,669 of themfor the first time in a week, the New York Islanders displayed their lately acquired scoring form against the California Golden Seals in the Nassau Coliseum tonight.

title: HANOI SAID TO HINT AT SMALLER FORCE
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 23A Canadian member of Parliament, just returned from North Vietnam, said today that officials there had told him that the projected international force that is to monitor a truce would be kept smaller than the United States had originally proposed.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF DESPITE A RALLY
description: After falling sharply most of the day, prices on the American Stock Exchange recovered somewhat yesterday after the White House reported shortly before 2 P.M. that President Nixon would announce at 10 P.M. developments in the Vietnam War.

title: The Glory And Tragedy Of L.B.J.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23Both the glory and the tragedy of Lyndon Johnson was that he believed utterly in the romantic tradition of Americain the Congress and the church, in that order; in Main Street and Wall Street, in the competitive state and in the welfare statein all of it part of the time and some of it all of the time: all the dreams and realities and myths, from Horatio Alger to Lord Keynes, no matter how contradictory.

title: Abraham Tulin, Zionist Leader, Dies
description: Abraham Tulin, a lawyer and Zionist leader, died yesterday at his home, 330 West 72d Street. He was 94 years old.

title: Vietnam War Casualties
description: United States45,933 killed and 303,616 wounded (with 153,300 of these requiring hospitalization).

title: Japanese Step Up Quest for Art in U.S.
description: Japanese buyers, shopping hard for goods in this country, are into another American market  art. No one knows precisely how much they are spending, but several New York dealers and auction representatives estimate that they purchased between $50million and $75million worth during the last year. And they predict that sales will be even bigger in 1973.

description: (Periods ended Dec. 31)

title: Red Smith
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Jan. 23Sargent Shriver, Democratic candidate for Vice President of the United States last November, was chatting with a dozen sports writers when George Forernan appeared on the far side of the swimming pool. In five seconds, Shriver was alone except for Barney Nagler of the Daily Racing Form.

title: Accord Is Believed Near On Legislative Districts
description: TRENTON, Jan. 23  New Jersey legislative reapportionment officials reported today that they were reasonably optimistic that they could avert a deadlock and adopt a compromise, bipartisan redistricting plan for this year's legislative elections.

title: Thousands at Johnson Bier
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 23Thousands of persons of all ages and from all walks of life filed past the coffin of former President Lyndon B. Johnson today as his body lay in state in the huge library bearing his name at the University of Texas.

title: WEAPONS STUDIED IN POLICE DEATHS
description: Police ballistics experts are examining the automatic weapons of two men slain in an exchange of fire with the police in a Brooklyn bar early yesterday to determine if they could have been used in the assassinations of two patrolmen last January. Two plainclothes detectives were wounded in yesterday's incident.

title: Trinity's Bells Ring Out
description: As soon as President Nixon ended his Vietnam peace announcement last night, Larry King, the organist at Trinity Church, went to an octaveandahalf keyboard in the sanctuary and began pealing the 10 bells in the tower of the historic church at Broadway and Wall Street.

title: 5thMan Theory Doubted In Siege at Brooklyn Store
description: The police disclosed yesterday that the gunmen who holed up for 47 hours with nine hostages in a Brooklyn sporting goods store had apparently arrived there in a commandeered gypsy cab after locking its driver in the trunk.

description: Theater

title: I.B.M. Lifts Payout By Sc and Splits Its Stock by 25%
description: The International Business Machines Corporation announced yesterday a 5cent increase in its quarterly dividend and a 25 per cent stock split.

title: Crusaders Set Back Jets, 5 to 4, On Clearwater's Overtime Goal
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 23 (UPI) Ray Clearwater's second goal of the game with 29 seconds gone in suddendeath overtime tonight gave the Cleveland Crusaders a 54 victory over the Winnipeg Jets.

title: Schedule for Procession and Rites
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 23 (UPI) Following, as released by military officials, is the schedule for services for former President Lyndon B. Johnson. All times are Eastern standard.

title: THIEU IS CAUTIOUS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Jan. 24President Nguyen Van Thieu, joining in announcing the Paris accord on Vietnam, declared today that he considered it only as a ceasefire and not as a guarantee of a stable, long, lasting peace.

title: Thousands at Johnson Bier
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Wednesday, Jan. 24Thousands of persons of all ages and from all walks of life filed past the coffin of former President Lyndon B. Johnson yesterday and throughout the night as his body lay in state in the huge library bearing his name at the University of Texas.

title: Muskie Says Wealthy Find More Ways to Cut Their Taxes, Such as Mexican Vegetable Rollover
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23Senator Edmund S. Muskie charged today that the ways in which some wealthy persons could keep their Federal income tax rate below that paid by families of average income were increasing, not decreasing.

description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's televised address to the nation last night on the Vietnam war, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Legislator Will Resist Court Plan Stampede
description: ALBANY, Jan. 23The ne chairman of the Senat Judiciary Committee said to day that he Would not be stampeded into recommend ing, passage of courtreforn legislation this year.

title: Priest Is Suspended For Fonda Marriage
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 23 (AP)The Episcopalian priest who officiated at the marriage of Jane Fonda, the actress, and Tom Hayden, the antiwar activist, has been indefinitely suspended from administration of the sacraments by his Bishop.

title: With Too Much Spare Time, Both Opened Shops
description: Parttime antiques dealers are anything but rare these days. For most of them, it's the result of collecting enthusiasms that could not be curbed, manias for anything from thimbles to threshers that, in time, threatened to force them from their homes.

title: Few Stay on Icelandic Isle As Eruption Opens Fissure
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Jan. 23 (Reuters)A volcanic eruption opened a fissure in an island off Iceland's southern coast early today and forced the evacuation of nearly all the 5,500 inhabitanti.

description: MIAMI, Jan. 23 (AP)V. R. Ferraris's Fil Jim equaled her victory total for 1972 as she won her first outing of the winter in the $7,000 Emardee Purse at Hialeah Park today.
