title: Offshore Schedule Calls for 11 Races
description: The new 197273 world championship offshore powerboat race schedule includes 11 races on the American circuit, with the possibility that two more, the Bahama 500 and the MiamiNassau Race, may be added.

title: Wheat, the Gold of the Prairie Provinces
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba  Farm people never like to admit that they're prosperous, said Lloyd Sirett who has spent his life growing wheat on 750 acres west of Winnipeg. But things have certainly been worse.

title: Boystown: Budgeting for a Family of 74
description: KEARNY  Like the Old Woman who lived in a shoe, Msgr. Robert P. Egan has an integrated family of 74 children at New Jersey's Boystown. But there is one significant difference: he knows what to do.

title: DR. HERBERT W. MEYER
description: Dr. Herbert Willy Meyer, a former New York surgeon, died Friday at his home in Rancho Santa Fe, Calif., where he moved in 1955. His age was 76.

title: Artists in Bergen Work on Campus
description: PARAMUS  Bergen Community College instituted a Resident Arts Program this month by awarding a $1,000 cash grant to each of five local groups. They are the Bergen Philharmonic Orchestra, the Bergen Youth Orchestra, the Pro Arte Chorale, the Center for Modern Dance Ecuation and the Art Center of Northern New Jersey.

title: Education Group Names Leader
description: Wallace B. Edgerton, former deputy chairman of the National Endowment for the Humanities, last week assumed the presidency of the Institute of International Education, one of the major organizations involved in educational and cultural exchanges between the United States and other countries.

title: COMPANIES RAISE ROLE OF WORKERS
description: PARIS, Jan. 27What can be done to get the worker, treated as little more than cog in a machine since the Industrial Revolution, to like his job?

title: Stage: Kenneth Brown's Nightlight
description: HARTFORD  Apparently one reason why Kenneth H. Brown has had difficulty getting professional productions for his plays since The Brig (1963) is that they have large casts. The Happy Bar, for example, has 28 characters. In Nightlight, which is now in Its world premiere engagement at the Hartford Stage Company, the playwright has eased that problem. Only 5 of his 17 people are alive. The rest are plaster.

title: Teamwork Helps Keep Mamaroneck a Snug Harbor
description: The saying There oughta be a law doesn't always solve problems, but if it is preceded by there oughta be a committee, it might. That's the success story of Mamaroneck, a threecenturyold village with one of the most popular and busy boat and yacht harbors on Long Island Sound.

title: Hild Synonymous With Sails and a Lot More
description: The boat Herb Hild remembers best was the first Star he owned himself, the one he had custombuilt from select Western Red Cedar soon after World War II when the timber was impossible to find.

title: Redskins' Top Aide Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI) Joe Sullivan, assistant coach and assistant general manager, announced today he was leaving the Washington Redskins for personal reasons. Sullivan, considered the No. 1 aide to Coach George Allen, said he was undecided whether to stay in football or go into private business.

title: Ton Racing Gets One Negative Vote
description: (Reprinted from Midget Ocean Racing Club News) It is becoming apparent to me that competitive ton racing is not within the economic realm of the average amateur racer.

title: Involve Yourself in Outboard Racing
description: Last October, the New Jersey Outboard Association held the first powerboat regatta to be held in the city since the 1939 World's Fair. More than 160 boats and drivers competed in the fivehour event at Flushing Meadows Park, Queens, with over 5,000 spectators attracted to a sport that has been underpublicized and obscure for at least 20 years.

title: South Vietnamese Adjust Exchange Rate of Currency
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 27 (Reuters)  South Vietnam today adjusted the exchange rate for its currency, changing the price for one United States dollar from 465 to 475 piasters.

title: Margot Zavell Paul A. Schmid Plan to Marry
description: Mrs. Arnold Zavell of New York and Breckenridge, Colo., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Margot Sophie Zavell, to Mark Louis Schmid, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul A. Schmid of South Westport, Mass.

title: Bathtub to Ocean, Boatitis Bug Can Bite Anytime
description: It's pretty safe to assume that someone in your family or a friend has had an attack of boatitis.

title: ... Making Columbia a Gem in the Ocean (Lakes, Too)
description: From camper tops, shower stalls and chemical toilets to the world's largest producer of sailboats in little more than a decade may sound like an Horatio Alger story to end them all, but that's the way it happened.

title: Rhode Island Five Registers 9279 Upset Over Fordham
description: KINGSTON, R. I., Jan. 27The University of Rhode Island varsity basketball team reacted to the Thursday announcement of Coach Tom Carmody's resignation at the end of the season by scoring a 9279 upset over Fordham today at Keaney Gymnasium before 1,500 spectators.

title: Dauplaise New Favorite With Trot Track Bettors
description: YONKERS, Jan. 27When Norm Dauplaise opened the Yonkers Raceway campaign on Jan. 3 by bringing home the daily double at a return of $202.60, he did not create a special image of himself.

title: Mrs. Abzug Urges a Drive For Newsman's Privilege
description: Representative Bella S. Ablzug called yesterday for a nationwide effort by all the media in support of Congressional action that would safeguard a newsman's privilege not to disclose the source of his information.

title: A North Fork Remembrance
description: SOUTHOLD, L.I.  A common ear for music and a common delight in playing it gave David Rothman of this North Fork village an intimate insight into Albert Einstein, who padded about here in $1.25 sandals, a sport shirt and shorts one summer more than three decades ago.

title: ...Seeds of the Future
description: Abroad and at home, the time has come to turn away from the condescending policies of paternalism. With these words, President Nixon has signaled his determination to place his conservative stamp on the next four years. And last week, there were new indications of the tensions this may hold for the future: Restructuring of the White House bureaucracy to bring the reins more tightly under Presidential control . . . signs of Congressional discontent as Democrats, joined by an increasing number of Republicans, sought ways to curb Presidential power (above, Mr. Nixon delivers the 1972 State of the Union message) . . . a decision by the Supreme Court that, in effect, called for a wholesale repeal of most state antiabortion lawsa decision that flew in the face of Mr. Nixon's expressed views.

title: Kissinger Will Not Return To Teaching at Harvard
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI) Henry A. Kissinger says he has no intention of leaving the White House to return to his former teaching post at Harvard University.

title: The great Balloon Competition.
description: IN 1773, at dawn in early January, there was a throng outside the walls of the Walnut Street prison in Colonial Philadelphia. The occasion was not a hanging, but a balloon launching that, if successful, would be the first aerial voyage in the history of the new United States of America.

title: TV ADS ON VOTING STUDIED IN JERSEY
description: A tough television advertisement depicting Senator George McGovern as a shifting weathervane was by far the most effective political commercial of last year's Presidential campaign, according to a study of suburban middleclass voters in New Jersey.

title: Other News About Accords
description: CAMBODIA The exiled Cambodian head of state said in Peking that his guerrilla forces would fight on despite the ceasefire in Vietnam. Cambodia announced a suspension of offensive activities tomorrow. [Page 26.]

title: Vote Due on RentControl Bill
description: TRENTONThe chairman of the Assembly's Conference Committee predicted yesterday that a controversial state rentcontrol measure will clear the committee tomorrow, thus virtually assuring its final passage in the Lower House.

title: Auto fact Drives Profits Into Canada
description: WINDSOR, OntarioThis industrial city across the river from Detroit was a fading hasbeen only few years ago, with a sluggish economy and dim future. Now it is enjoying a new prosperity, with sudden increases in such figures as consumer spending and housing starts.

title: Chorale Changes Its Tune
description: SUMMIT  The Summit Chorale which has a longestablished reputation for innovative programing, is heading toward innovative presentation as well. The first step toward this will be evident today at its annual Winter Concert at Calvary Episcopal Church; the concert begins at 4:30.

title: Evinrude: Refined and Simplified
description: Evinrude Motors, Milwaukee, is exhibiting 13 outboard motors, from 2 to 135 horsepower, at the Show. Virtually every motor incorporates refinements in engineering. A hydraulic assistmechanical shift has been applied to all motors over 50 horsepower. The shiftcalled power pilot is similar to power steering on an automobile.

title: Women for Pakistani Army
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Jan. 27 (AP)Women will receive military training as part of Pakistan's defense plan, the Government announced.

title: Badminton Is for Fun And Fitness In Mt. Lakes
description: MOUNTAIN LAKES  For 40 years now, badminton has been the name of the game at the Mountain Lakes Badminton Club, whose more than 40 members meet twice a week in fierce competitive spirit. The club is one of 27 in the New York metropolitan area, and the game, its devotees will readily admit, is far more than just a backyard pastime on a lazy summer afternoon.

title: Horsepower Mark
description: The average horsepower of new outboards motors sold during 1972 climbed to a record 38,1, up from 35.6 the year before. But the average outboard boat sold during the year was slightly smaller15.5 feet long compared with 15.6 in 1971, according to a boating industry survey.

title: J. G. Bouza to Wed Pamela Devenney
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 27  Miss Pamela Dorrance Devenney and Joseph Glenn Bouza plan to be married in April.

title: Exciting to cook
description: Paris and Brest are both cities in France. They have little in common besides this creampuff pastry, which is classic. Instead of baking the dough in little blobs that turn into puffs, the recipe calls for piping it into concentric rings that end up as a creamfilled cake. Creampuff dough is versatile and one of the few things that are exciting to cook. That moment when, for the first time, you blithely dump two cups of flour into a pot of boiling butter, water, sugar and salt is undeniably spectacular. The final results can be, too, but require more finesse. The dough must be heated and laboriously stirred until it is dry but has not burned. Then the eggs go in (use large eggs; size matters) one by one and oven heat turns your work into airy pte  chou.

title: Invite Rita Rait to America!
description: I want Rita Rait (pronounced Wright) to be invited to the United States by our Government and by some of our universities as soon as possible. She is the champion and translator in the Soviet Union of William Faulkner and J. D. Salinger and John Updike and Franz Kafka and Anne Frank and Robert Burns, among others.

title: Aussie, Girl Overcome Antagonism
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand In this country, I've been told, there are more boats per capita than any other place in the world. Australia might rate a close second to that. Since most of the residents live near the sea and the weather is usually fair, it's understandable that nearly every type of boat can be found.

title: Is Everyone Ready for the Next Tango?
description: YOU can be sure that Last Tango in Paris, the controversial and intensely sexual drama which jolted New York Film Festival audiences last fall and is due next Thursday at the Trans  Lux East, will not be the last movie from Bernardo Bertolucci. In fact, the dynamic 31yearold Italian director, who was also responsible for Before the Revolution, Spider's Stratagem and The Conformist, has two new flicks in the offing.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A ban on open burning in New York City and surrounding counties was extended yesterday until 4 P.M. Sunday by the State Department of Environmental Conservation.

title: Princeton Elects Cronin
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 27Bill Cronin, a junior from Port Washington, L. I., has been elected captain of Princeton's 1973 varsity football team. The 6foot3inch, 235pound tight end caught six passes for 67 yards last season. Cronin is Princeton's 102d football captain.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Consumer affairs and environmental control are prominent items on state legislative menus so far this year. Bills are ranging from nofault automobile insurance to restrictions on land use.

title: PENTAGON TO DROP ITS FREEZE ON JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI) The Pentagon announced today that it would lift next Thursday a freeze imposed last month on military and civilian promotions and on civilian hiring.

title: N.Y.U. Decides to Continue Its Italian Studies Program
description: New York University has rescinded a decision to terminate its graduate Italian studiea program as part of a severe fiscal retrenchment and, instead, has assigned an additional professor to strengthen the program.

title: In the Other England, the Land of Cotton, Nobody Says Baaaaath
description: YOU come out of the rain into the public bar, and the landlord of the pub considerately asks, Art witshert? This means Art thou wetshod? or Are your feet wet? The correct response is Aye. The other drinkers in the bar will look on you with kindly curiosity, and one of them will say, Tha a Yank? Again you say, Aye. You can go a long way with just Aye. The landlord says Patent?; you say Aye, and you are served with a pint of bitter ale. One drinker downs his pint and says: Ah weel. Oo's getten chippan on. This means: I must be going home. My wife has probably already started cooking the frenchfried potatoes for lunch. The landlord, referring to this wife, says, ma miss's, what fettle? This means: A propos your lady wife. How is her health these days? The answer comes, Oo's getten chowder wartch, meaning, She has developed a pain in her shoulder. And so on.

title: Guide Tells What,When, How, Where
description: True or false?

title: A fashion that became a classic
description: Though fashion in its fickle way has shortcircuited many a style fad (Remember hot pants? Midiskirts?), pants suits seem destined to go on forever. At least, for another season.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: G.I. Makes Chartering An Odyssey
description: ATHENS, Greece  Bill Lefakinis is a Greekborn American G.I. who has embarked on a plan to make the Greek waters the world's largest yachting center.

title: Big Influx Into Italian Cities
description: ROME, Jan. 27 (AP)Statistics indicate that four million farm workers have moved to the cities in 20 years, reducing Italy's agricultural labor force by 53 per cent.

title: Miss Streeter To Be Bride
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Jan. 27 Mr. and Mrs. Thomas W. Streeter have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Deborah Streeter, to Stephen M. Savery, son of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Savery of Arlington, Va. The wedding is planned for June.

title: The Berras and the Tripuckas, or the Games Some People Play
description: MONTCLAIRChange has come to the Berras of Montclair and the Tripuckas of Bloomfield. The kids are becoming college graduates, their high school athletic rivalry is nearing an end and the familiesadults as well as younger membersare becoming close friends.

title: History and Legend: A Warm Look Back At Southern Jersey
description: A great many easytotake lessons on the history of New Jersey have been put together by a man who collects tales and data about the state, especially its southern portion, with the eager abandon of a mushroom pickerone who throws everything into his bag and sorts them out later for labeling.

title: Amilcar Cabral Death for A Symbol Of Hope
description: LAGOS, NigeriaWhat we need very badly is a victory, a symbol. We need to concentrate our efforts on freeing one colonial territoryliberate it and this will help us to organize to liberate the rest. This argument has been common wherever Africans gathered to talk of ending colonial and minority white rule on this continent.

title: R. J. Hosch to Wed Miss Carolyn King
description: WOODCLIFF LAKE, N. J., Jan, 27Miss Carolyn King and Robert Joseph Hosch plan to be married April 7 in the St. Moritz Hotel in New York.

title: Spaniard Says Kidnappers Blindfolded Him for 10 Days
description: PAMPLONA, Spain, Jan. 27 (UPI)Felipe Huarte, an industrialist, said today that he was constantly blindfolded, first with adhesive tape and then with a hood, during his 10 days as a prisoner of Basque guerrillas.

title: The World Turned Upside Down
description: The phrase American Revolution conjures up images of Washington and Franklin, Bunker Hill and Valley Forge; mention of the French Revolution suggests Marat, Robespierre and the taking of the Bastille. But the English Revolution suggests nothing to most people, for it is rarely remembered that it was the British who first taught an amazed world that the head of a king is connected to the body of a king by nothing more substantial than neck.

title: IntheWater Shows Big as All Outdoors
description: Although the National Association of Engine and Boat Manufacturers runs what many consider the most distinguished boat show in the United States, two Annapolis men are getting; into the act  and the N.A.E.B.M.'s hair.

title: Computer Tracks Suspect in Slaying Of Brooklyn Youth
description: With the help of a computer in Albany, detectives in Brooklyn tracked down the getaway car used in a drugstore robbery last Monday in which a you was Alain and arrested two suspects yesterday.

title: BATTLES CONTINUE AFTER CEASEFIRE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Jan. 28A ceasefire officially went into effect throughout Vietnam at 8 A.M. today, but widespread fighting continued and there were reports that an unarmed American helicopter sent to pick up a Vietcong delegation and bring it to Saigon had been shot down over Tay Nin Ninh Province.

title: A Guide To Using Sea Aids
description: Before the boat show closes its doors, thousands of boatmen will have oohed and ached, thumned and caressed, kissedand even occretly made love tothe lady of their choice.

title: There's a Frostbite Fleet for Everyone Around Here
description: Any winter weekend you'd like to do something different, try racing a small sailboat on the icy waters of Long Island Sound.

title: Elliott Is Leaving City Planning Post
description: Donald H. Elliott, chairman of the City Planning Coihmission and a key policymaker for the last seven years, is leaving his post to return to practice law.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Shortly after 10 o'clock Tuesday morning, Commissioner Pete Rozelle will walk to a microphone in the ballroom of the Americana Hotel where the National Football League draft is being held and announce, The Houston Oilers have...

title: PRINCETON TAKES N.J. TRACK TITLE
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 27Meetrecord performances by Doug Greenwood, Chris Elliot and Jeff Weicksel today led Princeton to its third consecutive New Jersey College indoor track and field title.

title: Jon Sherwood Barrett Fiance Of Miss Carol Elizabeth Polk
description: LONDONDERRY, Vt., Jan. 27Miss Carol Elizabeth Polk and Jon Sherwood Barrett will be married March 31 in Dorset.

title: U.S. Boxers Lose, 65; Reggie Jones Is Upset
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan. 27 (AP)The Soviet Union's amateur boxing team built a big advantage in the lighter weight classes today and beat the United States, six matches to five, to continue domination of their international series. The margin of difference was the surprising loss of Reggie Jones of Newark in the 156pound class.

title: Miss Pierpoint, Gerard A. Bos To Be Married
description: Mr. and Mrs. Powell Pierpoint of New York and Madison, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Harriet Walworth Pierpoint, to Gerard Afford Bos, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gerard Karel Bos of Rock Hill, Md., and Manalapan, Fla.

title: Mosbacher Says No to America's Cup
description: With syndicates forming and tank testing under way in preparation for another America's Cup defense in 1974, one name is missingEmil (Bus) Mosbacher Jr.

title: Boys Will Be Boys And All That
description: MACHISMO is alive and well on Broadway. It may be the year of liberation 1973, but when one looks at three of the biggest hits of the seasonButley, That Championship Season and Pippinone is struck by the consistency of thematic content: male identity crisis. These three shows are very different in tone and treatment (one is even a musical), but they are alike in their concentration on the male ego in the throes of some crisis situation, and in the way they ignore the importance and seriousness of women. In fact, women don't appear on stage at all in That Championship Season (a corrupt celebration of the rites of perpetual adolescence).

title: Key Witness Pressed in Kerner Trial
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 27  Under harsh crossexamination by defense attorneys, William S. Miller, the Government's key witness in the bribery and income tax evasion trial of former Gov. Otto Kerner, testified this week that he had concealed his personal ownership of horse racing stock while chairman of the Illinois Racing Board and gave faulty testimony last week.

title: No, She Is Not Paul Robeson
description: AFREQUENT and visible performer, Paula Robison should well enough known to have her name spelled correctly. Yet once in a while a copyreader, typesetter or proofreader thinks she is really Paul Robeson and changes the name accordingly. What is interesting about this confusion is not that Miss Robison is a beautiful 32yearold flutist and Robeson is the eminent retired singer and actor but that she is named for him and he is her godfather. It happened quite simply because her father, the playwright David Robison, was working with Robeson at the time she was born.

title: Male Chauvinist Bill
description: PROVIDENCE, RI, Jan. 27 (UPI)A bill described by its sponsor, State Senator Donald Roch, as male chauvinist legislation has been introduced in the Rhode Island legislature. He said that the measure would allow men to hold jobs as dental hygienists and abolish an outdated law that allowed only women to fill such jobs.

title: Shore Hill Protests Housing For Aged
description: More than 300 residents of the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn attended a meeting last night to protest a proposed 22story apartment building for the elderly that would rise in an area made up primarily of small apartment units and singlefamily homes, some in the $80,000to$130,000 class.

title: Vichy France
description: The story of France during the German occupation is especially fascinating when it is told as a morality tale. It was this emphasis on individual and group responsibility in a time of extreme national crisis that made Marcel Ophuls's The Sorrow and the Pity so poignant a film for many Americans. By its unrelenting insistence on where people were during the war, what they did or did not do, and how they judged their actions then and now, it made us think about our own moral responsibilities at a critical, if not comparable moment in our history.

title: Dutchman Concocting 60Footer
description: SAINT MAARTEN, Netherlands Antilles  In primitive surroundings, on the shores of the Simpson Bay Lagoon, Peter Spronk, an experienced shipwright, is building a 60foot catamaran, which he believes will prove exceptionally safe for a twohulled vessel.

title: One person, disturbed or disturbing, is observed and treated for illness ...
description: Classical psychiatry and psychoanalysis are rooted in the mechanistic science of the late 19th century, and the relationship of psychiatrist to patient, of analyst to analysand also reflects that of the authoritarian 19thcentury physician to his physically ill and medically ignorant patient. This relationship is implicit in the process of diagnosing a mental illness; it is institutionalized in mental hospitals and elaborated in verbal and physical treatment. One person, socially sanctioned and professionally trained, is considered objective; the other, disturbed or disturbing, is observed and treated for the signs and symptoms of an illness for which there is most often no demonstrable anatomical or physiologic evidence.

title: Some Lessons From Phase 2
description: WASHINGTON  C. Jackson Grayson Jr. is that rarest of American birds, the tameduck price regulator.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: CONSUMER PRICES rose 0.3 per cent in December and 3.4 per cent for the year as a whole.... America's foreigntrade deficit swelled to $6.4billion in 1972 from $2billion in 1971. The December deficit totaled $563.2million... New orders for durable goods fell $740million in December to $36.88billion....Investors cashed in $6,6billion of mutual funds in 1972, while buying a total of $4.9billion.

title: Electronics
description: America, scientists say, is on the verge of entering the age of the wired city. A revolution in electronics communications, if properly directed, has the potential of benefiting our whole way of life.

title: Woman Joins Club
description: With an outboard speed mark of 107.91 miles an hour, Mrs. Molly Ballou of Hemet, Calif., a dragboat racer, became the first woman driver to join the Evinrude 100MileanHour Club. Her record, set in Oakland last June, places her among 24 outboard drivers nationally who have had their records certified by the American Power Boat Association.

title: $28Million Goal, A Record, Is Set By American ORT
description: The American ORT Federation has adopted a record budget of $28,912,000 for the expansion of its network of schools and installations to train unskilled Jewish refugees in Israel, France and other lands.

title: Judge Gives 101 Years; Regrets Ban on Chair
description: WACO, Tex., Jan. 27 (UPI) District Judge Carl C. Anderson has sentenced a convicted murderer to 101 years in prison but told him he would have preferred the sentence to he death in the electric chair.

title: This Medea Is More Hausfrau Than Horror
description: THERE is a contradiction at the heart of Minos Volanakis's production of Medea that is endlessly repeated and never resolved.

title: Hampton Bays to Vote On Status as a Village
description: HAMPTON BAYS, L.I.The people of Hampton Bays will go to the polls on Saturday, Feb. 24, to decide whether they want to incorporate as an independent village or remain a hamlet governed by the Town of Southampton.

title: The Man Who Want It to Snow In Queens
description: Have you noticed that when your husband or neigh ?? (or whoever does the shoveling) says: There hasn't been any snow this winter, there's a wonderfully jubilant tone to his voice?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The struggle between the political appointees of government and Gordon Rule, a senior civil servant, concerning testimony before a committee of the Congress raises disturbing questions.

title: NEW ROLE SOUGHT BY RIO DE JANEIRO
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 22Like a woman of leisure who has seen better days, this city is looking for a new role that will support the style of life to which it has been accustomed.

title: A New Treasure Flow in Panama
description: PANAMA CITYFor centuries the poor people of this isthmus have watched hungrily as legendary treasures passed through Panama, and lived, after a fashion, on the little that rubbed off in passage.

title: GOVERNOR OFFERS CONSUMER BILLS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27Governor Rockefeller has sent to the Legislature nine consumerprotection bills, including a measure to require every pharmacy to post a state list of the 150 most frequently ordered prescription drugs and the pharmacy's current retail prices.

title: Hydrofoils Making Every Scene From WaterSkiing to Trimaran
description: It's been over a half  century since that phone fellow, Alexander Graham Bell, proved he could speed a boat faster on hydrofoils. Since then, there's been some expensive and successful military diddling with the idea with sophisticated designs radically different from Bell's ladder concepts.

title: Homosexuals Organize at Universities
description: Armed with baseball bats, a group of homosexual students at Cornell, perhaps 100 in all, descended on Morrie's Tavern in Ithaca, one night two years ago.

title: P.S.C. Study Lays City Power Losses To Con Ed Neglect
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27The Public Servide Commission released a report today charging that excessive and premature failures in powercable joints recently installed by the Consolidated Edison Company were responsible for the electricalservice interruptions in Brooklyn and Queens last summer.

title: Miss Patterson Fiancee Of Anthony Manheim
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 27Mr. and Mrs. Walter MacleanPatterson have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Bettina Patterson, to Anthony Arthur Manheim of Brooklyn, New York, son of Paul Ernest Manheim of New York and East Hampton, L. I., and the late Mrs. Kate Carns Manheim.

title: Miss Rothamel Engaged to K. C. Fichter
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Jan. 27Miss Margaret Jean Rothamel and Kenneth Charles Fichter, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Fichter of Tenafly, N. J. plan to be married on June 23 in the chapel at Fort Hamilton in Brooklyn.

title: FischerDieskau Cancels
description: Dietrich Fischer  Dieskau, who had been scheduled to sing the world premiere of a Samuel Barber song cycle today at Tully Hall, has canceled his American appearances because of influenza. The premiere has been postponed, probably to next season. Today's revised program will contain chamber works played by the Juilliard Quartet; Walter Trampler, violist, and Richard Goode, pianist.

title: Ecuador Enters Oil Era
description: QUITO, Ecuador  For more years than Ecuadorans care to remember, their economy depended largely on the fickle world banana market. A result has been chronic political, social and financial instability.

title: Prince Sihanouk Says That the Fighting Will Continue in Cambodia but That He Is Open to Talks With U.S.
description: PEKING, Jan. 27 (Reuters)The exiled Cambodian head of state, Prince Norodom Sihanouk, said today that his guerrilla forces would fight on despite the ceasefire in Vietnam.

title: Two Turkish Officials Slain; Coast Police Hold Suspect
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Jan. 27 (AP)The Turkish Consul General and his vice consul were shot to death at the Biltmore Hotel here today and a Santa Barbara land developer was booked for investigation of homicide in the case, the authorities said.

title: the traveler's world
description: ONE of the worst sins committed against the great American motorist is the uniformly miserable eating he is compelled to endure along the highways of this country and especially on its toll pikes. On the New York Thruway and the New Jersey and Pennsylvania Turnpikes and across the toll roads of the Middle West, the motorist is a captive consumer. Unless he spends time and mileage to go off the toll roads, he must accept the brand of gasoline sold an them and pay a higher price for it and do the same for the kind and quality of meals he and his family ingest, courtesy of politicians and their exclusively licensed franchisers.

title: Brothers Seek Last Hurrah
description: Carl Marasco and his brother Pete make a hobby out of scouting college football players each year and predicting which ones will be drafted by the 26 pro teams of the National Football League. They rate and rank more than 400 players.

title: Newark Heads the List as Aid Rolls Pass 500,000
description: The number, of New Jersey residents on the publicassistance rolls went over the halfmillion mark for the first time late in 1972, according to figures just compiled by the state's Division of Public Welfare.

title: Manic Name of Kiekhaefer Back in the Game
description: Booth B6 in the Coliseum has a special meaning to anyone interested in powerboating. It is the booth that houses Kiekhaefer Aeromarine Motors, Inc., and if the first part of that name seems familiar to you, no wonder.

title: Chotiner's Statement Links Dairy Farm Aid to Votes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27About the time that the Nixon Administration was reversing a prior decision and granting a 1971 increase in the federall regulated milk price level, Murray M. Chotiner, one of the President's oldest friends and a former Nixon political agent and fundraiser, was telling top Presidential aides that if you don't help the farmer, you don't get his support.

title: Balcony of Europe
description: In his first novel, Langrishe Go Down, winner of several literary prizes, Aidan Higgins told of an Irish spinster's pathetic love for an arrogant German grifterstudent. Rather slowgoing, it nonetheless convincingly depicted an upper middleclass family in steep decline, and was particularly moving in its portrayal of Imogen Langrishe.

title: Cluster of 6 Colleges in Claremont, Calif Is Thriving on Diversity
description: CLAREMONT, Calif.The little group of colleges at the foot of the San Gabriel Mountains is thriving on a medieval idea that draws dozens of college administrators here each year to see what it is all about.

title: BOSTON LEAD CUT
description: The weekend started nicely for the Knicks last night at Madison Square Garden as they won the first of what they consider to be two must games against the Boston Celtics, 111108, before a screaming capacity crowd of 19,694 that contributed all it could to the thrilling triumph.

title: LOANS BY AGENCY CALLED IMPROPER
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame charged yesterday that the city's Addiction Services Agency had handled an employe imprest fund in an irresponsible manner and made numerous improper loans from it.

title: UNANIME TAKES RACE AT HIALEAH
description: MIAMI, Jan. 27Stretch runners don't have much of a chance on the main course at Hialeah this season. The track is so tight, and so fast, that speed horses are winning 80 per cent of the races. But the grass course is another matter and Hasty House Farm's Unanime proved a point today in the $25,000 added Palm Beach Handicap.

title: HOMOSEXUAL RUNS FOR CITY CORM
description: James W. Owles, who described himself as the first avowed homosexual to run for public office here, announced yesterday his candidacy, for the City Council seat held by Mrs. Carol Greitzer.

title: AL ALTMAN
description: Al Altman, a children'swear rnanufacturer here, died Friday of a coronary ailment in the Florida Keys, where he was on vacation. He was 71 years old and lived in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Some Lessons From Phase 2
description: WASHINGTON  C. Jackson Grayson Jr. is that rarest of American birds, the tameduck price regulator.

title: Cost to a President
description: Lyndon Baines Johnson, the 36th President of the United States who died last week at the age of 64, may be remembered, among other things, as the last frontiersman to occupy the White House. He was 100 proof southwestern American, a character out of Mark Twain and (in certain moods) William Faulkner, the heir of generations of frontier folkways and folklore. He was never more be guiling than, when relaxed and confiding, he spun his Texas tales or lapsed into the idiom and metaphor of the old Southwest.

title: Jazz Clinics At Schools Are Playing A Dual Role
description: EAST BRUNSWICKTwo years ago, Ross Cooper, then a 15yearold high school student in Olympia Fields, Ill., worked on a committee that sponsored a jazz clinic and concert by the Stan Kenton Orchestra.

title: Writer Autographs New Book at Show
description: A writer in the field of boating and mechanical service, Ernest A. Zadig will be autographing copies of his new book, The Complete Book of Boating (PrenticeHall, $12.95), at The Sportsman's Trading Post booth. The book includes complete lesson plans for the United States Power Squadrons and the Coast Guard Auxiliary boating courses.

title: Women on Their Own
description: WOMEN choose women? a sexist show! It's obscene! a wellknown New York art dealer was heard to remark. He is just one in a legion of men in the arts throughout the centuries who did not think it obscene to exclude women from every phase of artfrom life classes to the museums, But women have been working nevertheless, and the question, Where are the women artists?, is at last answered. They are everywhere; they are strong; they are together; and they have come out.

title: New Agency May Regulate Race Betting
description: Barring lastminute revisions, Governor Rockefeller's study group on horse racing is expected to recommend formation of a State Racing Authority that would regulate all ontrack and offtrack parimutuel activity in New York.

title: Snead Opens 11Shot Lead In P.G.A. Seniors' Event
description: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla., Jan. 27 (AP)Sam Snead, who has won more pro tournaments than anyone else, seemed on his way to another victory as he opened an 11stroke lead after the third round of the annual seniors' tournament of the Professional Golfers' Association.

title: COURT CANCELS SUIT IN NEWSPAPER FIGHT
description: DENVER, Jan. 27 (UPI)The United States Court of Appeals for the 10th circuit has ordered dismissal of a lawsuit by Samuel Newhouse, the newspaper owner, aimed at gaining control of the Denver Post.

title: Some Lessons From Phase 2
description: WASHINGTON  C. Jackson Grayson Jr. is that rarest of American birds, the tameduck price regulator.

title: Tank Watch Enjoys New Popularity
description: A watch designed more than half a century ago, as a tribute to the glamorous, goggled men in the American Expeditionary Force's tank corps, has become the season's newest status symbol. The slim black lizard band, with an 18kaart gold case, reportedly has been bought by luminaries ranging from Mrs. Aristotle Onassis and her sister, Princess Lee Radziwill, to Carter Burden, Valentino, Truman Capote and Sammy Davis Jr.

title: Some Lessons From Phase 2
description: WASHINGTON  C. Jackson Grayson Jr. is that rarest of American birds, the tameduck price regulator.

title: Sinecure on Fire Island: Detective by Powerboat
description: Detective Dennis Romano spent most of his offduty time on his boat in Fire Island, so for the summer of '72 he requested Suffolk County's Third Squad in Bay Shore, L. I., to assign him to patrol the island at the Atlantique Beach Station.

title: PATHET LAO GIVES NO HINT OF PEACE
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 27Gen. Phoune Sipraseuth, head of the Pathet Lao negotiating team in the Laos peace talks, returned here today from consultations in Samneua and Hanoi. Despite the ceasefire in Vietnam, he gave no indication that peace in Laos could now be concluded quickly.

title: World News Briefs
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Jan. 27 (Reuters) Extra British troops were moved into Londonderry today on the eve of commemorations of the first anniversary of Bloody Sunday, when 13 Catholic civilians were shot to death.

title: David Bryce Maxwell to Marry Kathryn A. Winkhaus in March
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., Jan. 27Mr. and Mrs. John Theodore Winkhaus have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kathryn Anne Winkhaus, to David Bryce Maxwell, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Douglas Maxwell of Glen Head. A March wedding is planned.

title: BICKER CAPTURES RICH COAST RACE
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 27 (AP)Favored Bicker defeated Royal Owl by 1 lengths today to capture the $92,100 San Fernando Stakes at Santa Anita Park.

title: Uruguay Economy Falters
description: MONTEVIDEO, UruguayAfter terrorizing South America's smallest republic for nine years, the Tupamaro guerrilla movement was shattered by President Juan Maria Bordaberry within six months of his inauguration last March 1.

title: The Sex Revolution Problem
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27H. P. Podsimmer of Old Puling, Conn., writes us about a problem that has arisen at his house in connection with the sexual revolution. He wants advice which this column, mired as it is in the anden sex regime, is unable to give. Readers who wish to be helpful may send advice to this column. It will be forwarded under plain cover.

title: She'll Do Much Ado on TV
description: HER smile, beneath those large liquid eyes and almost Oriental cheekbones, is even more dazzling offstage than on, and for a moment the sunny kitchen of Kathleen Widdoes' pleasantly cluttered Horatio Street apartment seems brighter by several hundred candlepower. Miss Widdoes, the petite costar (she's Beatrice to Sam Waterston's Benedick) of the New York Shakespeare Festival's muchbravoed production of Much Ado About Nothing, pops a piece of homemade coffee cake on a plate, passes it to her visitor along with a mug of coffee, and settles down for the talk she'd rather have had in her dressing room at the Winter Garden.

title: Industrialization Comes to the Caribbean With More Pollution Than Jobs
description: On the south coast of Puerto Rico, sulphur dioxide smoke belches from a forest of smokestacks in a petrochemical complex. Riding the trade winds to the northwest, it shrouds the mountains in acrid blue mist.

title: FundRaising: New Approach Lacks Personal Touch
description: ENGLEWOODTen years ago, it was an annual ritual for 500 volunteers in Englewood to enthusiastically ring neighbors' doorbells, in quest of contributions to the American Cancer Society.

title: Clayton Is Linked To the Past
description: Is it a moon buggy? Is it some sort of Rube Goldberg contraption? Passersby stop to stare and wonder at the strange blue and yellow object perched high on stilts on the shore of the St. Lawrence River in the 1000 Islands town of Clayton, N. Y.

title: Experts Ponder Legal Questions Posed by Advances in Medicine
description: A pregnant woman is screened for abnormalities in her unborn child and one is found, an abnormality often associated with criminal behavior. Must she have an abortion?

title: John Cochran to Wed Miss Brown
description: CARBONDALE, Colo., Jan. 27Mr. and Mrs. David R. C. Brown have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Laurene Robinson Brown to John Bradford Cochran, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bradford Cochran of Bernardsville, N. J.

title: I MUSICI STANDARDS MARK BACH CONCERT
description: The I Musici Bach concert at Carnegie Hall Friday night was technically up to the group's familiar high standardsneat ensemble, secure intonation and highgloss tonal sheenbut the musical results seemed a trifle dull and predictable.

title: Australia/New Zealand
description: SYDNEY  Since forging a Pacific partnership in World War II, the United States, Australia and New Zealand have followed largely similar policies in Asia. Australian and New Zealand troops served in Korea. And, while most other American allies balked, the Anzacs joined the Americans in Vietnam.

title: LIVERPOOL UPSET IN BRITISH SOCCER
description: LONDON, Jan. 27 (UPI)The First and Second Division leaden suffered defeats today to throw the championship race in each league wide open.

title: Knox Will Lead by Motivation
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 27 A handsome, intense driver from the Motor City has taken over the controls for the Los Angeles Rams.

title: CHARGES DISMISSED IN RIGHTS SLAYINGS
description: JACKSON, Miss., Jan. 27 (UPI)  Federal indictments against three men in the slaying of three young civil rights workers in 1964 have been dropped. United States District Court Judge William Harold Cox signed an order earlier this week dismissing Federal indictments against E. G. Barnett, Edgar Ray Killen and Jerry. M. Sharpe, all of the Meridian area.

title: They Also Serve Who Await Bermuda Racers
description: To put on a Bermuda Race right you need at least three ingredients: the guys and gals who race the boats, the committee members who make the whole thing go and the wives and seagulls who see their men off in Newport, R.I., and then fly to Bermuda to wait  and, as was the case last June, to worry.

title: Child to the Gershmans
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Richard Gershman of Lynbrook, L.I., on Jan. 12 at Mount Sinai Hospital. The child has been named Allison Beth. Mrs. Gershman is the former Miss Marjorie Morris, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Larry Morris of New York.

title: Stamps Depict Fishing
description: Since gamefishing is a special tourist attraction in the British Virgin Islands, a special issue of postage stamps portraying that sport was released in the territory last Dec. 12.

title: Daughter for Detjens
description: NEW PALTZ, N.Y., Jan. 27 A daughter was born on Jan. 17 to Mr. and Mrs. Theodore Gustav Detjen in the Kingston Hospital.

title: Point of View
description: BRASILIAWith a growth rate of 10.4 per cent in 1972, Brazil completed her fifth consecutive year in which the gross national product rose by more than 9 per cent.

title: COOPERATION SEEN WITH PRESS PANEL
description: The privately financed press council being set up to monitor the national news media appears likely to receive the cooperation of at least half of the major news organizations.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Earthquakes
description: At 4:11 in the morning on Nov. 18, 1755, residents of colonial Boston heard a sound like distant thunder. The ground shook, and trees along the streets swept wildly back and forth across the darkened sky. New Madrid, Mo., in 1811 ... Long Island in 1884 ... Charleston, S.C., in 1888 earthquakes all.

title: Zoning Being Used To Save Farmland In Upstate Counties
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27  A program to preserve farmland in New York State by forming agricultural districts, with special zoning regulations and possible tax benefits for farmers, is gathering momentum upstate.

title: College Upstate Seeks to Alter Controversial System of Tenure
description: A small, upstate New York college is on the verge of adopting a major modification of the traditional system of academic tenure by offering contracts to faculty members who complete their probationary period but do not receive tenure.

title: Bluegrass Confronts Nashville On Island
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I.After opening the door for bluegrass music in Manhattan during the past year, the Bluegrass Club of New York is now spreading the music out to Long Island.

title: Are Exchanges Obsolete?
description: The New York and other stock exchanges may now be heading toward extinction.

title: Pope Asking Italians To Give for Vietnam
description: ROME, Jan. 27 (UPI)Pope Paul VI has instructed Italian bishops to set aside Sunday, Feb. 4, in all the country's churches as a day of prayer and special collections for the reconstruction of Vietnam, the Vatican announced today.

title: PITTSBURGH GETS INTEGRATION PLAN
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 27  A school desegregation plan that would put 75 per cent of the city's 70,000 students in integrated public schools by 1980 has been proposed by Superintendent of Schools Louis J. Kishkunas.

title: No Penalty Urged in Victimless Crime
description: The criminal justice section of the New York State Bar Association recommended yesterday that all criminal sanctions be removed from a variety of victimless crimes, including possession or private use of small quantities of marijuana.

title: Collombin Takes His 4 th Downhill
description: KITZBUEHEL, Austria, Jan. 27Roland Collombin, Switzerland's daredevil downhiller, won the Hahnekamm race today and increased his lead in the Alpineskiing World Cup.

title: THE OPENING
description: SHELTERThursday, Golden, 6:45. A musical with book and lyrics by Gretchen Cryer; score by Nancy Ford. Starring Marcia Rodd and Terry Kiser.

title: Recordings
description: Two artists who have made valiant efforts to revive the forgotten or neglected repertory of the 19th century are Aaron Rosand, violinist, and Jascha Silberstein, cellist. When they have gone to the trouble to learn such works, it seems only fair that their performances should be preserved through recording, and this has happened on a pair of recent disks.

title: Bridge
description: Some of the urban problems of the seventies extend to bridge. Thieves are everywhere, but at least the thievery at the bridge table is nonviolent, and the victims may even praise the perpetrators. The victim on the diagramed deal from a team game was Paul Grossman of Washington, D.C., and he reported, in sorrowful admiration, a fine piece of theft by a young Washington expert, Barry Bragin.

title: How One Priest Does His Preaching
description: FATHER DONALD J. CASEY, is an easygoing, athleticlooking, 37yearold Maryknoll priest who sports ski sweaters and a Seiko diving watch, operates out of an office decorated with snowbunny pinups, and preaches provocative messages not with words but with film. Highlights from an example of his work, a 24minute documentary called The Healer, will be shown today at 1 P.M. on the ABC series, Directions.

title: Brooklyn School Celebrates Award With Taste
description: The culinary spotlight fell on an unlikely place last weekthe gymnasium at the New York City Community College in Brooklyn.

title: In the Swimming Pool, Equality Remains Afloat
description: Marina Cohen, a senior, had been manager of the men's swimming team at Hunter College for two years before she joined the team as a competitor, this year, so she was no stranger to the men on the squad. Kim Piker, a freshman, was.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York has sold the Catholic Charities Building, at 122 East 22d Street, to Sackman Enterprises Inc. The $1.4million sale is part of an attempt by the archdiocese to consolidate its administrative offices in a new building on the west side of First Avenue between 55th and 56th Streets.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Common Cause to Focus on Trenton
description: PRINCETON  Common Cause, the 210,000member citizens' lobby that has concentrated its efforts on the national level, is now organizing itself by states so as to be able to lobby in state capitals as well. And New Jersey Common Cause, with more than 9,000 members; is in the forefront of this movement.

title: BIAGGI IS RUNNING A BUSY CAMPAIGN
description: Biaggi in '73, says the sign on the door of the 12th floor suite at 535 Fifth Avenue. Biaggi in '73 says the operator who answers the telephone, and the same slogan appears on the blue button worn by the aides who a?? busy in the bustling rooms.

title: 546th Cosmos Launched
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 27 (AP)The Soviet Union launched yesterday the 546th unmanned earth satellite in its secret Cosmos program, Tass reported.

title: Music
description: An Evening With the Two Charlies: Ives and Morrow!

title: Four Promising Young Riders Finish Team Training Course
description: Four promising young riders  Tony D'Ambrosio Jr., Melanie Smith, Mike Matz and Mac Cone  finished two weeks of training yesterday at the United States Equestrian Team's Gladstone, N.J., base.

title: Stevens Urges Police to Reject Funds So Courts Can Get Them
description: A highranking state justice has suggetted that the city's Police Department turn down additional funds so the money can go to the courts.

title: Chinese Names for Towns in Siberia Are Eliminated
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 27  The Soviet Government has just made new work for the world's mapmakers by announcing that towns in Far Eastern Siberia with Chinesesounding names have been given new Russian ones.

title: Music
description: Rudolf Serkin and Pierre Boulez made, on the face of it, an unlikely pair to be cast as collaborators in the Schumann Piano Concerto. But their differences were sublimated in a tense and dashing performance with the New York Philharmonic on Thursday night.

title: Headliners
description: The advertising fraternity last week ran it down the flagpoletwiceas the Federal Trade Commission scored one signal victory and opened fire on another front.

title: BRUINS WIN, 8263
Some Lessons From Phase 2
description: WASHINGTON  C. Jackson Grayson Jr. is that rarest of American birds, the tameduck price regulator.

title: Economic Nationalism: A Fact of Life in Modern Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY  A series of Government announcements that Mexico would insist on greater participation with foreign investors was greeted emotionally in some quarters here.

title: Law
description: In a recent California divorce action  involving a bitter contest for the custody of two young children the judge awarded the youngsters to the mother. When the father's lawyer objected, pointing out that both parents were working and the father would in fact be able to spend more time with the children, the judge cut him off, saying: Fathers don't make good mothers.

title: Bruins Suffer Fifth Loss in Last Six Games as Hawks Rally for 42 Victory
description: BOSTON, Jan. 27 (AP)The Chicago Black Hawks spotted Boston an early twogoal lead, then battled back to defeat the Bruins, 42, tonight. It was their fifth loss in their last six National Hockey League games.

title: Air Pollution Alert Issued by Governor For Cleveland Area
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 27 (UPI) Gov. John J. Gilligan issued an air pollution alert today for the metropolitan Cleveland area, including all of Cuyahoga County, ordering all industry in the area to curtail all pollution emmissions and persons with respiratory problems to stay indoors.

title: Hanoi Lists of P.O.W.'s Are Made Public by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The State Department tonight released the list of American civilians acknowledged by North Vietnam as having been captured in South Vietnam during the Vietnam war. The list left about half the 51 American civilians believed missing or captured unaccounted for.

title: The Music Only Echoes The Past
description: NEW ORLEANS  When news papers here reported that a young woman from Minneapoli?? had been assaulted as she wan?? tiered through the halls of the Ne?? Orleans Jazz Museum in the heart ?? the busy French Quarter, it was ?? shocking thing, of course. But almos?? as saddening was the fact that in th?? middle of the afternoon she was th?? only visitor to the. Jazz Museum, ?? shrine to what many look upon as ?? true American art form, born right here ??

title: Search Ends at Montreal Exchanges
description: MONTREAL  A Frenchspeaking Canadian in his early forties, with no investment industry experience, has just taken over the presidency of the Montreal and Canadian Stock Exchanges.

title: Ceasefire
description: After all the death and destruction, the settlement finally written simply codified the military stalemate of the long war. The United States agreed to depart without a guarantee of the survival of an independent, antiCommunist South Vietnam. North Vietnam agreed to stop fighting without a guarantee of a Communistdominated coalition government in Saigon. Both sides agreed to leave the South's future to a political contest among Vietnamese.

title: Paterson Youth Is Seized After a Classroom Rape
description: PATERSON, N, J., Jan. 27A 17yearold youth who allegedly raped a 20yearold teacher in a school cloakroom yesterday after forcing her out of her classroom at knifepoint while her fourthgrade pupils looked on in terror was arrested at his home here today.

title: St. Charles Is the Last Trolley Left
description: NEW ORLEANSThis city, home of the Mardi Gras, is said to be capable of stimulating everything but the mind. But it can even do that for anyone with a taste for architectural detail, historic trivia and the human comedy. And one of the best ways to indulge the taste is to ride the trolley, an institution in New Orleans ever since Tennessee Williams's 1948 Pulitzer Prizewinning play, A Streetcar Named Desire. The real streetcar named Desire, whose destination was Desire Street, has long since been replaced by a bus, but the streetcar named St. Charles (actually, 35 of them) is till going and has become a favorite with tourists.

title: Charlie had a drinking problem
description: Charlie Lester is 38, a former New York journalist who has landed a big publicrelations job in Los Angeles. He is assistant to the board chairman of a giant oil company, for whom he writes speeches, articles and glossy annual reports. Like many P.R. men he is cynical about his work (the oil company is a major pollutant, and much of Charlie's duty is to publicize his boss as a highminded champion of ecology) yet at the same time he's proud of itproud of his skill, of the chairman's flattering praise, of the money that provides a nice home in Malibu for his beloved wife Fran and their children.

title: Floyd Odium and the Work Ethic
description: INDIAN PALMS, Calif.In the thirties, forties and fifties, decisions that shaped much of corporate America were made in the Olympicsize pool in front of the big house of the CochranOdium ranch here. Bathing trunks were de rigueur when Floyd D. Odium conducted board meetingsand many directors were asked for their vote as they were treading water, a secretary at poolside taking minutes.

title: Gallup Poll Finds Public Divided On Abortions in First 3 Months
description: Although the United States Supreme Court has given broad sanction to abortions, the American public is about equally divided on whether abortions ought to be permitted in the first three months of pregnancy, the Gallup Poll reported yesterday.

title: Ballet: Maids Electrifies
description: A superlative performance, danced straight from the gut, was offered by Daniel Devins and Gayle Young in their first time here in the title roles of The Maids Thursday night at the City Center. The new cast for the Herbert Ross ballet, added to the American Ballet Theater's repertory last week, also included Keith Lee as the lover of Marie Johansson, who repeated her role as the mistress.

title: TangoErotic or Exotic?
description: BERNARDO BERTOLUCCI'S Last Tango Paris is a beautiful, courageous, foolish, romantic and reckless film and Bertolucci is like the diving champion, drunk on enthusiasm, who dares dive from the high board knowing well that the pool is half empty. The stunt comes off, but the dive is less grand than we might expect from what we've heard and read, and especially from what we know of Bertolucci. I mention this the outset because the film is being so overpraised (and overpriced) that many disappointed people may be reluctant to indulge its failures, thus to miss its achievements, which are considerable.

title: Central America: A Market Shattered
description: MANAGUA, NicaraguaA devastating earthquake here last Dec. 23, brought the five Central American republics together in a handsome show of solidarity.

title: Bolivia's Bold Devaluation
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia  Bolivia's military rulers survived bloody political and economic battles in 1972 and ended the year in as strong a position as could be reasonably hoped for in this volatile land.

title: Simon Haviland Weds Miss Sommerhoff
description: ANCRAMDALE, N. Y., Jan. 27Miss Jenny Busch Sommerhoff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kurt Sommerhoff of Ancramdale, was married here this noon to Simon Knyvett Haviland of London, an edifor with the Phaidon Press, publishers of art books there. The Rev. David Vogel performed the ceremony in St. John's Lutheran Church. The bride, whose father owns a dairy farm, is a graduate of the Westover School and Wheaton College in Norton, Mass. The bridegroom, son of the late Maj. L. P. Haviland of the British Army and the late Mrs. Haviland of Musselburgh, Scotland, was educated at Eton and Cambridge University.

title: Watergate
description: WASHINGTONpeter L. Maroulis is a mildmannered lawyer from Poughkeepsie, N. Y. who treads very lightly in the United States District Court here while representing C. Gordon Liddy, a defendant in the Watergate trial.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: Out of the frying pan into the fire.

title: Bored? Go SkateSail at 40 M.P.H.
description: Look out on a large frozen lake during a crisp winter day and your eye may be captured by colorful arrows flying at high speed. One arrow flips over and goes shooting off in a new direction, the other swiftly follows. Back and forth, a ballet of silent grace. You are watching skate sailing.

title: Using the Sun For Heating
description: ALL the world is cheered by the sun Shakes peare told us. But today we are more interested in putting the sun's energy to work improving our lives. Those concerned with heating and cooling greenhouses will be cheered to discover what the sun actually can do.

title: Music
description: CZECH music and musicians are on the agenda this week, what with the performance on Wednesday in Carnegie Hall of the Czech State Orchestra, and Walter Susskind's program, also in Carnegie Hall, with the St. Louis Symphony on Thursday. The Czech State Orchestra is coming in with a provincial program, as so many Czech orchestras have a habit of doing. They come here with the honest belief that this country has not heard the New World Symphony, and that God put them on earth so that they should baptize the American heathens in the Dvorak.

title: LeagueLeading Crusaders Turn Back Cougars, 21
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 27 (UPI) Paul Andrea and Rick Pumple scored on power plays to give the leagueleading Cleveland Crusaders a 21 victory over the Chicago Cougars in a World Hockey Association game tonight.

title: Point of View
description: Executive Director, Citizens Housing and Planning Council

title: OPENING THIS WEEK
description: STEELYARD BLUESMan Myerson's comedy written by David S. Ward and starring Jane Fonda, Donald Sutherland and Peter Boyle, Wednesday at the Beckman.

title: Is there a male menopause?
description: My friends had been married for 19 years; good marriage as marriages go, or so she thought and so their circle believed. Mutual interests, satisfactory sex life, flowers every Valentine's Day, two nice children, two successful careers, a country house, a retirement plan.... Then one day he announced that he wanted to split, and split. More to her agony, he went off with a woman young enough, she says, to be their daughter. She is sure she knows the reason: It's the menopause.

title: PingryKent Place School Merger Gains
description: HILLSIDEArchitects for the future home of Pingry and Kent Place Schools, two of the most prestigious independent institutions in New Jersey, expect to unveil on Thursday the first plans for the schools' new 200acre site in rural Bernards Township.

title: Gold Cup Winner, Muncey, at Show
description: The only living man to win five Gold Cup races, Bill Muncey, is appearing at the boat show with the Atlas Van Lines unlimited hydroplane that made up his national championship team. Muncey won six of seven races last year on the thunderboat circuit. Although world records are unofficial in the unlimited hydro world, Muncey set such historic marks as the fastest recorded time for a 15mile heat over a 2mile course (110.655 miles an hour) and the fastest time for a single lap in competition (115.979).

title: West German Birth Rate Drops And Not Much Protest Is Heard
description: BONN, Jan. 27More people died than were born during. 1972 in West Germany and as yet, only a tiny scattering of voices have been raised against this sign of the declining national birth rate.

title: Stars Rout Chaps, 123.104, On Strong Play of Reserves
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 27 (AP)Ron Boone's 26 points and a strong effort by the Utah reserves paced the Stars to a 123104 victory over the Dallas Chapparals tonight In an American Basketball Association game.

title: Renoir Once MoreTop to Bottom
description: PUT on a Renoir show and you have to accept two difficulties as a beginning. First, most of Renoir's best paintings are so well known that there isn't much you can prove by showing them once more, even though to get in among them and soak may be a pleasure. Paradoxically, the other difficulty is that you can't get the bestknown ones, and that leaves a dreadful hole. Without the Louvre's Moulin de la Galette and the Philadelphia Museum's Bathers from the Tyson collection (unlendable for 25 years under terms of the bequest), you haven't really got the whole show even if you have managed to get the Louvre's very late Great Bathers of 1918, as the Art Institute of Chicago has done for an exhibition opening this coming Satur*day.

title: Lucy Marion Fiancee
description: The engagement of Miss Lucy Blair Marion, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Clarence K. Marion of Beechhurst, Queens, to Donald John Kazyak Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Kazyak of Huntington, L. I., has been announced by the future bride's parents. Miss Marion and her fianc are juniors at Ohio State University. Her father is a lawyer, and Mr. Kazyak's father is manager of the Great Eastern discount chain store in Lindenhurst, L. I. A summer wedding is planned.

title: Nation Ends Draft, Turns to Volunteers
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird announced today that the military draft had ended.

title: Chalet Club Runs Gamut of Thrills
description: Enjoy spectacular 300mile journeys, run the rapids of the Colorado River, camp in the Grand Canyon, travel through two billion years of geology.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section

title: Judith A. Bradeen Fiancee of Student
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 27Donald Bradeen, head of the classics department at the University of Cincinnati, and Mrs. Bradeen have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Judith Ann Bradeen, to Herbert S. Landsman Jr., son of Mr. Landsman, executive vice president of the Federated Department Stores, and Mrs. Landsmain. Both families are of Cincinnati.

title: Miss McMillen to Wed
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I. Jan. 27 Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Lloyd M. McMillen of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Laura Elizabeth McMillen, to Midshipman David C. Fischer, a second classman at the United States Naval Academy at Annapolis, Md. He is a on of Robert T. Fischer of. Uniondale and Mrs. Isabelle Fischer of Freeport.

title: To Buy a House Is to Buy a School District
description: Remember the days when eatinkitchen, sunken living room and cathedral ceiling lured the potential home buyer? Now the A1 school district is Circe's song. And like the alluring but uncompromising siren, once you're seduced by her charms, the school district alternately satisfies and frustrates, but realy loosens its grip on the homeowner's life.

title: Chile Struggling With Shortages
description: SANTIAGOChile was increasingly difficult, cheerless and unpleasant last year. Inflation was the highest in the world. There were shortages of goods, then of food staples and finally unofficial but extensive rationing.

title: Greece: Islands Of Sun
description: Please don't cruise the Greek Islands with your placecollecting phobia hanging out. Just about any quirk can exist in Greece except a blownup sense of urgency. A figure of 1,001 islands and a main coastline 10,000 miles long may seem the ultimate confrontation.

title: Camera World
description: NEW YORK University's School of Continuing Education, Washington Square, N. Y., is again offering a Spring program of courses and workshops in photography starting on Feb. 5. There will be a course in photojournalism that will be taught by a group of former photographers from Life magazine ($45); one on basics that will meet on Monday evenings from 6 to 8, and again on Tuesdays from 8:10 to 10 ($60); another On creative photography that will be held on Thursday evenings from 6:10 to 8 ($60); one on darkroom fundamentals that will meet on Tuesday and Thursday from 6:10 to 8 P.M. ($100); plus a course on color photography that will also meet on Tuesday evenings from 6:10 to 8 ($60). There will also be a series of photographic field trips that will take place on Saturdays from 10 A.M. to 1 P.M. ($60). Registration for these courses is now going on at the school office, 2 University Place. Phone (212) 5982373.

title: TANAKA PROPOSES A PARLEY ON ASIA
description: TOKYO, Jan. 27Premier Kakuei Tanaka tentatively proposed today that a conference of Asian and Pacific nations be convened to secure the postVietnam peace of Asia.

title: CITY SEEN CEDING LABOR CONTROLS
description: Mayor Lindsay and the city's other potentially influential elected officials are pictured as having ceded power over city labor relations to others in a new politicalscience study that contends that the public has become losers to unionized city employes.

title: The Toll: 12 Years of War
description: Military

title: East Germany's Recognition Of Spain Jolts Many Citizens
description: BERLIN, Jan. 27Many East Germans were shocked to hear, earlier this month, that their Communist Government had recognized Spain, a land of an entirely different totalitarian strain.

title: WAGE RISES IN 1972 LOWER THAN IN 1971
description: WASHINGTON, Jana 27 (AP) The Labor Department said yesterday that first year wage increases in major labor contracts covering 2.1 million workers averaged 7 per cent last year. The year before they were 11.6 per cent.

title: RABBI QUESTIONS CRITICS OF KEY '73
description: Rabbi Henry Siegman, executive vice president of the Synagogue Council of America, has charged that criticism by some Jewish leaders of Key '73, a current Christian evangelism drive, is alarmist and harmful to Jewish interests.

title: MAINE ELKS LODGES GET LIQUOR LICENSES
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Jan. 27The director of the Maine Bureau of Alcoholic Beverages says that he has mailed six liquor licenses to Elks lodges since the United States Supreme Court blocked the state from withholding such licenses.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Lockheed and I.T.T. and now Grummanwe know how corporations visAvis the Government operate. Or we think we do, though obviously only the tip of the iceberg is showing. Jonathan Ryder, in TREVAYNE (Delacorte, $7.95) sets out to Tell All. A retired millionaire who made it big in aerospace contracts is recruited to head a commission in Washington investigating the militaryindustrial complex. He ends up taking on a supercorporation singlehanded, fighting corruption (including actual murder) that extends to the highest levels. Finally, he discovers that if he cannot win one way there always are others.

title: Amer. Hockey League
description: STANDING OF THE TEAMS

title: Truce Supervisors From Poland, Hungary and Canada Leave for South Vietnam
description: WARSAW, Jan. 27A contingent of 75 Polish military officers and civilians left here tonight to join Hungarian, Canadian and Indonesian units in supervising the Vietnam ceasefire.

title: INDONESIA DESTROYS MARIJUANA FIELDS
description: MEDAN, Indonesia, Jan. 27 (Reuters)The police have burned off more than 240 acres of marijuana plants around Medan in the last few months and farmers in this north Sumatra area have been sternly warned about growing it.

title: A Woman's Place Is Home? in Hockey, the Ice Is Broken
description: Hey, what's the matter with No. 6? asked an oppqnent who overheard some teammates talking about the Lehman College hockey team's left wing.

title: Miss Ramage Sets Wedding for Sept. 1
description: SNYDER, N. Y., Jan. 27Miss Kathryn. Michele Ramage and John Skelton Hutcheson, who are with the trust department of the National Bank of Westchester in White Plains, plan to be married Sept, 1 in Buffalo.

title: Oil on Troubled Waters Must Be Applied Right
description: Reprinted with permission of Sea Frontiers, copyrighted by the International Oceanographic Foundation.

title: Government Funds Spur Development
description: OTTAWAOne year after its troubled birth, the Canada Development Corporation is investing Government funds by the millions throughout the country, and although it is still controversial in some business circles, its sponsors say they are making converts.

title: Long Beach To Select Supervisor On Tuesday
description: LONG BEACH, L. I.The abrupt resignation of Long Beach's Democratic supervisor from the Republicandominated Nassau County Board of Supervisors leaves local Republicans with a prize plum to bestow.

title: They Soar in Silence Over the Island
description: MASTIC, L. I.A hardy group of sailplane devotees gathers on Long Island each weekend, undeterred by winter weather, to engage in what one of them describes as the nearest thing to being a bird.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Is there a successful formula for a Seventh Avenue apparel firm in a highly volatile market extremely sensitive not only to changes in fashion but to changes in the economy as well?

title: Parley Takes Step to Curb Air Piracy
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 27An international aviation conference voted here today to take a step toward a concerted attack on airliner hijacking and air piracy.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Here's the kind of person Al Kaline is: When contractsigning time came in 1971, the Detroit Tigers wanted to reward their former boy wonder for his consistent excellence over the years by making him their first $100,000 operative. He refused the increase while all the lodge brothers in the ballplayers' union recoiled in horror at so reprehensible a display of nobility and unselfishness. I don't deserve such a salary, he told Jim Campbell, the general manager. I didn't have a good enough season last year. This ball club has been so fair and decent to me that I'd prefer to have you give it to me when I rate it.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events maybe obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Cost to an Economy
description: From a cold business point of view, World War II was a blessing for the United States: It lifted a depressed economy up to full employment and made this country not only the arsenal of democracy but its financial, capital as well. By contrast, the Vietnam war was an unmitigated drain. Since the economy was already close to full employment in 1965 when President Johnson began his major escalation, the war put an extra strain on national resources and kicked off an inflation that has been difficult to root out.

title: 2 Roommates Slain in Brooklyn Coop
description: The bodies of two men, one a city school teacher, were found yesterday in the teacher's Brooklyn Heights apartment, one with multiple stab wounds in the back, the other with an apparent broken neck.

title: Mrs. Sauser Has Nuptials
description: KEENE, N. H., Jan. 27Mrs. Carolyn Ewing Sauser, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James D. Ewing of Keene, was married here this afternoon to James Ayer Rousmaniere Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Rousmaniere of Oyster Bay, L. I.

title: A Memorable Coppelia
description: There was great excitement at the City Center 55th Street Theater on Friday night when the American Ballet Theater's Cynthia Gregory and Michael Denard danced up a storm in Enrique Martinez's Copplia.

title: 2 Patrolmen in a Radio Car Wounded in Queens
description: Two patrolmen inside a radio car were shot at an intersection in the Jamaica section of Queens early today, the police reported. The men were rushed to Mary Immaculate Hospital where they were said to be in fair condition.

title: U.S. Power Squadrons Sail On, Still LibFree
description: There are those, it seems, who feel women should be accepted as members in United States Power Squadrons immediately, if not sooner.

title: ROBINSON TAKES DENVER BOWLING
description: DENVER, Jan. 27Jay Robinson of Los Angeles rallied to defeat Gus Lampo of Endicott, N. Y., for first place in the $50,000. Denver open bowling tournament yesterday. The score was 193182.

title: WALL STREET
description: He takes a firm grip on the podium and his audience turns silent. His voice level rises and its tone grows stern. He stabs the air with a muscular finger and decries the private deal makers in Wall Street who are undermining the stock marketthose evil forces lurking behind the scenes in violation of the public interest.

title: Hilary Roche Fiancee Of John White Geary 2d
description: Mr. and Mrs. Sidney B. Wood Jr. of New York and Southampton, L. I., have announced the engagement of Mrs. Wood's daughter, Miss Hilary Somers Roche, to John White Geary 2d, son of Ivirs. Alfred H. Geary of New York and the late Mr. Geary of Devon, Pa.

title: Television
description: THE People's Republic of China is making it on American television. In recent weeks the world's most populous nation has been the subject of two major prime  time specials: Michelangelo Antonioni's Chung Kuo, carried on the network of the. American Broadcasting Company, and The Forbidden City, on the network of the National Broadcasting Company.

title: Pro Football Draft: A Bumper Crop
description: This is a year that a team can get well in a hurry, said Frank (Bucko) Kilroy, the shrewd director of player personnel for the New England Patriots as he licked his lips. Kilroy was speaking of the National Football League's annual draft of college players that will take place on Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: Pemex Reports Plenty Of Oil for Mexican Use
description: MEXICO CITYFor now at least Mexico is spared the problem of finding alternative sources to petroleum.

title: Rautbord Bounces From Couch to World Offshore Championship
description: Bobby Rautbord, a long, lean millionaire type from Miami Beach, is the ninth ocean powerboat racing champion of the world. Since the relatively new sport is looked upon as one of man's quickest ways to dismantle his frame, the 38yearold driver was asked what was the highlight of his sixyear climb to the zenith of offshore racing.

title: Cornell Six Tops Dartmouth
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Jan. 27 (AP) Cornell scored four goals in the final 10 minutes to post 5.3 hockey victory over Dartmouth today.

title: Lee Webster Wilson and, Robert Bruce Albro Plan Spring Wedding
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Webster Hill Wilson of New York of the engagement of Mr. Wilson's daughter, Miss Lee Webster Wilson, to Robert Bruce Albro, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Clifford Albro Jr. of North Wilbraham, Mass. An early spring wedding is planned.

title: Hospitals Prepare for 1.6 Million Abortions Annually
description: In the wake of the Supreme Court's sweeping decision on abortion last week, medical facilities around the country have, begun preparing to treat an estimated total of 1.6 million American women a year who will seek to terminate prtriancies.

title: Opera: Bartered Bride Fascinates and Maddens
